original: @32a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @32a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: panytsa skan dha bh'a shyam /
analyzed: panytsa skan dha bh'a shyam /
translated: Pa√±caskandha-bhƒÅ·π£ya

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: bung po lnga'i bshad pa /
analyzed: bung po lnga'i bshad pa /
translated: The Explanation of the Five Aggregates

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to youthful Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´.

original: rab tu byed pa 'di bshad pa la don rnam pa bzhi dang por bstan dgos te /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'di bshad pa la don rnam pa bzhi dang por bstan dgos te /
translated: At the outset, four topics must be presented in this treatise:

original: don rnam pa bzhi ni mchod pa'i cho ga brjod pa dang ; 'brel pa dang / dgos pa dang / dgos pa'i yang dgos pa'o //
analyzed: don rnam pa bzhi ni mchod pa'i cho ga brjod pa dang ; 'brel pa dang / dgos pa dang / dgos pa'i yang dgos pa'o //
translated: The four topics are the statement of the ritual of worship, the connection, the purpose, and the purpose of the purpose.

original: de la mchod pa'i cho ga brjod pa ni bdag gang la dad pa'i lha'i yon tan bstod cing brjod pa ste /
analyzed: de la mchod pa'i cho ga brjod pa ni bdag gang la dad pa'i lha'i yon tan bstod cing brjod pa ste /
translated: Among them, the statement of the ritual of worship is the praise and expression of the qualities of the deity in whom one has faith.

original: de yang skyes bu dam pa rnams kyi lugs dang mthun par bya ba dang / bgegs kyis bar chad ma byas par gtsug lag brtsams pa mthar phyin par bya ba'i phyir dang por mi brjod du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de yang skyes bu dam pa rnams kyi lugs dang mthun par bya ba dang / bgegs kyis bar chad ma byas par gtsug lag brtsams pa mthar phyin par bya ba'i phyir dang por mi brjod du mi rung ngo //
translated: Moreover, in accordance with the way of holy beings, it is not suitable not to state it at the beginning in order to complete the composition of the treatise without obstacles created by hindrances.

original: de la gtsug lag 'di yang mngon pa'i chos mdzod la 'jug pa'i sgo lta bur gyur ba dang de'i yan lag tu gtogs pa /
analyzed: de la gtsug lag 'di yang mngon pa'i chos mdzod la 'jug pa'i sgo lta bur gyur ba dang de'i yan lag tu gtogs pa /
translated: This treatise is like a door to the Abhidharma Treasury and is a part of it.

original: bstod pa'i cho ga ni mngon pa'i chos mdzod kyi mgor glengs zin pas /
analyzed: bstod pa'i cho ga ni mngon pa'i chos mdzod kyi mgor glengs zin pas /
translated: The praise ritual is mentioned at the beginning of the Abhidharma Treasury,

original: der 'dus pa'i phyir logs shig tu ma bshad do //
analyzed: der 'dus pa'i phyir logs shig tu ma bshad do //
translated: so it is included there and is not explained separately.

original: 'brel pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can rnams kyi don du mngon pa'i chos le'u 'bum gsungs te /
analyzed: 'brel pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can rnams kyi don du mngon pa'i chos le'u 'bum gsungs te /
translated: The connection is that the Bhagavan taught the Abhidharma in one hundred thousand chapters for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de ni gzhung mangs pas kun gyis khong du chud par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ni gzhung mangs pas kun gyis khong du chud par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Since that is extensive, it is not understood by all.

original: yi ge nyung ngu gtsug lag chung ngu 'di tsam khong du chud pas mngon pa'i chos 'bum gyi mtshan nyid la mkhas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yi ge nyung ngu gtsug lag chung ngu 'di tsam khong du chud pas mngon pa'i chos 'bum gyi mtshan nyid la mkhas par 'gyur te /
translated: By understanding this small treatise with few letters, one becomes skilled in the characteristics of the one hundred thousand Abhidharma.

original: de ltar na mngon pa'i chos 'bum dang gtsug lag 'dir 'brel to //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon pa'i chos 'bum dang gtsug lag 'dir 'brel to //
translated: Thus, the one hundred thousand Abhidharma and this treatise are connected.

original: dgos pa ni chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir gtsug lag 'di brtsams te /
analyzed: dgos pa ni chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir gtsug lag 'di brtsams te /
translated: The purpose is that this treatise was composed in order to become skilled in the characteristics of phenomena.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas par bya ba nyid dgos pa'o ;
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas par bya ba nyid dgos pa'o ;
translated: The purpose is to become skilled in the characteristics of phenomena.

original: / de la chos rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: / de la chos rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of phenomena:

original: zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga'o //
translated: the five aggregates that are uncontaminated and the five aggregates that are contaminated.

original: de la zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga ni gzugs kyi phung po nas rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i bar du lnga'o //
analyzed: de la zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga ni gzugs kyi phung po nas rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i bar du lnga'o //
translated: The five contaminated aggregates are the five from the form aggregate to the consciousness aggregate.

original: zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga ni tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga ni tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po'o //
translated: The five uncontaminated aggregates are the aggregate of morality, the aggregate of meditative stabilization, the aggregate of wisdom, the aggregate of liberation, and the aggregate of the wisdom of liberation.

original: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The characteristics of phenomena are also of two kinds:

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: specific characteristics and general characteristics.

original: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni dper na @32b sa'i rang gi mtshan nyid sra ba dang / chu'i rang gi mtshan nyid gsher ba dang / me'i rang gi mtshan nyid tsha ba dang / rlung gi rang gi mtshan nyid g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni dper na @32b sa'i rang gi mtshan nyid sra ba dang / chu'i rang gi mtshan nyid gsher ba dang / me'i rang gi mtshan nyid tsha ba dang / rlung gi rang gi mtshan nyid g-yo ba'o //
translated: The specific characteristics are, for example, the specific characteristic of earth is solidity, the specific characteristic of water is fluidity, the specific characteristic of fire is heat, and the specific characteristic of wind is movement.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa ste /
translated: The general characteristics are impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness.

original: gtsug lag 'di thos na chos de dag gi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtsug lag 'di thos na chos de dag gi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one hears this treatise, one will become skilled in the specific and general characteristics of those phenomena.

original: chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la mkhas pa ni mngon pa'i chos mdzod dang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang dpyad zin pas na 'di brtsams pa don med do zhe na /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la mkhas pa ni mngon pa'i chos mdzod dang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang dpyad zin pas na 'di brtsams pa don med do zhe na /
translated: One may object, ‚ÄúSince the specific and general characteristics of phenomena have already been analyzed in the Abhidharma Treasury and the Levels of Yogic Practice, there is no point in composing this treatise.‚Äù

original: lan du slob ma rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: lan du slob ma rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In response, there are two types of students:

original: spros pas shes pa dang / glengs pas shes pa'o //
analyzed: spros pas shes pa dang / glengs pas shes pa'o //
translated: those who understand through elaboration and those who understand through brief explanation.

original: de la spros pas shes pa ni gzhung zhib tu bshad na /
analyzed: de la spros pas shes pa ni gzhung zhib tu bshad na /
translated: For those who understand through elaboration, the text should be explained in detail.

original: don rtogs par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: don rtogs par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The purpose is to understand the meaning.

original: de dag gi don du ni mngon pa'i chos mdzod la sogs pa yang dgos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi don du ni mngon pa'i chos mdzod la sogs pa yang dgos par 'gyur ro //
translated: For that purpose, the Abhidharma treatise called the Treasury of Knowledge and so on are necessary.

original: glengs pas shes pa ni mdo tsam du bstan na don mang du khong du chud par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: glengs pas shes pa ni mdo tsam du bstan na don mang du khong du chud par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Knowledge through recitation is when one understands many meanings through being taught just a brief summary.

original: de'i phyir gtsug lag 'di brtsams pas na brtsams pa don med pa ma yin no //üîΩyang na khyim na gnas pa kha cig chos kyi mtshan nyid la yang dag par mkhas par 'dod la zhing dang tshong la sogs pa 'phral gyi bya ba la thogs pas gzhung mang por nyan par mi nus pa dang / rab tu byung ba rnal 'byor yid la byed pa kha cig gzhung mang po mnyan na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtsug lag 'di brtsams pas na brtsams pa don med pa ma yin no // yang na khyim na gnas pa kha cig chos kyi mtshan nyid la yang dag par mkhas par 'dod la zhing dang tshong la sogs pa 'phral gyi bya ba la thogs pas gzhung mang por nyan par mi nus pa dang / rab tu byung ba rnal 'byor yid la byed pa kha cig gzhung mang po mnyan na /
translated: Therefore, the composition of this treatise is not meaningless.üîΩOr, some householders desire to be well-versed in the characteristics of phenomena, but due to being occupied with immediate tasks such as farming, commerce, and so on, they are unable to listen to extensive texts.

original: rnal 'byor gyi bar chad du 'ang 'gyur du dogs la /
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi bar chad du 'ang 'gyur du dogs la /
translated: And some renunciates who engage in mental cultivation fear that listening to extensive texts would be an obstacle to their practice.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid la'ang mkhas par 'dod pa yod de /
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid la'ang mkhas par 'dod pa yod de /
translated: But they also desire to be learned in the characteristics of phenomena.

original: de dag gi phyir 'di brtsams pas brtsams pa don med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi phyir 'di brtsams pas brtsams pa don med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since this treatise was composed for that purpose, it is not pointless.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa na yang ji dgos she na /
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa na yang ji dgos she na /
translated: What is the purpose of being skilled in the characteristics of phenomena?

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas par ma byas na /
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas par ma byas na /
translated: If one does not become skilled in the characteristics of phenomena,

original: nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba'i thabs med do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba'i thabs med do //
translated: there is no means to abandon the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa ma spangs na 'khor ba'i brtson ra las mi thar ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ma spangs na 'khor ba'i brtson ra las mi thar ro //
translated: If the afflictions are not abandoned, one does not escape the prison of cyclic existence.

original: 'khor ba las mthar na mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas mi thob bo //
analyzed: 'khor ba las mthar na mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas mi thob bo //
translated: If one does not escape cyclic existence, one does not attain the state of nirvana.

original: de bas na chos kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas na nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na chos kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas na nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if one is skilled in the characteristics of phenomena, the afflictions will be abandoned.

original: nyon mongs pa spangs na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs na /
translated: If the afflictions are abandoned,

original: 'khor ba'i brtson ra las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i brtson ra las 'byung ngo //
translated: one will escape the prison of cyclic existence.

original: 'khor ba'i brtson ra las byung na mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas thob ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i brtson ra las byung na mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas thob ste /
translated: If one escapes the prison of cyclic existence, one will attain the state of nirvana.

original: de ni dgos pa'i yang dgos pa'o //
analyzed: de ni dgos pa'i yang dgos pa'o //
translated: That is the ultimate purpose.

original: yang na gtsug lag 'dis @33a * //
analyzed: yang na gtsug lag 'dis @33a * //
translated: Or, this treatise

original: mgo nas mjug tu don rnam pa bzhi ston te /
analyzed: mgo nas mjug tu don rnam pa bzhi ston te /
translated: teaches four topics from beginning to end.

original: grangs dang / ming dang / rab tu dbye ba dang mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: grangs dang / ming dang / rab tu dbye ba dang mtshan nyid do //
translated: Enumeration, name, classification, and definition.

original: de la phung po lnga zhes bya bas grangs ston to //
analyzed: de la phung po lnga zhes bya bas grangs ston to //
translated: Among them, the five aggregates is the teaching of the number.

original: gzugs kyi phung po dang / tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po zhes bya bas ming bstan to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po dang / tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po zhes bya bas ming bstan to //
translated: The aggregate of form, the aggregate of feeling, the aggregate of perception, the aggregate of volitional factors, and the aggregate of consciousness is the teaching of the name.

original: gzugs gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzugs gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: What is form?

original: me'i khams dang rlung gi khams zhes bya ba yan chad kyis rab tu dbye ba bstan to //
analyzed: me'i khams dang rlung gi khams zhes bya ba yan chad kyis rab tu dbye ba bstan to //
translated: Up to the fire element and the wind element is the teaching of the classification.

original: sa'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: sa'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the earth element?

original: sra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: sra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: Hardness, etc. is the teaching of the definition.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa'i phung po la'ang ci rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa'i phung po la'ang ci rigs par bya'o //
translated: The aggregates of feeling, etc. should also be understood in the same way.

original: phung po lnga ni zhes bya ba la smras pa /
analyzed: phung po lnga ni zhes bya ba la smras pa /
translated: The five aggregates is said.

original: phung po drug la sogs par mang du yang ma bshad /
analyzed: phung po drug la sogs par mang du yang ma bshad /
translated: The six aggregates, etc. are not explained in many ways.

original: bzhir nyung du yang ma bshad par ci'i phyir lnga kho nar grangs nges par bstan /
analyzed: bzhir nyung du yang ma bshad par ci'i phyir lnga kho nar grangs nges par bstan /
translated: Why are there not fewer than five aggregates, or more than five?

original: de'i yang lan du bdag dang bdag gi dngos po bstan par bya ba'i phyir phung po lnga po kho na las mang du yang ma bshad nyung du yang ma bshad do //
analyzed: de'i yang lan du bdag dang bdag gi dngos po bstan par bya ba'i phyir phung po lnga po kho na las mang du yang ma bshad nyung du yang ma bshad do //
translated: The aggregates are taught to be exactly five in number in order to show the two kinds of self-existence, the self-existence of the self and the self-existence of what belongs to the self.

original: de la gzugs kyi phung po dang / tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po bzhi ni bdag gi ba'i dgos pa dngos po ste /
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi phung po dang / tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po bzhi ni bdag gi ba'i dgos pa dngos po ste /
translated: The four aggregates of form, feeling, perception, and mental formations are the self-existence of what belongs to the self.

original: sems can dag phal cher de la bdag gi yin no zhes chags so //
analyzed: sems can dag phal cher de la bdag gi yin no zhes chags so //
translated: Most sentient beings are attached to them, thinking, ‚ÄúThis is mine.‚Äù

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po ni bdag ces bya ba'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po ni bdag ces bya ba'i dngos po ste /
translated: The aggregate of consciousness is the self-existence of the self.

original: sems can dag de la bdag ces 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can dag de la bdag ces 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Sentient beings grasp it as the self.

original: yang na snod dang / zas dang / tshag tseg dang / byed pa po dang / zab po'i dngos po bstan pa'i phyir phung po lnga nyid du bshad kyi drug dang bzhi la sogs pa ma bstan to //
analyzed: yang na snod dang / zas dang / tshag tseg dang / byed pa po dang / zab po'i dngos po bstan pa'i phyir phung po lnga nyid du bshad kyi drug dang bzhi la sogs pa ma bstan to //
translated: Or else, the five aggregates are taught in order to indicate the container, the food, the eater, the agent, and the entity that is eaten.

original: de la snod lta bur gyur pa ni gzugs kyi phung po ste /
analyzed: de la snod lta bur gyur pa ni gzugs kyi phung po ste /
translated: The form aggregate is like a container,

original: snod la kha zas brten pa dang 'dra bar tshor ba dang / 'du shes la sogs pa'i phung po yang gzugs kyi phung po la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snod la kha zas brten pa dang 'dra bar tshor ba dang / 'du shes la sogs pa'i phung po yang gzugs kyi phung po la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the aggregates of feeling, perception, etc., are supported on the form aggregate, just as food is supported on a container.

original: zas lta bur gyur pa ni tshor ba'i phung po ste /
analyzed: zas lta bur gyur pa ni tshor ba'i phung po ste /
translated: The aggregate of feeling is like food,

original: kha zas bza' bar bya ba yin pa bzhin du tshor ba bde ba dang / sdug bsngal yang myong bar bya ba'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha zas bza' bar bya ba yin pa bzhin du tshor ba bde ba dang / sdug bsngal yang myong bar bya ba'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain are to be experienced, just as food is to be eaten.

original: tshag tseg lta bur gyur pa ni 'du shes kyi phung po ste /
analyzed: tshag tseg lta bur gyur pa ni 'du shes kyi phung po ste /
translated: The aggregate of perception is like the cook,üîΩbecause it is perception that discriminates the various qualities of the object, just as the cook discriminates the various qualities of the food.

original: kha zas tshod ma la sogs pa tshag tseg dang bsres na lhag par bza' bar nus pa bzhin du mi gtsang ba la gtsang ba dang sdug bsngal la bde bar 'dzin pa'i 'du @33b shes phyin ci log yod na lhag par tshor ba'i phung po la chags parüîΩbyed pas so //
analyzed: kha zas tshod ma la sogs pa tshag tseg dang bsres na lhag par bza' bar nus pa bzhin du mi gtsang ba la gtsang ba dang sdug bsngal la bde bar 'dzin pa'i 'du @33b shes phyin ci log yod na lhag par tshor ba'i phung po la chags par byed pas so //
translated: Just as food mixed with spices can be eaten more easily, if there is a distorted ideation that apprehends the impure as pure and suffering as happiness, then one can more easily generate attachment to the aggregate of feeling.

original: byed pa po lta bur gyur ba ni 'du byed kyi phung po ste /
analyzed: byed pa po lta bur gyur ba ni 'du byed kyi phung po ste /
translated: The aggregate of formation is like the one who acts.

original: las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / de'i 'bras bu bde ba dang sdug bsngal 'du byed kyi phung po sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / de'i 'bras bu bde ba dang sdug bsngal 'du byed kyi phung po sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it establishes the aggregate of formation, which is the result of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma, happiness and suffering.

original: za ba bor gyur pa ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po ste /
analyzed: za ba bor gyur pa ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po ste /
translated: The aggregate of consciousness is like the one who eats.

original: las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu bde ba dang sdug bsngal yang mjug tu rnam par shes pas myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu bde ba dang sdug bsngal yang mjug tu rnam par shes pas myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because consciousness experiences the result of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma, happiness and suffering, in the end.

original: 'o na dang por gzugs kyi phung po bshad /üîΩde'i 'og tu tshor ba /üîΩde'i 'og tu 'du shes /
analyzed: 'o na dang por gzugs kyi phung po bshad / de'i 'og tu tshor ba / de'i 'og tu 'du shes /
translated: Well then, why is the aggregate of form explained first?üîΩWhy is feeling explained after that?

original: de'i 'og tu 'du byed /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'du byed /
translated: Why is discrimination explained after that?üîΩWhy is formation explained after that?

original: de'i 'og tu rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Then consciousness.

original: rim pa 'di ltar ci'i phyir bkod ce na /
analyzed: rim pa 'di ltar ci'i phyir bkod ce na /
translated: Why are they arranged in this order?

original: smras pa / ji ltar spom rim mam rags rim gyis rim pa 'di ltar bkod de /
analyzed: smras pa / ji ltar spom rim mam rags rim gyis rim pa 'di ltar bkod de /
translated: They are arranged in the order in which they are grasped, that is, in the order in which they are apprehended.

original: gzugs kyi phung po ni thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du rnam par shes pa lnga'i rten du gyur pa dang / mig nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du rnam par shes pa drug gi dmigs par gyur pa'i phyir thams cad pas rags shing sbom pas na dang por gzugs kyi phung po bshad do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po ni thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du rnam par shes pa lnga'i rten du gyur pa dang / mig nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du rnam par shes pa drug gi dmigs par gyur pa'i phyir thams cad pas rags shing sbom pas na dang por gzugs kyi phung po bshad do //
translated: The form aggregate is the coarsest and most obvious of the five aggregates, since it is the basis of the five types of consciousness, from eye consciousness to body consciousness, and it is the object of the six types of consciousness, from eye consciousness to mind consciousness.

original: gzugs med pa'i phung po bzhi las 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po bas tshor ba'i phung po rags te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i phung po bzhi las 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po bas tshor ba'i phung po rags te /
translated: The feeling aggregate is coarser and more obvious than the four formless aggregates, the perception aggregate, the formation aggregate, and the consciousness aggregate.

original: bdag gi mgo na bar tshor ro //
analyzed: bdag gi mgo na bar tshor ro //
translated: One feels, ‚ÄúMy head hurts,‚Äù

original: rkang pa na bar tshor ro zhes 'jig rten pa dag gsal bar tha snyad du 'dogs pas na de'i 'og tu tshor ba'i phung po bshad do //
analyzed: rkang pa na bar tshor ro zhes 'jig rten pa dag gsal bar tha snyad du 'dogs pas na de'i 'og tu tshor ba'i phung po bshad do //
translated: Since the world clearly uses the convention ‚ÄúI feel pain in my foot,‚Äù the aggregate of feeling is explained after the aggregate of form.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po dang rnam par shes pa'i phung po bas 'du shes kyi phung po rags te /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po dang rnam par shes pa'i phung po bas 'du shes kyi phung po rags te /
translated: The aggregate of perception is grosser than the aggregates of formation and consciousness.

original: 'di ni bud med 'di ni skyes pa zhes yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa rtogs par sla bas na de'i 'og tu 'du shes kyi phung po bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ni bud med 'di ni skyes pa zhes yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa rtogs par sla bas na de'i 'og tu 'du shes kyi phung po bshad do //
translated: Since it is easy to understand the apprehension of the signs of objects, such as ‚ÄúThis is a woman,‚Äù or ‚ÄúThis is a man,‚Äù the aggregate of perception is explained after the aggregate of feeling.

original: rnam par shes pa pas 'du byed kyi phung po rags te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa pas 'du byed kyi phung po rags te /
translated: The aggregate of formation is grosser than the aggregate of consciousness.

original: las dge ba dang mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid khong du chud par sla zhing 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa sems las byung zhing skyes pa na 'dod chags shig skyes so //
analyzed: las dge ba dang mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid khong du chud par sla zhing 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa sems las byung zhing skyes pa na 'dod chags shig skyes so //
translated: Since it is easy to understand the characteristics of virtuous and nonvirtuous formations, and since it is easy to know and feel that attachment, anger and so on arise from the mind, such as ‚ÄúAttachment has arisen,‚Äù

original: zhe sdang zhig skyes so zhes zhe sdang tshor zhing shes par sla bas de'i 'og tu 'du byed kyi phung po bshad do //
analyzed: zhe sdang zhig skyes so zhes zhe sdang tshor zhing shes par sla bas de'i 'og tu 'du byed kyi phung po bshad do //
translated: or ‚ÄúAnger has arisen,‚Äù the aggregate of formation is explained after the aggregate of perception.

original: rnam par shes pa ni thams cad pas phra ba yin pa'i phyir 'jug tu smos so //üîΩyang na khams gsum gyi @34a * //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni thams cad pas phra ba yin pa'i phyir 'jug tu smos so // yang na khams gsum gyi @34a * //
translated: Consciousness is mentioned last because it is the most subtle of all.

original: rim pas phung po lnga'i rim pa de ltar bkod de /
analyzed: rim pas phung po lnga'i rim pa de ltar bkod de /
translated: Or else, the order of the five aggregates is established according to the order of the three realms.

original: khams gsum ni 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams so //
analyzed: khams gsum ni 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams so //
translated: The three realms are the realm of desire, the realm of form, and the formless realm.

original: de la 'dod pa'i khams na ni rnam par shes pa gzugs la brten pas dang por gzugs kyi phung po bshad do //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams na ni rnam par shes pa gzugs la brten pas dang por gzugs kyi phung po bshad do //
translated: In the realm of desire, consciousness is based on form, so the aggregate of form is mentioned first.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi ni rnam par shes pa bsam gtan gyi bde ba'i tshor ba la brten pas de'i 'og tu tshor ba'i phung po bstan to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi ni rnam par shes pa bsam gtan gyi bde ba'i tshor ba la brten pas de'i 'og tu tshor ba'i phung po bstan to //
translated: The four meditations of the realm of form are based on the feeling of pleasure of the meditations, so the aggregate of feeling is mentioned next.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched na ni rnam par shes pa 'du shes la brten pas de'i 'og tu 'du shes kyi phung po bstan to //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched na ni rnam par shes pa 'du shes la brten pas de'i 'og tu 'du shes kyi phung po bstan to //
translated: In the formless realm, the base of infinite space, the base of infinite consciousness, and the base of nothingness, consciousness is supported by ideation. Therefore, after the aggregate of form, the aggregate of ideation is taught.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo cung zad med cung zad med min skye mched na ni rnam par shes pa sems las byung ba'i tshogs 'du byed kyi chos la brten pas de'i 'og tu 'du byed kyi phung po bstan to //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo cung zad med cung zad med min skye mched na ni rnam par shes pa sems las byung ba'i tshogs 'du byed kyi chos la brten pas de'i 'og tu 'du byed kyi phung po bstan to //
translated: In the peak of cyclic existence, the base of neither ideation nor non-ideation, consciousness is supported by the aggregate of formations, the collection of mental factors. Therefore, after the aggregate of ideation, the aggregate of formations is taught.

original: rnam par shes pa ni de dag kun tu 'gro ba'i phyir mjug tu smos so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni de dag kun tu 'gro ba'i phyir mjug tu smos so //
translated: Consciousness is mentioned last because it is omnipresent.

original: gzugs kyi phung po rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir gzugs gang zhe na zhes dris so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir gzugs gang zhe na zhes dris so //
translated: To present the classification of the aggregate of form, the root text asks, ‚ÄúWhat is form?‚Äù

original: brgal ba gong du ming tsam du bstan pa'i tshe ni gzugs kyi phung bo zhes smras la /
analyzed: brgal ba gong du ming tsam du bstan pa'i tshe ni gzugs kyi phung bo zhes smras la /
translated: In the previous section, when form was mentioned as mere name, the aggregate of form was mentioned.

original: 'dir gzugs kyi phung po gang zhe na zhes mi 'dri bar ci'i phyir gzugs gang zhe na zhes 'dri /
analyzed: 'dir gzugs kyi phung po gang zhe na zhes mi 'dri bar ci'i phyir gzugs gang zhe na zhes 'dri /
translated: Here, why is it asked, ‚ÄúWhat is the form aggregate?‚Äù rather than ‚ÄúWhat is the form aggregate?‚Äù

original: smras pa / gzugs las ma gtogs par phung po logs shig na med de /
analyzed: smras pa / gzugs las ma gtogs par phung po logs shig na med de /
translated: It is said: The aggregate is not separate from form.

original: nas dang 'bras la sogs pa'i phung po bzhin no //
analyzed: nas dang 'bras la sogs pa'i phung po bzhin no //
translated: It is like the aggregates of barley, rice, and so on.

original: dper na nas dang 'bras grub na phung po yang zla la grub pa dang 'dra bar gzugs grub na phung po yang zla la grub bas gzugs gang zhe na zhes dris kyang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: dper na nas dang 'bras grub na phung po yang zla la grub pa dang 'dra bar gzugs grub na phung po yang zla la grub bas gzugs gang zhe na zhes dris kyang nyes pa med do //
translated: For example, when barley and rice are established, the aggregate is also established. Similarly, when form is established, the aggregate is also established. Therefore, there is no fault in asking, ‚ÄúWhat is form?‚Äù

original: yang na gzugs kyi don sngar bstan nas phung po'i don phyis 'chad pas gzugs gang zhe na zhes dris kyi gzugs kyi phung po gang zhe na zhes ma dris so //
analyzed: yang na gzugs kyi don sngar bstan nas phung po'i don phyis 'chad pas gzugs gang zhe na zhes dris kyi gzugs kyi phung po gang zhe na zhes ma dris so //
translated: Or, since the meaning of form was taught previously, the meaning of aggregate is explained later. Therefore, it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is form?‚Äù but not ‚ÄúWhat is the form aggregate?‚Äù

original: cung zad gzugs gang yin pa de dag thams cad ces bya ba ni gang gzugs kyi rnam grangs su gzhag pa 'das pa'i gzugs dang / ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs dang / da ltar gyi gzugs dang / gzugs bzang po dang / gzugs ngan pa dang /
analyzed: cung zad gzugs gang yin pa de dag thams cad ces bya ba ni gang gzugs kyi rnam grangs su gzhag pa 'das pa'i gzugs dang / ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs dang / da ltar gyi gzugs dang / gzugs bzang po dang / gzugs ngan pa dang /
translated: All that is form is included in the four great elements and the form derived from the four great elements.üîΩThe meaning is that all that is classified as form, whether past form, future form, or present form, good form or bad form,

original: gzugs ring ba dang / gzugs thung ba dang / gzugs phra ba dang / gzugs sbom po zhes bya ba de dag thams cad @34b 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i gzugs dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'i gzugs su 'dus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs ring ba dang / gzugs thung ba dang / gzugs phra ba dang / gzugs sbom po zhes bya ba de dag thams cad @34b 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i gzugs dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'i gzugs su 'dus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: long form or short form, subtle form or gross form, is included in the form of the four great elements and the form derived from the four great elements.

original: de nas gzugs rnam pa gnyis pa bstan te /
analyzed: de nas gzugs rnam pa gnyis pa bstan te /
translated: Next, the author teaches a second classification of form:

original: rgyu'i gzugs dang / 'bras bu'i gzugs so //
analyzed: rgyu'i gzugs dang / 'bras bu'i gzugs so //
translated: primary form and derivative form.

original: de la 'byung ba chen po bzhi zhes bya bas rgyu'i gzugs bstan te ;
analyzed: de la 'byung ba chen po bzhi zhes bya bas rgyu'i gzugs bstan te ;
translated: The four great elements are taught as primary form

original: gzugs thams cad kyi rgyu ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs thams cad kyi rgyu ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the cause of all form.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'i gzugs zhes bya bas 'bras bu'i gzugs bstan to //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'i gzugs zhes bya bas 'bras bu'i gzugs bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúform derived from the four great elements‚Äù indicates resultant form.

original: de la 'byung ba'i don ci dkar po dang / ser po la sogs pa'i gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs chen po de dag de las 'byung zhing skye bas na 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'byung ba'i don ci dkar po dang / ser po la sogs pa'i gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs chen po de dag de las 'byung zhing skye bas na 'byung ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúgreat element‚Äù is as follows: These are called ‚Äúgreat elements‚Äù because they are the sources from which various kinds of form, such as blue, yellow, and so on, are derived.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs bcu gcig la khyab pas na chen po'o //üîΩyang na skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can yin bas na 'byung pa'o //
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs bcu gcig la khyab pas na chen po'o // yang na skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can yin bas na 'byung pa'o //
translated: They are called ‚Äúgreat‚Äù because they pervade the eleven types of form that are derived from them.üîΩAlternatively, they are called ‚Äúgreat elements‚Äù because they are subject to origination and destruction.

original: yang nas dang chu dang me dang rlung 'di dag sems can gyi las kyis 'byung bas na 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: yang nas dang chu dang me dang rlung 'di dag sems can gyi las kyis 'byung bas na 'byung ba'o //
translated: They are called ‚Äúgreat elements‚Äù because they are the sources from which the world originates.

original: chen po ni sa'i khams 'di dag gnas pa che ste /
analyzed: chen po ni sa'i khams 'di dag gnas pa che ste /
translated: They are called ‚Äúgreat‚Äù because the earth element is the foundation of the world,üîΩbecause the water element is the source of the world,üîΩbecause the fire element is the source of the world,

original: thog thag tu khyab par mngon sum du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thog thag tu khyab par mngon sum du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and because the wind element is the source of the world.

original: chu'i khams kyang che ste /
analyzed: chu'i khams kyang che ste /
translated: The water element is also great

original: nam sems can rnams 'dod chags kyi shas che ba na /
analyzed: nam sems can rnams 'dod chags kyi shas che ba na /
translated: because when sentient beings are overcome by passion,

original: chu'i bskal pa byung bas bsam gtan dang po pa man chad 'jig par byed do //üîΩme'i khams 'di yang che ste /üîΩnam sems can zhe sdang gi shas che ba na /
analyzed: chu'i bskal pa byung bas bsam gtan dang po pa man chad 'jig par byed do // me'i khams 'di yang che ste / nam sems can zhe sdang gi shas che ba na /
translated: The eon of water destroys the world up to the first meditation.üîΩThe eon of fire destroys the world up to the second meditation.

original: me'i bskal pas bsam gtan gnyis pa man chad sreg par byed do //üîΩrlung gi khams kyang che ste /
analyzed: me'i bskal pas bsam gtan gnyis pa man chad sreg par byed do // rlung gi khams kyang che ste /
translated: When beings are dominated by hatred, the eon of fire begins.üîΩThe eon of wind destroys the world up to the third meditation.

original: nam sems can gti mug bdo ba na rlung gi bskal pas bsam gtan gsum pa man chad 'jig par byed do //
analyzed: nam sems can gti mug bdo ba na rlung gi bskal pas bsam gtan gsum pa man chad 'jig par byed do //
translated: When beings are dominated by delusion, the eon of wind begins.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir 'byung ba chen po bzhi kho nar bshad la lnga dang gsum la sogs par bshad /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir 'byung ba chen po bzhi kho nar bshad la lnga dang gsum la sogs par bshad /
translated: Why are only four fundamental material elements taught?

original: smras pa / sa bon gyi rten dang / sa bon brlan pa dang / sa bon smin pa dang / 'phel bar 'di bzhi kho nas byed de /
analyzed: smras pa / sa bon gyi rten dang / sa bon brlan pa dang / sa bon smin pa dang / 'phel bar 'di bzhi kho nas byed de /
translated: The four are taught because they are the basis of the seed, the moistening of the seed, the ripening of the seed, and the growth of the seed.

original: lngar bshad du ni dgos pa med gsum du bshad na mi nus pas khri'i rkang pa bzhin te bzhi kho nar bshad do //
analyzed: lngar bshad du ni dgos pa med gsum du bshad na mi nus pas khri'i rkang pa bzhin te bzhi kho nar bshad do //
translated: There is no need to teach a fifth or a third, because they are not capable of being taught as such. They are taught as four, like the legs of a bed.

original: de la sa bon gyi rten ni sa'i khams kyis byed do //
analyzed: de la sa bon gyi rten ni sa'i khams kyis byed do //
translated: The earth element is the basis of the seed.

original: sa bon brlan bar ni chu'i khams kyis byed do //
analyzed: sa bon brlan bar ni chu'i khams kyis byed do //
translated: The water element causes the seed to swell.

original: sa bon smin par ni me'i khams kyis byed do //
analyzed: sa bon smin par ni me'i khams kyis byed do //
translated: The fire element ripens the seed.

original: sa bon 'phel bar ni rlung gi khams kyis byed do //
analyzed: sa bon 'phel bar ni rlung gi khams kyis byed do //
translated: The wind element causes the seed to grow.

original: bskal pa nam mkha'i khams kyang sa bon skye ba @35a * //
analyzed: bskal pa nam mkha'i khams kyang sa bon skye ba @35a * //
translated: The space element does not cause the seed to grow, but it does not obstruct the seed.

original: la go skabs 'byed bar byed na des bsnan te ci'i phyir 'byung ba chen po lngar me gzhag / smras pa /
analyzed: la go skabs 'byed bar byed na des bsnan te ci'i phyir 'byung ba chen po lngar me gzhag / smras pa /
translated: If the space element does not obstruct the seed, why is it not included among the causes of the seed?üîΩThe space element does not obstruct the seed because it is not obstructed by form.

original: go skabs 'byed par byed pa ni gzugs can gyi chos kyis byed la nam mkha' la ni gzugs med pas go skabs 'byed pa med pa dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi ni skye ba dang ; 'jig pa'i chos can yin la nam mkha' la skye ba dang /
analyzed: go skabs 'byed par byed pa ni gzugs can gyi chos kyis byed la nam mkha' la ni gzugs med pas go skabs 'byed pa med pa dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi ni skye ba dang ; 'jig pa'i chos can yin la nam mkha' la skye ba dang /
translated: The four great elements are subject to arising and destruction, but space is not subject to arising and destruction.

original: 'jig pa med pas 'byung ba chen po zhes mi bya'o //üîΩ'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jig pa med pas 'byung ba chen po zhes mi bya'o // 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, space is not included among the great elements.üîΩThe S≈´tra says: ‚ÄúThe form that is derived from the four great elements.‚Äù

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgyu las skyes pa'am /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgyu las skyes pa'am /
translated: The form that is derived from the four great elements as its cause.

original: 'byung ba chen po 'di dag las mthong ba'i gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po 'di dag las mthong ba'i gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Visible form derived from the four great elements is called ‚Äúderived‚Äù because it is the cause of the four great elements.

original: de'ang mig gi dbang po la sogs pa rnam pa bcu gcig go zhes 'og nas 'chad do //
analyzed: de'ang mig gi dbang po la sogs pa rnam pa bcu gcig go zhes 'og nas 'chad do //
translated: This is explained below as the eleven types of form, such as the eye faculty.

original: de las 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag ni rgyu rnam pa lngas 'byung ba chen po las gyur pa'i gzugs kyi rgyu byed de /
analyzed: de las 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag ni rgyu rnam pa lngas 'byung ba chen po las gyur pa'i gzugs kyi rgyu byed de /
translated: The four great elements act as the cause of form derived from the great elements in five ways.

original: rgyu rnam pa lnga ni skyed pa dang ; brten pa dang / gnas pa dang / rton pa dang / 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa lnga ni skyed pa dang ; brten pa dang / gnas pa dang / rton pa dang / 'phel ba'o //
translated: The five ways are as the cause of generation, support, abiding, reliance, and growth.

original: de la sa bon med na myu gu mi skye ba bzhin du 'byung ba chen po bzhi med na rgyur byas pa'i gzugs mi skye bas na skyed pa'i rgyu byed do //
analyzed: de la sa bon med na myu gu mi skye ba bzhin du 'byung ba chen po bzhi med na rgyur byas pa'i gzugs mi skye bas na skyed pa'i rgyu byed do //
translated: If there is no seed, a sprout does not arise. Similarly, if the four great elements do not exist, form derived from the great elements does not arise. Therefore, the great elements act as the cause of generation.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi la ma brten par rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dag logs shig tu gnas pa'i mthu med de /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi la ma brten par rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dag logs shig tu gnas pa'i mthu med de /
translated: Form derived from the great elements does not have the power to abide separately without relying on the four great elements.

original: de bas na brten pa'i rgyu byed do //
analyzed: de bas na brten pa'i rgyu byed do //
translated: Therefore, the great elements act as the cause of support.

original: shing bcad na grib ma med par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: shing bcad na grib ma med par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as when a tree is cut down, its shade disappears.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag nyams sam snang rmas na rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams kyang nyams par 'gyur bas na gnas pa'i rgyu byed do //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag nyams sam snang rmas na rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams kyang nyams par 'gyur bas na gnas pa'i rgyu byed do //
translated: The four great elements act as the cause of endurance because when the four great elements deteriorate or are damaged, the form derived from the four great elements also deteriorates.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dper na rgan po 'khar ba la brten nas 'gro ba dang 'dra bar skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis skye ba dang / rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams kyi skad cig ma'i rgyun kyang rgyun mi 'chad par skye bar byed pas na rton pa'i rgyu byed do //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dper na rgan po 'khar ba la brten nas 'gro ba dang 'dra bar skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis skye ba dang / rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams kyi skad cig ma'i rgyun kyang rgyun mi 'chad par skye bar byed pas na rton pa'i rgyu byed do //
translated: The four great elements act as the cause of support because they cause the continuum of the form derived from the four great elements to arise without interruption, just as an old man walks with the support of a stick.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi brtas shing smin na rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyang brtas par 'gyur bas na 'phel ba'i rgyu byed do //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi brtas shing smin na rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyang brtas par 'gyur bas na 'phel ba'i rgyu byed do //
translated: The four great elements act as the cause of growth because when the four great elements increase and mature, the form derived from the four great elements also increases.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi grangs tsam bstan pa dmigs kyis phye ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi grangs tsam bstan pa dmigs kyis phye ste /
translated: The four great elements are taught in terms of their mere enumeration.

original: bshad par bya ba'i phyir 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag gang zhe na zhes dris nas /
analyzed: bshad par bya ba'i phyir 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag gang zhe na zhes dris nas /
translated: In order to explain them in terms of their specific characteristics, the root text asks, ‚ÄúWhat are the four great elements?‚Äù and then responds,

original: sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams so zhes @35b bshad do //
analyzed: sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams so zhes @35b bshad do //

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: sa'i khams gang zhe na sra ba nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: sa'i khams gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni sa'i khams kyi mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: gang sra ba dang / mkhrang ba dang / lci ba ni sa'i khams kyi mtshan nyid do //

original: chu'i khams gang zhe na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chu'i khams gang zhe na zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: chu'i khams kyi mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //

analyzed: gsher ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni gang gsher ba dang snum pa dang brlan pa ni chu'i khams kyi mtshan nyid do //

original: me'i khams gang zhe na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: me'i khams gang zhe na zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: ma'i khams kyi mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'o //

analyzed: tsha ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni gang tsha ba dang / dro ba dang tshig par byed pa ni me'i khams kyi mtshan nyid do //

original: rlung gi khams gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rlung gi khams gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: yang zhing g-yo ba nyid ni rlung gi khams kyi mtshan nyid de yang ba ni 'gul bar byed pa'o //

analyzed: g-yo ba ni dngos po'i rgyun yul gzhan du phyin cing skye bar byed pa'o //

analyzed: brgal bas sa dang chu dang me'i gsum la mtshan nyid re re bstan la /

original: rlung gi khams la ni yang ba dang g-yo ba ste /
analyzed: rlung gi khams la ni yang ba dang g-yo ba ste /
translated: But the wind element has lightness and motility.

original: ci'i phyir mtshan nyid gnyis su bshad /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mtshan nyid gnyis su bshad /

analyzed: lan du gal te yang ba 'ba' zhig smos la /

translated: If ‚Äúmovement‚Äù were not mentioned, then smoothness, roughness, heaviness, and lightness would be derivative form that is the object of the body sense faculty and would be derivative form that is the wind element.

original: rlung gi khams su 'gyur du dogs pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //üîΩgal te g-yo ba 'ba' zhig smos kyi yang ba ma smos na ni sems las byung ba'i chos bshad pa'i skabs su sems pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rlung gi khams su 'gyur du dogs pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro // gal te g-yo ba 'ba' zhig smos kyi yang ba ma smos na ni sems las byung ba'i chos bshad pa'i skabs su sems pa gang zhe na /
translated: This would be a fault, since it would be suspected that the wind element would be included in the primary elements.üîΩIf only ‚Äúmovement‚Äù were mentioned and not ‚Äúlightness,‚Äù then intention, which is mentioned in the section on mental factors, would be suspected of being the wind element, since it is said, ‚ÄúWhat is intention?

original: gang sems g-yo ba'o zhes 'byung ba'i sems pa de rlung gi khams su 'gyur du dogs pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang sems g-yo ba'o zhes 'byung ba'i sems pa de rlung gi khams su 'gyur du dogs pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
translated: It is the movement of the mind.‚Äù

analyzed: de bas na gang yang ba dang g-yo ba'i chos gnyis gang yod pa de ni rlung gi khams kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Therefore the characteristic of the wind element is any phenomenon that is both light and moving.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i mtshan nyid bshad nas las bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i mtshan nyid bshad nas las bstan par bya ste /

analyzed: de la las ni brtan pa dang / sdud pa dang / smin pa dang / 'phel bar byed pa'o //

original: sa'i khams kyi las ni brtan par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sa'i khams kyi las ni brtan par byed pa'o //

original: @36a * // chu'i khams kyi las ni sdud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: @36a * // chu'i khams kyi las ni sdud par byed pa'o //
translated: The function of the water element is toüîΩcohere.

original: me'i khams kyi las ni smin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: me'i khams kyi las ni smin par byed pa'o //
translated: The function of the fire element is to ripen.

original: rlung gi khams kyi las ni 'phel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rlung gi khams kyi las ni 'phel bar byed pa'o //

original: 'o na khams kyi don ci /
analyzed: 'o na khams kyi don ci /
translated: What is the meaning of element?

original: khams kyi don ni 'dzin par byed pa'i don to ste /
analyzed: khams kyi don ni 'dzin par byed pa'i don to ste /

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs bcu gcig 'dzin pas na /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs bcu gcig 'dzin pas na /
translated: Since the eleven types of derivative form are held,

analyzed: sa'i khams chu'i khams me'i khams rlung gi khams zhes bya'o //
translated: the earth element, water element, fire element, and wind element areüîΩmentioned.

analyzed: yang na rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pas na khams zhes bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, they are called elements because they hold their own andüîΩgeneral characteristics.üîΩThe earth element holds the characteristic of solidity, the water elementüîΩholds the characteristic of fluidity, and so on. They also hold the general

original: sa sra ba'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa dang chu gsher ba'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa la sogs pa dang / mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang ; bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: sa sra ba'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa dang chu gsher ba'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa la sogs pa dang / mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang ; bdag med pa ste /
translated: characteristics of impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and nonself.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pas so //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pas so //
translated: because it grasps the general characteristics.

original: yang na gang na 'byung ba chen po bzhi gcig yod pa de ni gcig gi nang na yang bzhi char yang yod do //
analyzed: yang na gang na 'byung ba chen po bzhi gcig yod pa de ni gcig gi nang na yang bzhi char yang yod do //
translated: Or else, wherever the four great elements occur, there is a totality of the four.

analyzed: dper na sa gang na yod pa na chu dang me dang rlung yang yod /
translated: For example, wherever there is earth, there is also water, fire and wind.

analyzed: chu gang na yod pa na sa dang me dang rlung yang yod pa las de na gang mthu che zhing shas che ba de ni sa zhes dngos su ming gis smos la / chu dang / me dang / rlung lta bu shas chung zhing mthu chung bar gnas pa la ni khams zhes bya'o //
translated: But, in the place where one of the great elements predominates, it is this one which gives its name to the complex: earth, water, fire or wind.üîΩThe other great elements are there, but in a state of potentiality, as potentialities.üîΩFor example, when one takes a handful of wheat, there is a certain amount of weight due to the ether and to space.

original: de'ang dper na phye phul gang dang ldan tshva phul gang bsres pa las lan tshva mthu che zhing shas che bar gyur pas lan tshva kha zhing dngos su ming gis 'byin kyang phye de na khams kyi mtshan nyid du med pa ma yin te yod do //
analyzed: de'ang dper na phye phul gang dang ldan tshva phul gang bsres pa las lan tshva mthu che zhing shas che bar gyur pas lan tshva kha zhing dngos su ming gis 'byin kyang phye de na khams kyi mtshan nyid du med pa ma yin te yod do //
translated: But the wheat is not called space because of this.

original: 'byung ba chen po gcig yod pa na kun yod par ci mngon /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po gcig yod pa na kun yod par ci mngon /
translated: If one of the great elements exists, how do you know that all exist?

original: lan du bcom ldan 'das kyi lung mdo las kyang 'byung la rigs pas brtags na yang mngon no //
analyzed: lan du bcom ldan 'das kyi lung mdo las kyang 'byung la rigs pas brtags na yang mngon no //
translated: The Blessed One‚Äôs scriptures state this, and it is evident when one examines with reasoning.

original: lung las 'byung bas ni mngal du 'pho ba'i mdor dga' bo pha dang ma'i mi gtsang pa ska ba las lus su gyur pa la sa dang chu dang me dang rlung rnams sra ba dang sdud pa dang / smin pa dang 'phel ba'i bya ba byed cing gnas so //
analyzed: lung las 'byung bas ni mngal du 'pho ba'i mdor dga' bo pha dang ma'i mi gtsang pa ska ba las lus su gyur pa la sa dang chu dang me dang rlung rnams sra ba dang sdud pa dang / smin pa dang 'phel ba'i bya ba byed cing gnas so //
translated: The scriptures state this in the Descent into the Womb Sutra, where it says that in the womb, Nanda, the body that arises from the parents‚Äô semen and blood is formed by the earth, water, fire, and wind elements, which perform the functions of solidity, cohesion, cooking, and inflation.

original: gal te dga' bo de na sa'i khams yod la chu'i khams med na ni phye'am thal ba'i chang bu bzhin du skams pa'am 'thul bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te dga' bo de na sa'i khams yod la chu'i khams med na ni phye'am thal ba'i chang bu bzhin du skams pa'am 'thul bar 'gyur te /
translated: If, Nanda, the earth element exists there but not the water element, it would dry up and evaporate like a lump of salt.

original: chus bsdus pas na mi 'thul zhing mi 'jig go //
analyzed: chus bsdus pas na mi 'thul zhing mi 'jig go //
translated: But because it is held together by water, it does not evaporate and disintegrate.

original: gal te chu yod la sa med na ni 'bru mar ram yungs mar bzhin du 'dzag cing 'bo bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te chu yod la sa med na ni 'bru mar ram yungs mar bzhin du 'dzag cing 'bo bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If water exists but not earth, it would flow and drip like oil or sesame seed paste.

original: gal te sa dang chu yod la me med na sha rul bzhin du myags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sa dang chu yod la me med na sha rul bzhin du myags par 'gyur ro //
translated: If earth and water exist but not fire, it would rot like meat.

original: gal te sa dang chu dang me yod la rlung med na @36b ni ji tsam du gnas pa las 'phel zhing rgyas par mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te sa dang chu dang me yod la rlung med na @36b ni ji tsam du gnas pa las 'phel zhing rgyas par mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: If earth, water, and fire exist but not wind, it would not grow or expand as much as it abides.

original: rigs pas brtags na yang gcig gang na yod pa na kun yod par mngon te rdo ba dang shing la sogs pa 'byar zhing so sor ma gyes pas na sa'i khams la chu'i khams yod par mngon no //
analyzed: rigs pas brtags na yang gcig gang na yod pa na kun yod par mngon te rdo ba dang shing la sogs pa 'byar zhing so sor ma gyes pas na sa'i khams la chu'i khams yod par mngon no //
translated: When examined by reasoning, it is evident that wherever one exists, all exist. Since stone, wood, etc., are joined and not separated, it is evident that the earth element exists in the earth element.

original: rdo dang shing la sogs pa g-yo zhing 'gul bas na rlung gi khams yod do //
analyzed: rdo dang shing la sogs pa g-yo zhing 'gul bas na rlung gi khams yod do //
translated: Since stone, wood, etc., move and shake, the wind element exists.

original: rdo gnyis phan tshun du phrad pa las me stag 'byung bas na me'i khams yod do //
analyzed: rdo gnyis phan tshun du phrad pa las me stag 'byung bas na me'i khams yod do //
translated: Since sparks occur from two stones striking each other, the fire element exists.

original: chu'i khams la yang gru dang 'dab ma la sogs pa 'dzin cing rten byed pas na chu'i khams la yang sa'i khams yod par mngon no //
analyzed: chu'i khams la yang gru dang 'dab ma la sogs pa 'dzin cing rten byed pas na chu'i khams la yang sa'i khams yod par mngon no //
translated: Since the water element holds and supports boats, leaves, etc., it is evident that the earth element exists in the water element.

original: chu'i nang du shing gi 'dab ma dang rtsva lhung ba 'drul zhing chu dron po dag kyang dmigs pas na chu'i nang na me yod par mngon no //
analyzed: chu'i nang du shing gi 'dab ma dang rtsva lhung ba 'drul zhing chu dron po dag kyang dmigs pas na chu'i nang na me yod par mngon no //
translated: The presence of fire in water is inferred from the observation of the rotting of leaves and grass in water and the presence of warm water.

original: thur du 'bab cing g-yo bas na rlung yod par mngon no //
analyzed: thur du 'bab cing g-yo bas na rlung yod par mngon no //
translated: The presence of wind is inferred from the downward movement and agitation of water.

original: rlung gi khams la yang 'dab ma dang rtsva 'dzin cing 'degs pas na sa'i khams yod par mngon no //
analyzed: rlung gi khams la yang 'dab ma dang rtsva 'dzin cing 'degs pas na sa'i khams yod par mngon no //
translated: The presence of the earth element in the wind element is inferred from the fact that wind holds up and carries leaves and grass.

original: rlung dro ba dag kyang dmigs la rdzas brlan pa rnams rlung la phyar na skam par 'gyur bas me'i khams yod par mngon no //üîΩtshub ma dang rlung gcig tu 'dus shing 'gyur zhing 'byung bas na /

translated: The presence of the fire element in the wind element is inferred from the observation of warm winds and the drying of wet objects by wind.

original: chu'i khams kyang yod par mngon no //
analyzed: chu'i khams kyang yod par mngon no //
translated: The presence of the water element in the wind element is inferred from the fact that wind collects and holds together dust and chaff.

original: me'i khams la yang me lce gcig gis gcig 'dzin pa dang / me lces 'dab ma dang rtsva la sogs pa 'degs shing 'dzin pas na sa'i khams yod par yang mngon no //
analyzed: me'i khams la yang me lce gcig gis gcig 'dzin pa dang / me lces 'dab ma dang rtsva la sogs pa 'degs shing 'dzin pas na sa'i khams yod par yang mngon no //
translated: The presence of the earth element in the fire element is inferred from the fact that flames support each other and hold up leaves, grass, etc.

original: me lce rnams kyang so sor mi 'gyes par gcig tu 'bar bas na chu'i khams yod par mngon no //
analyzed: me lce rnams kyang so sor mi 'gyes par gcig tu 'bar bas na chu'i khams yod par mngon no //
translated: Since the flames do not spread out but burn together, the water element is evident.

original: 'gul zhing g-yo bas na rlung gi khams kyang yod par mngon no //
analyzed: 'gul zhing g-yo bas na rlung gi khams kyang yod par mngon no //
translated: Since it moves and vibrates, the wind element is evident.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag bshad nas /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the four great elements,

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs la phye na grangs du yod pa dang ming gis gang dang gang yin pa dang de dag gi mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs la phye na grangs du yod pa dang ming gis gang dang gang yin pa dang de dag gi mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat are the derivative forms?‚Äù

analyzed: de'i don ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs la grangs ni du zhig yod /

analyzed: ming gis ni gang dang gang yin /

analyzed: gzugs nas reg bya'i phyogs mtshan nyid ni ji lta bu zhes dris pa'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: de dag bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach those,

analyzed: mig gi dbang po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it says ‚Äúthe eye faculty‚Äù and so on.

analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi grangs ni mig gi dbang po nas lus kyi dbang po'i bar du dbang @37a * //
translated: The number of derivative form is from the eye faculty to the body faculty.üîΩ

analyzed: po lnga dang ; gzugs nas reg bya'i phyogs gcig gi bar du yul lnga dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pas bsnan te bcu gcig go //
translated: The number of derivative form is eleven: the five sense faculties from the eye faculty to the body faculty, the five objects from visible form to tactility, and nonindicative form.

original: de dag gi ming yang /
analyzed: de dag gi ming yang /
translated: The names of these are

original: mig gi dbang po dang / rna ba'i dbang po dang / sna'i dbang po dang / lce'i dbang po dang / lus kyi dbang po dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i phyogs gcig dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o zhes ming gis smos pa rnams so //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po dang / rna ba'i dbang po dang / sna'i dbang po dang / lce'i dbang po dang / lus kyi dbang po dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i phyogs gcig dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o zhes ming gis smos pa rnams so //
translated: the eye faculty, the ear faculty, the nose faculty, the tongue faculty, the body faculty, visible form, sound, smell, taste, one part of tactility, and nonindicative form.

original: de dag gi mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach their characteristics,

original: mig gi dbang po gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: the root text asks, ‚ÄúWhat is the eye faculty?‚Äù

original: de yang mig gi dbang po'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: de yang mig gi dbang po'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: This is the same as asking, ‚ÄúWhat is the defining characteristic of the eye faculty?‚Äù

original: de'i mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach its defining characteristic, the root text says,
