analyzed: yul kha dog gzugs dang ba'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The object is the clarity of form.

original: mig gi dbang po'i yul ni sngon po dang / ser po dang / dkar po dang / dmar po la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po'i yul ni sngon po dang / ser po dang / dkar po dang / dmar po la sogs pa yin la /
translated: The object of the eye sense-faculty is blue, yellow, red, white, etc.

original: dper na me long dang shel dang chu la sogs pa gzugs dang zhing gsal bas gzugs brnyan snang ba 'byung ba bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na me long dang shel dang chu la sogs pa gzugs dang zhing gsal bas gzugs brnyan snang ba 'byung ba bzhin du /
translated: For example, when a mirror, a crystal, water, etc. are clear, the reflection of a form appears.

original: mig gi dbang po yang gzugs dang zhing gsal ste /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po yang gzugs dang zhing gsal ste /
translated: In the same way, when the eye sense-faculty is clear,

original: gzugs dang phrad par 'gyur pa na /
analyzed: gzugs dang phrad par 'gyur pa na /
translated: when it comes into contact with a form,

original: gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan 'byung bar 'gyur nas gzugs kyi rang bzhin ji lta bu yin pa de dang mthun pa kho nar mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i rgyu byed de /
analyzed: gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan 'byung bar 'gyur nas gzugs kyi rang bzhin ji lta bu yin pa de dang mthun pa kho nar mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i rgyu byed de /
translated: the reflection of the form arises and the eye consciousness arises in accordance with the nature of the form.

original: de bas na gzugs dang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs dang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is why it is called clarity of form.

original: mig gi dbang po'i yul rdul phra rab ni mig gi sprin gyi nang na zar ma'i me tog kha 'bus ltar gnas so //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po'i yul rdul phra rab ni mig gi sprin gyi nang na zar ma'i me tog kha 'bus ltar gnas so //
translated: The atoms of the object of the eye sense-faculty are located in the eye, like the petals of a jasmine flower.

original: smras pa / de ltar na dang ba'i sgra smos pas chog mod gzugs kyi sgra smos pa ji dgos /üîΩsmras pa / gzugs kyi sgra ma smos par dang ba 'ba' zhig smos pa na ni sems las byung ba bshad pa'i skabs su dad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: smras pa / de ltar na dang ba'i sgra smos pas chog mod gzugs kyi sgra smos pa ji dgos / smras pa / gzugs kyi sgra ma smos par dang ba 'ba' zhig smos pa na ni sems las byung ba bshad pa'i skabs su dad pa gang zhe na /
translated: Objection: In that case, it would suffice to say the term clarity. Why say the term form?üîΩResponse: If the term form were not mentioned and only clarity were mentioned, then when the mental factors are explained, it would be thought that faith is the eye faculty, since it is said, ‚ÄúWhat is faith?

original: sems dang ba'o zhes bshad pa de mig gi dbang po yin no snyam du yid gol bar 'gyur bas gzugs kyi sgra smos te /
analyzed: sems dang ba'o zhes bshad pa de mig gi dbang po yin no snyam du yid gol bar 'gyur bas gzugs kyi sgra smos te /
translated: It is clarity of mind.‚Äù Therefore the term form is mentioned.

original: dad pa dang ba yin yang sems pa ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin ma yin la /
analyzed: dad pa dang ba yin yang sems pa ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin ma yin la /
translated: Faith is clarity, but it is not by nature form.

original: mig gi dbang po ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin yang yin no //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin yang yin no //
translated: The eye faculty is by nature form.

original: dang ba'i rang bzhin yang yin pas so //
analyzed: dang ba'i rang bzhin yang yin pas so //
translated: It is also by nature clarity.

original: smras pa / 'o na gzugs zhes smos pas chog mod /
analyzed: smras pa / 'o na gzugs zhes smos pas chog mod /
translated: Objection: In that case, it would suffice to say the term form.

original: dang ba'i sgra smos ji dgos lan du gzugs 'ba' zhig smos la dang ba ma smos na rdo dang shing la sogs pa'i @37b gzugs kyang mig gi dbang po yin no snyam du yid gol bar 'gyur ba dang / ling tog gis khebs pa dang dmus long dag la yang mig gi dbang po yod pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas na dang ba'i sgra smos te /
analyzed: dang ba'i sgra smos ji dgos lan du gzugs 'ba' zhig smos la dang ba ma smos na rdo dang shing la sogs pa'i @37b gzugs kyang mig gi dbang po yin no snyam du yid gol bar 'gyur ba dang / ling tog gis khebs pa dang dmus long dag la yang mig gi dbang po yod pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas na dang ba'i sgra smos te /
translated: And there would be the fault that the eye faculty would exist for those who are covered by cataracts and for the blind.üîΩTherefore, the term clarity is mentioned.

original: rdo dang shing la sogs pa dang ling rtog gis khebs pa dang dmus long la sogs pa la gzugs yin du zin kyang dad pa med pa'i phyir mig gi dbang po ma yin no //
analyzed: rdo dang shing la sogs pa dang ling rtog gis khebs pa dang dmus long la sogs pa la gzugs yin du zin kyang dad pa med pa'i phyir mig gi dbang po ma yin no //
translated: Even though form exists for those covered by cataracts, for the blind, and for stone, wood, and so on, it is not the eye faculty because it lacks clarity.

original: yang smras pa de ltar na /
analyzed: yang smras pa de ltar na /
translated: Again, it is said:

original: gzugs dang ba zhes smos pas chog mod yul kha dog zhes smos pa'i sgra ji dgos /
analyzed: gzugs dang ba zhes smos pas chog mod yul kha dog zhes smos pa'i sgra ji dgos /
translated: If it is sufficient to state clarity of form, what is the need for the term object color?

original: lan du de yang dgos pa rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir yul kha dog ces mi brjod du mi rung ste /
analyzed: lan du de yang dgos pa rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir yul kha dog ces mi brjod du mi rung ste /
translated: In response, it is not suitable to not state the object color for two reasons.

original: gzugs dang ba 'ba' zhig smos la yul kha dog ma smos na /üîΩrna ba la sogs pa'i dbang po yang gzugs dang ba yin pas de mig gi dbang po yin no snyam du yid gol bar 'gyur ba dang / me long dang / shel dang chu la sogs pa yang gzugs dang ba yin pas /
analyzed: gzugs dang ba 'ba' zhig smos la yul kha dog ma smos na / rna ba la sogs pa'i dbang po yang gzugs dang ba yin pas de mig gi dbang po yin no snyam du yid gol bar 'gyur ba dang / me long dang / shel dang chu la sogs pa yang gzugs dang ba yin pas /
translated: If only the clarity of form were mentioned, and not the object, color,üîΩthen the ear and other sense organs would be the clarity of form, and it would be thought that they are the eye sense organ.

original: de dag mig gi dbang po yin no snyam du yid gol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag mig gi dbang po yin no snyam du yid gol bar 'gyur te /
translated: And it would be thought that mirrors, crystals, water, etc. are the eye sense organ, because they are the clarity of form.

original: de dag gzugs dang ba yin du zin kyang yul kha dog ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gzugs dang ba yin du zin kyang yul kha dog ma yin no //
translated: Even though they are the clarity of form, they are not the object, color.

original: de bas na gang yul kha dog kyang yin gzugs kyang yin dang ba yang yin pa de ni mig gi dbang po'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na gang yul kha dog kyang yin gzugs kyang yin dang ba yang yin pa de ni mig gi dbang po'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that the eye sense organ is defined as that which is both the object, color, and the clarity of form.

original: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa'i dbang po lhag ma la yang so sor ci rigs par sbyar zhing bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa'i dbang po lhag ma la yang so sor ci rigs par sbyar zhing bshad do //
translated: The remaining sense organs, such as the ear, should be explained in the same way, each according to their type.

original: rna ba'i dbang po'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rna ba'i dbang po'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain the definition of the ear sense organ,

original: rna ba'i dbang po gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: rna ba'i dbang po gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is the ear sense organ?‚Äù

original: rna ba'i dbang po'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: rna ba'i dbang po'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: What is the definition of the ear faculty?

original: de'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To teach its definition,

original: yul sgra gzugs dang ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yul sgra gzugs dang ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThe object is sound, and its form is clear.‚Äù

original: rna ba'i dbang po'i yul ni sgra snyan pa dang / mi snyan pa la sogs pa yin la de'i gzugs kyang shel dang me long la sogs pa dang 'dra ba dang zhing gsal ba yin la /
analyzed: rna ba'i dbang po'i yul ni sgra snyan pa dang / mi snyan pa la sogs pa yin la de'i gzugs kyang shel dang me long la sogs pa dang 'dra ba dang zhing gsal ba yin la /
translated: The object of the ear faculty is sound, such as pleasant and unpleasant sounds, and its form is like crystal, a mirror, and so on. It is clear.

original: de ltar gsal ba'i mthus rna ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu byed do //
analyzed: de ltar gsal ba'i mthus rna ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu byed do //
translated: By the power of being clear in this way, it acts as the cause for the production of the ear consciousness.

original: de'i rdul phran ni grog gcus pa'i mdud pa 'dra bar rna ba'i nang na gnas so //
analyzed: de'i rdul phran ni grog gcus pa'i mdud pa 'dra bar rna ba'i nang na gnas so //
translated: Its atoms are located in the ear, resembling the coils of a black snake.

original: sna'i dbang po'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sna'i dbang po'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To teach the definition of the nose faculty,

original: sna'i dbang po gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: sna'i dbang po gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is the nose faculty?‚Äù

original: de yang sna'i dbang po'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: de yang sna'i dbang po'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: This also means, ‚ÄúWhat is the definition of the nose faculty?‚Äù

original: de'i lan du yul dri gzugs dang ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i lan du yul dri gzugs dang ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To answer that, it is said, ‚ÄúThe object is smell, and its form is clear.‚Äù

original: sna'i dbang po'i yul ni dri zhim pa dang / mi zhim @38a * //
analyzed: sna'i dbang po'i yul ni dri zhim pa dang / mi zhim @38a * //
translated: The object of the nose sense faculty is smell, such as fragrant and foul odors.üîΩ

original: pa la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: pa la sogs pa yin la /
translated: The object of the nose sense faculty is pleasant smell, unpleasant smell, and so on.

original: de'ang shel dang me long la sogs pa ltar gzugs dang zhing gsal ba ste /
analyzed: de'ang shel dang me long la sogs pa ltar gzugs dang zhing gsal ba ste /
translated: Moreover, it is clear form and field like crystal, a mirror, and so on.

original: de'i phyir na sna'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir na sna'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu byed do //
translated: Therefore, it acts as the cause that generates the nose consciousness.

original: de'i rdul phran ni mig sman bsku ba'i lcags thur ltar mtshul ba'i nang thog thag gnas so //
analyzed: de'i rdul phran ni mig sman bsku ba'i lcags thur ltar mtshul ba'i nang thog thag gnas so //
translated: Its atoms are located in the entire palate like an ointment stick for the eyes.

original: lce'i dbang po'i mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lce'i dbang po'i mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the characteristics of the tongue sense faculty,

original: lce'i dbang po gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: lce'i dbang po gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is the tongue sense faculty?‚Äù

original: lce'i dbang po'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: lce'i dbang po'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat are the characteristics of the tongue sense faculty?‚Äù

original: de'i lan du yul ro gzugs dang ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i lan du yul ro gzugs dang ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response to that, it is said, ‚ÄúThe object of the tongue is the clear form of taste.‚Äù

original: lce'i dbang po'i yul ni ro mngar ba dang skyur ba la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: lce'i dbang po'i yul ni ro mngar ba dang skyur ba la sogs pa yin la /
translated: The object of the tongue sense faculty is sweet, sour, and so on.

original: de'ang me long dang shel la sogs pa bzhin du gzugs dang zhing gsal ba ste /
analyzed: de'ang me long dang shel la sogs pa bzhin du gzugs dang zhing gsal ba ste /
translated: Moreover, it is clear form and field like a mirror, crystal, and so on.

original: de'i rgyus na lce'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu byed do //
analyzed: de'i rgyus na lce'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu byed do //
translated: The tongue sense faculty is the cause that generates the tongue consciousness.

original: lce'i dbang po'i rdul phran ni zla ba phyed pa 'dra bar lce'i dbus thog thag skra'i khyon tsam zhig dbang pos ma khyab par gnas te /
analyzed: lce'i dbang po'i rdul phran ni zla ba phyed pa 'dra bar lce'i dbus thog thag skra'i khyon tsam zhig dbang pos ma khyab par gnas te /
translated: The particles of the tongue sense faculty are like a half-moon. They are located in the middle of the tongue, covering an area the size of a hair.

original: de'ang dbang pos khyab na ni glad rgyas rgyun du 'dzag pas snying po'i phyir yi ga 'chus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'ang dbang pos khyab na ni glad rgyas rgyun du 'dzag pas snying po'i phyir yi ga 'chus par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the tongue were covered by the sense faculty, the brain would be constantly oozing, and one would lose one‚Äôs appetite.

original: lus kyi dbang po'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩlus kyi dbang po gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir / lus kyi dbang po gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: To explain the characteristics of the body sense faculty,üîΩthe root text asks, ‚ÄúWhat is the body sense faculty?‚Äù

original: lus kyi dbang po'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: This is asking, ‚ÄúWhat are the characteristics of the body sense faculty?‚Äù

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: In response, the root text says,

original: yul reg bya gzugs dang ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yul reg bya gzugs dang ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe object of the body sense faculty is tangible form.‚Äù

original: lus kyi dbang po'i yul ni 'jam pa dang / rtsub pa la sogs pa'i reg bya yin la /
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po'i yul ni 'jam pa dang / rtsub pa la sogs pa'i reg bya yin la /
translated: The object of the body sense faculty is the tangible object of smoothness, roughness, and so on.

original: de'ang shel dang me long la sogs pa bzhin du gzugs dang zhing gsal ba ste /
analyzed: de'ang shel dang me long la sogs pa bzhin du gzugs dang zhing gsal ba ste /
translated: It is also clear and transparent, like a crystal or a mirror.

original: de'i rgyus ni lus kyi rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu byed do //
analyzed: de'i rgyus ni lus kyi rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu byed do //
translated: and by reason of that, it is the cause of the arising of the body consciousness.

original: de'i rdul phran ni pags pa'am ko ba bzhin du lus thog thag khyab par gnas so ;
analyzed: de'i rdul phran ni pags pa'am ko ba bzhin du lus thog thag khyab par gnas so ;
translated: Its atoms are distributed throughout the body like the skin or the bark.

original: / kha cig na re bee d'u rya'i kha dog 'dra bar lus kyi dbus nas yar gnas te /
analyzed: / kha cig na re bee d'u rya'i kha dog 'dra bar lus kyi dbus nas yar gnas te /
translated: Some say that it is located in the middle of the body like the color of beryl,

original: gang du reg bya byung ba der rgyug go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gang du reg bya byung ba der rgyug go zhes zer ro //
translated: and that it runs to the place where there is contact.

original: dbang po'i don ci bdag po byed pa'am dbang byed pa'i don ni dbang po'i don te ci la dbang byed ce na /
analyzed: dbang po'i don ci bdag po byed pa'am dbang byed pa'i don ni dbang po'i don te ci la dbang byed ce na /
translated: What is the meaning of indriya? It means ‚Äúto exercise sovereignty‚Äù or ‚Äúto exercise control.‚Äù With regard to what does it exercise sovereignty?

original: gzugs la sogs pa so so'i yul la dbang byed de /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa so so'i yul la dbang byed de /
translated: It exercises sovereignty with regard to its own object, form, etc.

original: dper na gzugs kyang mig gi dbang pos mthong gi rna ba'i dbang po la sogs pa gzhan gyis mi mthong ba dang / sgra yang rna ba'i dbang pos thos kyi mig la sogs pa gzhan gyis mi thos pas /
analyzed: dper na gzugs kyang mig gi dbang pos mthong gi rna ba'i dbang po la sogs pa gzhan gyis mi mthong ba dang / sgra yang rna ba'i dbang pos thos kyi mig la sogs pa gzhan gyis mi thos pas /
translated: For example, form is seen by the eye faculty, but not by the ear faculty, etc. Sound is heard by the ear faculty, but not by the eye faculty, etc.

original: so so'i yul la dbang byed do //üîΩdbang po lnga bshad zin to //
analyzed: so so'i yul la dbang byed do // dbang po lnga bshad zin to //
translated: Thus, it exercises sovereignty with regard to its own object.üîΩThe five faculties have been explained.

original: da yang yul lnga bstan te /
analyzed: da yang yul lnga bstan te /
translated: Now the five objects will be explained.

original: de la yang @38b gzugs kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la yang @38b gzugs kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the characteristic of form,

original: gzugs gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: gzugs gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: he asks, ‚ÄúWhat is form?‚Äù

original: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the characteristic of form?‚Äù

original: lan du mig gi yul te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lan du mig gi yul te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response, he says, ‚ÄúThe object of the eye.‚Äù

original: gzugs ni mig gi dbang po dang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul yin gyi rna ba la sogs pa dbang po gzhan gyi yul ma yin no zhes thun mong ma yin par ston to //
analyzed: gzugs ni mig gi dbang po dang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul yin gyi rna ba la sogs pa dbang po gzhan gyi yul ma yin no zhes thun mong ma yin par ston to //
translated: Form is the object of the eye faculty and eye consciousness, but it is not the object of other faculties such as the ear. This teaches that form is not shared.

original: gzugs la phye na du yod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs la phye na du yod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the divisions of form,

original: kha dog dang dbyibs dang rnam par rig byed do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs dang rnam par rig byed do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúcolor, shape, and informative form.‚Äù

original: mig gi yul du gyur pa gzugs la phye na gsum ste /
analyzed: mig gi yul du gyur pa gzugs la phye na gsum ste /
translated: Form that is the object of the eye is divided into three:

original: kha dog dang dbyibs dang rnam par rig byed do //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs dang rnam par rig byed do //
translated: color, shape, and informative form.

original: smras pa / gzugs kyi yul la rnam pa gsum du ci'i phyir phye ste bshad /
analyzed: smras pa / gzugs kyi yul la rnam pa gsum du ci'i phyir phye ste bshad /
translated: Question: Why is the object of form divided into three types and explained?

original: lan du gzugs kyi rab tu dbye ba la the tshom za ba dang / phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa dang / mi shes pa rnams la gzugs la phye na rnam pa gsum yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lan du gzugs kyi rab tu dbye ba la the tshom za ba dang / phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa dang / mi shes pa rnams la gzugs la phye na rnam pa gsum yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In response, it is taught that there are three types of form in order to teach that form is threefold for those who doubt the classification of form, who hold wrong views about it, and who do not understand it.

original: kha dog dang dbyibs dang rnam par rig byed do zhes gsum du phye ste bstan to //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs dang rnam par rig byed do zhes gsum du phye ste bstan to //
translated: Form is classified as three types: color, shape, and informative form.

original: de la the tshom za ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs dang rnam par rig byed gzugs yin nam 'on te ma yin zhes yid gnyis za ba'o //
analyzed: de la the tshom za ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs dang rnam par rig byed gzugs yin nam 'on te ma yin zhes yid gnyis za ba'o //
translated: Doubt is the uncertainty that wonders, ‚ÄúIs color, shape, and informative form form or not?‚Äù

original: log par 'dzin pa ni kha dog dang dbyibs dang rnam par rig byed ni gzugs ma yin gyi gzugs zhes bya ba ni gzhan zhig yod do snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: log par 'dzin pa ni kha dog dang dbyibs dang rnam par rig byed ni gzugs ma yin gyi gzugs zhes bya ba ni gzhan zhig yod do snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: Wrong view is the thought that color, shape, and informative form are not form but that there is something else called form.

original: mi shes pa ni gzugs la phye na du yod /
analyzed: mi shes pa ni gzugs la phye na du yod /
translated: Ignorance is the lack of understanding that form is classified as three types.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba gang la bya mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba gang la bya mi shes pa'o //
translated: It is the lack of understanding of what is meant by the term form.

original: de dag la kha dog dang dbyibs dang / rnam par rig byed gzugs yin no zhes bstan pas the tshom za ba dang / log par 'dzin pa dang / mi shes pa med par 'gyur te ;
analyzed: de dag la kha dog dang dbyibs dang / rnam par rig byed gzugs yin no zhes bstan pas the tshom za ba dang / log par 'dzin pa dang / mi shes pa med par 'gyur te ;
translated: The Buddha, in order to eliminate doubt, wrong views, and ignorance, taught that form is of three types: color-form, shape-form, and informative form.

original: de'i phyir gzugs la rnam pa gsum du phye ste bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs la rnam pa gsum du phye ste bshad do //
translated: Therefore, form is explained as being of three types.

original: de la kha dog la phye na rnam pa bcu bzhi yod de /
analyzed: de la kha dog la phye na rnam pa bcu bzhi yod de /
translated: Color-form is of fourteen types:

original: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / sprin dang / du ba dang / rdul dang / khug rna dang / grib ma dang / nyi ma'i 'od dang / snang ba dang ; mun pa dang / bla gab med pa dang /
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / sprin dang / du ba dang / rdul dang / khug rna dang / grib ma dang / nyi ma'i 'od dang / snang ba dang ; mun pa dang / bla gab med pa dang /
translated: blue, yellow, red, white, cloud, smoke, dust, mist, shadow, sun, light, darkness, the sky, and the gleam of water.

original: nam mkha'o // de la khug rna ni lho 'ur mo'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'o // de la khug rna ni lho 'ur mo'o //
translated: Mist is a southern wind.

original: grib ma ni gang na gzugs snang ba'o //
analyzed: grib ma ni gang na gzugs snang ba'o //
translated: Shadow is where form appears.

original: nyi ma'i 'od ni nyi zer ro //
analyzed: nyi ma'i 'od ni nyi zer ro //
translated: Sun is the light of the sun.

original: snang ba ni zla ba dang skar ma dang sman dang nor bu'i 'od do //
analyzed: snang ba ni zla ba dang skar ma dang sman dang nor bu'i 'od do //
translated: Light is the light of the moon, stars, herbs, and jewels.

original: mun pa ni gang na gzugs mi snang ba'o //üîΩbla gab med pa @39a * //
analyzed: mun pa ni gang na gzugs mi snang ba'o //üîΩbla gab med pa @39a * //
translated: Darkness is where form does not appear.üîΩ The sky is the color of the sky.üîΩThe gleam of water is the reflection of the sky in water.

original: ni thogs pa dang bcas pa gzugs kyi bar gang ci'ang thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ni thogs pa dang bcas pa gzugs kyi bar gang ci'ang thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: Space is the absence of any obstruction whatsoever to the contact of any material form whatsoever.

original: nam mkha' ni gang stong pa'i gong na gang kha dog sngon por snang ba'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni gang stong pa'i gong na gang kha dog sngon por snang ba'o //
translated: Space is the absence of any material form whatsoever.

original: lhag ma sla ba rnams ni dngos su brda phrad par sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: lhag ma sla ba rnams ni dngos su brda phrad par sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: The other terms are easy to understand and do not need to be explained.

original: dbyibs ni brgyad de /
analyzed: dbyibs ni brgyad de /
translated: Shape is of eight types:üîΩlong, short, square, round, high, low, even, uneven.

original: ring ba dang / thung ba dang / lham pa dang / zlum po dang / sgang dang / gshong dang / mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa'o //üîΩde la ring ba dang / thung ba gnyis ni ltos pa las gdags te /
analyzed: ring ba dang / thung ba dang / lham pa dang / zlum po dang / sgang dang / gshong dang / mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa'o // de la ring ba dang / thung ba gnyis ni ltos pa las gdags te /
translated: Long and short are relative designations.

original: dper na / pha la ltos nas bu zhes gdags /
analyzed: dper na / pha la ltos nas bu zhes gdags /
translated: For example, a son is designated as a son in relation to a father,üîΩand a father is designated as a father in relation to a son.

original: bu la ltos te pha zhes gdags pa bzhin du ring po la ltos te thung ngu zhes gdags /
analyzed: bu la ltos te pha zhes gdags pa bzhin du ring po la ltos te thung ngu zhes gdags /
translated: In the same way, long is designated in relation to short,

original: thung ngu la ltos te ring po zhes gdags so //
analyzed: thung ngu la ltos te ring po zhes gdags so //
translated: and short is designated in relation to long.

original: lham pa ni kun tu dkyil 'khor ram gru bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: lham pa ni kun tu dkyil 'khor ram gru bzhi pa'o //
translated: Square is a shape that is equal in all directions.

original: zlum po ni ril ril po'o //
analyzed: zlum po ni ril ril po'o //
translated: Round is a shape that is circular.

original: sgang ni ri la sogs pa mtho ba'o //
analyzed: sgang ni ri la sogs pa mtho ba'o //
translated: High is a shape that is elevated, like a mountain.

original: gshong ni khron pa la sogs pa dma' ba'o //üîΩmnyam pa ni ngos thag thug med pa la phya le 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: gshong ni khron pa la sogs pa dma' ba'o // mnyam pa ni ngos thag thug med pa la phya le 'dug pa'o //
translated: A pit is a depression such as a well.üîΩA plain is a flat surface without any break in the horizon.

original: mi mnyam pa ni dbyibs mi mnyam pa ste thag thug can no //üîΩrnam par rig byed ni tshe rabs snga ma la dge ba'i chos la goms pas thal mo sbyor ba dang / phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa'i lus kyi las dang / tshe rabs snga ma la mi dge ba la goms pas khu tshur bcangs pa dang /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa ni dbyibs mi mnyam pa ste thag thug can no // rnam par rig byed ni tshe rabs snga ma la dge ba'i chos la goms pas thal mo sbyor ba dang / phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa'i lus kyi las dang / tshe rabs snga ma la mi dge ba la goms pas khu tshur bcangs pa dang /
translated: An uneven surface is a surface with a break in the horizon.üîΩThe expression of informative form is the action of the body that is, the action of joining the palms in reverence, prostration, and so on, due to habituation to virtuous dharmas in previous lives.

original: rdeg pa la sogs pas lus kyi las la rnam par rig byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: rdeg pa la sogs pas lus kyi las la rnam par rig byed ces bya'o //
translated: The action of the body that is, the action of clenching the fists, beating, and so on, due to habituation to nonvirtue in previous lives is called informative form.

original: ci'i phyir de la rnam par rig byed ces gdags she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de la rnam par rig byed ces gdags she na /
translated: Why is it called informative form?üîΩBecause others know that a clear mind has arisen through the action of joining the palms in reverence and so on and

original: thal mo sbyor ba la sogs pa lus kyi las kyi sgo nas de'i sems dang ba zhig skyes so zhes gzhan gyis rig par 'gyur ba dang / khu tshur bcangs pa la sogs pa lus kyi las kyi sgo nas /
analyzed: thal mo sbyor ba la sogs pa lus kyi las kyi sgo nas de'i sems dang ba zhig skyes so zhes gzhan gyis rig par 'gyur ba dang / khu tshur bcangs pa la sogs pa lus kyi las kyi sgo nas /
translated: because others know that a defiled mind has arisen through the action of clenching the fists and so on.

original: de'i sems zhe sdang ba zhig skyes so zhes gzhan gyis rig pas na rnam par rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i sems zhe sdang ba zhig skyes so zhes gzhan gyis rig pas na rnam par rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The mind of another is known by the statement, He has a mind that is angry, and so it is called that which is known.

original: sgra'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The characteristic of sound is taught.

original: sgra gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: sgra gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: What is sound?

original: sgra'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: sgra'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: What is the characteristic of sound?

original: lan du rna ba'i yul te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lan du rna ba'i yul te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The answer is: The object of the ear.

original: sgra ni rna ba'i dbang po dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pas shes pa'i yul yin gyi mig la sogs pa dbang po gzhan gyi yul ma yin no zhes thun mong ma yin par ston to //üîΩsgra la phye na rnam pa du yod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgra ni rna ba'i dbang po dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pas shes pa'i yul yin gyi mig la sogs pa dbang po gzhan gyi yul ma yin no zhes thun mong ma yin par ston to // sgra la phye na rnam pa du yod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Sound is the object of the ear faculty and the ear consciousness, and is not the object of other faculties such as the eye, etc. This shows that it is not shared.

original: zin pa dang ma zin pa dang gnyi ga ste /
analyzed: zin pa dang ma zin pa dang gnyi ga ste /
translated: In order to show the divisions of sound, it is said: Sound is threefold: articulated, inarticulated, and both.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgyu las byung ba'o zhes bya ba @39b smos te ;
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgyu las byung ba'o zhes bya ba @39b smos te ;
translated: It is said: It arises from the four great elements.

original: sgra la phye na rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sgra la phye na rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Sound is threefold:

original: zin pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgyu las byung ba dang / ma zin pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgyu las byung ba dang / gnyi ga'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: zin pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgyu las byung ba dang / ma zin pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgyu las byung ba dang / gnyi ga'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
translated: Sound that is both is that which arises from the cause of the four great elements that are both grasped and not grasped.

original: de la zin pa ni sems dang sems las byung bas yongs su bzung ba ste /
analyzed: de la zin pa ni sems dang sems las byung bas yongs su bzung ba ste /
translated: Sound that is grasped is that which is apprehended by mind and mental factors.

original: gang lus su gtogs pa sems can rnams kyi lag pa dang ngag gi sgra ni zin pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgyu las byung ba'i sgra zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang lus su gtogs pa sems can rnams kyi lag pa dang ngag gi sgra ni zin pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgyu las byung ba'i sgra zhes bya'o //
translated: The sound of the body, such as the voice and hands of sentient beings, is called sound that arises from the cause of the four great elements that are grasped.

original: ma zin pa ni sems dang sems las byung bas yongs su ma bzung ba ste /
analyzed: ma zin pa ni sems dang sems las byung bas yongs su ma bzung ba ste /
translated: Sound that is not grasped is that which is not apprehended by mind and mental factors.

original: gang rlung dang nags tshal dang chu'i sgra ni ma zin pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgyu las byung ba'i sgra zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang rlung dang nags tshal dang chu'i sgra ni ma zin pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgyu las byung ba'i sgra zhes bya'o //
translated: The sound of wind, forest, and water is called sound that arises from the cause of the four great elements that are not grasped.

original: gnyi ga ni gang zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi yang yod la ma zin pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgyu yang yod pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga ni gang zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi yang yod la ma zin pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgyu yang yod pa las byung ba ste /
translated: Sound that is both is that which arises from the cause of the four great elements that are both grasped and not grasped.

original: de yang lag pa dang / rnga la sogs pa phrad pa las byung ba'i sgra ni gnyi ga'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgyu las byung ba'i sgra zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang lag pa dang / rnga la sogs pa phrad pa las byung ba'i sgra ni gnyi ga'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgyu las byung ba'i sgra zhes bya'o //
translated: The sound that arises from the contact of hand and drum, etc. is called the sound that arises from the cause of the four great elements of both.

original: dri'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dri'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the characteristic of smell,

original: dri gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: dri gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: he asks, ‚ÄúWhat is smell?‚Äù

original: dri'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: dri'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the characteristic of smell?‚Äù

original: lan du sna'i yul te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lan du sna'i yul te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In reply, he says, ‚ÄúThe object of the nose.‚Äù

original: dri ni sna'i dbang po dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i yul yin gyi dbang po gzhan gyi yul ma yin no zhes thun mong ma yin par ston to//
analyzed: dri ni sna'i dbang po dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i yul yin gyi dbang po gzhan gyi yul ma yin no zhes thun mong ma yin par ston to//
translated: Smell is the object of the nose faculty and nose consciousness, and is not the object of other faculties. This shows that it is not shared.

original: dri la phye na du yod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dri la phye na du yod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the divisions of smell,

original: dri zhim pa dang / dri mi zhim pa dang / de las gzhan pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dri zhim pa dang / dri mi zhim pa dang / de las gzhan pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúPleasant smell, unpleasant smell, and other.‚Äù

original: de la phye na rnam pa gsum du gzhag go //
analyzed: de la phye na rnam pa gsum du gzhag go //
translated: It is established that there are three types of smell.

original: de la dri zhim pa ni dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi la phan par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la dri zhim pa ni dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi la phan par byed pa ste /
translated: Among them, a pleasant smell is that which benefits the faculty and the four great elements.

original: gla rtsi dang tsandan dang gur gum la sogs pa'i dri'o //
analyzed: gla rtsi dang tsandan dang gur gum la sogs pa'i dri'o //
translated: The smell of musk, sandalwood, and saffron, etc.

original: dri mi zhim pa ni dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi la gnod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: dri mi zhim pa ni dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi la gnod par byed pa ste /
translated: Unpleasant smell is that which harms the sense faculty and the four great elements.

original: ngan skyugs la sogs pa'i dri'o //
analyzed: ngan skyugs la sogs pa'i dri'o //
translated: The smell of excrement, etc.

original: de las gzhan pa ni dbang po lnga dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi la phan par yang mi byed gnod par yang mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni dbang po lnga dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi la phan par yang mi byed gnod par yang mi byed pa ste /
translated: Neutral smell is that which neither benefits nor harms the five sense faculties and the four great elements.

original: dri zhim pa yang ma yin dri mi zhim pa yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dri zhim pa yang ma yin dri mi zhim pa yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is neither a pleasant smell nor an unpleasant smell.

original: de yang dung phor dang nya phyis la sogs pa'i dri'o //
analyzed: de yang dung phor dang nya phyis la sogs pa'i dri'o //
translated: It is the smell of a conch shell, oyster shell, etc.

original: dri zhim pa la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dri zhim pa la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Pleasant smell is also of three kinds:

original: lhan cig skyes pa dang sbyar ba dang smin pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa dang sbyar ba dang smin pa'o //
translated: natural, compounded, and matured.

original: de la tsandan dang / gur gum la sogs pa'i dri ni lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de la tsandan dang / gur gum la sogs pa'i dri ni lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: The smell of sandalwood, saffron, etc. is natural.

original: bdug pa'i ril bu la sogs pa @40a * //
analyzed: bdug pa'i ril bu la sogs pa @40a * //
translated: The smell of incense pills, etc.

original: rnams ni sbyar pa'o //
analyzed: rnams ni sbyar pa'o //
translated: is compounded.

original: aa mra'i 'bras bu smin pa la sogs pa'i dri ni smin pa'o //
analyzed: aa mra'i 'bras bu smin pa la sogs pa'i dri ni smin pa'o //
translated: The smell of a ripe mango, etc. is matured.

original: dri mi zhim pa la yang lhan cig te /
analyzed: dri mi zhim pa la yang lhan cig te /
translated: And also with the foul odor.

original: ro'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //üîΩlan ro // ro'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: ro'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to // lan ro // ro'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: What is the characteristic of taste?üîΩThe answer: Taste.

original: ro'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: ro'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The question: What is the characteristic of taste?

original: lan du lce'i dbang po ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lan du lce'i dbang po ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The answer: The organ of taste.

original: ro ni lce'i dbang po dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i yul yin gyi /
analyzed: ro ni lce'i dbang po dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i yul yin gyi /
translated: Taste is the object of the organ of taste and the consciousness of taste.

original: dbang po gzhan gyi yul ma yin no zhes thun mong ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: dbang po gzhan gyi yul ma yin no zhes thun mong ma yin par bstan to //
translated: It is not the object of other organs. This shows that it is not common.

original: rol phye na du yod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rol phye na du yod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the divisions of taste, he says:

original: mngar ba dang / skyur ba dang / lan tshva dang / kha ba dang / tsha ba dang / bska ba'o zhes smos te /
analyzed: mngar ba dang / skyur ba dang / lan tshva dang / kha ba dang / tsha ba dang / bska ba'o zhes smos te /
translated: Sweet, sour, salty, pungent, bitter, and astringent.

original: rol phye ba rnam pa drug go //
analyzed: rol phye ba rnam pa drug go //
translated: Taste is divided into six kinds.

original: de la mngar ba ni /üîΩka ra dang / bu ram dang / sbrang rtsi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la mngar ba ni / ka ra dang / bu ram dang / sbrang rtsi la sogs pa'o //
translated: Here, sweet isüîΩsugar, molasses, honey, etc.

original: skyur ba ni tsha dang skyur rtsi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skyur ba ni tsha dang skyur rtsi la sogs pa'o //
translated: Sour is tamarind, citron, etc.

original: lan tshva ni bro ba ste lan tshva rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: lan tshva ni bro ba ste lan tshva rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: Salt is taste, and there are five kinds of salt.

original: kha ba ni mkhris pa dang ; tig ta la sogs pa'o //üîΩtsha ba ni pi pi ling dang / na le sham dang sga la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kha ba ni mkhris pa dang ; tig ta la sogs pa'o // tsha ba ni pi pi ling dang / na le sham dang sga la sogs pa'o //
translated: Pungent is bile, and bitter, etc.üîΩHot is long pepper, ginger, garlic, etc.

original: bska ba ni aa ru ra dang ba ru ra la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bska ba ni aa ru ra dang ba ru ra la sogs pa'o //
translated: Astringent is chebulic myrobalan, beleric myrobalan, etc.

original: reg bya'i phyogs gcig gi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: reg bya'i phyogs gcig gi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To indicate the definition of one part of the tangible,

original: reg bya'i phyogs gcig gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: reg bya'i phyogs gcig gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i tshig ste /
translated: he says, What is one part of the tangible?

original: reg bya'i phyogs gcig gi mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: reg bya'i phyogs gcig gi mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, What is the definition of one part of the tangible?

original: lan du lus kyi yul te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lan du lus kyi yul te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response, he says, The tangible is the object of the body.

original: reg bya rnams ni lus kyi dbang po dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul yin gyi dbang po gzhan gyi yul ma yin no zhes thun mong ma yin par bstan to //üîΩreg bya la phye na du yod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: reg bya rnams ni lus kyi dbang po dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul yin gyi dbang po gzhan gyi yul ma yin no zhes thun mong ma yin par bstan to // reg bya la phye na du yod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The tangibles are the objects of the body faculty and the body consciousness, but they are not the objects of other faculties. This shows that they are not common.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi po gzhag ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi po gzhag ste /
translated: To indicate how many kinds of tangibles there are, he says, The four great elements are posited.

original: 'jam pa dang / rtsub pa dang / lci ba dang / yang ba dang / grang ba dang / bru ba dang / skom pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'jam pa dang / rtsub pa dang / lci ba dang / yang ba dang / grang ba dang / bru ba dang / skom pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Smoothness, roughness, heaviness, lightness, cold, hunger, and thirst.

original: lus kyi yul reg bya la phye na 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i steng du 'jam pa nas skom pa'i bar du rgyur byas pa'i gzugs bdun gyis bsnan te bcu gcig yod do //üîΩsmras pa / 'byung ba chen po bzhi gzhag ste /
analyzed: lus kyi yul reg bya la phye na 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i steng du 'jam pa nas skom pa'i bar du rgyur byas pa'i gzugs bdun gyis bsnan te bcu gcig yod do // smras pa / 'byung ba chen po bzhi gzhag ste /
translated: When tactile objects of the body are classified, there are eleven: the four great elements and the seven types of derivative form, from smoothness to thirst.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig ste cir dgos /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig ste cir dgos /
translated: Objection: What is the point of the words ‚Äúsetting aside the four great elements‚Äù?

original: lan du de la dgos pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: lan du de la dgos pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: Reply: There are two reasons for this.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i mtshan nyid gong du bshad zin pas da 'dir bshad mi @40b dgos pa'i phyir gzhag pa dang / 'dir rgyur byas pa'i gzugs bshad pa'i skabs yin gyi 'byung ba chen po bshad pa'i skabs ma yin pas gzhag go //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i mtshan nyid gong du bshad zin pas da 'dir bshad mi @40b dgos pa'i phyir gzhag pa dang / 'dir rgyur byas pa'i gzugs bshad pa'i skabs yin gyi 'byung ba chen po bshad pa'i skabs ma yin pas gzhag go //
translated: The characteristics of the four great elements have already been explained above, so they are set aside and not explained here. And derivative form is being explained here, not the great elements, so they are set aside.

original: smras pa / 'byung ba chen po bzhi gong du bshad zin pas da bshad mi dgos na yang ma smos pas mi chog gam /
analyzed: smras pa / 'byung ba chen po bzhi gong du bshad zin pas da bshad mi dgos na yang ma smos pas mi chog gam /
translated: Objection: Since the four great elements have already been explained above, it is unnecessary to explain them again.üîΩResponse: But it is not permissible not to mention them.

original: lan du yang mi smos su ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi yang lus kyi yul reg bya'i nang du gtogs par bstan dgos pas mi smos su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: lan du yang mi smos su ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi yang lus kyi yul reg bya'i nang du gtogs par bstan dgos pas mi smos su mi rung ngo //
translated: Since the four great elements are included in the tactile objects of the body, it is not permissible not to mention them.

original: de ltar na reg bya rnam pa gnyis te 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgyu las skyes pa rtsub pa la sogs pa bdun no //
analyzed: de ltar na reg bya rnam pa gnyis te 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgyu las skyes pa rtsub pa la sogs pa bdun no //
translated: Thus there are two types of tactile objects: the four great elements and the seven such as roughness that arise from the cause of the four great elements.

original: de la 'jam pa ni mnyen pa mi rtsub pa reg par bzod pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jam pa ni mnyen pa mi rtsub pa reg par bzod pa'o //
translated: Among them, smoothness is softness, not roughness, and is a tolerable contact.

original: rtsub pa ni mi mnyen pa reg par mi bzod pa'o //
analyzed: rtsub pa ni mi mnyen pa reg par mi bzod pa'o //
translated: Roughness is not softness, and is an intolerable contact.

original: lci ba ni gang gi dbang gis srang gi mgo mthur du dma' bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lci ba ni gang gi dbang gis srang gi mgo mthur du dma' bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Weight is that by whose power the head of a scale hangs down.

original: yang ba ni bong cher zin kyang bong chung du lci ba la ljid kyis mi thub ste /
analyzed: yang ba ni bong cher zin kyang bong chung du lci ba la ljid kyis mi thub ste /
translated: Lightness is that which, though large in volume, is not heavy, and cannot overcome heaviness.

original: srang gi mgo mtho la mjug dma' bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: srang gi mgo mtho la mjug dma' bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The head of a scale rises and the end falls.

original: grang ba ni gang gis nyen na dro bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: grang ba ni gang gis nyen na dro bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: Cold is that which is desired to be warm when one is afflicted by it.

original: bru ba ni gang za bar 'dod pa skye ba'o //
analyzed: bru ba ni gang za bar 'dod pa skye ba'o //
translated: Hunger is the desire to eat.

original: skom pa ni gang 'thung 'dod pa skye ba'o //
analyzed: skom pa ni gang 'thung 'dod pa skye ba'o //
translated: Thirst is the desire to drink.

original: brgal ba / za 'dod pa dang 'thung 'dod pa ni /
analyzed: brgal ba / za 'dod pa dang 'thung 'dod pa ni /
translated: Objection: The desire to eat and the desire to drink

original: sems las byung ba'i chos yin na /
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos yin na /
translated: are mental factors.üîΩHow can they be posited as objects of the body faculty that arise from the four great elements?

original: de ji ltar lus kyi dbang po'i yul reg bya'i phyogs gcig 'byung ba chen po bzhi las skyes pa'i chos su gzhag / lan du 'di ni rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa ste /üîΩdper na / sangs rgyas 'byung ba bde ba dang // chos bstan pa yang bde ba'o //
analyzed: de ji ltar lus kyi dbang po'i yul reg bya'i phyogs gcig 'byung ba chen po bzhi las skyes pa'i chos su gzhag / lan du 'di ni rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa ste / dper na / sangs rgyas 'byung ba bde ba dang // chos bstan pa yang bde ba'o //
translated: Reply: This is a case of calling the result by the name of the cause.üîΩFor example, it is said:üîΩThe appearance of a buddha is happiness.

original: zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma is happiness.

original: tshigs bcad 'di yang rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa yin te /
analyzed: tshigs bcad 'di yang rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa yin te /
translated: This verse also calls the result by the name of the cause.

original: sangs rgyas 'jig rten du 'byung zhing skye ba ni skye ba thams cad du sdug bsngal bar bshad pas bde ba ma yin med kyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'jig rten du 'byung zhing skye ba ni skye ba thams cad du sdug bsngal bar bshad pas bde ba ma yin med kyi /
translated: The appearance and birth of a buddha in the world is not happiness because it is explained that all birth is suffering.

original: sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byung bas dam pa'i chos bstan pa'i rgyu las sems can rnams bde 'gro dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur bas lha dang mi'i bde 'gro dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu thob pa de rgyu sangs rgyas 'byungüîΩba la btags nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byung bas dam pa'i chos bstan pa'i rgyu las sems can rnams bde 'gro dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur bas lha dang mi'i bde 'gro dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu thob pa de rgyu sangs rgyas 'byung ba la btags nas /
translated: Because of the cause of the Buddha‚Äôs teaching the excellent Dharma in the world, sentient beings obtain the result of happy rebirth and nirvana. Therefore, the result of happy rebirth as a god or human and nirvana is designated as the appearance of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba bde ba dang // zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba bde ba dang // zhes gsungs so //
translated: The appearance of the Buddha is happiness.

original: chos bshad pa yang /
analyzed: chos bshad pa yang /
translated: Also, the teaching of the Dharma

original: 'bad pa chen pos bya dgos pas bde ba ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'bad pa chen pos bya dgos pas bde ba ma yin mod kyi /
translated: is not happiness because it must be done with great effort.

original: rgyu de las bde 'gro dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu bde ba 'thob pa'i bde ba 'byung ste /üîΩ'bras bu de rgyu @41a * //
analyzed: rgyu de las bde 'gro dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu bde ba 'thob pa'i bde ba 'byung ste / 'bras bu de rgyu @41a * //
translated: However, the happiness of obtaining the result of happy rebirth and nirvana arises from that cause.

original: chos bstan pa la btags nas /üîΩchos bstan pa yang bde ba'o //
analyzed: chos bstan pa la btags nas / chos bstan pa yang bde ba'o //
translated: That result is designated as the teaching of the Dharma.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma is also happiness.

original: de dang 'dra par rlung gi khams kyi shas che bar gyur na lto'i nang du pho ba kha 'byar ba'i reg bya'i khyad par zhig 'byung ste /
analyzed: de dang 'dra par rlung gi khams kyi shas che bar gyur na lto'i nang du pho ba kha 'byar ba'i reg bya'i khyad par zhig 'byung ste /
translated: Similarly, when the wind element predominates, a special tactile sensation arises in the stomach, like the stomach being tied in a knot.

original: des rgyu byas nas za 'dod pa skye'o //
analyzed: des rgyu byas nas za 'dod pa skye'o //
translated: That acts as the cause for the desire to eat.

original: pho ba kha 'byar ba ni za 'dod pa'i rgyu yin la za 'dod pa ni de'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: pho ba kha 'byar ba ni za 'dod pa'i rgyu yin la za 'dod pa ni de'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: The stomach being tied in a knot is the cause of the desire to eat and the desire to eat is the result of that.

original: za 'dod pa'i 'bras bu'i ming de rgyu la btags nas /
analyzed: za 'dod pa'i 'bras bu'i ming de rgyu la btags nas /
translated: The name of the result, the desire to eat, is imputed to the cause.

original: pho ba kha 'byar ba la za 'dod pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: pho ba kha 'byar ba la za 'dod pa zhes bshad do //
translated: The stomach being tied in a knot is explained as the desire to eat.

original: de bzhin du me'i khams kyi shas che bar gyur na /
analyzed: de bzhin du me'i khams kyi shas che bar gyur na /
translated: Similarly, when the fire element predominates,

original: lto'i nang du lgang pa kha 'byar ba'i reg bya'i khyad par skye ste /
analyzed: lto'i nang du lgang pa kha 'byar ba'i reg bya'i khyad par skye ste /
translated: a special tactile sensation arises in the stomach, like a balloon being inflated.

original: de'i rgyu la 'thung 'dod pa skye'o ;
analyzed: de'i rgyu la 'thung 'dod pa skye'o ;
translated: The desire to drink arises from that cause.

original: / de la lgang pa kha 'byar ba ni de'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: / de la lgang pa kha 'byar ba ni de'i rgyu'o //
translated: The balloon being inflated is the cause of that.

original: 'thung 'dod pa ni 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: 'thung 'dod pa ni 'bras bu ste /
translated: The desire to drink is the result.

original: 'bras bu 'thung 'dod pa'i ming lgang pa kha 'byar ba la btags nas 'thung 'dod pa'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'thung 'dod pa'i ming lgang pa kha 'byar ba la btags nas 'thung 'dod pa'o zhes bshad de /
translated: The name of the result, the desire to drink, is imputed to the cause, the balloon being inflated, and is explained as the desire to drink.

original: rgyu la 'bras bu btags pas na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu btags pas na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in designating the cause with the name of the result.

original: de la chu dang me'i shas che ba ni 'jam pa'o ;üîΩ/ sa dang rlung gi shas che pa ni rtsub pa'o //
analyzed: de la chu dang me'i shas che ba ni 'jam pa'o ; / sa dang rlung gi shas che pa ni rtsub pa'o //
translated: Among them, that which is dominated by water and fire is soft.üîΩThat which is dominated by earth and wind is rough.

original: sa dang chu'i shas che pa ni lci ba'o //
analyzed: sa dang chu'i shas che pa ni lci ba'o //
translated: That which is dominated by earth and water is heavy.

original: me dang rlung gi shas che pa ni yang pa'o //üîΩchu dang rlung gi shas che ba ni grang pa'o //
analyzed: me dang rlung gi shas che pa ni yang pa'o // chu dang rlung gi shas che ba ni grang pa'o //
translated: That which is dominated by fire and wind is light.üîΩThat which is dominated by water and wind is cold.

original: rlung gi shas che ba ni bru pa'o //
analyzed: rlung gi shas che ba ni bru pa'o //
translated: That which is dominated by wind is rough.

original: me'i shas che ba ni sgom pa'o //
analyzed: me'i shas che ba ni sgom pa'o //
translated: That which is dominated by fire is hot.

original: yul lnga bshad zin to //
analyzed: yul lnga bshad zin to //
translated: The five objects have been explained.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To present the characteristics of non-informative matter, it is asked:

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gang zhen zhes dris te /üîΩrnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhen zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gang zhen zhes dris te / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhen zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: What is non-informative matter?üîΩThe meaning of the question is: What are the characteristics of non-informative matter?üîΩTo present the cause of non-informative matter and its nature, it is said:

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rgyu gang yin pa dang rang bzhin ji lta bu yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rgyu gang yin pa dang rang bzhin ji lta bu yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: It is the non-informative that arises from the primary elements that are the cause of the informative.

original: rnam par rig byed pa dang ; ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i gzugs te /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed pa dang ; ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i gzugs te /
translated: Form derived from the elements of intimation and concentration.

original: bltar med pa thogs pa med pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bltar med pa thogs pa med pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is invisible and non-resistant.

original: rnam par rig byed pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of non-revealing form is intimation and concentration.

original: de'i rang bzhin ni bltar med pa thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni bltar med pa thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: Its nature is invisible and non-resistant.

original: de la rnam par rig byed ni rnam pa gnyis te ;
analyzed: de la rnam par rig byed ni rnam pa gnyis te ;
translated: Intimation is of two kinds:

original: lus kyi rnam bar rig byed dang / ngag gi rnam par rig byed do //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam bar rig byed dang / ngag gi rnam par rig byed do //
translated: bodily intimation and verbal intimation.

original: lus kyi rnam par rig byed la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par rig byed la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Bodily intimation is of three kinds:

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du mi ston pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du mi ston pa'o //
translated: virtuous, non-virtuous, and neutral.

original: de la srog mi gcod pa dang / ma byin par mi len pa dang / mi tshangs bar mi spyod pa ni lus kyi @41b rnam par rig byed dge ba'o //
analyzed: de la srog mi gcod pa dang / ma byin par mi len pa dang / mi tshangs bar mi spyod pa ni lus kyi @41b rnam par rig byed dge ba'o //
translated: Among those, not taking life, not taking what is not given, and not engaging in sexual misconduct are virtuous bodily intimation.

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed mi dge ba'o //
translated: Taking life, taking what is not given, and sexual misconduct are nonvirtuous informative actions of the body.

original: ri mo 'dri ba dang btsem 'drub byed pa la sogs pa bzo'i las rnams ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed lung du mi ston pa'o //
analyzed: ri mo 'dri ba dang btsem 'drub byed pa la sogs pa bzo'i las rnams ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed lung du mi ston pa'o //
translated: The actions of crafts such as painting and weaving are nonindicative informative actions of the body.

original: ngag gi rnam par rig byed la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: ngag gi rnam par rig byed la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Verbal informative action is also of three types:

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du mi ston pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du mi ston pa'o //
translated: virtuous, nonvirtuous, and nonindicative.

original: de la brdzun dang / phra ma dang / ngag 'khyal pa dang / tshig rtsub po spangs pa ni ngag gi rnam par rig byed dge ba'o //
analyzed: de la brdzun dang / phra ma dang / ngag 'khyal pa dang / tshig rtsub po spangs pa ni ngag gi rnam par rig byed dge ba'o //
translated: Abandoning lying, malicious speech, harsh speech, and gossip is virtuous verbal informative action.

original: brdzun dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub mo dang / ngag 'khyal pa smra ba dag ni ngag gi rnam par rig byed mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: brdzun dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub mo dang / ngag 'khyal pa smra ba dag ni ngag gi rnam par rig byed mi dge ba'o //
translated: Lying, malicious speech, harsh speech, and gossip are nonvirtuous verbal informative action.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad phar song tshur shog ces bya ba la sogs pa smra ba ni ngag gi rnam par rig byed lung du mi ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad phar song tshur shog ces bya ba la sogs pa smra ba ni ngag gi rnam par rig byed lung du mi ston pa'o //
translated: Speaking worldly conventions such as ‚Äúgo‚Äù and ‚Äúcome‚Äù is nonindicative verbal informative action.

original: ting nge 'dzin la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Concentration is also twofold:

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //

analyzed: de las 'og ma la skyon du lta zhing sa gong ma la yon tan du lta ba'i 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan mi lcogs su mi rung ba dang / bsam gtan dang po dang bsam gtan khyad par can dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa dang /
translated: The remaining six concentrations are contaminated, because they are the basis of the afflicted view of the self.üîΩThe remaining six concentrations are contaminated, because they are the basis of the afflicted view of the self.

original: de la 'dod par gtogs pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa la rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod par gtogs pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa la rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Non-revealing form belonging to the desire realm has four types:

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa dang / sdom pa med pa dang / sdom pa yang ma yin mi sdom pa yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa dang / sdom pa med pa dang / sdom pa yang ma yin mi sdom pa yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: the pratimoksa vow, the bodhisattva vow, neither a vow nor not a vow, and that which is neither.

original: de la so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ni lus dang ngag gi sgo nas gzhan la gnod par byed pa las slar ldog pa ste /üîΩde yang dge slong pha dang / dge slong ma dang / dge sbyong pha dang / dge sbyong ma dang / dge slob ma dang / dge bsnyen pha dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / dus khrims @42a * //
analyzed: de la so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ni lus dang ngag gi sgo nas gzhan la gnod par byed pa las slar ldog pa ste / de yang dge slong pha dang / dge slong ma dang / dge sbyong pha dang / dge sbyong ma dang / dge slob ma dang / dge bsnyen pha dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / dus khrims @42a * //
translated: The pratimoksa vow is to turn away from harming others through body and speech.

original: pa dang brgyad do //
analyzed: pa dang brgyad do //
translated: It is eightfold: the vows of a fully ordained monk, a fully ordained nun, a male novice, a female novice, a male or female candidate for full ordination, a male or female layperson, and a one-day vow holder.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa ni bdag gi lus dang srog la yang phangs pa med par lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi sgo nas rnam pa thams cad du gzhan la phan 'dogs par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa ni bdag gi lus dang srog la yang phangs pa med par lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi sgo nas rnam pa thams cad du gzhan la phan 'dogs par zhugs pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva vow is to engage in benefiting others in every way through body, speech, and mind, without regard for one's own body or life.

original: sdom pa med pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi sgo nas rnam pa thams cad du gzhan la gnod pa byed par zhugs pa ste /üîΩde'ang bya ba dang / nya pa dang / rngon pa dang / shan pa dang / brtson srung dang / gshed ma pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sdom pa med pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi sgo nas rnam pa thams cad du gzhan la gnod pa byed par zhugs pa ste / de'ang bya ba dang / nya pa dang / rngon pa dang / shan pa dang / brtson srung dang / gshed ma pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those who are neither restrained nor unrestrained are those who are engaged in benefiting or harming others in part.

original: sdom pa yang ma yin mi sdom pa yang ma yin pa ni phan pa dang / gnod pa phyogs re re la zhugs pa ste phan pa phyogs gcig la zhugs pa ni yang nyin re zhing dkyil 'khor ma byas par zan mi bza'o zhes dam bcas pas 'cha'am zan chang gcig tsam yang gzhan la ma byin par zan mi bza'o zhes dam 'cha' ba'o
analyzed: sdom pa yang ma yin mi sdom pa yang ma yin pa ni phan pa dang / gnod pa phyogs re re la zhugs pa ste phan pa phyogs gcig la zhugs pa ni yang nyin re zhing dkyil 'khor ma byas par zan mi bza'o zhes dam bcas pas 'cha'am zan chang gcig tsam yang gzhan la ma byin par zan mi bza'o zhes dam 'cha' ba'o
translated: Those who are engaged in benefiting others in part are those who have taken a vow such as, ‚ÄúI will not eat without first making a mandala offering every day,‚Äù or ‚ÄúI will not eat without giving some food to others, even if it is only a morsel.‚Äù

original: // gnod pa phyogs gcig la zhugs pa ni nyin re zhing mi 'ga' gzhan la mi brdeg par zan mi bza'o zhes dam bcas pa 'cha' ba'o //
analyzed: // gnod pa phyogs gcig la zhugs pa ni nyin re zhing mi 'ga' gzhan la mi brdeg par zan mi bza'o zhes dam bcas pa 'cha' ba'o //
translated: Those who are engaged in harming others in part are those who have taken a vow such as, ‚ÄúI will not eat without beating another person every day.‚Äù

original: de la so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa dang / phan pa phyogs gcig la zhugs pa ni skyabs su 'gro ba dang / brdzun la sogs pa las ldog pa ngag gi rnam par rig byed dge ba dang /üîΩsrog gcod pa la sogs pa las ldog pa lus kyi rnam par rig byed dge ba'i rgyu las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa dang / phan pa phyogs gcig la zhugs pa ni skyabs su 'gro ba dang / brdzun la sogs pa las ldog pa ngag gi rnam par rig byed dge ba dang / srog gcod pa la sogs pa las ldog pa lus kyi rnam par rig byed dge ba'i rgyu las 'byung ngo //
translated: The cause of the virtue of the indicative form of speech is the going for refuge and the bodhisattva vow, which are the cause of the virtue of the indicative form of body, which is the vow of individual liberation and the bodhisattva vow, and the virtue of the indicative form of body, which is the cause of the benefit of one part.

original: sdom pa med pa dang / gnod pa phyogs gcig la zhugs pa ni brdzun zer ba la sogs pa ngag gi rnam par rig byed mi dge ba dang / srog gcod pa la sogs pa lus kyi rnam par rig byed mi dge ba'i rgyu las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sdom pa med pa dang / gnod pa phyogs gcig la zhugs pa ni brdzun zer ba la sogs pa ngag gi rnam par rig byed mi dge ba dang / srog gcod pa la sogs pa lus kyi rnam par rig byed mi dge ba'i rgyu las 'byung ngo //
translated: The cause of nonvirtue is the nonvirtue of the indicative form of speech, which is lying and so on, and the nonvirtue of the indicative form of body, which is killing and so on.

original: gzugs su gtogs pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi dang / mi lcogs su mi rung ba dang / bsam gtan zag pa can la snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe sdom pa'i gzugs skye ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs su gtogs pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi dang / mi lcogs su mi rung ba dang / bsam gtan zag pa can la snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe sdom pa'i gzugs skye ba ste /
translated: Nonindicative form belonging to the form realm is the form of vows that arises when one enters meditative attainment of the four absorptions of the form realm, the meditative attainment of unrestricted access concentration and the contaminated absorptions.

original: de ni bsam gtan gyi sdom pa zhes bya'o //üîΩzag pa med pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad la snyoms par zhugs pa las /
analyzed: de ni bsam gtan gyi sdom pa zhes bya'o // zag pa med pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad la snyoms par zhugs pa las /
translated: That is called the absorption vows.

original: gang sdom pa'i gzugs skye ba ste /
analyzed: gang sdom pa'i gzugs skye ba ste /
translated: Uncontaminated nonindicative form is the form of vows that arises when one enters meditative attainment of the uncontaminated concentration of the eightfold noble path.

original: de ni zag pa med pa'i @42b sdom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni zag pa med pa'i @42b sdom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called the uncontaminated vows.

original: de bas na gzugs su gtogs pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / zag pa med pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gnyis ni ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i gzugs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na gzugs su gtogs pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / zag pa med pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gnyis ni ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i gzugs zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore both nonindicative form belonging to the form realm and uncontaminated nonindicative form are called form derived from the absorptions.

original: gzugs su gtogs pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: gzugs su gtogs pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i gzugs so //

translated: Non-revealing form belonging to the uncontaminated realm is form arisen from uncontaminated concentration.üîΩQuestion: Why are these called form derived from the elements?

original: smras pa / de dag kyang 'byung ba chen po bzhi la brten nas /
analyzed: smras pa / de dag kyang 'byung ba chen po bzhi la brten nas /
translated: Answer: They are also called form derived from the four great elements because they are supported by the four great elements.

original: 'byung zhing 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i mthu ma nyams shing de rnams gtong bar byed pa'i rgyu med kyi bar du sems 'khrugs pa dang / ma 'khrugs pa dang sems med pa rnams kyi dus na yang chu'i rgyun bzhin du rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung bas na rgyur byas pa'i gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung zhing 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i mthu ma nyams shing de rnams gtong bar byed pa'i rgyu med kyi bar du sems 'khrugs pa dang / ma 'khrugs pa dang sems med pa rnams kyi dus na yang chu'i rgyun bzhin du rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung bas na rgyur byas pa'i gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: As long as the power of the four great elements that produce it is not impaired and there is no cause to abandon them, they occur without interruption like the current of a river, even when the mind is disturbed, undisturbed, or absent. Therefore, they are called derivative form.

original: de la so sor thar pa'i sdom pa gtong ba'i rgyu ni rnam pa bzhi ste /

analyzed: sdom pa phul ba dang / log pa'i lta ba la zhugs pa'o //

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las langs pa'o //

translated: Form that is visible and resistant is posited as the object of the eye sense faculty. It is color, shape, and informative form.

translated: Form that is not visible but is resistant is the five sense faculties of the eye, etc., and the four objects of sound, smell, taste, and tactility.

analyzed: bltar yang mi snang la thogs pa yang med pa'i gzugs ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs so //
translated: Form that is not visible and is not resistant is non-informative form.

original: sdom pa'i gzugs te de dag la ci'i phyir rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes gdags she na /
analyzed: sdom pa'i gzugs te de dag la ci'i phyir rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes gdags she na /
translated: Why is it called non-informative form?

original: smras pa / ji ltar rnam par rig byed gzugs kyi rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: smras pa / ji ltar rnam par rig byed gzugs kyi rang bzhin yin la /
translated: It is said: Informative form is by nature form.

original: thal mo sbyor ba la sogs pa lus kyi las kyi sgo nas /
analyzed: thal mo sbyor ba la sogs pa lus kyi las kyi sgo nas /
translated: Through the action of the body, such as joining the palms in homage,

original: nang gi sems kyi ngo bo rig par rung bzhin du rnam par rig byed ma yin ba de yang gzugs kyi rang bzhin kyang yin mod kyi /
analyzed: nang gi sems kyi ngo bo rig par rung bzhin du rnam par rig byed ma yin ba de yang gzugs kyi rang bzhin kyang yin mod kyi /
translated: Although the nature of the internal mind is suitable to be known, it is not a form of manifest action.

original: de'i sgo nas nang gi sems kyi ngo bo rig par byar mi rung bas na rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas nang gi sems kyi ngo bo rig par byar mi rung bas na rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: However, since it is not suitable to be known by means of that, it is called non-manifest action.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi nas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i bar de dag la ci'i phyir gzugs zhes bya /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi nas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i bar de dag la ci'i phyir gzugs zhes bya /
translated: Why are the four great elements and so on up to non-manifest action called form?

original: smras pa / gzhig cing gnod par byed rung bas na gzugs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: smras pa / gzhig cing gnod par byed rung bas na gzugs zhes bya ste /
translated: It is said: They are called form because they are suitable to be destroyed and harmed.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dge slong dag gzhig cing gzhom du yod pa'i phyir gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dge slong dag gzhig cing gzhom du yod pa'i phyir gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn also said, ‚ÄúMonks, form is called the appropriated aggregate because it is suitable to be destroyed and overcome.‚Äù

original: smras pa / @43b 'o na rnam par rig byed ma yin pa bltar med la thogs pa med pas gzhig cing gnod pa byar mi rung na de ji ltar gzugs su 'gyur /
analyzed: smras pa / @43b 'o na rnam par rig byed ma yin pa bltar med la thogs pa med pas gzhig cing gnod pa byar mi rung na de ji ltar gzugs su 'gyur /
translated: It is said: Well then, since non-manifest action is invisible and unobstructing, it is not suitable to be destroyed and harmed. How can it be form?

original: smras pa / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa nyid la gzhig cing gnod pa byar mi rung yang shing bcad na grib ma med par 'gyur pa dang nor bu rin po che bcag na 'od med par 'gyur ba bzhin du 'byung ba chen po bzhi nyams par byas na rnam
analyzed: smras pa / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa nyid la gzhig cing gnod pa byar mi rung yang shing bcad na grib ma med par 'gyur pa dang nor bu rin po che bcag na 'od med par 'gyur ba bzhin du 'byung ba chen po bzhi nyams par byas na rnam
translated: Even though it is not suitable to destroy or harm nonindicative form itself, when the four great elements are impaired, nonindicative form is also impaired, just like a shadow disappears when a tree is cut down or the light of a jewel disappears when it is broken.

original: par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs kyang nyams par 'gyur bas gzugs zhes byas pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs kyang nyams par 'gyur bas gzugs zhes byas pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore there is no fault in calling it form.

original: gzugs kyi phung po bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the form aggregate is complete.üîΩThe aggregate of feelingüîΩThe aggregate of feeling is mentioned after the form aggregate.

original: // / gzugs kyi phung po bshad zin pa'i 'og tu tshor ba'i phung po smos pas de bshad pa'i skabs su bab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / gzugs kyi phung po bshad zin pa'i 'og tu tshor ba'i phung po smos pas de bshad pa'i skabs su bab pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it is the appropriate section to explain it,

original: tshor ba gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: tshor ba gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: it asks, What is feeling?

original: tshor ba'i phung po'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, What is the definition of the aggregate of feeling?

original: 'dir tshor ba'i phung po gang zhe na zhes ma dris kyi /
analyzed: 'dir tshor ba'i phung po gang zhe na zhes ma dris kyi /
translated: Here it does not ask, What is the aggregate of feeling?

original: tshor ba gang zhe na zhes ci'i phyir 'dri zhe na /
analyzed: tshor ba gang zhe na zhes ci'i phyir 'dri zhe na /
translated: Why does it ask, What is feeling?

original: yang gzugs kyi phung po'i skabs su lan btab pa bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: yang gzugs kyi phung po'i skabs su lan btab pa bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
translated: Or, as was explained in the context of the form aggregate, it should be explained as follows.

original: dris pa'i lan du /
analyzed: dris pa'i lan du /
translated: In response to the question,

original: myong ba rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: myong ba rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThere are three kinds of experience.‚Äù

analyzed: tshor ba zhes bya ba ni myong ba la bya ste / yul gyi rang bzhin sim pa dang / yul gyi rang bzhin gdung ba dang / yul gyi rang bzhin sim pa yang ma yin /
translated: Feeling is called ‚Äúexperience‚Äù because it experiences the three kinds of objects.

original: gdung ba yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo rnam pa gsum myong zhing mngon sum du byed pas na tshor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gdung ba yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo rnam pa gsum myong zhing mngon sum du byed pas na tshor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It experiences and manifests the three kinds of objects: the nature of objects that is soothing, the nature of objects that is tormenting, and the nature of objects that is neither soothing nor tormenting.

original: yang na las dge ba dang las mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i 'bras bu bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa gsum myong bar byed pas na tshor ba zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: yang na las dge ba dang las mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i 'bras bu bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa gsum myong bar byed pas na tshor ba zhes bya'o ;
translated: Or, it is called ‚Äúfeeling‚Äù because it experiences the three kinds of results of virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral actions: pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain.

original: / tshor ba la yang phye na du yod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / tshor ba la yang phye na du yod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the divisions of feeling, he says,

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa bde ba yang ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa bde ba yang ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
