translated: pleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: tshor ba la phye na rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: tshor ba la phye na rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: When feeling is classified, there are three types:

original: bde ba'i tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'o //
translated: pleasant feeling, unpleasant feeling, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant feeling.

original: smras pa / bde ba'i tshor ba dang sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba gnyis ni so sor rang gi rig par 'byung ba yod par mngon no //
analyzed: smras pa / bde ba'i tshor ba dang sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba gnyis ni so sor rang gi rig par 'byung ba yod par mngon no //
translated: Objection: The occurrence of pleasant feeling and unpleasant feeling is clearly known by each one individually.

original: de gnyis las ma gtogs par bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba yod par ci mngon /
analyzed: de gnyis las ma gtogs par bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba yod par ci mngon /
translated: But how is the existence of a feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant known?

original: lan du / de ni bcom ldan @44a * //üîΩ'das kyi lung las kyang 'byung la /
analyzed: lan du / de ni bcom ldan @44a * // 'das kyi lung las kyang 'byung la /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:üîΩThe existence of a feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant is clearly known from the scriptures of the Lord Buddha and from logical reasoning.üîΩThe existence of a feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant is clearly known from the scriptures of the Lord Buddha.

original: rigs pas brtags na yang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba yod par mngon no //
analyzed: rigs pas brtags na yang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba yod par mngon no //
translated: The existence of a feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant is clearly known from logical reasoning.üîΩThe scriptures state:

original: lung las 'byung ba ni mod sde las tshor ba rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: lung las 'byung ba ni mod sde las tshor ba rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThere are three kinds of feelings.‚Äù

original: bde ba'i tshor ba dang sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba dang sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: There is the feeling of pleasure, the feeling of pain and the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain.

original: yang mdo sde gzhan dag las bde ba yang spangs sdug bsngal yang spangs nas dang po nyid du yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba gnyis 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang mdo sde gzhan dag las bde ba yang spangs sdug bsngal yang spangs nas dang po nyid du yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba gnyis 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: Again, in other s≈´tras, it is said that, having abandoned pleasure and abandoned pain, first the two, mental pleasure and mental pain, cease.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba so sor myong ba bsam gtan bzhi ba la snyoms par zhugs nas gnas so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba so sor myong ba bsam gtan bzhi ba la snyoms par zhugs nas gnas so zhes gsungs so //
translated: Experiencing the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain, one enters and remains in the fourth concentration.

original: rigs pas brtags na yang nam yang tshor ba dang bral ba'i sems 'byung mi srid la bar skabs su bde ba'i tshor ba yang mi 'byung sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba yang mi 'byung ba'i sems dmigs pas na ;
analyzed: rigs pas brtags na yang nam yang tshor ba dang bral ba'i sems 'byung mi srid la bar skabs su bde ba'i tshor ba yang mi 'byung sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba yang mi 'byung ba'i sems dmigs pas na ;
translated: When analyzed logically, it is impossible for a mind to arise that is ever free of feeling. Since a mind that is neither a feeling of pleasure nor a feeling of pain is observed in the interim,

original: de'i skabs su ni bde ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: de'i skabs su ni bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: at that time it is neither pleasureüîΩnor pain.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that a feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant occurs.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To indicate the characteristics of pleasant feeling,

original: bde ba ni gang 'gag pa las gang phrad par 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bde ba ni gang 'gag pa las gang phrad par 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúPleasant is that from the cessation of which one desires contact.‚Äù

original: dngos po gang zhig dang phrad pa las bral bar 'gyur ba dang / yang de dang slar phrad par 'dod pa ni bde ba'i tshor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po gang zhig dang phrad pa las bral bar 'gyur ba dang / yang de dang slar phrad par 'dod pa ni bde ba'i tshor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is a thing from contact with which one desires separation and again desires contact with it is called a pleasant feeling.

original: 'gag ces bya ba ni bral ba la bya'o //
analyzed: 'gag ces bya ba ni bral ba la bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúCessation‚Äù means separation.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To indicate the characteristics of unpleasant feeling,

original: sdug bsngal ni byung ba las gang bral bar 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni byung ba las gang bral bar 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúUnpleasant is that from the occurrence of which one desires separation.‚Äù

original: byung ba las zhes bya ba 'di dngos po gang dang phrad par gyur ba las de dang phyis bral bar 'dod cing mi phrad par 'dod pa ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byung ba las zhes bya ba 'di dngos po gang dang phrad par gyur ba las de dang phyis bral bar 'dod cing mi phrad par 'dod pa ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is a thing from the occurrence of which one desires separation and does not desire contact is called an unpleasant feeling.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin ba'i tshor ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin ba'i tshor ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To indicate the characteristics of neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling, he says:

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa ni gang gnyi gar 'dod bar mi 'gyur pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa ni gang gnyi gar 'dod bar mi 'gyur pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Neither-painful-nor-pleasant is that which is not considered to be either.üîΩThat which is neither-painful-nor-pleasant is that which is neither considered to be painful nor considered to be pleasant.

original: dngos po gang dang phrad kyang bral bar 'dod pa yang mi skye dngos po gang dang bral yang slar phrad par 'dod pa yang mi skye ba ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po gang dang phrad kyang bral bar 'dod pa yang mi skye dngos po gang dang bral yang slar phrad par 'dod pa yang mi skye ba ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When one encounters a thing, the wish to be separated from it does not arise, and when one is separated from it, the wish to be reunited with it does not arise.

original: yang na dngos po gang dang @44b phrad pa'i tshe ni 'bral bar mi 'dod la bral ba'i tshe ni slar phrad par 'dod pa skye ba de ni bde ba'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: yang na dngos po gang dang @44b phrad pa'i tshe ni 'bral bar mi 'dod la bral ba'i tshe ni slar phrad par 'dod pa skye ba de ni bde ba'i tshor ba'o //
translated: Or, when one encounters a thing, one does not wish to be separated from it, and when one is separated from it, the wish to be reunited with it arises. That is pleasant feeling.

original: dngos po gan dang phrad pa'i tshe ni /
analyzed: dngos po gan dang phrad pa'i tshe ni /
translated: When one encounters a thing,

original: bral bar 'dod la bral ba'i tshe ni slar phrad par mi 'dod pa de ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'o //
analyzed: bral bar 'dod la bral ba'i tshe ni slar phrad par mi 'dod pa de ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'o //
translated: one wishes to be separated from it, and when one is separated from it, one does not wish to be reunited with it. That is painful feeling.

original: btang snyoms kyi tshor ba ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi tshor ba ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The feeling of equanimity is as explained above.

original: yang na bde ba'i tshor ba ni lus brtas pa dang sems brtan par byed pa dang yid dang mthun par byed pas nyams su len pa'i phyir de 'gags na yang slar de dang phrad par 'dod pa skye'o //
analyzed: yang na bde ba'i tshor ba ni lus brtas pa dang sems brtan par byed pa dang yid dang mthun par byed pas nyams su len pa'i phyir de 'gags na yang slar de dang phrad par 'dod pa skye'o //
translated: Or, the feeling of pleasure is cultivated because it nourishes the body, stabilizes the mind, and is agreeable to the mind. Therefore, when it ceases, one desires to meet with it again.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni lus nyams par byed pa dang sems nyams par byed pa dang / yid du mi 'ong bas nyams su gnod par byed pa'i phyir de dang phrad na yang slar 'bral ba'i 'dod pa skye'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni lus nyams par byed pa dang sems nyams par byed pa dang / yid du mi 'ong bas nyams su gnod par byed pa'i phyir de dang phrad na yang slar 'bral ba'i 'dod pa skye'o //
translated: The feeling of pain is cultivated because it harms the body, harms the mind, and is disagreeable. Therefore, when one meets with it, one desires to be separated from it.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba bzhin du lus dang sems la gnod par byed cing yid du mi 'ong bar byed pa yang med /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba bzhin du lus dang sems la gnod par byed cing yid du mi 'ong bar byed pa yang med /
translated: The feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain is cultivated because it does not harm the body or mind, and is not disagreeable, like the feeling of pain.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba bzhin du lus la phan par byed cing yid du 'ong bar byed pa yang med pas de dang phrad na yang 'bral bar 'dod pa ni mi skye la /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba bzhin du lus la phan par byed cing yid du 'ong bar byed pa yang med pas de dang phrad na yang 'bral bar 'dod pa ni mi skye la /
translated: Since it does not benefit the body like the feeling of pleasure, and does not please the mind, when one encounters it, the desire not to be separated from it does not arise.

original: bral na yang phrad par 'dod pa mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: bral na yang phrad par 'dod pa mi skye ba'o //
translated: And when one is separated from it, the desire to be united with it does not arise.

original: tshor ba'i phung po bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the aggregate of feeling is complete.

original: // / tshor ba'i phung po'i 'og tu 'du shes kyi phung po smos pa de bshad pa'i skabs su bab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / tshor ba'i phung po'i 'og tu 'du shes kyi phung po smos pa de bshad pa'i skabs su bab pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the aggregate of perception is mentioned after the aggregate of feeling, the time has come to explain it.

original: 'du shes gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: 'du shes gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: What is perception?

original: 'du shes kyi phung po'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: This is the question: What is the characteristic of the aggregate of perception?

original: de'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach its characteristic,

original: yul la mtshan mar 'dzi pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yul la mtshan mar 'dzi pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said: The apprehension of the mark of an object.

original: de la yul ni gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro la sogs pa'i yul lnga'o //
analyzed: de la yul ni gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro la sogs pa'i yul lnga'o //
translated: Therein, the object is the five objects such as form, sound, smell, taste, and so on.

original: yul de'i mtshan nyid yul gyi khyad par la bya ste /
analyzed: yul de'i mtshan nyid yul gyi khyad par la bya ste /
translated: The mark of the object is taken to be the particularity of the object,

original: sngon po dang ser po dang dmar po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po dang dmar po la sogs pa'o //
translated: such as blue, yellow, red, and so on.

original: 'dzin pa ni 'di ni sngon po nyid yin gyi ser po ma yin zhes bye brag tu rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni 'di ni sngon po nyid yin gyi ser po ma yin zhes bye brag tu rtog pa'o //
translated: Grasping is the specific conception that this is blue, not yellow.

original: smras pa / de lar na mig gi rnam par shes pa dang 'du shes gnyis la khad par ci yod /
analyzed: smras pa / de lar na mig gi rnam par shes pa dang 'du shes gnyis la khad par ci yod /
translated: Objection: What is the difference between the eye consciousness and the conception that arises with it?

original: smras pa ; spyir gzugs tsam mo zhes shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa ; spyir gzugs tsam mo zhes shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Response: Consciousness is the general cognition that this is simply a form.

original: gzugs kyang 'di ni sngon po nyid yin gyi ser po ni ma yin no zhes bye brag tu 'byed pa ni 'du shes te de bas na khyad par yod do //
analyzed: gzugs kyang 'di ni sngon po nyid yin gyi ser po ni ma yin no zhes bye brag tu 'byed pa ni 'du shes te de bas na khyad par yod do //
translated: Conception is the specific differentiation that this is blue, not yellow. Thus, there is a difference.üîΩTo demonstrate that the aggregate of conception is threefold,

original: 'du shes kyi phung po la phye na du yod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po la phye na du yod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: he says:

original: de ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It is threefold:

original: @45a * // phra ba dang chen por gyur pa dang tshad med pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: @45a * // phra ba dang chen por gyur pa dang tshad med pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: subtle, vast, and immeasurable.

original: 'du shes la phye na rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: 'du shes la phye na rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Conception is threefold.

original: de la 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'du shes ni phra ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'du shes ni phra ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Conception in the desire realm is called subtle.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga tsam la dmigs shing khams gzhan la ltos na ngan par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga tsam la dmigs shing khams gzhan la ltos na ngan par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is inferior in relation to the other realms, since it is only concerned with the five sense objects such as form, etc.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi 'du shes ni chen por gyur pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi 'du shes ni chen por gyur pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The ideation of the form realm is called ‚Äúvast,‚Äù

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'du shes pas mchog tu gyur pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi yul la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'du shes pas mchog tu gyur pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi yul la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is superior to the ideation of the desire realm and because it is concerned with the object of concentration.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi 'du shes ni tshad med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi 'du shes ni tshad med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The ideation of the formless realm is called ‚Äúinfinite,‚Äù

original: nam mkha' ni mtha' yas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par tshad med par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni mtha' yas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par tshad med par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is concerned with the infinite aspects of space, etc.

original: yang na slob dpon kha cig na re yungs kar la sogs pa la dmigs ba'i 'du shes ni phra ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na slob dpon kha cig na re yungs kar la sogs pa la dmigs ba'i 'du shes ni phra ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, according to another opinion, ideation concerned with mustard seeds, etc. is called ‚Äúsubtle,‚Äù

original: ri rab la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i 'du shes ni chen por gyur pa zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: ri rab la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i 'du shes ni chen por gyur pa zhes bya'o ;
translated: ideation concerned with Mount Meru, etc. is called ‚Äúvast,‚Äù

original: / nam mkha' la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i 'du shes ni tshad med pa zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: / nam mkha' la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i 'du shes ni tshad med pa zhes 'chad do //
translated: and ideation concerned with space, etc. is called ‚Äúinfinite.‚Äù

original: 'du shes kyi phung po bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the aggregate of perception is complete.

original: // /'du shes kyi phung po'i 'og tu 'du byed kyi phung po smos pas /
analyzed: // /'du shes kyi phung po'i 'og tu 'du byed kyi phung po smos pas /
translated: Since the aggregate of compositional factors is mentioned after the aggregate of perception,

original: de bshad pa'i skabs su bab ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bshad pa'i skabs su bab ba'i phyir /
translated: it is the appropriate occasion to explain it.

original: 'du byed rnams gang zhe na zhes dris te ;
analyzed: 'du byed rnams gang zhe na zhes dris te ;
translated: What are compositional factors?

original: 'du byed kyi phung po rnams kyi mtshan yid dang rang bzhin gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po rnams kyi mtshan yid dang rang bzhin gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this question is: What are the characteristics and nature of the aggregates of compositional factors?

original: de la rgyu dang rkyen rnams 'dus shig tshogs nas byas shig bskyed pa'i phyir 'du byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la rgyu dang rkyen rnams 'dus shig tshogs nas byas shig bskyed pa'i phyir 'du byed ces bya'o //
translated: They are called compositional factors because causes and conditions assemble and gather together to create and generate them.

original: smras pa / gong du gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i skabs su ni gzugs gang zhe na /üîΩtshor ba gang zhe na zhes dris kyi gzugs rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: smras pa / gong du gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i skabs su ni gzugs gang zhe na / tshor ba gang zhe na zhes dris kyi gzugs rnams gang zhe na /
translated: In the above sections on form, feeling, and so on, the root text asks, ‚ÄúWhat is form?‚ÄùüîΩand ‚ÄúWhat is feeling?‚Äù but it does not ask, ‚ÄúWhat are forms?‚Äù

original: tshor ba rnams gang zhe na zhes ma dris la /
analyzed: tshor ba rnams gang zhe na zhes ma dris la /
translated: and ‚ÄúWhat are feelings?‚Äù

original: 'dir 'du byed kyi phung po bshad pa'i skabs su 'du byed gang zhe na zhes mi 'dri bar ci'i phyir 'du byed rnams gang zhe na zhes 'dri /
analyzed: 'dir 'du byed kyi phung po bshad pa'i skabs su 'du byed gang zhe na zhes mi 'dri bar ci'i phyir 'du byed rnams gang zhe na zhes 'dri /
translated: Here, in the context of explaining the aggregate of formation, why is it asked, ‚ÄúWhat are the formations?‚Äù instead of asking, ‚ÄúWhat is formation?‚Äù

original: smras pa / gzugs dang tshor ba'i phung po bshad pa'i skabs pas 'du byed kyi phung po bshad pa'i skabs su chos mang du bstan cing 'chad pas na 'du byed rnams gang zhe na zhes dris so //
analyzed: smras pa / gzugs dang tshor ba'i phung po bshad pa'i skabs pas 'du byed kyi phung po bshad pa'i skabs su chos mang du bstan cing 'chad pas na 'du byed rnams gang zhe na zhes dris so //
translated: It is said: Because many phenomena are taught and explained in the context of explaining the aggregate of formation, it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat are the formations?‚Äù

original: lan du tshor ba dang 'du shes las gzhan pa sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang sems dang mi ldan pa rnams so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lan du tshor ba dang 'du shes las gzhan pa sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang sems dang mi ldan pa rnams so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response it says, ‚ÄúThey are mental factors other than feeling and discernment and also that which is not associated with the mind.‚Äù

original: gzhan @45b pa zhes bya ba ni bzhag ste zhes bya ba'i don tam bkol lam zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: gzhan @45b pa zhes bya ba ni bzhag ste zhes bya ba'i don tam bkol lam zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: Other means set aside or used.

original: mdor na tshor ba dang 'du shes gnyis gzhag gam bkol te sems las 'byung ba'i chos ji snyed yod pa dang sems dang mi ldan pa'i chos ji snyed yod pa la 'du byed kyi phung po zhes pa'i do to //
analyzed: mdor na tshor ba dang 'du shes gnyis gzhag gam bkol te sems las 'byung ba'i chos ji snyed yod pa dang sems dang mi ldan pa'i chos ji snyed yod pa la 'du byed kyi phung po zhes pa'i do to //
translated: In brief, all dharmas that are mental factors, as many as there are, and all dharmas that are not associated with the mind, as many as there are, are included in the aggregate of formation.

original: smras pa / tshor ba dang 'du shes las gzhan pa zhes bya ba de'i tshig smos pa de cir dgos /
analyzed: smras pa / tshor ba dang 'du shes las gzhan pa zhes bya ba de'i tshig smos pa de cir dgos /
translated: Objection: What is the point of using the words ‚Äúother than feeling and discernment‚Äù?

original: lan du de gnyis kyi mtshan nyid gong du bshad zin to //
analyzed: lan du de gnyis kyi mtshan nyid gong du bshad zin to //
translated: In response, the characteristics of those two have already been explained above.

original: da 'dir bshad mi dgos pas na gzhan pa zhes bya ba'i tshig smos te /
analyzed: da 'dir bshad mi dgos pas na gzhan pa zhes bya ba'i tshig smos te /
translated: Since they do not need to be explained here, the words ‚Äúother than‚Äù are used.

original: de gnyis 'dir mi bshad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de gnyis 'dir mi bshad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that those two are not explained here.

original: smras pa de gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ltar gu bshad zin to //
analyzed: smras pa de gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ltar gu bshad zin to //
translated: Objection: The characteristics of those two have already been explained.

original: 'dir bshad mi dogs na yod ye ma smos pas mi chog gam /
analyzed: 'dir bshad mi dogs na yod ye ma smos pas mi chog gam /
translated: If they do not need to be explained here, why not just not mention them at all?

original: lan du de gnyis kyang sems las byung ba'i chos su gtogs te /
analyzed: lan du de gnyis kyang sems las byung ba'i chos su gtogs te /
translated: In response, those two are included in mental factors.

original: 'du byed kyi chos su gtogs pa'i sems las byung ba'i chos yin no zhes bstan dgos pa'i phyir 'dir ming smos su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi chos su gtogs pa'i sems las byung ba'i chos yin no zhes bstan dgos pa'i phyir 'dir ming smos su mi rung ngo //
translated: It is necessary to teach that it is a mental factor that is included in the aggregate of formation.

original: smras pa / sems las byung ba la nga bcu rtsa gcig yod pa las gzhan ni 'du byed kyi phung po zhes phung po gcig tu bsdus la tshor ba dang 'du shes gnyis ci'i phyir logs shig tu bkar te /
analyzed: smras pa / sems las byung ba la nga bcu rtsa gcig yod pa las gzhan ni 'du byed kyi phung po zhes phung po gcig tu bsdus la tshor ba dang 'du shes gnyis ci'i phyir logs shig tu bkar te /
translated: Question: Among the eleven mental factors, why are the others included in the aggregate of formation, while feeling and discernment are explained separately as distinct aggregates?

original: phung po re rer ci'i phyir bshad /
analyzed: phung po re rer ci'i phyir bshad /
translated: Why are they explained as separate aggregates?

original: smras pa / tshor ba ni myong bar byed pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: smras pa / tshor ba ni myong bar byed pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Answer: Feeling has the nature of experience.

original: de la dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa /
analyzed: de la dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa /
translated: It is explained as a separate aggregate because it experiences the virtuous and nonvirtuous karmic maturation

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal myong bar byed pas na bkar te logs shig tu phung por bshad pa dang / 'du shes ni tha snyad du 'dogs pa'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal myong bar byed pas na bkar te logs shig tu phung por bshad pa dang / 'du shes ni tha snyad du 'dogs pa'i dngos po ste /
translated: and the experience of pleasure and pain. Discernment is the entity that imputes conventions.

original: 'du shes kyi mthong ba dang thos pa dang rtogs pa la sogs pa'i don rnams la mtshan mar bzung nas mthong ngo thos so rtogs so zhes 'jig rten pa rnams tha snyad du 'dogs pas na logs shig tu bkar te phung po re rer byas te bshad do
analyzed: 'du shes kyi mthong ba dang thos pa dang rtogs pa la sogs pa'i don rnams la mtshan mar bzung nas mthong ngo thos so rtogs so zhes 'jig rten pa rnams tha snyad du 'dogs pas na logs shig tu bkar te phung po re rer byas te bshad do
translated: The world designates the objects of perception, such as what is seen, heard, and cognized, as signs, and designates them as seen, heard, and cognized. Therefore, they are distinguished and explained as separate aggregates.

original: // yang ma tshor ba dang 'du shes gnyis ni rtsod pa'i rtsa ba byed pa dang 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur pas /
analyzed: // yang ma tshor ba dang 'du shes gnyis ni rtsod pa'i rtsa ba byed pa dang 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur pas /
translated: Also, feeling and perception are the roots of dispute and the causes of cyclic existence.

original: sems las byung ba gzhan pas kyang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu lhag par byed pas na sems las byung ba'i chos yin du zin kyang logs shig tu phung po re re bya ste bshad do //
analyzed: sems las byung ba gzhan pas kyang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu lhag par byed pas na sems las byung ba'i chos yin du zin kyang logs shig tu phung po re re bya ste bshad do //
translated: Even though they are mental factors, they are explained as separate aggregates because they are the causes of afflictions more than other mental factors.

original: de la rtsod pa'i rtsa ba gnyis te /
analyzed: de la rtsod pa'i rtsa ba gnyis te /
translated: There are two roots of dispute:

original: 'dod pa la chags pa dang lta ba la chags pa'o //üîΩrtsod pa yang phyogs rnam par @46a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa la chags pa dang lta ba la chags pa'o // rtsod pa yang phyogs rnam par @46a * //
translated: attachment to desire and attachment to views.üîΩThere are two sides of dispute:

original: gnyis te / khyim na gnas pa'i phyogs dang rab tu byung pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: gnyis te / khyim na gnas pa'i phyogs dang rab tu byung pa'i phyogs so //
translated: the side of householders and the side of those gone forth.

original: de la khyim na gnas pa'i phyogs ni 'dod pa la chags pa'i rgyus rtsod do //
analyzed: de la khyim na gnas pa'i phyogs ni 'dod pa la chags pa'i rgyus rtsod do //
translated: Those who live in a household quarrel because of the cause of attachment to pleasure.üîΩA sutra also declares:

original: mdo las kyang 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la chags shing rnam par bcings pa dang rab tu zhen pa'i rgyus khyim pa rnams kyang khyim pa dang lhan cig rtsod do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo las kyang 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la chags shing rnam par bcings pa dang rab tu zhen pa'i rgyus khyim pa rnams kyang khyim pa dang lhan cig rtsod do zhes gsungs te /
translated: Householders quarrel with householders due to the cause of attachment to pleasure, being bound to it and clinging to it.

original: de ltar na khyim na gnas pa rnams rtsod pa'i rtsa ba ni tshor bas byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na khyim na gnas pa rnams rtsod pa'i rtsa ba ni tshor bas byed do //
translated: Thus, those who live in a household quarrel due to the cause of feeling.

original: rab tu byung ba rnams ni lta ba la kun tu chags pa'i rgyus rtsod de /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba rnams ni lta ba la kun tu chags pa'i rgyus rtsod de /
translated: Those who have gone forth quarrel due to the cause of attachment to views.üîΩA sutra also declares:

original: mdo las kyang lta ba la kun tu chags shing rnam par bcings pa dang / kun tu zhen pa'i rgyus rab tu byung ba rnams kyang rab tu byung ba dang / lhan cig rtsod do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo las kyang lta ba la kun tu chags shing rnam par bcings pa dang / kun tu zhen pa'i rgyus rab tu byung ba rnams kyang rab tu byung ba dang / lhan cig rtsod do zhes gsungs te /
translated: Those who have gone forth quarrel with those who have gone forth due to the cause of attachment to views, being bound to it and clinging to it.

original: rab tu byung ba rnams lta ba las rtsod pa'i rtsa ba yang bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / rtag par 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes phyin ci log yin pas de gnyis logs shig tu phung po re rer gzhag go /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba rnams lta ba las rtsod pa'i rtsa ba yang bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / rtag par 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes phyin ci log yin pas de gnyis logs shig tu phung po re rer gzhag go /
translated: The root of dispute among those who have gone forth is the wrong conception of grasping the self and grasping permanence, etc. Therefore, these two are separately posited as the aggregates of clinging.

original: 'khor ba'i rgyu ni gang zag rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgyu ni gang zag rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of persons who are the cause of samsara:

original: sred pa la spyod pa dang lta ba la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa la spyod pa dang lta ba la spyod pa'o //
translated: those who engage craving and those who engage views.

original: sred pa la spyod pa'i gang zag rnams ni tshor ba la chags pa'i rgyus 'khor bar 'khor la /
analyzed: sred pa la spyod pa'i gang zag rnams ni tshor ba la chags pa'i rgyus 'khor bar 'khor la /
translated: Persons who engage craving revolve in samsara through the cause of attachment to feeling.

original: lta ba la chags pa'i gang zag rnams ni bdag med pa la bdag tu 'du shes pa la sogs pa 'du shes phyin ci log gi rgyus 'khor bar 'khor bas na /
analyzed: lta ba la chags pa'i gang zag rnams ni bdag med pa la bdag tu 'du shes pa la sogs pa 'du shes phyin ci log gi rgyus 'khor bar 'khor bas na /
translated: Persons who engage views revolve in samsara through the cause of wrong conception, such as conceiving a self where there is no self.

original: de gnyis 'khor ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir logs shig tu phung po re rer bshad do //
analyzed: de gnyis 'khor ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir logs shig tu phung po re rer bshad do //
translated: Therefore, since these two are the cause of samsara, they are explained separately as the aggregates of clinging.

original: smras pa / ji ste tshor ba dang 'du shes gnyis las gzhan pa reg pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / rnyed pa la sogs pa sems dang mi ldan pa'i chos rnams 'dir 'du byed kyi phung por bshad na mdo dang 'gal te /
analyzed: smras pa / ji ste tshor ba dang 'du shes gnyis las gzhan pa reg pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / rnyed pa la sogs pa sems dang mi ldan pa'i chos rnams 'dir 'du byed kyi phung por bshad na mdo dang 'gal te /
translated: He says: If the mental factors such as contact and so on, which are different from feeling and discernment, and the nonassociated formative factors such as acquisition and so on, are explained as the aggregate of formation here, then it contradicts the s≈´tras.üîΩThe s≈´tras state:

original: mdo las kyang 'du byed rnams kyi phung po gang zhe na /
analyzed: mdo las kyang 'du byed rnams kyi phung po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the aggregate of formation?

original: sems pa'i tshogs drug ste /üîΩmig gi kun tu reg pa las byung ba'i sems pa nas /
analyzed: sems pa'i tshogs drug ste / mig gi kun tu reg pa las byung ba'i sems pa nas /
translated: It is the group of six intentions.

original: yid kyi kun tu reg pa nas byung ba'i sems pa'o zhes 'byung ba dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: yid kyi kun tu reg pa nas byung ba'i sems pa'o zhes 'byung ba dang 'gal lo //
translated: It is intention arising from contact with the eye up to intention arising from contact with the mind.üîΩThis contradicts the s≈´tras.

original: lan du mdo las sems pa drug la 'du byed kyi phung por gsungs pa ni gtso bo'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: lan du mdo las sems pa drug la 'du byed kyi phung por gsungs pa ni gtso bo'i dbang du byas te /
translated: The s≈´tras state that the aggregate of formation is the six intentions because they are primary.

original: gsungs pas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: gsungs pas 'gal ba med do //
translated: There is no contradiction.

original: ji ltar gtso bo zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gtso bo zhe na /
translated: Why are they primary?

original: sems pa ni sems mngon par 'du byed cing g-yo bar byed pas na gtso bo ste /
analyzed: sems pa ni sems mngon par 'du byed cing g-yo bar byed pas na gtso bo ste /
translated: Intention is primary because it forms and moves the mind.

original: sems @46b pa'i dbang gis dge ba la yang sems 'jug par byed /
analyzed: sems @46b pa'i dbang gis dge ba la yang sems 'jug par byed /
translated: and by the power of intention, the mind engages virtue,

original: mi dge ba la yang sems 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: mi dge ba la yang sems 'jug par byed de /
translated: the mind engages nonvirtue,

original: lung du mi ston pa la yang sems 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung du mi ston pa la yang sems 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the mind engages the ethically neutral.

original: yid la byed pa la sogs pa yang sems pa'i rjes su 'brang zhing 'byung ba yin pas mdo las sems pa'i tshogs drug 'ba' zhig smos pa der gzhan yang zhar gyis gsungs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa la sogs pa yang sems pa'i rjes su 'brang zhing 'byung ba yin pas mdo las sems pa'i tshogs drug 'ba' zhig smos pa der gzhan yang zhar gyis gsungs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Since attention and so on follow and arise after intention, the sutra's statement that there are only six collections of intention should be understood to implicitly include the others.

original: gtso bo'i dbang du byas pa ni dper na rgyal po gshags zhes smras pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: gtso bo'i dbang du byas pa ni dper na rgyal po gshags zhes smras pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, when it is said that the king is coming,

original: gzhan zham 'bring 'ong ngo zhes ma smras kyang de dag kyang de na ma 'ongs pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzhan zham 'bring 'ong ngo zhes ma smras kyang de dag kyang de na ma 'ongs pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: even though it is not said that his retinue is coming, it is not that they are not coming.

original: 'du byed kyi phung por sems las byung ba'i chos dang sems dang mi ldan pa'i chos rnam pa gnyis bsdus pa las sems las byung ba'i chos zhes bya ba dngos su gang la bya mi shes te /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung por sems las byung ba'i chos dang sems dang mi ldan pa'i chos rnam pa gnyis bsdus pa las sems las byung ba'i chos zhes bya ba dngos su gang la bya mi shes te /
translated: The aggregate of formation includes both mental factors and non-associated compositional factors.

original: de bstan pa'i phyir sems las byung ba'i chos rnams gang zhe na zhes dris nas lan du chos gang sems dang ldan pa rnams so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir sems las byung ba'i chos rnams gang zhe na zhes dris nas lan du chos gang sems dang ldan pa rnams so zhes bshad do //
translated: It is not known what is actually meant by mental factors, so in order to teach that, the root text asks, ‚ÄúWhat are mental factors?‚Äù and then answers, ‚ÄúThey are phenomena that are concomitant with the mind.‚Äù

original: sems las skyes shing sems las 'thon pas na sems las byung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems las skyes shing sems las 'thon pas na sems las byung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: They are called mental factors because they are born from the mind and emerge from the mind.

original: de yang chos gang sems dang ldan ba rnams la ni sems las byung ba'i chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang chos gang sems dang ldan ba rnams la ni sems las byung ba'i chos zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called mental factors because they are phenomena that are concomitant with the mind.

original: de la sems dang ldan pa'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: de la sems dang ldan pa'i don ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of concomitant with the mind?

original: rig pa nas spyod pa'i bar du chos 'di dag gnas mnyam pa dang dmigs pa mnyam pa dang / rnam pa mnyam pa dang / dus mnyam pa dang / rdzas mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: rig pa nas spyod pa'i bar du chos 'di dag gnas mnyam pa dang dmigs pa mnyam pa dang / rnam pa mnyam pa dang / dus mnyam pa dang / rdzas mnyam pa ste /
translated: These phenomena from consciousness to the faculties are concomitant because they are the same in terms of basis, focal object, aspect, time and substance.

original: mnyam pa lngas mnyam du skye zhing sems kyi rjes su 'brang bas na sems dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //üîΩgnas mnyam pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa mig gi dbang po la gnas shing brten na /
analyzed: mnyam pa lngas mnyam du skye zhing sems kyi rjes su 'brang bas na sems dang ldan pa zhes bya'o // gnas mnyam pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa mig gi dbang po la gnas shing brten na /
translated: They are called ‚Äúassociated with mind‚Äù because they arise equally through the five equalities and because they follow the mind.

original: reg pa la sogs pa de'i rjes su 'brang ba'i sems las byung ba rnams kyang mig gi dbang po nyid la brten cing gnas kyi gzhan rnams la mi gnas so //
analyzed: reg pa la sogs pa de'i rjes su 'brang ba'i sems las byung ba rnams kyang mig gi dbang po nyid la brten cing gnas kyi gzhan rnams la mi gnas so //
translated: The equality of support means that when eye consciousness is supported and based on the eye faculty, the mental factors that accompany it, such as contact, are also supported and based on the eye faculty and not on the other faculties.

original: dmigs pa mnyam pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa gzugs la dmigs na reg pa la sogs pa de'i rjes su 'brang gi sems las byung ba rnams kyang gzugs nyid la dmigs kyi sgra la sogs pa gzhan la mi dmigs so //
analyzed: dmigs pa mnyam pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa gzugs la dmigs na reg pa la sogs pa de'i rjes su 'brang gi sems las byung ba rnams kyang gzugs nyid la dmigs kyi sgra la sogs pa gzhan la mi dmigs so //
translated: The equality of object means that when eye consciousness focuses on form, the mental factors that accompany it, such as contact, also focus on form and not on other objects such as sound.

original: rnam par mnyam pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa sngon po'i rnam pa lta bur skyes na reg pa la sogs pa de'i rjes su 'brang ba yang sngon @47a * //
analyzed: rnam par mnyam pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa sngon po'i rnam pa lta bur skyes na reg pa la sogs pa de'i rjes su 'brang ba yang sngon @47a * //
translated: The equality of aspect means that when eye consciousness arises with the aspect of blue, the mental factors that accompany it, such as contact, also have the aspect of blue.

original: po'i rnam pa lta bur skye'i ser po'i rnam pa lta bur mi skye'o //
analyzed: po'i rnam pa lta bur skye'i ser po'i rnam pa lta bur mi skye'o //
translated: They arise in the aspect of blue, not in the aspect of yellow.

original: dus mnyam pa ni gang gi skad cig ma la mig gi rnam par shes pa skyes pa de'i skad cig ma nyid la reg pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba 'ang de nyid kyi skad cig ma la skye'i skad cig ma phyi ma la mi skye'o //
analyzed: dus mnyam pa ni gang gi skad cig ma la mig gi rnam par shes pa skyes pa de'i skad cig ma nyid la reg pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba 'ang de nyid kyi skad cig ma la skye'i skad cig ma phyi ma la mi skye'o //
translated: Simultaneous means that contact and so on arise in the same moment that the eye consciousness arises, not in a later moment.

original: rdzas mnyam pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa rdzas gcig byung na reg pa la sogs pa 'ang reg pa rdzas gnyis mi 'byung gi reg pa'i rdzas gcig 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rdzas mnyam pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa rdzas gcig byung na reg pa la sogs pa 'ang reg pa rdzas gnyis mi 'byung gi reg pa'i rdzas gcig 'byung ngo //
translated: Equal in substance means that when one substance of eye consciousness arises, one substance of contact arises, not two substances of contact.

original: 'du byed sems dang ldan pa de dag kyang gang dang gang yin pa mi shes pa dang grangs su yod pa mi shes te /
analyzed: 'du byed sems dang ldan pa de dag kyang gang dang gang yin pa mi shes pa dang grangs su yod pa mi shes te /
translated: One does not know which are the mental factors that are concomitant with the mind, nor does one know their number.

original: de bas na de dag gang zhe na zhes dris te /üîΩde'i don ni sems dang ldan pa'i chos de dag ming gis ni gang dang gang yin /
analyzed: de bas na de dag gang zhe na zhes dris te / de'i don ni sems dang ldan pa'i chos de dag ming gis ni gang dang gang yin /
translated: Therefore, the root text asks, ‚ÄúWhat are they?‚ÄùüîΩThe meaning of that is, ‚ÄúWhat are the names of those phenomena that are concomitant with the mind?

original: grangs ni du zhig yod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: grangs ni du zhig yod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: What is their number?‚Äù

original: de'i phyir smras pa reg pa dang yid la byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa reg pa dang yid la byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: contact, mental attention, feeling, etc.

original: de dag gi ming ni reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang tshor ba zhes dngos su ming gis smos pa'o //üîΩgrangs ni rig pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de dag gi ming ni reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang tshor ba zhes dngos su ming gis smos pa'o // grangs ni rig pa nas brtsams te /
translated: Their names are contact, mental attention, feeling, etc.

original: dpyod pa'i bar du lnga bcu rtsa gcig ste /
analyzed: dpyod pa'i bar du lnga bcu rtsa gcig ste /
translated: Their number is fifty-one, beginning with investigation.

original: lnga bcu rtsa gcig po la 'du byed sems dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lnga bcu rtsa gcig po la 'du byed sems dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The fifty-one are called ‚Äúembellishers of mind.‚Äù

original: de dag las kun tu 'gro ba ni du /
analyzed: de dag las kun tu 'gro ba ni du /
translated: Among them, how many are omnipresent?

original: yul so sor nges pa ni du /
analyzed: yul so sor nges pa ni du /
translated: How many are restricted to specific domains?

original: dge ba ni du /üîΩnyon mongs pa ni du /
analyzed: dge ba ni du / nyon mongs pa ni du /
translated: How many are virtuous?üîΩHow many are afflictions?

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ni du /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ni du /
translated: How many are secondary afflictions?üîΩHow many are other?

original: gzhan pa ni du yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩde rnams las lnga ni kun tu 'gro ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan pa ni du yin pa bstan pa'i phyir / de rnams las lnga ni kun tu 'gro ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To indicate this, it says:üîΩFive of them are omnipresent, etc.

original: sems dang ldan pa'i chos lnga bcu rtsa gcig las reg pa nas sems pa'i bar du lnga ni kun tu 'gro ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems dang ldan pa'i chos lnga bcu rtsa gcig las reg pa nas sems pa'i bar du lnga ni kun tu 'gro ba zhes bya ste /
translated: From among the fifty-one mental factors, five from contact to intention are called omnipresent.

original: kun tu 'gro ba'i don ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi khams gsum gyi sems can gyi sems thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro bas na kun tu 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba'i don ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi khams gsum gyi sems can gyi sems thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro bas na kun tu 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The meaning of omnipresent is that it is called omnipresent because it pervades all minds of sentient beings of the three realms of desire, form and formlessness.

original: yang na mig gi rnam par shes pa nas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes ba'i bar du rnam par shes pa brgyad car gyi rjes su 'gro bas na kun tu 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na mig gi rnam par shes pa nas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes ba'i bar du rnam par shes pa brgyad car gyi rjes su 'gro bas na kun tu 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Or it is called omnipresent because it pervades the eight consciousnesses from eye consciousness to the all-base consciousness.

original: yang na dge ba'i sems dang mi dge ba'i sems dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang zag pa med pa'i sems thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug bas na kun tu 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na dge ba'i sems dang mi dge ba'i sems dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang zag pa med pa'i sems thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug bas na kun tu 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Or it is called omnipresent because it pervades all virtuous, nonvirtuous and neutral minds and uncontaminated minds.

original: lnga ni yul so sor nges pa'o zhes pa la /
analyzed: lnga ni yul so sor nges pa'o zhes pa la /
translated: The five are determined by their objects.

original: 'dun pa nas shes @47b rab kyi bar du lnga ni yul so sor nges ba zhes bya ste yul so sor nges zhes bya ba yang de dag gi yul so sor nges shing chad pa yin gyi yul thams cad de dag gi yul ma yin zhing yul thams
analyzed: 'dun pa nas shes @47b rab kyi bar du lnga ni yul so sor nges ba zhes bya ste yul so sor nges zhes bya ba yang de dag gi yul so sor nges shing chad pa yin gyi yul thams cad de dag gi yul ma yin zhing yul thams
translated: The five from aspiration to wisdom are called definite with regard to object visaya.

original: cad la de dag mi 'jug pas na yul so sor nges ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: cad la de dag mi 'jug pas na yul so sor nges ba zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called definite with regard to object because their objects are definite and limited. They are not the objects of all mental factors and they do not engage all objects.

original: kha cig na re yul gang du lnga po las gcig 'byung ba der lnga car gdon mi za bar 'byung bas na yul so sor nges pa'o zhes 'chad do //üîΩbcu gcig ni dge ba'o zhes pa la dad pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: kha cig na re yul gang du lnga po las gcig 'byung ba der lnga car gdon mi za bar 'byung bas na yul so sor nges pa'o zhes 'chad do // bcu gcig ni dge ba'o zhes pa la dad pa nas brtsams te /
translated: Some say: Since it is definite that all five occur in any given object, they are definite with regard to object.üîΩEleven are virtuous.

original: mi 'tshe ba'i bar dag tu bcu gcig la ni dge ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mi 'tshe ba'i bar dag tu bcu gcig la ni dge ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The eleven from faith to nonviolence are called virtuous.

original: dge ba'i don ni ma dad pa la sogs pa nag po'i phyogs kyi gnyen por gyur pa dang / 'dod mi chags pa dang / zhe mi sdang ba dang / gti mi mug pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dge ba zhes bya'o //üîΩdrug ni nyon mongs pa zhes pa la 'dod chags nas brtsams te /
analyzed: dge ba'i don ni ma dad pa la sogs pa nag po'i phyogs kyi gnyen por gyur pa dang / 'dod mi chags pa dang / zhe mi sdang ba dang / gti mi mug pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dge ba zhes bya'o // drug ni nyon mongs pa zhes pa la 'dod chags nas brtsams te /
translated: Virtue means that which is the antidote to the dark side of non-faith, etc., and that which is endowed with the roots of virtue of non-attachment, non-hatred, and non-delusion.üîΩSix are afflictions.

original: the tshom gyi bar du drug ni nyon mongs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: the tshom gyi bar du drug ni nyon mongs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The six beginning with attachment and ending with doubt are called afflictions.

original: de dag gis lus dang sems la sdug bsngal zhing nyon mongs par byed pa dang / sems dri ma can du byed pas na nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //üîΩlhag ma ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o zhes bya ba la khro ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de dag gis lus dang sems la sdug bsngal zhing nyon mongs par byed pa dang / sems dri ma can du byed pas na nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o // lhag ma ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o zhes bya ba la khro ba nas brtsams te /
translated: They are called afflictions because they afflict the body and mind with suffering and affliction, and because they make the mind defiled.üîΩThe rest are secondary afflictions.

original: shes bzhin med pa'i bar du lhag ma nyi shu ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shes bzhin med pa'i bar du lhag ma nyi shu ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The rest, beginning with anger and ending with lack of vigilance, are the twenty secondary afflictions.

original: ngan skyugs dang de las byung ba'i khu ba dang 'dra bar nyon mongs pa las skyes shing byung bas na nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ngan skyugs dang de las byung ba'i khu ba dang 'dra bar nyon mongs pa las skyes shing byung bas na nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called secondary defilements because they arise and appear from the defilements, like vomit and the liquid that comes from vomit.

original: ngan skyugs lta bur gyur pa ni nyon mongs pa drug go //
analyzed: ngan skyugs lta bur gyur pa ni nyon mongs pa drug go //
translated: The six defilements are like vomit.

original: de las byung ba'i khu ba lta bu ni lhag ma nyi shu'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i khu ba lta bu ni lhag ma nyi shu'o //
translated: The remaining twenty are like the liquid that comes from vomit.

original: yang na nyi shu po de dag nyon mongs pa drug gi yan lag tu gtogs pa dang / nyon mongs pa drug bzhin du lus dang sems la gnod pa byed cing sems dri ma can du byed pas na nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na nyi shu po de dag nyon mongs pa drug gi yan lag tu gtogs pa dang / nyon mongs pa drug bzhin du lus dang sems la gnod pa byed cing sems dri ma can du byed pas na nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, the twenty are called secondary defilements because they are included in the six defilements as limbs, and because they harm the body and mind like the six defilements and make the mind defiled.

original: bzhi ni gzhan du yang ngo zhes ba la 'gyod pa nas dpyod pa'i bar du bzhi ni gzhan du yang zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bzhi ni gzhan du yang ngo zhes ba la 'gyod pa nas dpyod pa'i bar du bzhi ni gzhan du yang zhes bya ste /
translated: Four are also elsewhere. Regret up to reflection are also elsewhere.

original: de bzhi la nye ba'i nyon mongs pa 'ba' zhig gi rang bzhin yin par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: de bzhi la nye ba'i nyon mongs pa 'ba' zhig gi rang bzhin yin par ma zad kyi /
translated: These four are not only by nature secondary defilements.

original: dge ba'i rang bzhin yang yod //
analyzed: dge ba'i rang bzhin yang yod //
translated: They also have a virtuous nature.

original: mi dge ba'i rang bzhin yang yod lung du ma bstan pa'i rang bzhin yang yod pas na gzhan du yang ngo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rang bzhin yang yod lung du ma bstan pa'i rang bzhin yang yod pas na gzhan du yang ngo zhes bya'o //
translated: Since they also have a virtuous nature and also have a nonvirtuous nature and also have an ethically neutral nature, they are said to be other.

original: da ni sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed de dag gi mtshan nyid bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed de dag gi mtshan nyid bshad par bya'o //
translated: Now, the characteristics of those formations not associated with mind will be explained.

original: @48a * // sum cu pa'i gtsug lag dang mngon pa'i chos bsdus pa'i gtsug lag las sems las byung ba lnga bcu rtsa gcig po rnams kyi rang bzhin dang las gnyi ga bshad pa ltar /
analyzed: @48a * // sum cu pa'i gtsug lag dang mngon pa'i chos bsdus pa'i gtsug lag las sems las byung ba lnga bcu rtsa gcig po rnams kyi rang bzhin dang las gnyi ga bshad pa ltar /
translated: The Thirty and the Compendium of Abhidharma explain both the nature and function of the fifty one mental factors.

original: phung po lnga'i gtsug lag 'di glengs pas shes pa 'dul ba'i don du byas te /
analyzed: phung po lnga'i gtsug lag 'di glengs pas shes pa 'dul ba'i don du byas te /
translated: Since this treatise on the five aggregates was composed for the purpose of training the mind through study,

original: mdo tsam du bstan pas na rang bzhin 'ba' zhig bshad nas las ma bstan mod kyi /
analyzed: mdo tsam du bstan pas na rang bzhin 'ba' zhig bshad nas las ma bstan mod kyi /
translated: only the nature of the aggregates is explained and their function is not taught.

original: slob ma rnams chos kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas par bya ba dang / sems las byung ba de dag rang bzhin brda phrad par sla bar bya ba'i phyir bdag gis ni rang bzhin dang las gnyi ga bstan no //
analyzed: slob ma rnams chos kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas par bya ba dang / sems las byung ba de dag rang bzhin brda phrad par sla bar bya ba'i phyir bdag gis ni rang bzhin dang las gnyi ga bstan no //
translated: However, I have explained both the nature and function of the aggregates in order to make disciples skilled in the characteristics of phenomena and to make the mental factors easy to understand.

original: lnga kun tu 'gro ba las tshor ba dang 'du shes gnyis gong du bshad zin pas na bshad mi dgos te /
analyzed: lnga kun tu 'gro ba las tshor ba dang 'du shes gnyis gong du bshad zin pas na bshad mi dgos te /
translated: Since feeling and discernment have already been explained above, it is unnecessary to explain them here.

original: da ni reg pa dang yid la byed pa dang sems pa gsum bshad do //
analyzed: da ni reg pa dang yid la byed pa dang sems pa gsum bshad do //
translated: Now, the three of contact, attention and intention will be explained.

original: de la reg pa'i rang bzhin bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la reg pa'i rang bzhin bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To explain the nature of contact,

original: reg pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: reg pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: it asks, ‚ÄúWhat is contact?‚Äù

original: reg pa'i rang bzhin nam mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: reg pa'i rang bzhin nam mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature or characteristic of contact?‚Äù

original: lan du gsum 'dus nas yongs su gcod pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lan du gsum 'dus nas yongs su gcod pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The answer is, ‚ÄúThe coming together of three is determination.‚Äù

original: gsum ni dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa gsum mo //
analyzed: gsum ni dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa gsum mo //
translated: Three refers to the three: faculty, object and consciousness.

original: de dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por lhan cig tu tshogs pa ni 'dus pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por lhan cig tu tshogs pa ni 'dus pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Their simultaneous assembly as cause and effect is called ‚Äúcoming together.‚Äù

original: yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa gsum ni rgyu yin no //
analyzed: yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa gsum ni rgyu yin no //
translated: The three‚Äîobject, faculty and consciousness‚Äîare the cause.

original: de'i rgyu las byung ba'i reg pa ni 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu las byung ba'i reg pa ni 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Contact, which arises from that cause, is the effect.

original: gsum 'dus pa'i rgyu las gang byung ba'i sems las byung ba de la reg pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa'i rgyu las gang byung ba'i sems las byung ba de la reg pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The mental factor that arises from the assembly of the three is called contact.

original: de la yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa gsum dus gcig tu 'dus pa las /
analyzed: de la yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa gsum dus gcig tu 'dus pa las /
translated: From the assembly of the three‚Äîobject, faculty, and consciousness‚Äî

original: de nyid kyi dus na tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa gsum skye bar byed pa dang rjes su mthun pa'am tshor ba gsum skye ba'i rgyu lta bur dbang po yongs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi dus na tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa gsum skye bar byed pa dang rjes su mthun pa'am tshor ba gsum skye ba'i rgyu lta bur dbang po yongs su 'gyur ro //
translated: at that very time, the faculty changes in accordance with the arising of the three feelings of pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain, or it is like the cause of the arising of the three feelings.

original: ci ltar dbang po tshor ba bde ba la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ba dang rjes su mthun par 'gyur ba'am ;
analyzed: ci ltar dbang po tshor ba bde ba la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ba dang rjes su mthun par 'gyur ba'am ;
translated: Just as the faculty changes in accordance with the arising of the feeling of pleasure, etc.,

original: tshor ba skye ba'i rgyu lta bur 'gyur ba de dang 'dra bar yul dang tshor ba bde ba la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ba dang rjes su mthun par yongs su gyur pa'am /
analyzed: tshor ba skye ba'i rgyu lta bur 'gyur ba de dang 'dra bar yul dang tshor ba bde ba la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ba dang rjes su mthun par yongs su gyur pa'am /
translated: or it becomes like the cause of the arising of feeling, in the same way, the object changes in accordance with the arising of the feeling of pleasure, etc.,üîΩor it becomes like the cause of the arising of feeling.

original: tshor ba skye ba'i rgyu lta bur yongs su 'gyur ba'i yul gyi rnam pa ji lta bu yin pas gcod par byed pa ni reg pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba skye ba'i rgyu lta bur yongs su 'gyur ba'i yul gyi rnam pa ji lta bu yin pas gcod par byed pa ni reg pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The form of the object that is the cause of the arising of feeling is the object that is grasped by contact.

original: @48b de'i las ni tshor ba'i rten byed pa ste /
analyzed: @48b de'i las ni tshor ba'i rten byed pa ste /
translated: Its action is to support feeling.

original: tshor ba skye ba'i rgyu byed pa'i don to //üîΩde bas na de mdo las kyang reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba 'byung zhes bshad pa dang mdo gzhan dag las tshor ba myong ba'i reg pa la brten nas /
analyzed: tshor ba skye ba'i rgyu byed pa'i don to // de bas na de mdo las kyang reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba 'byung zhes bshad pa dang mdo gzhan dag las tshor ba myong ba'i reg pa la brten nas /
translated: Its meaning is to be the cause of the arising of feeling.üîΩTherefore, in the sutras it is said, ‚ÄúFeeling arises with contact as its condition.‚Äù

original: bde ba'i tshor ba skye'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba skye'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: In other sutras it is said, ‚ÄúPleasant feeling arises in dependence on contact that is experienced as pleasant.‚Äù

original: yid la byad pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yid la byad pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To indicate the nature of attention,

original: yid la byed pa gang zhes dris te /
analyzed: yid la byed pa gang zhes dris te /
translated: it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is attention?‚Äù

original: yid la byed pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature and characteristic of attention?‚Äù

original: lan du sems kyi 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lan du sems kyi 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The answer is, ‚ÄúThe engagement of mind.‚Äù

original: 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni sems yul la 'gro bar byed pa'am der lta bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni sems yul la 'gro bar byed pa'am der lta bar byed pa ste /
translated: Engagement means the mind going to an object or looking at it.

original: bsgom par bya ba yul dmigs pa'i khyad par la sogs pa dmigs par bya ba'i yul gang yang rung ba la sems mngon du lta zhing der phyogs par byed pas na sems kyi 'jug pa zhes bya ste /üîΩde lta bur byed pa de la yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba yul dmigs pa'i khyad par la sogs pa dmigs par bya ba'i yul gang yang rung ba la sems mngon du lta zhing der phyogs par byed pas na sems kyi 'jug pa zhes bya ste / de lta bur byed pa de la yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The engagement of the mind is called mental attention because it directs the mind toward any object that is to be focused on, such as the object of meditation, the special object of observation, etc.

original: de'i las ni dmigs pa la sems 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i las ni dmigs pa la sems 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The action of mental attention is to hold the mind to the object.

original: dmigs pa la sems 'dzin ces bya ba'i don yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa la sems 'dzin ces bya ba'i don yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of holding the mind to the object?

original: keng rus la sogs pa dmigs pa'i yul la sems yang nas yang du 'jog par byed pa ni sems 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: keng rus la sogs pa dmigs pa'i yul la sems yang nas yang du 'jog par byed pa ni sems 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Repeatedly fixing the mind on the object of meditation, such as a skeleton, is called holding the mind.

original: de bas na dmigs pa'i yul la sems kyi skad cig ma'i rgyun du dmigs pa de ni de'i las su bshad kyi //üîΩsems kyi skad cig ma gcig de la dmigs nas /
analyzed: de bas na dmigs pa'i yul la sems kyi skad cig ma'i rgyun du dmigs pa de ni de'i las su bshad kyi // sems kyi skad cig ma gcig de la dmigs nas /
translated: Therefore, the continuous stream of moments of mind that focuses on the object of meditation is explained as its action.

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa'i tshe skad cig ma gzhan la dmigs pa de ni de'i las su mi gzhag go //
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa'i tshe skad cig ma gzhan la dmigs pa de ni de'i las su mi gzhag go //
translated: But if you focus on one moment of mind and then focus on another moment in the second moment, etc., that would not be its action.

original: sems pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the nature of intention,

original: sems pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: sems pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: he asks, ‚ÄúWhat is intention?‚Äù

original: sems pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: sems pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature and characteristic of intention?‚Äù

original: lan du yon tan dang nyes pa dang gnyi ga ma yin pa la sems mngon par 'du byed pa yid kyi las so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lan du yon tan dang nyes pa dang gnyi ga ma yin pa la sems mngon par 'du byed pa yid kyi las so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The answer is, ‚ÄúMental karma is the formation of the mind with regard to virtues, faults, and neither.‚Äù

original: de la dge ba'i chos rnams ni yon tan no //
analyzed: de la dge ba'i chos rnams ni yon tan no //
translated: Among those, virtuous dharmas are virtues.

original: mi dge ba'i chos rnams ni nyes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos rnams ni nyes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Nonvirtuous dharmas are faults.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams la ni gnyi ga ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams la ni gnyi ga ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Undefiled neutral dharmas are neither.

original: sems mngon par 'du byed pa zhes bya ba ni sems g-yo bar byed 'gul bar byed ces bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: sems mngon par 'du byed pa zhes bya ba ni sems g-yo bar byed 'gul bar byed ces bya ba'i don te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe formation of the mind‚Äù means the movement of the mind, the stirring of the mind.

original: sems 'di ci 'ang mi byed cing mi g-yo ba yin na sems pa zhes bya ba sems las byung bas bskyod nas /
analyzed: sems 'di ci 'ang mi byed cing mi g-yo ba yin na sems pa zhes bya ba sems las byung bas bskyod nas /
translated: If this mind does nothing and does not move, it is not stirred by the mental factor called intention.

original: sems dge ba @49a * //
analyzed: sems dge ba @49a * //
translated: The mind is virtuous,

original: la yang mngon par 'du byed cing dge ba byed pa la yang 'jug / sems mi dge ba la yang mngon par 'du byed cing mi dge ba byed pa la yang 'jug / sems lung du ma bstan pa la yang mngon par 'du byed cing lung du ma
analyzed: la yang mngon par 'du byed cing dge ba byed pa la yang 'jug / sems mi dge ba la yang mngon par 'du byed cing mi dge ba byed pa la yang 'jug / sems lung du ma bstan pa la yang mngon par 'du byed cing lung du ma
translated: They engage in the formation of virtuous minds and the performance of virtue. They engage in the formation of nonvirtuous minds and the performance of nonvirtue. They engage in the formation of neutral minds and the performance of neutral actions.

original: bstan pa la yang 'jug par byed pa ni sems pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bstan pa la yang 'jug par byed pa ni sems pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is also called volition because it is the mental factor that engages the mind in the formation of virtue and the performance of virtue, in the formation of nonvirtue and the performance of nonvirtue, and in the formation of the ethically neutral and the performance of the ethically neutral.

original: dper na khab mi g-yo zhing byed pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: dper na khab mi g-yo zhing byed pa med mod kyi /
translated: For example, an iron is not moving and does not act,

original: rdo khab long gi dbang gis khab g-yo zhing 'gul ba bzhin no //üîΩyang na dge ba'i chos rnams la ni sems yon tan can du sems shing lta ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams la ni nyes pa can du sems shing lta ba dang gnyi ga ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: rdo khab long gi dbang gis khab g-yo zhing 'gul ba bzhin no // yang na dge ba'i chos rnams la ni sems yon tan can du sems shing lta ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams la ni nyes pa can du sems shing lta ba dang gnyi ga ma yin pa ste /
translated: but due to the power of a magnet, the iron moves and acts.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams la ni yon tan can dang nyes pa can gnyi gar mi sems mi lta bar byed pa ni sems pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams la ni yon tan can dang nyes pa can gnyi gar mi sems mi lta bar byed pa ni sems pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, it is called volition because it is the mental factor that views virtuous phenomena as having good qualities, views nonvirtuous phenomena as having faults, and views ethically neutral phenomena as neither having good qualities nor having faults.

original: yang na phan 'dogs pa rnams la ni yon tan du lta zhing sems /
analyzed: yang na phan 'dogs pa rnams la ni yon tan du lta zhing sems /
translated: Or else, with regard to those who are helpful, one has the attitude of seeing them as having good qualities.

original: gnod pa byed pa la ni nyes par lta zhing sems /
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa la ni nyes par lta zhing sems /
translated: With regard to those who are harmful, one has the attitude of seeing them as having faults.üîΩWith regard to those who are neither helpful nor harmful, one has the attitude of neither seeing their good qualities nor their faults.

original: bar ma la ni gnyi gar yang mi sems mi lta bar byed pa ni sems pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bar ma la ni gnyi gar yang mi sems mi lta bar byed pa ni sems pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äúhaving the attitude of seeing.‚Äù

original: smras pa / yid kyi las zhes bya ba yang sems g-yo bar byed pa la bya bas yid kyi las zhes ma brjod kyang /
analyzed: smras pa / yid kyi las zhes bya ba yang sems g-yo bar byed pa la bya bas yid kyi las zhes ma brjod kyang /
translated: Objection: Even though the statement ‚ÄúThe mental action is the volition‚Äù does not mention the mental action as the movement of the mind,

original: sems mngon par 'du byed ces brjod pas yid kyi las yin no zhes zhar gyis thob na /
analyzed: sems mngon par 'du byed ces brjod pas yid kyi las yin no zhes zhar gyis thob na /
translated: it is the mental action because it is said to be the mental formation.

original: yid kyi las zhes brjod pa cir dgos /
analyzed: yid kyi las zhes brjod pa cir dgos /
translated: What is the point of saying ‚Äúmental action‚Äù?

original: lan du rnam par rtog pa dang / dpyod pa la sogs pa yang /
analyzed: lan du rnam par rtog pa dang / dpyod pa la sogs pa yang /
translated: In response, conceptualization, investigation, and so on

original: sems mngon par 'du byed pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: sems mngon par 'du byed pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: are also by nature mental formations.

original: sems g-yo bar byed pa yin du zin kyang yid kyi las ma yin te /
analyzed: sems g-yo bar byed pa yin du zin kyang yid kyi las ma yin te /
translated: Even though they are the movement of the mind, they are not mental actions.

original: rnam par shes pa mi g-yo ba'i chos las g-yo ba bzhin du byed pa ni sems pas byed kyi sems las byung pa gzhan gyis mi byed pas na yid kyi las zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mi g-yo ba'i chos las g-yo ba bzhin du byed pa ni sems pas byed kyi sems las byung pa gzhan gyis mi byed pas na yid kyi las zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called mental action because it is volition that makes consciousness move, as if it were a physical action, and it is volition that does this, not any other mental factor.

original: des ni sems las byung ba gzhan bkar ba yin no //üîΩde la yid kyi las zhes bya bas sems pa'i rang bzhin bstan to //
analyzed: des ni sems las byung ba gzhan bkar ba yin no // de la yid kyi las zhes bya bas sems pa'i rang bzhin bstan to //
translated: By this, it is shown that volition is a mental factor.üîΩIt is called mental action because it is volition that makes the mind move, as if it were a physical action, and it is volition that does this, not any other mental factor.

original: yon tan dang nyes pa gnyi ga ma yin pa la sems mngon par 'du byed pa ni de'i las yin par bstan to //
analyzed: yon tan dang nyes pa gnyi ga ma yin pa la sems mngon par 'du byed pa ni de'i las yin par bstan to //
translated: By this, it is shown that volition is a mental factor.

original: lnga kun tu 'gro ba bshad zin to //
analyzed: lnga kun tu 'gro ba bshad zin to //
translated: The five omnipresent mental factors have now been explained.

original: lnga yul so sor nges par bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: lnga yul so sor nges par bstan par bya ste /
translated: The five object-determining mental factors will now be explained.

original: de la yang 'dod pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la yang 'dod pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the nature of desire,

original: 'dod pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: 'dod pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is desire?‚Äù

original: 'dod pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature and characteristic of desire?‚Äù

original: de'i lan du 'dod pa'i dngos po la 'dod pa'o @49b zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i lan du 'dod pa'i dngos po la 'dod pa'o @49b zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response, it is said, ‚ÄúDesire is the desire for desirable things.‚Äù

original: 'dod pa yang 'dod pa'i dngos po nyid la 'dod pa skye'o /
analyzed: 'dod pa yang 'dod pa'i dngos po nyid la 'dod pa skye'o /
translated: Desire arises in regard to the very thing that is desired.

original: 'dod pa ma yin pa'i dngos po la 'dod pa mi skye bas yul nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ma yin pa'i dngos po la 'dod pa mi skye bas yul nges pa'o //
translated: Desire does not arise in regard to the thing that is not desired. Thus, the object is ascertained.

original: de la 'dod pa'i dngos po ni blta bar 'dod pa'i dngos po gzugs dang mnyan par 'dod pa'i dngos po sgra la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i dngos po ni blta bar 'dod pa'i dngos po gzugs dang mnyan par 'dod pa'i dngos po sgra la sogs pa'o //
translated: The thing that is desired is the thing that is desired to be seen, such as form, the thing that is desired to be heard, such as sound, and so on.

original: 'dod pa ni blta bar bya ba'i yul dang mnyan par bya ba'i yul de la ji ltar blta ji ltar mnyan snyam ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa ni blta bar bya ba'i yul dang mnyan par bya ba'i yul de la ji ltar blta ji ltar mnyan snyam ste /
translated: Desire is the desire to see and hear in regard to the object that is desired to be seen and heard.

original: blta bar bya ba dang mnyan par bya ba'i yul la mthong zhing thos kyang ji ma rung snyam du smon pa ni 'dod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: blta bar bya ba dang mnyan par bya ba'i yul la mthong zhing thos kyang ji ma rung snyam du smon pa ni 'dod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The desire to see and hear in regard to the object that is desired to be seen and heard is called desire.

original: smras pa / 'dod pa ni 'dod pa'i dngos po la 'dod pa yin na de lta na ni srid pa yang 'dod pa'i dngos po la 'dod pa yin pas srid pa dang de gnyis la khyad par ci yod /
analyzed: smras pa / 'dod pa ni 'dod pa'i dngos po la 'dod pa yin na de lta na ni srid pa yang 'dod pa'i dngos po la 'dod pa yin pas srid pa dang de gnyis la khyad par ci yod /
translated: Objection: If desire is the desire in regard to the thing that is desired, then craving is also the desire in regard to the thing that is desired. Thus, what is the difference between these two?

original: smras pa / sred pa ni 'dod pa'i dngos po la chags shing zhen pa'i bdag nyid yin la /
analyzed: smras pa / sred pa ni 'dod pa'i dngos po la chags shing zhen pa'i bdag nyid yin la /
translated: He said: Craving has the nature of attachment and clinging to desired things.

original: 'dod pa ni dngos po la gcig tu zhen pa med kyi //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni dngos po la gcig tu zhen pa med kyi //
translated: But desire is not attachment to a thing in a single way,

original: smon pa tsam du zad pas na khyad par yod do //
analyzed: smon pa tsam du zad pas na khyad par yod do //
translated: but is merely aspiration. Thus, there is a difference.

original: de'i las ni brtson 'grus kyi rten byed pa ste /
analyzed: de'i las ni brtson 'grus kyi rten byed pa ste /
translated: Its action is to support striving,

original: 'dod pa yod na brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa yod na brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when there is desire, one undertakes striving.

original: mos pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mos pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To teach the nature of aspiration,

original: mos pa gang zhen zhes dris te /
analyzed: mos pa gang zhen zhes dris te /
translated: he said, ‚ÄúWhat is aspiration?‚Äù

original: mos pa'i rang bzhin dang / mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: mos pa'i rang bzhin dang / mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature and characteristic of aspiration?‚Äù

original: lan du nges pa'i dngos po nyid la de bzhin du 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lan du nges pa'i dngos po nyid la de bzhin du 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response, he said, ‚ÄúIt is the holding of a thing as certain in just that way.‚Äù

original: mos pa'i yul ni nges pa'i dngos po kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: mos pa'i yul ni nges pa'i dngos po kho na yin gyi /
translated: The object of aspiration is only a certain thing,

original: ma nges pa'i dngos po la mos pa mi 'jug pas na yul nges par bstan to //
analyzed: ma nges pa'i dngos po la mos pa mi 'jug pas na yul nges par bstan to //
translated: because aspiration does not engage an uncertain thing. Thus, the object is taught as certain.

original: mi slu ba'i lung dang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i rigs pas dngos po rnams la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang bdag med pa'i rang bzhin du gtan la dbab par byas shing the tshom med par byas pa ni nges pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: mi slu ba'i lung dang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i rigs pas dngos po rnams la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang bdag med pa'i rang bzhin du gtan la dbab par byas shing the tshom med par byas pa ni nges pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: The ascertainment of things as impermanent, painful and without self by means of the reasoning of unerring scripture, direct perception and inference, and the absence of doubt, is the ascertained thing.

original: de bzhin du 'dzin ces bya ba ni mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs par gtan la phab cing yid ches par byas pa de la dngos po rnams ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa kho nar bden pa'i rtag pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes 'dzin pa ni nges pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dzin ces bya ba ni mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs par gtan la phab cing yid ches par byas pa de la dngos po rnams ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa kho nar bden pa'i rtag pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes 'dzin pa ni nges pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the ascertainment of things as impermanent, painful and so on, and the conviction that things are only impermanent, painful and so on, and not permanent, blissful and so on, is called ascertainment.

original: yang na phung po lnga la gzugs ni dbu ba'i gong bu lta bu tshor ba ni chu'i chu bur dang 'dra ba /
analyzed: yang na phung po lnga la gzugs ni dbu ba'i gong bu lta bu tshor ba ni chu'i chu bur dang 'dra ba /
translated: Or, the five aggregates are like a mass of foam, feelings are like water bubbles,

original: 'du shes ni smig rgyu lta bu /
analyzed: 'du shes ni smig rgyu lta bu /
translated: perceptions are like mirages,

original: 'du byed ni chu shing gi snying po dang 'dra ba /
analyzed: 'du byed ni chu shing gi snying po dang 'dra ba /
translated: formations are like plantain trees,üîΩand consciousness is like a magical creation.
