original: @50a * // rnam par shes pa ni sgyu ma lta bu yin par yid ches par byas nas de la de bzhin du bden no zhes 'dzin pa ni nges pa'i dngos po la de bzhin du 'dzin ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: @50a * // rnam par shes pa ni sgyu ma lta bu yin par yid ches par byas nas de la de bzhin du bden no zhes 'dzin pa ni nges pa'i dngos po la de bzhin du 'dzin ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Having gained confidence that consciousness is like an illusion, to apprehend it as real in that way is called ‚Äúapprehending the ascertained object as it is.‚Äù

original: de la mos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la mos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called ‚Äúresolution.‚Äù

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
translated: Therefore, the Lord Buddha has said:

original: gzugs ni dbu ba lta bu ste //üîΩtshor pa chu yi chu bur 'dra //
analyzed: gzugs ni dbu ba lta bu ste // tshor pa chu yi chu bur 'dra //
translated: Form is like foam on water;üîΩFeeling is like a water bubble;

original: smig rgyu lta bu 'du shes te //
analyzed: smig rgyu lta bu 'du shes te //
translated: Perception is like a mirage;

original: 'du byed chu shing 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: 'du byed chu shing 'dra ba'o //
translated: Disposition is like a plantain tree;

original: rnam shes sgyu ma 'dra bar ni //üîΩnyi ma'i gnyen gyis rab tu gsungs //
analyzed: rnam shes sgyu ma 'dra bar ni // nyi ma'i gnyen gyis rab tu gsungs //
translated: Consciousness is like an illusion.

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus has the Kinsman of the Sun taught.

original: de'i las ni mi 'phrogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de'i las ni mi 'phrogs par byed pa ste /
translated: Its action is to make one unassailable.

original: dngos po rnams la mi rtag pa la sogs par yid ches par gyur na /
analyzed: dngos po rnams la mi rtag pa la sogs par yid ches par gyur na /
translated: When one has gained confidence that things are impermanent, etc.,

original: rang gi lta ba las mu stegs can la sogs pa rgol ba gzhan gyis lta ba gzhan du bsgyur bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi lta ba las mu stegs can la sogs pa rgol ba gzhan gyis lta ba gzhan du bsgyur bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: one‚Äôs own view cannot be changed by others, such as tƒ´rthikas, who argue with one about one‚Äôs view.

original: dran pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dran pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show its nature of memory,

original: dran pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: dran pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: What is mindfulness?

original: dran pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: dran pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: What is the nature and characteristic of mindfulness?

original: de'i lan du ;
analyzed: de'i lan du ;
translated: The answer is:

original: 'dris pa'i dngos po ma brjed pa ste /
analyzed: 'dris pa'i dngos po ma brjed pa ste /
translated: It is the non-forgetting of a familiar object.

original: sems la gsal ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sems la gsal ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is the clarity of mind.

original: dran pa yang 'dris pa'i dngos po la sems ma brjed par 'byung gi ma 'dris pa'i dngos po la /
analyzed: dran pa yang 'dris pa'i dngos po la sems ma brjed par 'byung gi ma 'dris pa'i dngos po la /
translated: Mindfulness occurs as the non-forgetting of a familiar object, but not as the non-forgetting of an unfamiliar object.

original: sems ma brjed pa mi 'byung bas yul nges par bstan to //
analyzed: sems ma brjed pa mi 'byung bas yul nges par bstan to //
translated: Thus, the object is specified.

original: sngon mthong ba dang thos pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas myong bar byas pa'i dngos po ni 'dris gcig pa po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sngon mthong ba dang thos pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas myong bar byas pa'i dngos po ni 'dris gcig pa po zhes bya'o //
translated: An object that has been experienced through seeing, hearing, etc. is called ‚Äúfamiliar‚Äù.

original: ma brjed pa ni sngon myong ba'i dngos po sems la bzung ba de med par ma gyur cing brjed pa dang chung za bar ma gyur pa ni ma brjed ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma brjed pa ni sngon myong ba'i dngos po sems la bzung ba de med par ma gyur cing brjed pa dang chung za bar ma gyur pa ni ma brjed ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Non-forgetting is the non-loss and non-forgetting of the object that has been experienced.

original: ma brjed pa'i don nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ma brjed pa'i don nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify the meaning of non-forgetting,

original: sems la gsal ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sems la gsal ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said: ‚ÄúIt is the clarity of mind‚Äù.

original: sngon myong ba'i dngos po de la yang dang yang du goms par byas pas smra la rag pa bzhin du gsal bar dran pa'i phyir gsal ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sngon myong ba'i dngos po de la yang dang yang du goms par byas pas smra la rag pa bzhin du gsal bar dran pa'i phyir gsal ba zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called clarity because it is clear, like a reflection, due to repeated habituation to the object of prior experience.

original: ma brjed pa dang gsal ba gnyis don tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma brjed pa dang gsal ba gnyis don tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Nonforgetfulness and clarity are not different in meaning.

original: de'i las ni g-yeng ba med pa ste ;
analyzed: de'i las ni g-yeng ba med pa ste ;
translated: Its function is nondistraction.

original: 'dris pa'i dngos po sems la gsal bar gyur na /
analyzed: 'dris pa'i dngos po sems la gsal bar gyur na /
translated: When the mind is clear with respect to a familiar object,

original: gzugs la dmigs pa las dmigs pa gzhan sgra la dmigs par mi 'gyur ba dang / dkar po'i rnam pa la dmigs pa las sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan la sems g-yeng bar mi 'gyur bas na @50b g-yeng ba med pa'i las can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la dmigs pa las dmigs pa gzhan sgra la dmigs par mi 'gyur ba dang / dkar po'i rnam pa la dmigs pa las sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan la sems g-yeng bar mi 'gyur bas na @50b g-yeng ba med pa'i las can zhes bya'o //
translated: it does not become distracted to another object, such as a sound, from its object, such as a form, and the mind does not become distracted to another aspect, such as blue, from its object, such as a white aspect. Therefore it is said to have the function of nondistraction.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain the nature of concentration,

original: ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: it asks, ‚ÄúWhat is concentration?‚Äù

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin dang / mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin dang / mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature and characteristics of concentration?‚Äù

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: The answer is,

original: brtags pa'i dngos po la sems rtse gcig pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: brtags pa'i dngos po la sems rtse gcig pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is one pointedness of mind on an examined object.

original: 'dir ting nge 'dzin kyang brtags pa'i dngos po nyid sems rtse gcig tu 'gyur gyi ma brtags pa'i dngos po la sems rtse gcig tu mi 'gyur bas na yul nges par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir ting nge 'dzin kyang brtags pa'i dngos po nyid sems rtse gcig tu 'gyur gyi ma brtags pa'i dngos po la sems rtse gcig tu mi 'gyur bas na yul nges par bstan to //
translated: Here, concentration is taught as having a definite object, since it is one pointedness of mind on an examined object, not on an unexamined object.

original: brtags pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni yon tan gyi dngos po dang nyes pa'i dngos po gnyis la bya'o ;
analyzed: brtags pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni yon tan gyi dngos po dang nyes pa'i dngos po gnyis la bya'o ;
translated: An examined object is either an object with good qualities or an object with faults.

original: / de 'ang bden pa bzhi las 'gog pa dang lam gyi dngos po la ni yon tan gyi dngos por brtags /
analyzed: / de 'ang bden pa bzhi las 'gog pa dang lam gyi dngos po la ni yon tan gyi dngos por brtags /
translated: Moreover, an object with good qualities is examined in the objects of cessation and path among the four noble truths.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi dngos po la ni nyes pa'i dngos por brtags so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi dngos po la ni nyes pa'i dngos por brtags so //
translated: An object with faults is examined in the objects of suffering and origin.

original: de la 'gog pa dang lam la yon tan gyi dngos por rtag pa yang 'gog pa'i bden pa la ni zhi ba dang 'gog pa dang gya nom pa dang nges par 'byung ba'i tshul lta bur yon tan du brtag pa lam gyi bden pa la yang lam dang
analyzed: de la 'gog pa dang lam la yon tan gyi dngos por rtag pa yang 'gog pa'i bden pa la ni zhi ba dang 'gog pa dang gya nom pa dang nges par 'byung ba'i tshul lta bur yon tan du brtag pa lam gyi bden pa la yang lam dang
translated: In regard to that, the truth of cessation is to be investigated as a good quality in the manner of peace, cessation, excellence, and definite emergence. The truth of the path is to be investigated as a good quality in the manner of a path,üîΩreason,

original: rigs pa dang // bsgrub par bya ba dang nges par 'byung bar byed pa'i tshul lta bur yon tan du brtag go //
analyzed: rigs pa dang // bsgrub par bya ba dang nges par 'byung bar byed pa'i tshul lta bur yon tan du brtag go //
translated: accomplishment, and definite emergence.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa la nyes par brtag pa yang sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i tshul du nyes pas brtag go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa la nyes par brtag pa yang sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i tshul du nyes pas brtag go //
translated: The truth of suffering and the truth of origination are to be investigated as faults. The truth of suffering is to be investigated as a fault in the manner of impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness.

original: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la yang rgyu dang kun 'byung ba dang rkyen dang rab tu 'byung ba'i tshul lta bur nyes par brtags pas na bden pa bzhi la brtag pa'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la yang rgyu dang kun 'byung ba dang rkyen dang rab tu 'byung ba'i tshul lta bur nyes par brtags pas na bden pa bzhi la brtag pa'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
translated: The truth of origination is to be investigated as a fault in the manner of cause, origination, condition, and arising. Therefore, the four truths are called the entities to be investigated.

original: rtse gcig ces bya ba ni dmigs pa gcig par byas pa ste /
analyzed: rtse gcig ces bya ba ni dmigs pa gcig par byas pa ste /
translated: One-pointedness means being focused on one object.

original: bden pa bzhi 'ba' zhig la dmigs kyi gzhan du sems ma g-yengs pa la sems rtse gcig ces bya'o //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi 'ba' zhig la dmigs kyi gzhan du sems ma g-yengs pa la sems rtse gcig ces bya'o //
translated: It is called one-pointedness of mind when the mind is not distracted to anything else, but is focused on the four noble truths alone.

original: de'i las ni shes rab kyi rten byed pa ste sems mnyam par bzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i shes rab skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i las ni shes rab kyi rten byed pa ste sems mnyam par bzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i shes rab skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Its function is to support wisdom, because when the mind is in equipoise, the wisdom that knows reality as it is arises.

original: shes rab kyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir shes rab gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir shes rab gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: To explain the nature of wisdom, it is asked, What is wisdom?

original: shes rab kyi rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, What is the nature and characteristic of wisdom?

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: In response, it is said:

original: de dag nyid rang bzhin du 'byed pa ste zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩde dag @51a * //
analyzed: de dag nyid rang bzhin du 'byed pa ste zhes bya ba smos te / de dag @51a * //
translated: They themselves are distinguished by nature.

original: nyid ces bya ba ni brtag bar bya ba'i dngos po bden pa bzhi nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: nyid ces bya ba ni brtag bar bya ba'i dngos po bden pa bzhi nyid la bya'o //
translated: They themselves refers to the four noble truths, which are the things to be investigated.

original: rab tu 'byed ces bya ba ni ma nor bar 'byed cing shes pa'am phyin ci ma log par 'byed cing shes pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu 'byed ces bya ba ni ma nor bar 'byed cing shes pa'am phyin ci ma log par 'byed cing shes pa ste /
translated: Thorough differentiation refers to unmistaken differentiation and knowledge or to nonerroneous differentiation and knowledge.üîΩWith regard to those four truths, the specific and general characteristics are unmixed, but they are similar in being mixed.

original: bden pa bzhi po de dag gi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ma 'dres kyang 'dres pa 'dra bar gnas pa la 'di ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'di ni spyi'i mtshan nyid do zhes phyin ci ma log par shes par 'gyur ba'am /üîΩyang dag pa'i chos la yang yang dag ba nyid do zhes shes /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi po de dag gi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ma 'dres kyang 'dres pa 'dra bar gnas pa la 'di ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'di ni spyi'i mtshan nyid do zhes phyin ci ma log par shes par 'gyur ba'am / yang dag pa'i chos la yang yang dag ba nyid do zhes shes /
translated: One should know that this is the specific characteristic and that is the general characteristic.üîΩOr else, one should know that the correct Dharma is just correct and the incorrect Dharma is just incorrect.

original: log pa'i chos la yang log pa nyid do zhes shes pa ni shes rab ces bya'o //
analyzed: log pa'i chos la yang log pa nyid do zhes shes pa ni shes rab ces bya'o //
translated: That is called wisdom.

original: ji ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi yul brtag pa'i dngos po nyid yin gyi gzhan la ma yin par yul nges pa de bzhin du shes rab kyang brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rab tu 'byed kyi gzhan mi 'byed pas na yul nges par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi yul brtag pa'i dngos po nyid yin gyi gzhan la ma yin par yul nges pa de bzhin du shes rab kyang brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rab tu 'byed kyi gzhan mi 'byed pas na yul nges par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Just as the object of concentration is ascertained as the entity of the object of investigation and not anything else, so wisdom is taught to have an ascertained object, since it thoroughly differentiates the entity of the object of investigation and does not differentiate anything else.

original: shes rab la phye na rnam pa du yod bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes rab la phye na rnam pa du yod bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the types of wisdom, he says:

original: rigs pa dang mi rigs pas bskyed ba dang gzhan yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rigs pa dang mi rigs pas bskyed ba dang gzhan yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is produced by reason and unreason, and also that which is not produced by reason and unreason.‚Äù

original: shes rab la phye na rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: shes rab la phye na rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Wisdom is of three types:

original: rigs pas bskyed pa'i shes rab dang mi rigs pas bskyed pa'i shes rab dang / gzhan yang ste rigs pas bskyed pa yang ma yin mi rigs pas bskyed pa yang ma yin ba'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: rigs pas bskyed pa'i shes rab dang mi rigs pas bskyed pa'i shes rab dang / gzhan yang ste rigs pas bskyed pa yang ma yin mi rigs pas bskyed pa yang ma yin ba'i shes rab bo //
translated: that which is produced by reason, that which is produced by unreason, and that which is not produced by reason or unreason.

original: de la mi slu ba'i lung dang / rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma dang / mngon sum gyi tshad ma gsum la rigs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la mi slu ba'i lung dang / rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma dang / mngon sum gyi tshad ma gsum la rigs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Reason is the three valid cognitions: non-deceptive scripture, inferential valid cognition, and direct perception.

original: rigs pa de gsum mnyan bsams bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni rigs pas bskyed ba'i shes rab ces bya'o //
analyzed: rigs pa de gsum mnyan bsams bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni rigs pas bskyed ba'i shes rab ces bya'o //
translated: Wisdom that arises from listening, reflection, and meditation on those three reasons is called ‚Äúwisdom produced by reason.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa kun spangs pa dang sdug bsngal thams cad spangs pa dang des bshad pa'i tshig la goms par byas na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa kun spangs pa dang sdug bsngal thams cad spangs pa dang des bshad pa'i tshig la goms par byas na /
translated: If one abandons all afflictions, abandons all suffering, and becomes familiar with the words explained by that [wisdom],

original: nyon mongs pa rnams spong bar byed par 'gyur ba'i skyes bu'i tshig ni mi slu ba'i lung zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams spong bar byed par 'gyur ba'i skyes bu'i tshig ni mi slu ba'i lung zhes bya'o //
translated: The words of a person that cause the abandonment of the afflictions are called ‚Äúauthoritative testimony that is non-deceptive.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa na yod pa dang phyogs dang mthun pa na yod pa dang / phyogs dang mi mthun pa na med pa ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tshad ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa na yod pa dang phyogs dang mthun pa na yod pa dang / phyogs dang mi mthun pa na med pa ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tshad ma zhes bya'o //
translated: The existence of the reason in the similar class, and the non-existence of the reason in the dissimilar class, are called ‚Äúthe valid knowledge that is inference.‚Äù

original: de la rjes su dpag pa na yod pa ni gang na du ba 'thu la bar snang pa de na me yod par dpag pa'o //
analyzed: de la rjes su dpag pa na yod pa ni gang na du ba 'thu la bar snang pa de na me yod par dpag pa'o //
translated: Regarding that, the existence of the reason in the similar class is the inference that ‚Äúwhere there is smoke, there is fire.‚Äù

original: phyogs dang mthun pa de na yod pa ni gang na du ba 'thul ba de na me yod par ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: phyogs dang mthun pa de na yod pa ni gang na du ba 'thul ba de na me yod par ci mngon zhe na /
translated: The existence of the reason in the similar class is the question, ‚ÄúHow do you know that where there is smoke, there is fire?‚Äù

original: dper na tshang mang chen po na du ba @51b 'thul bar mthong bas de na me yod par snang ba'o //
analyzed: dper na tshang mang chen po na du ba @51b 'thul bar mthong bas de na me yod par snang ba'o //
translated: For example, because one sees smoke in a kitchen, one infers that there is fire there.

original: phyogs dang mi mthun pa na med pa ni me dang chur mi mthun pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs dang mi mthun pa na med pa ni me dang chur mi mthun pa ste /
translated: The non-existence of the reason in the dissimilar class is the incompatibility of fire and water.

original: de bas na gang na me yod pa de na du ba yod kyi gang na chu yod pa de na du pa mi 'thul lo //
analyzed: de bas na gang na me yod pa de na du ba yod kyi gang na chu yod pa de na du pa mi 'thul lo //
translated: Therefore, where there is fire, there is smoke, but where there is water, there is no smoke.

original: mngon sum ni mig gi dbang pos bum pa mngon sum du mthong ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: mngon sum ni mig gi dbang pos bum pa mngon sum du mthong ba lta bu ste /
translated: Direct perception is like the eye faculty directly seeing a pot.

original: de 'ang rnal 'byor pa'i sems dang dbang po'i rnam par shes pa rnams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyi dngos po so sor rang gis rig pa dang bzhi'o //
analyzed: de 'ang rnal 'byor pa'i sems dang dbang po'i rnam par shes pa rnams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyi dngos po so sor rang gis rig pa dang bzhi'o //
translated: It is also the four: the yogi's mind, the sense consciousnesses, the mental consciousness, and the individual awareness of the entities of the mind and mental factors.

original: mi rigs pa zhes bya ba ni mi slu ba ma yin pa'i lung dang rjes su dpag par snang ba dang / log par bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin la mi rigs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mi rigs pa zhes bya ba ni mi slu ba ma yin pa'i lung dang rjes su dpag par snang ba dang / log par bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin la mi rigs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: What is called unreasonable is the appearance of unreasonable scripture and inference, and the unreasonable called wrong explanation in samƒÅdhi.

original: de gsum mnyan pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni mi rigs pa bskyed pa'i shes rab ces bya'o //
analyzed: de gsum mnyan pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni mi rigs pa bskyed pa'i shes rab ces bya'o //
translated: The wisdom that arises from listening, reflection, and meditation on those three is called the wisdom that generates the unreasonable.

original: de la brdzun gyi rgyu nyon mongs pa thams cad ma spangs pa dang sdug bsngal thams cad ma spangs pa dang / de'i tshig bsgoms na yang nyon mongs pa spong bar mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de la brdzun gyi rgyu nyon mongs pa thams cad ma spangs pa dang sdug bsngal thams cad ma spangs pa dang / de'i tshig bsgoms na yang nyon mongs pa spong bar mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The cause of lying is not having abandoned all the afflictions and not having abandoned all suffering, and even if one meditates on its words, the afflictions will not be abandoned.

original: mu stegs pa grangs can dang bye brag pa la sogs pa'i tshig ni mi slu ba ma yin pa'i lung zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mu stegs pa grangs can dang bye brag pa la sogs pa'i tshig ni mi slu ba ma yin pa'i lung zhes bya'o //
translated: The words of the tƒ´rthikas, such as the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas and Vai≈õe·π£ikas, are called ‚Äúuntrue scriptures.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag par snang ba ni rjes su dpag pa dngos po ma yin gyi rtags kyis rjes su dpag pa dang tshul 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par snang ba ni rjes su dpag pa dngos po ma yin gyi rtags kyis rjes su dpag pa dang tshul 'dra ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúApparent inference‚Äù is not an actual inference but is similar to an inference based on a reason.

original: dper na aa mra'i shing gi yal ga 'di la 'bras bu gcig smin pas na thams cad smin to zhes dpog pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na aa mra'i shing gi yal ga 'di la 'bras bu gcig smin pas na thams cad smin to zhes dpog pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like inferring that ‚Äúsince one fruit on this branch of a mango tree is ripe, all the fruits are ripe.‚Äù

original: log par bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni bdag med pa la bdag tu bshad pa'i chos la sems rtse gcig tu 'jog pa'o ;
analyzed: log par bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni bdag med pa la bdag tu bshad pa'i chos la sems rtse gcig tu 'jog pa'o ;
translated: ‚ÄúDistorted meditative concentration‚Äù is one-pointedly focusing the mind on a teaching that explains the self where there is no self.

original: / rigs pas bskyed pa yang ma yin mi rigs pas bskyed pa yang ma yin pa'i shes rab ni gang skyes ma thag tu thob pa'i shes rab dang / tshem drub la sogs pa 'jig rten na bzo sna tshogs shes pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: / rigs pas bskyed pa yang ma yin mi rigs pas bskyed pa yang ma yin pa'i shes rab ni gang skyes ma thag tu thob pa'i shes rab dang / tshem drub la sogs pa 'jig rten na bzo sna tshogs shes pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: The wisdom that is not produced by reasoning nor by what is unreasonable is the wisdom that is obtained immediately upon birth and the wisdom that knows the various worldly crafts such as sewing, etc.

original: de'i las ni the tshom sel bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: de'i las ni the tshom sel bar byed pa ste /
translated: Its action is to remove doubt.

original: shes rab kyis chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rab tu phye nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyis chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rab tu phye nas /
translated: Having distinguished the general and particular characteristics of things by means of wisdom,

original: phyin ci ma log par shes par byas nas de yin nam ma yin snyam pa'i the tshom med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par shes par byas nas de yin nam ma yin snyam pa'i the tshom med par 'gyur ro //
translated: one becomes free from doubt as to whether or not they are so.

original: lnga yul so sor nges pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: lnga yul so sor nges pa bshad zin to //
translated: The five with specific objects have been explained.

original: bcu gcig dge ba bshad par bya ste /üîΩde la dad pa'i rang bzhin bstan @52a * //üîΩpa'i phyir / dad pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: bcu gcig dge ba bshad par bya ste / de la dad pa'i rang bzhin bstan @52a * // pa'i phyir / dad pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: The eleven virtues will now be explained.üîΩIn order to show the nature of faith, it is asked: ‚ÄúWhat is faith?‚Äù

original: dad ba'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: dad ba'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is: What is the nature and characteristic of faith?

original: lan du / las dang 'bras bu dang / bde ba dang / dkon mchog la mngon par yid ches shing zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lan du / las dang 'bras bu dang / bde ba dang / dkon mchog la mngon par yid ches shing zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúOne has full confidence in action and result, in happiness, and in the Jewels.‚Äù

original: de la las ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la las ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Action is of three kinds:

original: bsod nams kyi las dang bsod nams ma yin pa'i las dang mi g-yo ba'i las so //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi las dang bsod nams ma yin pa'i las dang mi g-yo ba'i las so //
translated: meritorious action, nonmeritorious action, and nontransferring action.

original: bsod nams kyi las ni gang 'dod ba'i khams nyid du gtogs pa'i dge ba'i las la bya ste /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi las ni gang 'dod ba'i khams nyid du gtogs pa'i dge ba'i las la bya ste /
translated: Meritorious action is to be understood as the virtuous action included in the desire realm.

original: de yang srog gcod pa las phyir ldog pa la sogs pa dge ba bcu la bya'o //
analyzed: de yang srog gcod pa las phyir ldog pa la sogs pa dge ba bcu la bya'o //
translated: It is the ten virtues, such as turning away from killing.

original: bsod nams ma yin pa'i las kyang 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa'i mi dge ba'i las la bya ste /
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa'i las kyang 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa'i mi dge ba'i las la bya ste /
translated: Nonmeritorious action is to be understood as the nonvirtuous action included in the desire realm.

original: de yang srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i mi dge ba bcu'i las la bya'o //
analyzed: de yang srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i mi dge ba bcu'i las la bya'o //
translated: It is the ten nonvirtues, such as killing.

original: mi g-yo ba'i las ni gzugs su gtogs pa'i bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med par gtogs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi'i dge ba'i las kyi rang bzhin la bya ste /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i las ni gzugs su gtogs pa'i bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med par gtogs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi'i dge ba'i las kyi rang bzhin la bya ste /
translated: Nontransferring action is to be understood as the virtuous action included in the four meditative concentrations of the form realm and the four formless meditative attainments.

original: de dag la rtag tu ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa las rnam par rtog pa'i rlung gis g-yo bar mi nus shing bskyod par mi nus pas mi g-yo ba'i las zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la rtag tu ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa las rnam par rtog pa'i rlung gis g-yo bar mi nus shing bskyod par mi nus pas mi g-yo ba'i las zhes bya'o //
translated: Since they are always in meditative equipoise and the wind of conceptuality cannot move or disturb them, it is called the karma of non-movement.

original: yang na 'dod pa'i khams kyi las dge ba dang mi dge ba ni sngar las gcig tu byas te 'bras bu 'phangs pa las phyis las gzhan byas na snga ma'i las kyi 'bras bu bskyod nas las phyis byas pa'i 'bras bu smin par 'gyur bas rnam par smin
analyzed: yang na 'dod pa'i khams kyi las dge ba dang mi dge ba ni sngar las gcig tu byas te 'bras bu 'phangs pa las phyis las gzhan byas na snga ma'i las kyi 'bras bu bskyod nas las phyis byas pa'i 'bras bu smin par 'gyur bas rnam par smin
translated: Or, in the desire realm, virtuous and non-virtuous karma are created as a single karma and the result is projected. Later, if another karma is created, the result of the previous karma is moved and the result of the later karma ripens.

original: par 'gyur ba la g-yo ba yod pa ltar /
analyzed: par 'gyur ba la g-yo ba yod pa ltar /
translated: Thus, there is movement in the ripening of karma.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med par gtogs pa'i las sngar byas te /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med par gtogs pa'i las sngar byas te /
translated: However, in the form and formless realms, karma is created earlier

original: 'bras bu 'phangs na phyis las gang byas kyang sngar byas pa'i 'bras bu nyid smin par 'gyur gyi las phyi mas snga ma'i 'bras bu bskyod par mi nus pas na mi g-yo ba'i las zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'phangs na phyis las gang byas kyang sngar byas pa'i 'bras bu nyid smin par 'gyur gyi las phyi mas snga ma'i 'bras bu bskyod par mi nus pas na mi g-yo ba'i las zhes bya'o //
translated: and the result is projected. Later, no matter what karma is created, the result of the previous karma alone ripens. The later karma cannot move the result of the former karma. Therefore, it is called the karma of non-movement.

original: 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of results:

original: yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: pleasant and unpleasant.

original: yid du mi 'ong ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang byol song ngo //
analyzed: yid du mi 'ong ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang byol song ngo //
translated: Unpleasant is the destiny of the hells, hungry ghosts, and animals.

original: yid du 'ong ba ni lha dang mi'o //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba ni lha dang mi'o //
translated: Pleasant is the destiny of gods and humans.

original: de la 'dod par gtogs pa las bsod nams ma yin pa'i las byas na ni ngan song gsum du 'bras bu rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'dod par gtogs pa las bsod nams ma yin pa'i las byas na ni ngan song gsum du 'bras bu rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Among them, if one performs an unmeritorious action belonging to the desire realm, the result will ripen in the three lower miserable destinies.

original: 'dod par gtogs pa'i bsod nams kyi las byas pas @52b ni 'dod pa'i khams nyid du lha dang mi'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod par gtogs pa'i bsod nams kyi las byas pas @52b ni 'dod pa'i khams nyid du lha dang mi'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one performs a meritorious action belonging to the desire realm, one will obtain a pleasant result in the desire realm itself, as a god or human.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med par gtogs pa'i mi g-yo ba'i las dge ba'i rang bzhin byas pa las ni /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med par gtogs pa'i mi g-yo ba'i las dge ba'i rang bzhin byas pa las ni /
translated: If one performs a wholesome action belonging to the form or formless realms,

original: gzugs dang gzugs med par gtogs pa'i lha'i nad du 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med par gtogs pa'i lha'i nad du 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: one will obtain a pleasant result in the heavens belonging to the form or formless realms.

original: de la las dge ba byas na ni 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba rnam par smin pa la las mi dge ba byas na ni 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba rnam par smin par yid ches pas las kyang yod la 'bras bu yang yod ces de gnyi
analyzed: de la las dge ba byas na ni 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba rnam par smin pa la las mi dge ba byas na ni 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba rnam par smin par yid ches pas las kyang yod la 'bras bu yang yod ces de gnyi
translated: If one performs virtuous karma, one has confidence in the pleasant results that will ripen. If one performs nonvirtuous karma, one has confidence in the unpleasant results that will ripen.

original: ga yod par mngon par yid ches pa ni dad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ga yod par mngon par yid ches pa ni dad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, confidence in the existence of both karma and its results is called faith.

original: bden pa ni rnam ba bzhi ste /
analyzed: bden pa ni rnam ba bzhi ste /
translated: There are four truths:

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa dang / 'gog pa'i bden pa dang / lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa dang / 'gog pa'i bden pa dang / lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: the truth of suffering, the truth of origin, the truth of cessation, and the truth of the path.

original: de la las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pas gzugs la sogs pa nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga 'bras bur gyur pa la ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pas gzugs la sogs pa nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga 'bras bur gyur pa la ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The five appropriated aggregates, such as form, generated by karma and affliction, are called the truth of suffering because they are the result.

original: de dag las kyang mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa dang bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid du ma nor cing phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag las kyang mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa dang bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid du ma nor cing phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called truths because they are not mistaken and are not distorted as having the characteristics of impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa gnyis la ni kun 'byung gi bden pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa gnyis la ni kun 'byung gi bden pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Karma and the afflictions are called the truth of origin.

original: de dag kyang rgyu dang kun 'byung ba dang rkyen dang rab tu 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid du ma nor cing phyin ci ma log pas na bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang rgyu dang kun 'byung ba dang rkyen dang rab tu 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid du ma nor cing phyin ci ma log pas na bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are also called the truth of origin, the truth of cause, the truth of strong generation, and the truth of complete generation.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa yang spangs nya bar len pa'i phud po lnga yang bkag pa la ni 'gog pa'i bden pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa yang spangs nya bar len pa'i phud po lnga yang bkag pa la ni 'gog pa'i bden pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Karma and the afflictions are also called the truth of cessation because they are abandoned and the five appropriated aggregates are stopped.

original: de 'ang 'gog pa dang zhi ba dang gya nom pa dad nges par 'byung bar phyin ci ma log cing ma nor bas na bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de 'ang 'gog pa dang zhi ba dang gya nom pa dad nges par 'byung bar phyin ci ma log cing ma nor bas na bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are also called the truth of cessation, the truth of peace, the truth of the sublime, and the truth of definite emergence.

original: de thob par byed pa'i thabs 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad la lam gyi bden pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de thob par byed pa'i thabs 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad la lam gyi bden pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The method that causes the attainment of cessation is called the truth of the path.

original: de 'ang lam dang rigs pa dang bsgrub par bya ba dang des par 'byung bar byed par phyin ci ma log cing ma nor bas na bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de 'ang lam dang rigs pa dang bsgrub par bya ba dang des par 'byung bar byed par phyin ci ma log cing ma nor bas na bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is also called the truth of the path, the truth of what is suitable, the truth of what is to be practiced, and the truth of what brings definite emergence.

original: de la sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa gnyis la sdug bsngal yod de /üîΩkun 'byung yod do zhes mngon par yid ches pa dang 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa gnyis la 'gog pa ni thob par bya bar nus /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa gnyis la sdug bsngal yod de / kun 'byung yod do zhes mngon par yid ches pa dang 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa gnyis la 'gog pa ni thob par bya bar nus /
translated: The two truths of suffering and origination are called suffering and origination.üîΩOne has full confidence that the two truths of cessation and path are cessation and path.

original: lam ni bsgrub par bya nus so zhes mngon @53a * //
analyzed: lam ni bsgrub par bya nus so zhes mngon @53a * //
translated: One has full confidence that cessation is attainable and the path is practicable.

original: par yid ches pa ni dad pa zhes bya'o //üîΩdkon mchog ces bya ba la dkon mchog gsum ste /
analyzed: par yid ches pa ni dad pa zhes bya'o // dkon mchog ces bya ba la dkon mchog gsum ste /
translated: This is called faith.

original: sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun no //
translated: The Three Jewels are the Buddha, the Dharma and the Sa·πÖgha.

original: de gsum nor bu rin po che dang 'dra ba'i phyir dkon mchog ces bya ste /
analyzed: de gsum nor bu rin po che dang 'dra ba'i phyir dkon mchog ces bya ste /
translated: They are called jewels because they are like precious jewels.

original: dper na nor bu rin po che dkon pa dang rin che ba dang / dga' bar byed pa dang / phan 'dogs pa dang mi ma yin pa'i gnod pa med par byed pa bzhin du sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun gyis kyang rnam pa de lnga byed pas na dkon mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: dper na nor bu rin po che dkon pa dang rin che ba dang / dga' bar byed pa dang / phan 'dogs pa dang mi ma yin pa'i gnod pa med par byed pa bzhin du sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun gyis kyang rnam pa de lnga byed pas na dkon mchog ces bya'o //
translated: For example, just as a precious jewel is rare, valuable, delightful, beneficial and removes harm from non-humans, the Buddha, Dharma and Sa·πÖgha perform those five functions, so they are called jewels.

original: ji ltar nor bu rin bo che dkon te dus thams cad du mi 'byung ba de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyang /
analyzed: ji ltar nor bu rin bo che dkon te dus thams cad du mi 'byung ba de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyang /
translated: Just as precious jewels are rare and do not occur at all times, so too

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis lus dang srog la yang mi phongs par rgyun du bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsgrub kyang bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis lus dang srog la yang mi phongs par rgyun du bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsgrub kyang bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur bas na /
translated: buddhas are rare because bodhisattvas become fully enlightened after three measureless kalpas, even though they constantly practice the accumulations of merit and sublime wisdom without regard for their bodies and lives.üîΩTherefore a sutra declares:

original: dkon pa ste de bas na mdo las kyang sangs rgyas 'byung ba ni au dum b'a ra'i me tog 'byung ba bzhin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dkon pa ste de bas na mdo las kyang sangs rgyas 'byung ba ni au dum b'a ra'i me tog 'byung ba bzhin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The appearance of a buddha is like the appearance of the udumbara flower.

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba dkon par gyur pas chos dang dge 'dun dkon mchog gnyis kyang dkon pa nyid do /
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba dkon par gyur pas chos dang dge 'dun dkon mchog gnyis kyang dkon pa nyid do /
translated: Since the appearance of a buddha is rare, the two jewels of Dharma and Sangha are also rare.

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba la rag las pas de la brten nas de gnyis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba la rag las pas de la brten nas de gnyis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are rare because they appear in dependence on the Buddha.

original: ji ltar nor bu rin po che rin che ba bzhin du sangs rgyas de yang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis bsgrubs pas 'thob pas na rin po che rin che ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar nor bu rin po che rin che ba bzhin du sangs rgyas de yang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis bsgrubs pas 'thob pas na rin po che rin che ba'o //
translated: Just as a precious jewel is valuable, so too is the Buddha, since it is attained through the accomplishment of the accumulations of merit and knowledge.

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pa drug las sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa'i pa rol tu phyin pa gsum ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa drug las sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa'i pa rol tu phyin pa gsum ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
translated: Among the six perfections, the three perfections of giving, morality, and patience are the accumulation of merit.

original: bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: The two perfections of concentration and wisdom are the accumulation of knowledge.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyi ga'i grogs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyi ga'i grogs su gyur pa'o //
translated: The perfection of effort is the helper of both.

original: chos dkon mchog ces bya ba ni mya ngan las 'da' ba la bya ste /
analyzed: chos dkon mchog ces bya ba ni mya ngan las 'da' ba la bya ste /
translated: The jewel of the Dharma is nirvana.

original: de yang 'jig rten thams cad kyis phangs par brtsi ba'i phung po lnga spangs pas 'thob pas na rin che ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten thams cad kyis phangs par brtsi ba'i phung po lnga spangs pas 'thob pas na rin che ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is attained through the abandonment of the five aggregates, which are valued by all worlds, it is called valuable.

original: dge 'dun dkon mchog kyang 'khor bar skyes pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes lta bu ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dge 'dun dkon mchog kyang 'khor bar skyes pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes lta bu ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The Jewel of the Community is also precious because it is not like the merit and wisdom of those born in cyclic existence.

original: 'khor ba las 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsgrubs pas 'thob pas na rin che ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba las 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsgrubs pas 'thob pas na rin che ba'o //
translated: It is obtained by accomplishing the collections of merit and wisdom that lead to liberation from cyclic existence.

original: ji ltar nor bu rin po che bdog na dga' bar byed pa de bzhin du dkon mchog @53b gsum po 'di mthong yang rung thos kyang rung /
analyzed: ji ltar nor bu rin po che bdog na dga' bar byed pa de bzhin du dkon mchog @53b gsum po 'di mthong yang rung thos kyang rung /
translated: Just as one is delighted when one obtains a precious jewel, so too, when one sees, hears, or even just recalls the three jewels,

original: rjes su dran par byas kyang rung dga' ba'i rgyur 'gyur bas na dga' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dran par byas kyang rung dga' ba'i rgyur 'gyur bas na dga' bar byed pa'o //
translated: one is delighted, because they are the cause of joy.

original: ji ltar nor bu rin po che bdog na nor bu gzhan yang 'du bas phan 'dogs par byed pa de bzhin du dkon mchog 'di gsum la bsu ba dang bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / yongs su shes par byas na /
analyzed: ji ltar nor bu rin po che bdog na nor bu gzhan yang 'du bas phan 'dogs par byed pa de bzhin du dkon mchog 'di gsum la bsu ba dang bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / yongs su shes par byas na /
translated: Just as when one obtains a precious jewel, other jewels are gathered and it is helpful, so too, when one welcomes and honors these three jewels and fully understands them,

original: lha dang mi'i 'bras bu 'thob pa nas /
analyzed: lha dang mi'i 'bras bu 'thob pa nas /
translated: one obtains the results of being a god or human.

original: mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bar du 'thob par byed pas bdog pa don chen po 'grub pa'i phyir phan 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bar du 'thob par byed pas bdog pa don chen po 'grub pa'i phyir phan 'dogs pa'o //
translated: It is helpful, because it accomplishes the great purpose of the possession of the three jewels.

original: dper na nor bu rin po che yod na mi ma yin pa'i gnod pas mi tshugs pa de bzhin du dkon mchog gsum rjes su dran par byas na yang mi ma yin pa'i gnod pas mi tshugs pas na mi ma yin pa'i gnod pa med par byed pa'o
analyzed: dper na nor bu rin po che yod na mi ma yin pa'i gnod pas mi tshugs pa de bzhin du dkon mchog gsum rjes su dran par byas na yang mi ma yin pa'i gnod pas mi tshugs pas na mi ma yin pa'i gnod pa med par byed pa'o
translated: Just as one is not harmed by nonhuman beings when one has a precious gem, so also one is not harmed by nonhuman beings when one has the recollection of the three jewels.

original: // de la sangs rgyas zhes bya ba yang dngos su na nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs nas /
analyzed: // de la sangs rgyas zhes bya ba yang dngos su na nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs nas /
translated: Here, buddha means that, in reality, after the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience are abandoned,

original: phung po lnga gnas gzhan du gyur te /
analyzed: phung po lnga gnas gzhan du gyur te /
translated: the five aggregates are transformed into another form.

original: sku gsum lhun gyis grub nas stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa la sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sku gsum lhun gyis grub nas stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa la sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: After the three bodies are spontaneously accomplished, the one who possesses the abundant good qualities of the powers, the fearlessnesses, and so forth is called a buddha.

original: de la sangs rgyas de ni nyes pa thams cad spangs ba yon tan thams cad phun sum tshogs pa yin pas thos kyang rung //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas de ni nyes pa thams cad spangs ba yon tan thams cad phun sum tshogs pa yin pas thos kyang rung //
translated: Whether you hear about him or not,

original: bdag gis shes kyang rung /
analyzed: bdag gis shes kyang rung /
translated: whether you understand him or not,

original: de'i sgo nas mchi ma dku ba dang ba spu ldang bal sogs pa'i dad ba sems las g-yos pa ni dad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas mchi ma dku ba dang ba spu ldang bal sogs pa'i dad ba sems las g-yos pa ni dad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: faith is the movement of the mind that is accompanied by tears, the rising of the hairs, and so forth.

original: chos zhes bya ba la chos rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba la chos rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The Dharma is of three kinds:

original: bshad pa'i chos dang / bsgrub pa'i chos dang / don dam pa'i chos so //
analyzed: bshad pa'i chos dang / bsgrub pa'i chos dang / don dam pa'i chos so //
translated: the Dharma of teaching, the Dharma of practice, and the ultimate Dharma.

original: de la gsung rang yan lag bcu gnyis ni bshad pa'i chos so //
analyzed: de la gsung rang yan lag bcu gnyis ni bshad pa'i chos so //
translated: The twelve branches of scripture are the Dharma of teaching.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad ni sgrub pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad ni sgrub pa'i chos so //
translated: The eightfold noble path is the Dharma of practice.

original: mya ngan las 'da' ba ni don dam pa'i chos so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'da' ba ni don dam pa'i chos so //
translated: Nirvana is the ultimate Dharma.

original: de la don dam pa'i chos ni kun 'byung dang sdug bsngal spangs pa'i bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la don dam pa'i chos ni kun 'byung dang sdug bsngal spangs pa'i bdag nyid yin no //
translated: The ultimate Dharma is the essence of the abandonment of the origin of suffering and of suffering.

original: sgrub pa'i chos ni de thob par byed pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos ni de thob par byed pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The Dharma of practice is the cause for attaining it.

original: bshad par bya ba'i chos ni de gnyis kyi don gsal bar ston par byed pa yin no zhes sems dang ba ni dang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bshad par bya ba'i chos ni de gnyis kyi don gsal bar ston par byed pa yin no zhes sems dang ba ni dang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The Dharma to be explained is that which clearly reveals the meaning of those two.

original: dge 'dun zhes bya ba la dge 'dun yang skyes bu gang zag brgyad la bya ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun zhes bya ba la dge 'dun yang skyes bu gang zag brgyad la bya ste /
translated: The Sangha is the eight kinds of persons.

original: bdud la sogs pas mi phyed pa dang / mu stegs la sogs pas @54a * //
analyzed: bdud la sogs pas mi phyed pa dang / mu stegs la sogs pas @54a * //
translated: They are not divided by Mara, etc.,

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa 'di las bzlog nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa 'di las bzlog nas /
translated: and they cannot be turned away from the Buddha's teaching

original: bishnu la sogs pa'i bstan pa gzhan la gzhag par mi nus pas na gang zag brgyad po la dge 'dun zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bishnu la sogs pa'i bstan pa gzhan la gzhag par mi nus pas na gang zag brgyad po la dge 'dun zhes bya'o //
translated: and placed in another teaching such as that of Visnu.üîΩThe Sangha is those who have crossed over the swamp of cyclic existence and those who are on the path to crossing over that swamp.

original: dge 'dun de dag kyang 'khor ba'i rdzab las brgal ba dang 'khor ba'i rdzab las brgal bar 'gyur ba'i lam la gnas pa bsod nams kyi zhing du gyur ba'o zhes sems dang ba ni dad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun de dag kyang 'khor ba'i rdzab las brgal ba dang 'khor ba'i rdzab las brgal bar 'gyur ba'i lam la gnas pa bsod nams kyi zhing du gyur ba'o zhes sems dang ba ni dad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are the field of merit.

original: de ltar na dad pa 'di rnam pa gsum du 'jug ste /
analyzed: de ltar na dad pa 'di rnam pa gsum du 'jug ste /
translated: Thus, faith is threefold.

original: yod pa'i dngos po la mngon pa yid ches pa'i rnam par 'jug pa dang / yon tan dang ldan pa la dang pa'i sems rnam par 'jug pa dang / yon tan dang ldan zhing yod pa thob par bya ba dang / skyed par nus pa'i dngos po la 'dod pa'i rnam par 'jug go //
analyzed: yod pa'i dngos po la mngon pa yid ches pa'i rnam par 'jug pa dang / yon tan dang ldan pa la dang pa'i sems rnam par 'jug pa dang / yon tan dang ldan zhing yod pa thob par bya ba dang / skyed par nus pa'i dngos po la 'dod pa'i rnam par 'jug go //
translated: The mode of activity that is confidence in the existence of things that exist; the mode of activity that is a mind full of faith in those who have virtues; the mode of activity that is desire for things that can be obtained and produced by those who have virtues and exist.

original: de la las dang las kyi 'bras bu dang bden pa bzhi ni yod pa'i dngos po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la las dang las kyi 'bras bu dang bden pa bzhi ni yod pa'i dngos po zhes bya ste /
translated: Here, the things that exist are karma, the results of karma, and the four noble truths.

original: yod pa la yod pa nyid du yid ches pa ni yod pa'i dngos po la mngon par yid ches pa'i rnam par 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yod pa la yod pa nyid du yid ches pa ni yod pa'i dngos po la mngon par yid ches pa'i rnam par 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Confidence in the existence of things that exist is called the mode of activity that is confidence in the existence of things that exist.

original: dkon mchog gsum ni yon tan dang ldan ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum ni yon tan dang ldan ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Those who have virtues are called the three jewels.

original: de la yang yon tan dang ldan pa nyid du sems dga' ba ni yon tan dang ldan pa la sems dang bar 'jug pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la yang yon tan dang ldan pa nyid du sems dga' ba ni yon tan dang ldan pa la sems dang bar 'jug pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Faith in those who have virtues is called the mode of activity that is a mind full of faith in those who have virtues.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni yon tan dang ldan zhing thob par bya nus pa yin la ;
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni yon tan dang ldan zhing thob par bya nus pa yin la ;
translated: Nirvana is endowed with good qualities and can be attained.

original: de'i lam ni bsgrub par bya nus pa yin te /üîΩde bas na mya ngan las 'das pa ni ji ltar thob par bya /
analyzed: de'i lam ni bsgrub par bya nus pa yin te / de bas na mya ngan las 'das pa ni ji ltar thob par bya /
translated: And its path can be practiced.üîΩTherefore, one should generate the desire to attain nirvana and practice its path.

original: lam ni ji ltar bsgrub par bya zhes 'dod pa skyes pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'i rnam par rin po che 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lam ni ji ltar bsgrub par bya zhes 'dod pa skyes pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'i rnam par rin po che 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the jewel of entering the desire to attain nirvana.

original: dad pa'i yon tan bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dad pa'i yon tan bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The jewel of faith is taught in order to demonstrate the good qualities of faith.

original: sems dang ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sems dang ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Faith is clarity of mind.

original: dper na chu dangs par byed pa'i nor bu chu rnyog pa can gyi nang du bcug na chu rnyog pa dangs par byed pa de bzhin du dangs pa zhes bya ba'i sems las byung ba'i nor bu rin po che 'di sems kyi rgyud la byung ba na sems
analyzed: dper na chu dangs par byed pa'i nor bu chu rnyog pa can gyi nang du bcug na chu rnyog pa dangs par byed pa de bzhin du dangs pa zhes bya ba'i sems las byung ba'i nor bu rin po che 'di sems kyi rgyud la byung ba na sems
translated: Just as a water-purifying jewel, when placed in turbid water, causes the water to become clear, in the same way, when this jewel of faith, called clarity, arises in the mindstream, it causes the mind to become clear.

original: la yod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rnyog pa dangs shing gsal bar byed pas na sems dang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: la yod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rnyog pa dangs shing gsal bar byed pas na sems dang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called mental clarity because it clarifies and illuminates the turbidity of the mental afflictions and secondary mental afflictions that exist in the mind.

original: smras pa / yid ches shing dang ba zhes bya ba smos pas chog mod sems zhes bya ba'i sgra smos ji dgos /
analyzed: smras pa / yid ches shing dang ba zhes bya ba smos pas chog mod sems zhes bya ba'i sgra smos ji dgos /
translated: Objection: It is sufficient to say ‚Äúfaith and clarity.‚Äù Why use the term ‚Äúmind‚Äù?

original: smras pa / dangs pa ni gzugs can gyi chos shel dang me long la sogs pa yang yod pas /
analyzed: smras pa / dangs pa ni gzugs can gyi chos shel dang me long la sogs pa yang yod pas /
translated: Response: Clarity exists as a physical phenomenon, such as a crystal or a mirror.

original: @54b sems ma smos na de dag la dang ba yin no snyam du 'dzin pa 'byung ba'i phyir sems dang ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: @54b sems ma smos na de dag la dang ba yin no snyam du 'dzin pa 'byung ba'i phyir sems dang ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If the mind were not mentioned, one might think that clarity refers to those things. Therefore, the term ‚Äúmental clarity‚Äù is used.

original: me long la sogs pa de dag ni gzugs dang ba'i rang bzhin yin gyi /
analyzed: me long la sogs pa de dag ni gzugs dang ba'i rang bzhin yin gyi /
translated: Those things, such as a mirror, have the nature of clarity of form.

original: dad pa ni sems dang ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dad pa ni sems dang ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Faith has the nature of clarity of mind.

original: de'i las ni 'dod pa'i rten byed pa ste /
analyzed: de'i las ni 'dod pa'i rten byed pa ste /
translated: Its action is to support desire.

original: dad pa yod na 'dod pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dad pa yod na 'dod pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because desire arises when there is faith.

original: ngo tsha shes pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain the nature of conscience, it is said:üîΩConscience is a sense of shame about offensive acts.

original: ngo tsha shes pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: What is shame?

original: ngo tsha shes pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhen zhes dris ba'i don to //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhen zhes dris ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is: What is the nature and characteristic of shame?

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: The answer is:

original: bdag gam chos kyi dbang du byas te /üîΩkha na ma tho bas ngo tsha ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gam chos kyi dbang du byas te / kha na ma tho bas ngo tsha ba'o //
translated: With regard to oneself or the Dharma,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: one is ashamed of what is objectionable.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis smad pa dang / sems can dmyal ba la sogs par 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba rnam par smin par 'gyur bas na srog gcod pa la sogs pa sdig pa'i las la kha na ma tho ba zhes bya'o //üîΩyang na mkhan po'am /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis smad pa dang / sems can dmyal ba la sogs par 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba rnam par smin par 'gyur bas na srog gcod pa la sogs pa sdig pa'i las la kha na ma tho ba zhes bya'o // yang na mkhan po'am /
translated: What is objectionable means sinful actions such as killing, because they are despised by the noble ones and because they have unpleasant results such as rebirth in the hells.

original: slob dpon nam skyes bu dam pa rnams kyi mdun du smra bar mi 'os shing brjod du mi rung ba'i sdig pa'i las la kha na ma tho ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: slob dpon nam skyes bu dam pa rnams kyi mdun du smra bar mi 'os shing brjod du mi rung ba'i sdig pa'i las la kha na ma tho ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, what is objectionable means sinful actions that are not to be spoken or uttered in the presence of preceptors, teachers, or holy persons.

original: sdig pa'i las de byas kyang rung ma byas kyang rung bdag gam chos kyi dbang du byas nas gang sems bag 'khums par gyur pa de ni ngo tsha shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdig pa'i las de byas kyang rung ma byas kyang rung bdag gam chos kyi dbang du byas nas gang sems bag 'khums par gyur pa de ni ngo tsha shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Whether one has done a sinful action or not, it is shame which causes the mind to shrink from sin, either through oneself or through the Dharma.

original: de la bdag gi dbang du byas zhes bya ba ni bdag la ltos zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la bdag gi dbang du byas zhes bya ba ni bdag la ltos zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Here, through oneself means in relation to oneself.

original: ji ltar bdag la ltos she na /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag la ltos she na /
translated: How is it in relation to oneself?

original: sdig pa'i dngos po de la 'di ltar dpyod do //
analyzed: sdig pa'i dngos po de la 'di ltar dpyod do //
translated: One examines the sinful thing in this way:

original: las ngan pa 'di ni 'phags pa dang skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis smad pa yin la bdag kyang cho rigs 'di lta bu las byung ba yin la /
analyzed: las ngan pa 'di ni 'phags pa dang skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis smad pa yin la bdag kyang cho rigs 'di lta bu las byung ba yin la /
translated: This bad action is despised by the noble ones and the holy ones, and I have come from a family such as this.üîΩSince I am learned and wise, it is not right for me to do this.

original: mkhas shing shes pa yin pas 'di bdag gis bya ba'i mi rigs so snyam nas sdig pa'i las la sems bag 'khums pa ni bdag gi dbang du byas nas kha na ma tho bas ngo tsha ba'o //
analyzed: mkhas shing shes pa yin pas 'di bdag gis bya ba'i mi rigs so snyam nas sdig pa'i las la sems bag 'khums pa ni bdag gi dbang du byas nas kha na ma tho bas ngo tsha ba'o //
translated: Thus, the mind shrinks from sinful action. This is shame through oneself in regard to sin.

original: ji ltar chos kyi dbang du byas nas /üîΩkha na ma tho bas ngo tshab yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar chos kyi dbang du byas nas /üîΩkha na ma tho bas ngo tshab yin zhe na /
translated: How is it through the Dharma?

original: sdig pa'i dngos po 'di byas na 'jig rten pha rol du 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba smin par 'gyur bar gsung rab dang chos kyi lugs las kyang 'byung ste /
analyzed: sdig pa'i dngos po 'di byas na 'jig rten pha rol du 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba smin par 'gyur bar gsung rab dang chos kyi lugs las kyang 'byung ste /
translated: The scriptures and the Dharma tradition also state, If you engage in this kind of negative action, in the next world an undesirable result will ripen.

original: 'di spyad na chos kyi lugs dang 'gal bas mi rigs so snyam nas sems bag la khums par 'gyur ba ni chos kyi dbang du byas nas kha na ma tho bas ngo tsha ba'o //üîΩ'di'i @55a * //
analyzed: 'di spyad na chos kyi lugs dang 'gal bas mi rigs so snyam nas sems bag la khums par 'gyur ba ni chos kyi dbang du byas nas kha na ma tho bas ngo tsha ba'o // 'di'i @55a * //
translated: This is the shame of the offense, because one thinks: ‚ÄúIf I do this evil deed, an unpleasant result will ripen for me in the next world,‚Äù and ‚ÄúIf I do this, it is contrary to the Dharma and the way of the scriptures.‚Äù

original: las ni log par spyod pa las sdom pa'i rten byed pa ste /
analyzed: las ni log par spyod pa las sdom pa'i rten byed pa ste /
translated: Its function is to support the avoidance of evil conduct,

original: ngo tsha shes pa yod na sdig pa las sdom zhing sdig pa'i las mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa yod na sdig pa las sdom zhing sdig pa'i las mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when one has a sense of shame, one avoids evil and does not commit evil deeds.

original: khrel yod pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khrel yod pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain the nature of a sense of shame,

original: khrel yod pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: khrel yod pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: the root text asks, ‚ÄúWhat is a sense of shame?‚Äù

original: khrel yod pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: khrel yod pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature and characteristic of a sense of shame?‚Äù

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: The answer is,üîΩ‚ÄúIt is the avoidance of evil on the basis of oneself or the Dharma.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten gyi dbang du byas nas kha na ma tho bas ngo tsha ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi dbang du byas nas kha na ma tho bas ngo tsha ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Shame due to the possibility of public disgrace is shame due to the possibility of public disgrace in the world.

original: 'jig rten gyi dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba 'di ni 'jig rten gyi dbang du bya ba la ltos nas zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba 'di ni 'jig rten gyi dbang du bya ba la ltos nas zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdue to the possibility of public disgrace in the world‚Äù means ‚Äúin dependence on the possibility of public disgrace in the world.‚Äù

original: ji ltar 'jig rten la ltos she na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten la ltos she na /
translated: How is there public disgrace in the world?

original: las 'di byas na 'jig rten pas smad pa dang / brdeg na log par spyod pa sdom pa'i rten byed pa'o //
analyzed: las 'di byas na 'jig rten pas smad pa dang / brdeg na log par spyod pa sdom pa'i rten byed pa'o //
translated: If one performs this action, one will be censured by the world and will be bound, beaten, and so on.

original: ma chags pa'i las 'di byas na bdag la 'di 'jig rten pa rnams smod pa dang / bcing ba dang / brdeg pa la sogs pa byed du 'ong ngo snyam nas /üîΩgang sems bag 'khums pa ni 'jig rten gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: ma chags pa'i las 'di byas na bdag la 'di 'jig rten pa rnams smod pa dang / bcing ba dang / brdeg pa la sogs pa byed du 'ong ngo snyam nas / gang sems bag 'khums pa ni 'jig rten gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: If one performs this nonvirtuous action, the world will censure me and will bind, beat, and so on.

original: kha na ma tho bas ngo tsha ba'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho bas ngo tsha ba'o //
translated: One‚Äôs mind becomes timid. This is shame due to the possibility of public disgrace in the world.

original: 'di'i las kyang log par spyod pa la sdom pa'i rten byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'di'i las kyang log par spyod pa la sdom pa'i rten byed pa ste /
translated: Its action is to support restraint from faulty conduct.

original: ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod par gyur na sdig pa'i las ma byas na ni mi byed la /
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod par gyur na sdig pa'i las ma byas na ni mi byed la /
translated: When one has a sense of shame and modesty, one does not commit sinful actions that one has not already committed.

original: byas na yang phyin chad kyang mi byed par sdom pas na log par spyod pa sdom pa'i rten byed pa'o //
analyzed: byas na yang phyin chad kyang mi byed par sdom pas na log par spyod pa sdom pa'i rten byed pa'o //
translated: And, having committed them, one does not commit them again in the future, by restraining oneself. Thus, it is the basis for restraining oneself from wrong conduct.

original: ma chags pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma chags pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the nature of nonattachment, he asks:

original: ma chags pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: ma chags pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: What is nonattachment?

original: ma chags pa'i rang bzhin dang / mtshan nyid dang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: ma chags pa'i rang bzhin dang / mtshan nyid dang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is: What is the nature and characteristic of nonattachment?

original: de la ma chags pa'i don ni rnam pa gsum du 'jug ste /
analyzed: de la ma chags pa'i don ni rnam pa gsum du 'jug ste /
translated: The meaning of nonattachment is threefold:

original: med pa dang / gzhan dang gnyen po rnams so //
analyzed: med pa dang / gzhan dang gnyen po rnams so //
translated: nonexistence, another meaning, and antidote.üîΩNonexistence is like the mere nonexistence of fame being called ‚Äúnot famous.‚Äù

original: med pa ni dper na grags pa med pa tsam la ma grags zhes bya ba bzhin du chags pa med pa tsam la ma chags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: med pa ni dper na grags pa med pa tsam la ma grags zhes bya ba bzhin du chags pa med pa tsam la ma chags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The mere nonexistence of attachment is called ‚Äúnonattachment.‚Äù

original: don gzhan du 'jug pa ni 'di ltar chags pa las gzhan pa ni zhe sdang ste /
analyzed: don gzhan du 'jug pa ni 'di ltar chags pa las gzhan pa ni zhe sdang ste /
translated: Another meaning is that, just as hatred is different from attachment,

original: zhe sdang ba la yang ma chags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang ba la yang ma chags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: hatred is also called ‚Äúnonattachment.‚Äù

original: gnyen po'i don du 'jug pa ni chags pa'i gnyen por gyur pa la ma chags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnyen po'i don du 'jug pa ni chags pa'i gnyen por gyur pa la ma chags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Non-attachment is the antidote to attachment.

original: 'dir ni gnyen po'i don du 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni gnyen po'i don du 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, it should be understood in the sense of antidote.

original: de bas na lan du /
analyzed: de bas na lan du /
translated: Therefore, the reply is:

original: chags pa'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: chags pa'i gnyen po ste /
translated: It is the antidote to attachment.

original: skyo zhing mi len pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩchags pa sngar bshad na /
analyzed: skyo zhing mi len pa'o zhes bya ba smos te / chags pa sngar bshad na /
translated: It is the discouragement and non-appropriation.

original: ma chags pa khong du @55b chud sla bar 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: ma chags pa khong du @55b chud sla bar 'gyur bas na /
translated: Since non-attachment is easily understood when attachment has been explained previously,

original: chags pa ja bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: chags pa ja bshad par bya'o //
translated: attachment will be explained.

original: de la srid pa dang srid pa'i longs spyod la zhen pa ni chags pa'o //
analyzed: de la srid pa dang srid pa'i longs spyod la zhen pa ni chags pa'o //
translated: Therein, attachment is the adherence to existence and the enjoyments of existence.

original: srid pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i phung po lnga la bya'o //
analyzed: srid pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i phung po lnga la bya'o //
translated: Existence refers to the five aggregates of cyclic existence.

original: srid pa'i longs spyod ni bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i longs spyod ni bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa la bya'o //
translated: The enjoyments of existence refer to food, drink, and so on.

original: ma chags pa ni srid pa dang / srid pa'i longs spyod la zhen pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ma chags pa ni srid pa dang / srid pa'i longs spyod la zhen pa med pa'o //
translated: Non-attachment is the non-adherence to existence and the enjoyments of existence.

original: dper na me'i gnyen po chu yin bas chu byung na me med par 'gyur ba dang / mun pa'i gnyen po snang ba yin pas snang ba byung na mun pa med par 'gyur ba bzhin du ma chags pa byung na chags pa med par 'gyur bas chags pa'i gnyen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dper na me'i gnyen po chu yin bas chu byung na me med par 'gyur ba dang / mun pa'i gnyen po snang ba yin pas snang ba byung na mun pa med par 'gyur ba bzhin du ma chags pa byung na chags pa med par 'gyur bas chags pa'i gnyen po zhes bya'o //
translated: For example, since water is the antidote to fire, when water appears, fire disappears. Since light is the antidote to darkness, when light appears, darkness disappears. In the same way, since nonattachment appears when attachment appears, it is called the antidote to attachment.

original: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir skyo zhing mi len pa'i tshig smos te /
analyzed: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir skyo zhing mi len pa'i tshig smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very meaning, the words ‚Äúdisillusioned and not grasping‚Äù are stated.

original: srid pa dang srid pa'i longs spyod kyi skyon skye ba dang / rga ba'i chos can yin par rig nas de la yid 'byung ba ni skyo ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: srid pa dang srid pa'i longs spyod kyi skyon skye ba dang / rga ba'i chos can yin par rig nas de la yid 'byung ba ni skyo ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Disillusionment is knowing the faults of existence and the enjoyments of existence, which are the phenomena of birth and aging, and then becoming disgusted with them.

original: de ltar yid byung bar gyur nas srid pa dang srid pa'i longs spyod mi sdud cing de dang bral bar 'dod kyi phrad par 'dod pa mi 'byung zhing chags pa dang zhen pa med pa ni mi len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yid byung bar gyur nas srid pa dang srid pa'i longs spyod mi sdud cing de dang bral bar 'dod kyi phrad par 'dod pa mi 'byung zhing chags pa dang zhen pa med pa ni mi len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Having become disgusted in that way, one does not accumulate existence and the enjoyments of existence. One desires to be free from them. The desire to meet with them does not arise. The absence of attachment and clinging is called ‚Äúnot grasping.‚Äù

original: 'di'i las kyang log par spyod pa la mi 'jug pa'i rten byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'di'i las kyang log par spyod pa la mi 'jug pa'i rten byed pa ste /
translated: Its action is to support the avoidance of perverse conduct.

original: srid pa dang srid pa'i longs spyod la ma chags na de'i don du sdig pa'i las mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa dang srid pa'i longs spyod la ma chags na de'i don du sdig pa'i las mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one is not attached to existence and the enjoyments of existence, one does not commit evil actions for their sake.

original: zhe mi sdang ba'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhe mi sdang ba'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the nature of non-hatred,

original: zhe mi sdang ba gang zhe na zhes dris te zhe mi sdang ba'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhe mi sdang ba gang zhe na zhes dris te zhe mi sdang ba'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: he asks, ‚ÄúWhat is non-hatred?‚Äù The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature and characteristic of non-hatred?‚Äù

original: 'dir yang zhe sdang gi gnyen por gyur pa la zhe mi sdang ba zhes bya ba'i don du blta'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang zhe sdang gi gnyen por gyur pa la zhe mi sdang ba zhes bya ba'i don du blta'o //
translated: Here, one should understand the meaning of non-hatred as the antidote to hatred.

original: lan du zhe sdang gi gnyen po ste byams pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lan du zhe sdang gi gnyen po ste byams pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response, he says, ‚ÄúIt is the antidote to hatred, i.e., love.‚Äù

original: zhe sdang sngar bshad na zhe mi sdang ba khong du chud sla bas zhe sdang je bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang sngar bshad na zhe mi sdang ba khong du chud sla bas zhe sdang je bshad par bya'o //
translated: Hatred was explained previously, but since non-hatred is easy to understand, it should be explained.

original: de la sems can dang sdug bsngal gyi gnas la gnod par sems pa ni zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: de la sems can dang sdug bsngal gyi gnas la gnod par sems pa ni zhe sdang ngo //
translated: In this regard, hatred is the intention to harm sentient beings and the basis of suffering.

original: sems can ni dgra la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can ni dgra la sogs pa'o //
translated: Sentient beings are enemies, etc.

original: sdug bsngal gyi gnas ni mtshon cha dang / dug dang / tsher ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi gnas ni mtshon cha dang / dug dang / tsher ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: The basis of suffering is weapons, poison, thorns, and so on.

original: gnod par sems pa ni gsad par bya bar sems pa'o ;
analyzed: gnod par sems pa ni gsad par bya bar sems pa'o ;
translated: Hostility is the intention to kill.

original: / zhe mi sdang ba ni sems can dang sdug bsngal gyi gnas la gnod par mi sems pa ste /
analyzed: / zhe mi sdang ba ni sems can dang sdug bsngal gyi gnas la gnod par mi sems pa ste /
translated: Non-hatred is the absence of the intention to harm sentient beings and the basis of suffering.

original: snang ba byung na mun pa byung ba med par 'gyur ba bzhin du zhi mi sdang ba byung na zhe sdang med par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: snang ba byung na mun pa byung ba med par 'gyur ba bzhin du zhi mi sdang ba byung na zhe sdang med par 'gyur bas na /
translated: Just as when light appears, darkness does not appear, when non-hatred appears, hatred does not appear.

original: zhe sdang gi gnyen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi gnyen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the antidote to hatred.

original: de'ang dngos su byams pa la bya ste /üîΩsems can la @56a * //
analyzed: de'ang dngos su byams pa la bya ste / sems can la @56a * //
translated: Moreover, it is love that is directly referred to.

original: phan 'dogs pa'i rnam par zhugs pa'i byams pa la zhe mi sdang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa'i rnam par zhugs pa'i byams pa la zhe mi sdang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Love that is engaged in the aspect of benefiting sentient beings is called non-hatred.

original: yang na zhe mi sdang ba yang zhe sdang gi gnyen po yin la /
analyzed: yang na zhe mi sdang ba yang zhe sdang gi gnyen po yin la /
translated: Or, non-hatred is the antidote to hatred.

original: zhe sdang gi gnyen po ni gzhan yang yod par bstan pa'i phyir byams pa smos te /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi gnyen po ni gzhan yang yod par bstan pa'i phyir byams pa smos te /
translated: Love is mentioned in order to show that there are other antidotes to hatred.

original: sems can dang sdug bsngal gyi gnas la gnod par mi sems pa'i zhe mi sdang ba yang zhe sdang gi gnyen po yin la /
analyzed: sems can dang sdug bsngal gyi gnas la gnod par mi sems pa'i zhe mi sdang ba yang zhe sdang gi gnyen po yin la /
translated: Non-hatred is the antidote to hatred, since it does not think of harming sentient beings and the bases of suffering.

original: sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i rnam par zhugs pa'i byams pa yang zhe sdang gi gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i rnam par zhugs pa'i byams pa yang zhe sdang gi gnyen po yin no //
translated: Loving kindness is the antidote to hatred, since it is engaged in the aspect of benefiting sentient beings.

original: 'di'i las kyang ngan par spyod la mi 'jug pa'i rten byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'di'i las kyang ngan par spyod la mi 'jug pa'i rten byed pa ste /
translated: Its action is to serve as the basis for not engaging in evil conduct,

original: zhe mi sdang ba yod na srog gcod pa la sogs pa sdig pa'i las la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhe mi sdang ba yod na srog gcod pa la sogs pa sdig pa'i las la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: since, when there is non-hatred, one does not engage in evil conduct such as killing.

original: gti mi mug pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir ro //
