analyzed: gti mi mug pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: To indicate the nature of non-delusion,

original: gti mi mug pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: gti mi mug pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: he asks, ‚ÄúWhat is non-delusion?‚Äù

original: gti mi mug pa'i rang bzhin dang / mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: gti mi mug pa'i rang bzhin dang / mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature and characteristic of non-delusion?‚Äù

original: lan du / gti mug gi gnyen po ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lan du / gti mug gi gnyen po ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response, he says, ‚ÄúIt is the antidote to delusion.‚Äù

original: gti mug sngar bshad na ;
analyzed: gti mug sngar bshad na ;
translated: Since delusion was explained earlier,

original: gti mi mug pa brda phrad par sla bar 'gyur ba'i phyir gti mug je bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: gti mi mug pa brda phrad par sla bar 'gyur ba'i phyir gti mug je bshad par bya'o //
translated: non-delusion is easy to understand. Therefore, delusion will be explained.

original: de la bden pa bzhi dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis la sogs pa mi shes pa ni gti mug ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la bden pa bzhi dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis la sogs pa mi shes pa ni gti mug ces bya'o //
translated: Ignorance is the non-understanding of the four noble truths, the twelve factors of dependent origination, and so on.

original: bden pa bzhi dang / rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis la sogs pa shes pa ni gti mi mug pa ste /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi dang / rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis la sogs pa shes pa ni gti mi mug pa ste /
translated: Non-ignorance is the understanding of the four noble truths, the twelve factors of dependent origination, and so on.

original: snang ba byung na mun pa med par 'gro ba bzhin du gti mi mug pa skyes na gti mug med par 'gro bas gti mug gi gnyen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: snang ba byung na mun pa med par 'gro ba bzhin du gti mi mug pa skyes na gti mug med par 'gro bas gti mug gi gnyen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Just as when light appears, darkness disappears, when non-ignorance arises, ignorance disappears. Therefore, it is called the antidote to ignorance.

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad kyang gti mug gi gnyen po yin pas dge ba'i chos kun la gti mi mug pa yin no snyam du 'dzin pa dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad kyang gti mug gi gnyen po yin pas dge ba'i chos kun la gti mi mug pa yin no snyam du 'dzin pa dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: Since all virtuous dharmas are antidotes to ignorance, one should think that non-ignorance is present in all virtuous dharmas.

original: yang dag pa la yang dag par rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yang dag pa la yang dag par rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To prevent that, it is said: Correct realization of the correct.

original: yang dag pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la sogs pa'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la sogs pa'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la bya'o //
translated: The correct refers to the specific and general characteristics of the four noble truths and so on.

original: yang dag par rtogs pa ni bden pa bzhi'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag par rtogs pa ni bden pa bzhi'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa ste /
translated: Correct understanding is the unmistaken understanding of the general and specific characteristics of the four noble truths.

original: dge ba'i chos kun gti mug gi gnyen po yin mod kyi de dag la gti mi mug pa zhes mi bya'i /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos kun gti mug gi gnyen po yin mod kyi de dag la gti mi mug pa zhes mi bya'i /
translated: Although all virtuous dharmas are antidotes to delusion, they are not called nondelusion.

original: gang bden pa bzhi phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'i shes rab la gti mug gi gnyen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang bden pa bzhi phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'i shes rab la gti mug gi gnyen po zhes bya'o //
translated: But the wisdom that unmistakenly understands the four noble truths is called the antidote to delusion.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That is of two kinds:

original: ye shes dang so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes dang so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: wisdom and discernment.

original: @56b de la ye shes kyang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: @56b de la ye shes kyang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Wisdom is of four kinds:

original: rnam par smin pa dang / rtogs pa dang / bsams pa dang / chud pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang / rtogs pa dang / bsams pa dang / chud pa'o //
translated: maturation, realization, reflection, and penetration.

original: de la gang skyes ma thag tu thob pa'i shes rab ni rnam par smin pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la gang skyes ma thag tu thob pa'i shes rab ni rnam par smin pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: The wisdom that is obtained immediately upon birth is called the wisdom of maturation.

original: gang thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni rtogs pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni rtogs pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: The wisdom that arises from listening is called the wisdom of realization.

original: bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni bsams pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni bsams pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: The wisdom that arises from reflection is called the wisdom of reflection.

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni chung pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //üîΩso sor rtog pa yang brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'i shes rab bam /
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni chung pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o // so sor rtog pa yang brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'i shes rab bam /
translated: The wisdom that arises from meditation is called ‚Äúthe wisdom of the small.‚ÄùüîΩDiscernment is the wisdom of one who is diligent,

original: ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i shes rab la bya ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i shes rab la bya ste /
translated: or the wisdom of one who is in meditative equipoise.

original: de'i mthus nyon mongs pa'i sa bon rtsa nas ma bton ma bcom du zin kyang nyon mongs pa rnams skye ba'i skabs mi 'byed pa ni so sor rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i mthus nyon mongs pa'i sa bon rtsa nas ma bton ma bcom du zin kyang nyon mongs pa rnams skye ba'i skabs mi 'byed pa ni so sor rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: By its power, even though the seeds of the afflictions have not been uprooted or destroyed, it does not allow the afflictions to arise. This is called ‚Äúdiscernment.‚Äù

original: don du na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i ye shes bzhi dang / so sor rtog pa'i bdag nyid kyi shes rab la gti mi mug pa zhes gdags so //
analyzed: don du na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i ye shes bzhi dang / so sor rtog pa'i bdag nyid kyi shes rab la gti mi mug pa zhes gdags so //
translated: In fact, the wisdom that correctly knows the general and specific characteristics of the four noble truths and the wisdom that has the nature of discernment is designated as ‚Äúnondelusion.‚Äù

original: smras pa / shes rab la gti mi mug pa zhes bya na /
analyzed: smras pa / shes rab la gti mi mug pa zhes bya na /
translated: Objection: If nondelusion is called ‚Äúwisdom,‚Äù

original: shes rab ni lnga yul so sor nges pa'i skabs su bshad zin pas /
analyzed: shes rab ni lnga yul so sor nges pa'i skabs su bshad zin pas /
translated: wisdom was already explained in the section on the objects of the five.

original: da yang bzlas te bshad ci dgos /
analyzed: da yang bzlas te bshad ci dgos /
translated: So why repeat it now?

original: smras pa / der ni shes rab kyi mtshan nyid spyir bshad pa dang / chos kyi mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par shes pa'i shes rab de dge ba zhig yin nam mi dge ba zhig yin nam /üîΩlung du ma bstan pa zhig yin pa dmigs kyis phye ste ma bstan to //
analyzed: smras pa / der ni shes rab kyi mtshan nyid spyir bshad pa dang / chos kyi mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par shes pa'i shes rab de dge ba zhig yin nam mi dge ba zhig yin nam / lung du ma bstan pa zhig yin pa dmigs kyis phye ste ma bstan to //
translated: He says: There, the general characteristic of wisdom was explained, and the wisdom that unerringly knows the characteristic of phenomena was not distinguished as being either virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: da 'dir ni chos kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'i shes rab de dge ba'i nang du gtogs par bstan pa'i phyir gti mi mug pa'i sgrar btags nas dge ba bcu gcig gi nang du bshad do //
analyzed: da 'dir ni chos kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'i shes rab de dge ba'i nang du gtogs par bstan pa'i phyir gti mi mug pa'i sgrar btags nas dge ba bcu gcig gi nang du bshad do //
translated: Here, in order to teach that the wisdom skilled in the characteristics of phenomena is included among virtuous factors, it is designated by the term nondelusion and explained among the eleven virtuous factors.

original: de'i las kyang nyes par spyod pa la mi 'jug pa'i rten byed pa ste /
analyzed: de'i las kyang nyes par spyod pa la mi 'jug pa'i rten byed pa ste /
translated: Its function is to serve as the basis for not engaging in misdeeds,

original: gti mug med pa'i gang zag rnams ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i las la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gti mug med pa'i gang zag rnams ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i las la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because persons who are nondeluded do not engage in actions such as killing.

original: brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the nature of effort,

original: brtson 'grus gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: it asks, ‚ÄúWhat is effort?‚Äù

original: brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: What is the nature and characteristic of effort?

original: lan du le lo'i gnyen po ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lan du le lo'i gnyen po ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The answer is: It is the antidote to laziness.

original: 'dir yang le lo sngar bstan na brtson 'grus rtogs par sla bar 'gyur bas le lo je bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang le lo sngar bstan na brtson 'grus rtogs par sla bar 'gyur bas le lo je bshad par bya'o //
translated: Here, if laziness is taught first, effort is easily understood, so laziness will be explained.

original: de la le lo rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la le lo rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of laziness:

original: smad pa'i dngos po la spro ba'i @57a * //
analyzed: smad pa'i dngos po la spro ba'i @57a * //
translated: laziness that is enthusiasm for contemptible things

original: le lo dang / snyom las kyi mtshan nyid kyi le lo'o //
analyzed: le lo dang / snyom las kyi mtshan nyid kyi le lo'o //
translated: and laziness that is the characteristic of indolence.

original: de la smad pa'i dngos po la brtson pa'i le lo ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i mi dge ba'i las bya ba la brtson pa ste /
analyzed: de la smad pa'i dngos po la brtson pa'i le lo ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i mi dge ba'i las bya ba la brtson pa ste /
translated: Laziness that is enthusiasm for contemptible things is enthusiasm for doing nonvirtuous actions such as killing.

original: de la yang le lo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la yang le lo zhes bya'o //
translated: That is also called laziness.

original: snyom las kyi mtshan nyid kyi le lo ni 'phres pa dang / nyal ba la sogs pa la dga' zhing dge ba dang mi dge ba gang la yang sems 'jug par mi spro ba ste /
analyzed: snyom las kyi mtshan nyid kyi le lo ni 'phres pa dang / nyal ba la sogs pa la dga' zhing dge ba dang mi dge ba gang la yang sems 'jug par mi spro ba ste /
translated: Laziness that is the characteristic of indolence is delight in sleeping, lying down, and so on, and not being enthusiastic about engaging the mind in any virtue or nonvirtue.

original: de la yang le lo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la yang le lo zhes bya'o //
translated: That is also called laziness.

original: brtson 'grus yod na le lo rnam pa gnyis med par 'gyur bas brtson 'grus ni le lo'i gnyen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus yod na le lo rnam pa gnyis med par 'gyur bas brtson 'grus ni le lo'i gnyen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the two kinds of laziness are absent when there is vigor, vigor is called the antidote to laziness.

original: smad pa la spro ba'i le lo dang / snyom las kyi mtshan nyid kyi le lo gnyi ga yang le lo nyid yin gyi brtson 'grus ma yin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smad pa la spro ba'i le lo dang / snyom las kyi mtshan nyid kyi le lo gnyi ga yang le lo nyid yin gyi brtson 'grus ma yin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Laziness is both the laziness of lack of enthusiasm for what is beneficial and the laziness of lack of enthusiasm for what is beneficial and the laziness of the nature of indolence. In order to show what the nature of vigor is, he says:

original: dge ba la sems mngon par spro ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩgang mnyan pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa dge ba'i las bya ba la zhugs nas sems nur ba dang ldog pa med pa ni brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gsung rab 'di las gzhan pa gang phyi rol pa rnams kyi brtson 'grus ni le lo nyid do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gsung rab 'di las gzhan pa gang phyi rol pa rnams kyi brtson 'grus ni le lo nyid do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the Lord has also said in this scripture that the effort of those who are outside this teaching is laziness.

original: de'i las ni dge ba'i phyogs rdzogs par byed pa dang / 'grub par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de'i las ni dge ba'i phyogs rdzogs par byed pa dang / 'grub par byed pa ste /
translated: Its action is to complete and accomplish the side of virtue.

original: brtson 'grus yod na dge ba'i phyogs 'grub pa dang rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus yod na dge ba'i phyogs 'grub pa dang rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when there is effort, the side of virtue is accomplished and completed.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of pliancy is taught.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: What is pliancy?

original: shin tu sbyangs pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: This is the question: What is the nature and characteristic of pliancy?

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: The answer is:

original: gnas ngan len gyi gnyen po ste /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi gnyen po ste /
translated: The antidote to the negative tendencies.

original: lus dang sems las su rung ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lus dang sems las su rung ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The serviceability of body and mind.

original: de la gnas ngan len zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi sa bon dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i sa bon la bya'o //
analyzed: de la gnas ngan len zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi sa bon dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i sa bon la bya'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúnegative reflex‚Äù refers to the seeds of the afflictions and the seeds of the obscurations to that which needs to be known.

original: de la nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi sa bon ni nyan thos rnams la sgrib po //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi sa bon ni nyan thos rnams la sgrib po //
translated: The seeds of the afflictions and the secondary afflictions are obscurations for the ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa'i sa bon ni byang chub sems dpa' la sgrib po //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa'i sa bon ni byang chub sems dpa' la sgrib po //
translated: The seeds of the obscurations to that which needs to be known are obscurations for the bodhisattvas.

original: shin tu sbyangs zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems las su rung ba la bya ste /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems las su rung ba la bya ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúpliancy‚Äù refers to the fitness of body and mind.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i sa bon dang bral na lus las su @57b rung ba dang sems las su rung ba 'byung bas shin tu sbyangs ba ni gnas ngan len gyi gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i sa bon dang bral na lus las su @57b rung ba dang sems las su rung ba 'byung bas shin tu sbyangs ba ni gnas ngan len gyi gnyen po yin no //
translated: When one is free of the seeds of the afflictions and the obscurations to that which needs to be known, one experiences the fitness of body and mind. Thus, pliancy is the antidote to negative reflex.

original: de la lus shin tu sbyangs pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: de la lus shin tu sbyangs pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristic of physical pliancy is

original: lus dang sems las su rung ba ste /
analyzed: lus dang sems las su rung ba ste /
translated: the fitness of body and mind.

original: lus las su rung ba ni dge ba'i phyogs bsgrub par bya ba la myur du 'grub par byed cing lus zo mdog bde zhing ;
analyzed: lus las su rung ba ni dge ba'i phyogs bsgrub par bya ba la myur du 'grub par byed cing lus zo mdog bde zhing ;
translated: Physical flexibility is the swift accomplishment of the practice of virtue and the physical experience of well-being.

original: lci ba med ba'o //üîΩsems las su rung ba ni rnal 'byor yid la byed pa'i tshe /
analyzed: lci ba med ba'o // sems las su rung ba ni rnal 'byor yid la byed pa'i tshe /
translated: Physical pliancy is the swift accomplishment of the virtuous group of phenomena and the body is comfortable and not heavy.üîΩMental pliancy is the swift accomplishment of the virtuous group of phenomena and the mind is clear and not obscured.

original: sems mi gsal ba med cing dmigs pa'i yul la sems thogs pa med par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: sems mi gsal ba med cing dmigs pa'i yul la sems thogs pa med par 'jug pa'o //
translated: Mental pliancy is the swift accomplishment of the virtuous group of phenomena and the mind is clear and not obscured.

original: smras pa / lus las su rung ba ni reg bya'i khyad par yin te /üîΩreg bya'i khyad par ni yang na 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rang bzhin yin /
analyzed: smras pa / lus las su rung ba ni reg bya'i khyad par yin te / reg bya'i khyad par ni yang na 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rang bzhin yin /
translated: It is said that physical pliancy is a special kind of tangible object.

original: yang na rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: yang na rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi rang bzhin yin la /
translated: A special kind of tangible object is either by nature the four great elements or by nature derivative form.

original: 'dir ni sems las byung ba shin tu sbyangs pa bshad pa'i skabs yin na /
analyzed: 'dir ni sems las byung ba shin tu sbyangs pa bshad pa'i skabs yin na /
translated: Since this is the section on explaining mental pliancy,

original: lus kyi reg bya'i khyad par la ji ltar na shin tu sbyangs pa zhes bya /
analyzed: lus kyi reg bya'i khyad par la ji ltar na shin tu sbyangs pa zhes bya /
translated: how can a special kind of tangible object of the body be called pliancy?

original: smras pa / lus kyi reg bya lus las su rung ba de sems las su rung ba ma yin du zin kyang lus las su rung ba des rgyu byas nas sems las su rung ba skyed pas na /
analyzed: smras pa / lus kyi reg bya lus las su rung ba de sems las su rung ba ma yin du zin kyang lus las su rung ba des rgyu byas nas sems las su rung ba skyed pas na /
translated: He replied: Even though physical pliancy is physical serviceability and not mental pliancy, physical pliancy acts as the cause for the generation of mental pliancy.

original: rgyu lus la sems shin tu sbyangs pa'i ming btags nas lus la shin tu sbyangs pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rgyu lus la sems shin tu sbyangs pa'i ming btags nas lus la shin tu sbyangs pa zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the cause is designated as mental pliancy and is explained as physical pliancy.

original: 'di'i las kyang de'i dbang gis gnas 'phos pa rnyed cing nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ma lus par spyod pa'o //üîΩshin tu sbyangs pa yod na sngon lus dang sems las su mi rung ba las /
analyzed: 'di'i las kyang de'i dbang gis gnas 'phos pa rnyed cing nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ma lus par spyod pa'o // shin tu sbyangs pa yod na sngon lus dang sems las su mi rung ba las /
translated: Its function is to obtain the transformation of the basis through its power and to completely eliminate the afflictive obstructions.üîΩWhen there is pliancy, one obtains the transformation of the basis from a previous unserviceability of body and mind

original: phyis lus dang sems las su rung ba'i mtshan nyid du gnas 'phos pa rnyed nas /
analyzed: phyis lus dang sems las su rung ba'i mtshan nyid du gnas 'phos pa rnyed nas /
translated: to a later serviceability of body and mind.

original: lus dang sems las su rung ba'i gnas 'phos nas las su rung ba'i mthus nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pha ma lus par spong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang sems las su rung ba'i gnas 'phos nas las su rung ba'i mthus nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pha ma lus par spong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Through the transformation of the basis of physical and mental pliancy, one completely eliminates the afflictive obstructions through the power of serviceability.

original: bag yod pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bag yod pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the nature of heedfulness,

original: bag yod pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: bag yod pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: What is heedfulness?

original: bag yod pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: bag yod pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: What is the nature and characteristic of heedfulness?

original: lan du / bag med pa'i gnyen po ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lan du / bag med pa'i gnyen po ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The answer is: It is the antidote to heedlessness.

original: 'dir yang bag med pa sngar bstan na bag yod pa brda phrad par sla bar 'gyur bas bag med pa ji bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir yang bag med pa sngar bstan na bag yod pa brda phrad par sla bar 'gyur bas bag med pa ji bstan to //
translated: Here, if heedlessness is taught first, it is easier to understand heedfulness, so heedlessness is taught.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / le lo la brten te 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa la sems 'jug pa srung zhing /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / le lo la brten te 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa la sems 'jug pa srung zhing /
translated: It is heedfulness because it protects the mind from engaging in the afflictions such as attachment and so on, which are based on attachment, aversion, delusion and laziness.

original: de'i gnyen po dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos rnams mi sgom pa ni bag @58a * //üîΩmed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos rnams mi sgom pa ni bag @58a * // med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is heedlessness because it does not cultivate the antidotes such as faith and so on, which are virtuous dharmas.

original: nyon mongs pa la sems 'jug pa srung bar byed cing de'i gnyen po dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos rnams sgom pa ni bag yod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la sems 'jug pa srung bar byed cing de'i gnyen po dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos rnams sgom pa ni bag yod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is heedfulness because it protects the mind from engaging in the afflictions and cultivates the antidotes such as faith and so on, which are virtuous dharmas.

original: bag yod pa skyes na bag med par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir bag yod pa ni bag med pa'i gnyen por bshad do //
analyzed: bag yod pa skyes na bag med par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir bag yod pa ni bag med pa'i gnyen por bshad do //
translated: Since one who has generated heedfulness does not become heedless, heedfulness is explained as the antidote to heedlessness.

original: bag yod pa'i gzhi dang / rgyu dang / de'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bag yod pa'i gzhi dang / rgyu dang / de'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the basis, cause, and nature of heedfulness,

original: ma chags pa nas brtson 'grus kyi bar du de dag la gnas te mi dge ba'i chos spong zhing de'i gnyen po dge ba'i chos rnams sgom pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ma chags pa nas brtson 'grus kyi bar du de dag la gnas te mi dge ba'i chos spong zhing de'i gnyen po dge ba'i chos rnams sgom pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúabiding in nonattachment, etc., one abandons the unwholesome dharmas and cultivates their antidotes, the wholesome dharmas.‚Äù

original: ma chags pa nas brtson 'grus kyi bar du zhes bya ba ni ma chags pa dang ; zhe mi sdang ba dang / gti mi mug pa dang / brtson 'grus dang bzhi'o //
analyzed: ma chags pa nas brtson 'grus kyi bar du zhes bya ba ni ma chags pa dang ; zhe mi sdang ba dang / gti mi mug pa dang / brtson 'grus dang bzhi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAbiding in nonattachment, etc.‚Äù refers to the four: nonattachment, nonhatred, nondelusion, and effort.

original: de dag la gnas te zhes bya ba ni chos gong ma bzhi la brten nas zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: de dag la gnas te zhes bya ba ni chos gong ma bzhi la brten nas zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: ‚ÄúAbiding in these‚Äù means ‚Äúhaving recourse to the above four dharmas.‚Äù

original: ma chags pa dang / zhe mi sdang ba dang / gti mi mug pa gsum ni bag yod pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: ma chags pa dang / zhe mi sdang ba dang / gti mi mug pa gsum ni bag yod pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Nonattachment, nonhatred, and nondelusion are the cause of heedfulness.

original: brtson 'grus ni bag yod pa'i gzhi'o ;
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni bag yod pa'i gzhi'o ;
translated: Effort is the basis of heedfulness.

original: / mi dge ba'i chos spong ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / mi dge ba'i chos spong ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: Abandoning unwholesome dharmas.

original: mi dge ba'i chos rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of unwholesome dharmas:

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos dang / zag pa'i gnas kyi yul lo //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos dang / zag pa'i gnas kyi yul lo //
translated: those that are defiled and those that are the objects of defilement.

original: de la zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: de la zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: Among them, the defiled dharmas are the dharmas of affliction such as desire, etc.

original: zag pa'i gnas kyi yul ni gzugs dang ; sgra dang / dri dang / ro la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa'i gnas kyi yul ni gzugs dang ; sgra dang / dri dang / ro la sogs pa'o //
translated: The objects of defilement are form, sound, smell, taste, etc.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams rnam par sel ba dang / rnam par 'joms pa dang sa bon yang dag par 'don par byed pa ni mi dge ba'i chos spong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams rnam par sel ba dang / rnam par 'joms pa dang sa bon yang dag par 'don par byed pa ni mi dge ba'i chos spong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The complete elimination, destruction, and uprooting of the defiled dharmas is called abandoning unwholesome dharmas.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa bcil ba ni rnam par sel ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa bcil ba ni rnam par sel ba'o //
translated: Among them, the elimination of affliction by the worldly path is complete elimination.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa spangs pa ni rnam par 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa spangs pa ni rnam par 'jog pa'o //
translated: The abandonment of affliction by the path of seeing is destruction.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa bag la nyal tshun chang spangs pa ni sa bon yang dag par 'don pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa bag la nyal tshun chang spangs pa ni sa bon yang dag par 'don pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The abandonment of the afflictions down to the dormant tendencies by the path of cultivation is called ‚Äúthe complete uprooting of the seeds.‚Äù

original: zag pa'i gnas kyi yul rnams kyang mi bsnyen par thag bsrings te btang ba ni spong ba'o ;
analyzed: zag pa'i gnas kyi yul rnams kyang mi bsnyen par thag bsrings te btang ba ni spong ba'o ;
translated: ‚Äú Abandonment‚Äù means not approaching and keeping one‚Äôs distance from the objects that are the basis of the contaminants.

original: / de'i gnyen po dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom pa zhes bya ba la ni de'i sgra mi dge ba'i chos dang sbyar te /
analyzed: / de'i gnyen po dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom pa zhes bya ba la ni de'i sgra mi dge ba'i chos dang sbyar te /
translated: ‚Äú Cultivating the virtuous qualities that are their antidotes‚Äù is connected with the nonvirtuous qualities by the word ‚Äútheir.‚Äù

original: mi dge ba'i chos de dag gi gnyen po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos de dag gi gnyen po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is ‚Äúthe antidotes to those nonvirtuous qualities.‚Äù

original: mi dge ba'i chos kyi gnyen po yang dge ba ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos kyi gnyen po yang dge ba ste /
translated: The antidotes to nonvirtuous qualities are virtuous.

original: de'ang zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba dang / zag pa med pa'i dge ba ste rnam pa @58b gnyis so //
analyzed: de'ang zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba dang / zag pa med pa'i dge ba ste rnam pa @58b gnyis so //
translated: They are of two types: contaminated virtue and uncontaminated virtue.

original: de la dad pa dang / sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba'o //
analyzed: de la dad pa dang / sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba'o //
translated: Among them, faith, generosity, morality, and so on are contaminated virtue.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad bo ni zag pa med pa'i dge ba'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad bo ni zag pa med pa'i dge ba'o //
translated: The eightfold noble path is uncontaminated virtue.

original: bsgom pa zhes bya ba ni chos de dag la 'dris par byed /
analyzed: bsgom pa zhes bya ba ni chos de dag la 'dris par byed /
translated: Meditation is the cultivation of those dharmas.

original: yang nas yang du chos de dag mngon sum du byed pa ste /
analyzed: yang nas yang du chos de dag mngon sum du byed pa ste /
translated: It is the repeated actualization of those dharmas.

original: mi dge ba'i chos spong zhing dge ba'i chos la goms par byed pa ni bag yod pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos spong zhing dge ba'i chos la goms par byed pa ni bag yod pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of heedfulness is the abandonment of non-virtuous dharmas and the cultivation of virtuous dharmas.

original: de'i las kyang 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i las kyang 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: Its action is the completion of all mundane and supramundane perfections.

original: de la 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa ni lha dang mir skyes pa dang / longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa ni lha dang mir skyes pa dang / longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Among them, mundane perfection is birth as a god or human and the perfection of resources.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa ni /
translated: Supramundane perfection is

original: nyan thos kyi byang chub dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi byang chub dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub 'thob pa'o //
translated: attaining the enlightenment of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, the enlightenment of the pratyekabuddhas, and unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: btang snyoms kyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To teach the nature of equanimity,

original: btang snyoms gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: btang snyoms gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: he asks, ‚ÄúWhat is equanimity?‚Äù

original: btang snyoms kyi rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: What is the nature and characteristic of equanimity?

original: de la btang snyoms rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la btang snyoms rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of equanimity:

original: tshor ba btang snyoms dang / tshad med pa btang snyoms dang 'du byed kyi btang snyoms so //üîΩtshor ba rnam pa gsum las tshor ba bde ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: tshor ba btang snyoms dang / tshad med pa btang snyoms dang 'du byed kyi btang snyoms so // tshor ba rnam pa gsum las tshor ba bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: equanimity of feeling, equanimity of the immeasurables, and equanimity of volition.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa ni tshor ba btang snyoms zhes bya'o //üîΩbyams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms zhes smos pa la 'jug gi btang snyoms zhes smos pa ni tshad med pa'i btang snyoms te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa ni tshor ba btang snyoms zhes bya'o // byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms zhes smos pa la 'jug gi btang snyoms zhes smos pa ni tshad med pa'i btang snyoms te /
translated: Among the three kinds of feeling, equanimity is neither pleasant nor unpleasant feeling.

original: de'ang gang la 'ang chags pa med pa su la yang zhe sdang ba med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de'ang gang la 'ang chags pa med pa su la yang zhe sdang ba med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Among the four immeasurables, equanimity is the absence of attachment to any being and the absence of aversion to any being.

original: rnal 'byor yid la byed pa na zhum rgod gnyis spangs na sems lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa ni 'du byed kyi btang snyoms zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor yid la byed pa na zhum rgod gnyis spangs na sems lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa ni 'du byed kyi btang snyoms zhes bya ste /
translated: When one is engaged in mental attention to yoga, if one abandons both laxity and excitement, the mind enters spontaneously, which is called equanimity of volition.

original: 'dir ni 'du byed kyi btang snyoms bshad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'du byed kyi btang snyoms bshad par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, equanimity of the formative forces should be understood.

original: de'i lan du ma chags pa nas brtson 'grus kyi bar du de dag nyid la gnas shing zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i lan du ma chags pa nas brtson 'grus kyi bar du de dag nyid la gnas shing zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response to that, the root text states, ‚ÄúAbiding in those very states of nonattachment, nonaversion, and nonignorance, he or she generates effort.‚Äù

original: ji ltar bag yod pa'i rgyu dang ; gzhi ma chags pa dang / zhe mi sdang ba dang / gti mi mug pa dang brtson 'grus yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar bag yod pa'i rgyu dang ; gzhi ma chags pa dang / zhe mi sdang ba dang / gti mi mug pa dang brtson 'grus yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as heedfulness is the cause and basis of nonattachment, nonaversion, nonignorance, and effort,

original: btang snyoms kyi rgyu dang / gzhi yang ma chags pa dang / zhe mi sdang ba dang / gti mi mug pa dang / brtson 'grus yin te /üîΩde dag nyid la gnas zhes bya ba ni chos de @59a * //
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi rgyu dang / gzhi yang ma chags pa dang / zhe mi sdang ba dang / gti mi mug pa dang / brtson 'grus yin te / de dag nyid la gnas zhes bya ba ni chos de @59a * //
translated: so too nonattachment, nonaversion, nonignorance, and effort are the cause and basis of equanimity.

original: bzhi la brten nas btang snyoms 'byung zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bzhi la brten nas btang snyoms 'byung zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúabiding in those very states‚Äù means that equanimity arises in dependence upon those four qualities.

original: chos de bzhi la brten nas btang snyoms 'byung na ci zhig 'byung /
analyzed: chos de bzhi la brten nas btang snyoms 'byung na ci zhig 'byung /
translated: If equanimity arises in dependence upon those four qualities, what occurs?

original: ci 'thob par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'thob par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is attained?

original: de'i phyir sems mnyam pa dang sems zhi ba dang rnal du bab pa dang sems lhun gyis grub pa yang 'thob pa ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems mnyam pa dang sems zhi ba dang rnal du bab pa dang sems lhun gyis grub pa yang 'thob pa ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúone also attains an even state of mind, a pacified mind, a mind that is settled, and a mind that is spontaneous.‚Äù

original: tshig de gsum gyis btang snyoms kyi dang po'i gnas dang bar gyi gnas dang tha ma'i gnas bstan to //
analyzed: tshig de gsum gyis btang snyoms kyi dang po'i gnas dang bar gyi gnas dang tha ma'i gnas bstan to //
translated: These three phrases indicate the initial, intermediate, and final stages of equanimity.

original: de la zhum pa dang rgod pa ni sems mtho ba'am dma' bar byed pas na mi mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la zhum pa dang rgod pa ni sems mtho ba'am dma' bar byed pas na mi mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, depression and excitement are called ‚Äúuneven‚Äù because they cause the mind to be high or low.

original: de la dang por zhum pa dang / rgod pa spangs nas sems mthon dman med par gyur pa ni sems mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: de la dang por zhum pa dang / rgod pa spangs nas sems mthon dman med par gyur pa ni sems mnyam pa ste /
translated: First, after abandoning depression and excitement, the mind becomes free from high and low. This is an even state of mind.

original: des btang snyoms kyi dang po'i gnas bstan to //
analyzed: des btang snyoms kyi dang po'i gnas bstan to //
translated: This indicates the initial stage of equanimity.

original: der zhum rgod dang por spangs te /
analyzed: der zhum rgod dang por spangs te /
translated: There, first abandon depression and excitement.

original: sems mnyam par gyur pa las /
analyzed: sems mnyam par gyur pa las /
translated: From the mind becoming even,

original: de nas sems mngon par 'du bya zhing bsgrim mi dgos par sngar sems mnyam par gzhag pa de'i ngang de bzhin du rgyun du 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: de nas sems mngon par 'du bya zhing bsgrim mi dgos par sngar sems mnyam par gzhag pa de'i ngang de bzhin du rgyun du 'byung ba ni /
translated: then, without the need for further mental application or effort, the mind continues just as it was previously placed in equipoise.

original: sems rnal du 'dug pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems rnal du 'dug pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called ‚Äúa mind that is settled.‚Äù

original: des ni btang snyoms kyi bar gyi gnas bstan to //
analyzed: des ni btang snyoms kyi bar gyi gnas bstan to //
translated: This explains the stations up to equanimity.

original: sems rnal du 'dug pa de'i tshe yang bsgoms nas ring po ma lon pa'i phyir zhum pa dang rgod pa gnyis 'byung du dogs pa'i sems skye'o //
analyzed: sems rnal du 'dug pa de'i tshe yang bsgoms nas ring po ma lon pa'i phyir zhum pa dang rgod pa gnyis 'byung du dogs pa'i sems skye'o //
translated: When the mind is in its natural state, one is still afraid that laxity and excitement will arise, because one has not yet practiced for a long time.

original: de'i 'og tu sgom pa la dus ring du byas pas bsgoms pa mthar phyin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sgom pa la dus ring du byas pas bsgoms pa mthar phyin par 'gyur te /
translated: After that, one practices for a long time and the cultivation is perfected.

original: btang snyoms kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhum pa dang / rgod pa yang ring du spangs na yang zhum rgod skye bar 'gyur ba'i dogs pa yang med par sems mnyam pa nyid la 'bad mi dgos par gnas pa ni /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhum pa dang / rgod pa yang ring du spangs na yang zhum rgod skye bar 'gyur ba'i dogs pa yang med par sems mnyam pa nyid la 'bad mi dgos par gnas pa ni /
translated: When one has long abandoned the laxity and excitement that are incompatible with equanimity, one is no longer afraid that laxity and excitement will arise. The mind rests in its natural state without the need for effort.

original: sems lhun gyis grub pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems lhun gyis grub pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the spontaneous mind.

original: des btang snyoms kyi tha ma'i gnas bstan to //
analyzed: des btang snyoms kyi tha ma'i gnas bstan to //
translated: This explains the final station of equanimity.

original: de dag thob nas yang cir 'gyur bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag thob nas yang cir 'gyur bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show what happens after one attains these, he says:

original: gang gis nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams bsal nas /
analyzed: gang gis nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams bsal nas /
translated: By this, one eliminates the defiled dharmas and

original: nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: dwells in the undefiled.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni thabs sam rgyur gyur pa'i btang snyoms la bya ste /
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni thabs sam rgyur gyur pa'i btang snyoms la bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBy which‚Äù refers to equanimity that is a method or cause.

original: btang snyoms gang gis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: btang snyoms gang gis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: ‚Äúby what equanimity.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa'i chos ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i tshogs rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i chos ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i tshogs rnams la bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAfflicted phenomena‚Äù refers to the groups of attachment, hostility, and so on.

original: bsal nas zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams sems la mi skye bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsal nas zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams sems la mi skye bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving dispelled‚Äù means that one should not generate the afflicted phenomena in the mind.

original: ji ltar sems la mi skye bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar sems la mi skye bar byed ce na /
translated: How does one not generate them in the mind?

original: btang snyoms ni 'dod chags la sogs @59b pa nyon mongs pa'i tshogs la 'gal ba yin pas /
analyzed: btang snyoms ni 'dod chags la sogs @59b pa nyon mongs pa'i tshogs la 'gal ba yin pas /
translated: Equanimity is incompatible with the groups of afflicted phenomena such as attachment.

original: btang snyoms skyes par gyur na gdon mi za bar nyon mongs pa rnams skye ba'i bgegs byed par 'jug pas na bsal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms skyes par gyur na gdon mi za bar nyon mongs pa rnams skye ba'i bgegs byed par 'jug pas na bsal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, when equanimity arises, it is said to ‚Äúdispel‚Äù the afflictions because it certainly acts as an obstruction to their arising.

original: gang gi phyir btang snyoms la gnas pa'i dus na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir btang snyoms la gnas pa'i dus na /
translated: For what reason?

original: nyon mongs pa rnams 'byung ba'i skabs med pas btang snyoms la gnas pa ni nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams 'byung ba'i skabs med pas btang snyoms la gnas pa ni nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: Since there is no opportunity for the afflictions to arise, one abides in equanimity. This is called ‚Äúabiding without afflictions.‚Äù

original: de ltar btang snyoms kyi nyon mongs pa sel bar byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa med par gnas shing spyod pa yin pas na /
analyzed: de ltar btang snyoms kyi nyon mongs pa sel bar byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa med par gnas shing spyod pa yin pas na /
translated: Thus, one is engaged in the elimination of the afflictions of equanimity and in abiding without afflictions.

original: btang snyoms kyi las kyang nyon mongs pa skye ba'i skabs med par byed pa'i rten byed pa'o /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi las kyang nyon mongs pa skye ba'i skabs med par byed pa'i rten byed pa'o /
translated: The function of equanimity is to provide a basis for preventing the arising of afflictions.

original: rnam par mi 'tshe ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par mi 'tshe ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain non-violence,

original: rnam par mi 'tshe ba gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: rnam par mi 'tshe ba gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is non-violence?‚Äù

original: rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i rang bzhin dang / mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i rang bzhin dang / mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature and characteristic of non-violence?‚Äù

original: lan du rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i gnyen po ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lan du rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i gnyen po ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The answer is, ‚ÄúThe antidote to violence.‚Äù

original: 'dir yang rnam par 'tshe ba sngar bstan na rnam par mi 'tshe ba rtogs par sla bar 'gyur bas rnam par 'tshe ba je bshad do //
analyzed: 'dir yang rnam par 'tshe ba sngar bstan na rnam par mi 'tshe ba rtogs par sla bar 'gyur bas rnam par 'tshe ba je bshad do //
translated: Here, if violence is explained first, non-violence will be easily understood, so violence is explained.

original: de la sems can la brdeg pa dang / bcing pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa sna tshogs pa byed pa ni rnam par 'tshe ba'o //
analyzed: de la sems can la brdeg pa dang / bcing pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa sna tshogs pa byed pa ni rnam par 'tshe ba'o //
translated: Violence is the various kinds of harm, such as beating and binding, that are done to sentient beings.

original: sems can la brdeg pa dang bcing ba la sogs pa gnod par mi byed pa ni rnam par mi 'tshe ba'o //
analyzed: sems can la brdeg pa dang bcing ba la sogs pa gnod par mi byed pa ni rnam par mi 'tshe ba'o //
translated: Nonviolence is the absence of the desire to beat and bind sentient beings.

original: rnam par mi 'tshe ba skyes na rnam par 'tshe ba med par 'gyur bas rnam par mi 'tshe ba ni rnam par 'tshe ba'i gnyen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi 'tshe ba skyes na rnam par 'tshe ba med par 'gyur bas rnam par mi 'tshe ba ni rnam par 'tshe ba'i gnyen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Since nonviolence arises when violence is absent, nonviolence is the antidote to violence.

original: rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i dngos po gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i dngos po gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the nature of nonviolence, he says:

original: snying rje'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: snying rje'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: compassion.

original: sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal sel bar byed pa ni snying rje ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal sel bar byed pa ni snying rje ste /
translated: Compassion is the desire to remove the suffering of sentient beings.

original: snying rje la rnam par mi 'tshe ba zhes bya'o //üîΩyang na snying rje la rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: snying rje la rnam par mi 'tshe ba zhes bya'o // yang na snying rje la rgya gar skad du /
translated: Nonviolence is called compassion.

original: k'a ru na zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: k'a ru na zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Or, in the Indian language, compassion is called karuna.

original: de la k'a'i don ni bde ba la bya la ru na zhes bya ba'i don ni 'gog pa la bya ste /
analyzed: de la k'a'i don ni bde ba la bya la ru na zhes bya ba'i don ni 'gog pa la bya ste /
translated: In that, the meaning of ka is taken as bliss, and the meaning of ru is taken as obstruction.

original: gzhan sdug bsngal ba mthong nas bdag kyang sdug bsngal bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan sdug bsngal ba mthong nas bdag kyang sdug bsngal bar gyur pa ste /
translated: and when one sees others suffering, one suffers oneself.

original: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bsal bar bya ba'i don du bdag nyid 'bad pa sna tshogs kyis sdug bsngal sna tshogs nyams su len par byed pas na bdag gi sdig sgrib ces kyang bya'o //üîΩji ltar 'dod ma chags pa dang / zhe mi sdang ba dang / gti mi mug pa dang / brtson 'grus bzhi las bag yod pa 'byung bas rdzas su med kyi btags par yod pa bzhin du rnam @60a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bsal bar bya ba'i don du bdag nyid 'bad pa sna tshogs kyis sdug bsngal sna tshogs nyams su len par byed pas na bdag gi sdig sgrib ces kyang bya'o // ji ltar 'dod ma chags pa dang / zhe mi sdang ba dang / gti mi mug pa dang / brtson 'grus bzhi las bag yod pa 'byung bas rdzas su med kyi btags par yod pa bzhin du rnam @60a * //
translated: And in order to remove the suffering of others, one undertakes various kinds of suffering through various kinds of effort, so it is also called the suffering of ones own sins and obscurations.

original: par mi 'tshe ba yang zhe mi sdang ba'i cha las 'byung bas na rdzas su med kyi btags par yod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: par mi 'tshe ba yang zhe mi sdang ba'i cha las 'byung bas na rdzas su med kyi btags par yod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Just as nonviolence is not a substance, but a designation, since nonviolence arises from the factor of nonaversion, just as heedfulness arises from the four: desire, nonattachment, nonhatred and nondelusion.

original: de'i las kyang bcing ba dang brdeg pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa sna tshogs kyis 'tshe bas sems can la mi 'tshe bas na rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i las byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i las kyang bcing ba dang brdeg pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa sna tshogs kyis 'tshe bas sems can la mi 'tshe bas na rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i las byed pa'o //
translated: Its function is to avoid violence, since it functions to avoid violence to sentient beings through various kinds of harm, such as binding and beating.

original: dge ba bcu gcig bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: dge ba bcu gcig bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the eleven virtues is complete.

original: // / nyon mongs pa drug bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / nyon mongs pa drug bshad par bya ste /
translated: The six afflictions are to be explained.

original: de la yang 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la yang 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the nature of desire,

original: 'dod chags gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: 'dod chags gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is desire?‚Äù

original: 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature and characteristic of desire?‚Äù

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that,

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la chags shing zhen pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩsred pa'i dbang gis khams gsum du skye ba len par byed pas sred pa la len pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la chags shing zhen pa'o zhes bya ba smos te / sred pa'i dbang gis khams gsum du skye ba len par byed pas sred pa la len pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúAttachment and clinging to the five appropriated aggregates.‚ÄùüîΩSince craving causes rebirth in the three realms, craving is called appropriation.

original: srid pa 'dis khams gsum du skye ba'i las len cing las skye bar byed pas na sred pa la ming du nye bar len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: srid pa 'dis khams gsum du skye ba'i las len cing las skye bar byed pas na sred pa la ming du nye bar len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, since this craving takes up the karma that causes rebirth in the three realms and makes karma arise, craving is called appropriation.

original: dper na rtsva dang phub ma las byung ba'i me la rtsva'i me phub ma'i me zhes bya ba bzhin du sred pa las byung ba'i phung po lnga la nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dper na rtsva dang phub ma las byung ba'i me la rtsva'i me phub ma'i me zhes bya ba bzhin du sred pa las byung ba'i phung po lnga la nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: For example, the fire that arises from grass and chaff is called the fire of grass and the fire of chaff.

original: yang na shing gang las me tog 'byung ba dang / 'bras bu 'byung ba'i shing de la me tog gi shing 'bras bu'i shing zhes bya ba bzhin du phung po gang las nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid sred pa 'byung bar byed pa'i phung po la nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na shing gang las me tog 'byung ba dang / 'bras bu 'byung ba'i shing de la me tog gi shing 'bras bu'i shing zhes bya ba bzhin du phung po gang las nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid sred pa 'byung bar byed pa'i phung po la nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, just as a tree from which flowers and fruit arise is called a flower tree and a fruit tree, the aggregates from which craving arises, which has the characteristic of defilement, are called the appropriated aggregates.

original: yang na rgyal pos bka' gar stsal ba'i bka' bzhin byed pa'i mi de la rgyal po'i skyes bu zhes bya ba bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid sred pas gang du btang ba bzhin du 'jug par byed pa'i phung po la nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes
analyzed: yang na rgyal pos bka' gar stsal ba'i bka' bzhin byed pa'i mi de la rgyal po'i skyes bu zhes bya ba bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid sred pas gang du btang ba bzhin du 'jug par byed pa'i phung po la nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes
translated: Or, just as a person who does whatever the king commands is called the king's man, the aggregates that engage in whatever they are sent to by craving, which has the characteristic of defilement, are called the appropriated aggregates.

original: bya ste / nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po ste lnga'o //
analyzed: bya ste / nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po ste lnga'o //
translated: The five appropriative aggregates are the form aggregate, the feeling aggregate, the perception aggregate, the compositional factor aggregate, and the consciousness aggregate.

original: zhen ba zhes bya ba la 'dod chags 'di snum dang 'dra bar zhen pa'i rang bzhin yin pas na zhen pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhen ba zhes bya ba la 'dod chags 'di snum dang 'dra bar zhen pa'i rang bzhin yin pas na zhen pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Clinging is attachment. Attachment is called ‚Äúclinging‚Äù because it is by nature an adherence, like oil.

original: dper na 'bru mar la sogs pa'i snum gyis gos la sogs pa'i gnas su zhugs nas kun tu mched par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dper na 'bru mar la sogs pa'i snum gyis gos la sogs pa'i gnas su zhugs nas kun tu mched par 'gyur te /
translated: For example, oil from sesame seeds, etc., penetrates and spreads through such things as cloth.

original: mched par gyur pa de la 'bad pa dang / brtsal ba chen pos kyang dbyung bar bka' ba de bzhin du 'dod chags 'dis kyang chags par bya ba'i rang gi yul la zhen tam /
analyzed: mched par gyur pa de la 'bad pa dang / brtsal ba chen pos kyang dbyung bar bka' ba de bzhin du 'dod chags 'dis kyang chags par bya ba'i rang gi yul la zhen tam /
translated: Even though one makes great effort and tries to remove it, it is difficult to do so. In the same way, attachment adheres to its own object of attachment or to this appropriated body.

original: phung po 'di la zhen nas chags pa mched par gyur na /
analyzed: phung po 'di la zhen nas chags pa mched par gyur na /
translated: Once it has spread through attachment,

original: @60b 'bad pa dang brtsal ba chen pos kyang dbral bar dka' bas na zhen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: @60b 'bad pa dang brtsal ba chen pos kyang dbral bar dka' bas na zhen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: it is difficult to remove it even with great effort and exertion. Therefore it is called ‚Äúclinging.‚Äù

original: zhen pa ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs snum la yang zhen pa zhes bya bas snum la 'dod chags zhes bya'o snyam du log par 'dzin pa dgag pa'i phyir 'dod chags zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhen pa ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs snum la yang zhen pa zhes bya bas snum la 'dod chags zhes bya'o snyam du log par 'dzin pa dgag pa'i phyir 'dod chags zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Attachment is the form that is derived from the four great elements that is called ‚Äúattachment to oiliness.‚Äù Therefore, it is called ‚Äúattachment to oiliness.‚Äù

original: chags pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la phongs par 'dzin cing gang yongs su gtong mi phod pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la phongs par 'dzin cing gang yongs su gtong mi phod pa'o //
translated: Attachment is the grasping of the five appropriated aggregates as one‚Äôs own and the inability to give them up.

original: de bas na snum ni phyi'i gos la sogs pa la snum zhen par byed par zad kyi phung po lnga la gtong mi phod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pas 'dod chags zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na snum ni phyi'i gos la sogs pa la snum zhen par byed par zad kyi phung po lnga la gtong mi phod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pas 'dod chags zhes mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, oiliness is merely the oiliness of external things such as clothing, and it is not the characteristic of the inability to give up the five aggregates. Therefore, it is not called ‚Äúattachment.‚Äù

original: de'i las kyang sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de'i las kyang sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa ste /
translated: Its action is the generation of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal ni khams gsum gyi phung po lnga la bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni khams gsum gyi phung po lnga la bya'o //
translated: Suffering is the five aggregates of the three realms.

original: de la 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags kyis ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi phung po lnga skyed do //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags kyis ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi phung po lnga skyed do //
translated: Attachment to the desire realm generates the five aggregates of the desire realm.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi 'dod chags kyis ni gzugs kyi khams kyi phung po lnga skyed /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi 'dod chags kyis ni gzugs kyi khams kyi phung po lnga skyed /
translated: Attachment to the form realm generates the five aggregates of the form realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na /
translated: In the formless realm,

original: gzugs kyi phung po ni med kyi tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po bzhi yod pas gzugs med pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags kyis ni gzugs med pa'i khams kyi phung po bzhi bskyed pas na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po ni med kyi tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po bzhi yod pas gzugs med pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags kyis ni gzugs med pa'i khams kyi phung po bzhi bskyed pas na /
translated: the form aggregate does not exist, but the four aggregates of feeling, discrimination, compositional factors, and consciousness do exist. Therefore, attachment to the formless realm generates the four aggregates of the formless realm.

original: de'i las kyang sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i las kyang sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, its action is to generate suffering.

original: khong khro ba'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khong khro ba'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To indicate the nature of anger,

original: khong khro ba gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: khong khro ba gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: the root text asks, ‚ÄúWhat is anger?‚Äù

original: khong khro ba'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: khong khro ba'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature or definition of anger?‚Äù

original: lan du sems can rnams la gnod pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lan du sems can rnams la gnod pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The response is ‚ÄúHarm toward sentient beings.‚Äù

original: gnod pa ni sems can rnams la sems rtsub pa ste /
analyzed: gnod pa ni sems can rnams la sems rtsub pa ste /
translated: Harm is a harsh attitude toward sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams la gsad pa dang / brdeg pa dang / bcing ba la sogs pa phan pa ma yin pa bya bar sems pa ni khong khro ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la gsad pa dang / brdeg pa dang / bcing ba la sogs pa phan pa ma yin pa bya bar sems pa ni khong khro ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Anger is the intention to harm sentient beings by killing, beating, binding, and so on.

original: de'i las kyang rnam pa gnyis byed de /
analyzed: de'i las kyang rnam pa gnyis byed de /
translated: Its action is twofold:

original: reg pa med par gnas pa dang / log par spyod pa'i rten byed pa'o //
analyzed: reg pa med par gnas pa dang / log par spyod pa'i rten byed pa'o //
translated: it provides a basis for not dwelling in comfort and for engaging in wrongdoings.

original: de la reg pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba la bya ste /
analyzed: de la reg pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba la bya ste /
translated: Here, comfort is understood as pleasure.

original: bde ba dang lhan cig tu gnas pa ni reg par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang lhan cig tu gnas pa ni reg par gnas pa'o //
translated: Dwelling in comfort is dwelling together with pleasure.

original: bde ba med par gnas pa ni reg pa med par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba med par gnas pa ni reg pa med par gnas pa ste /
translated: Dwelling without comfort is dwelling without pleasure.

original: rtag tu sdug bsngal dang lhan cig tu gnas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtag tu sdug bsngal dang lhan cig tu gnas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one always dwells together with suffering.

original: ji ltar sdug bsngal dang lhan cig gnas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar sdug bsngal dang lhan cig gnas she na /
translated: How does one dwell together with suffering?

original: zhe sdang can ni rtag tu sems 'khrug pas rgyun du yang sems la gdung ba dang bcas so //
analyzed: zhe sdang can ni rtag tu sems 'khrug pas rgyun du yang sems la gdung ba dang bcas so //
translated: The angry person always has a disturbed mind, and so the mind is always accompanied by pain.

original: sems kyi rjes su lus 'brang ba'i phyir lus kyang gdung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems kyi rjes su lus 'brang ba'i phyir lus kyang gdung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because the body follows the mind, the body also becomes painful.

original: @61a * // de bas na spyod lam thams cad du lus dang sems sdug bsngal dang lhan cig tu gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @61a * // de bas na spyod lam thams cad du lus dang sems sdug bsngal dang lhan cig tu gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, in all modes of behavior, the body and mind remain together with suffering.

original: zhe sdang can dag ni gsad pa dang bcing ba la sogs pa'i las kyang gdon mi za bar byed pas /
analyzed: zhe sdang can dag ni gsad pa dang bcing ba la sogs pa'i las kyang gdon mi za bar byed pas /
translated: Those who are hateful certainly commit actions such as killing and binding,

original: de'i las log par spyod pa'i rten byed par yang bshad do //
analyzed: de'i las log par spyod pa'i rten byed par yang bshad do //
translated: and therefore it is also said that it is the basis for the performance of perverse actions.

original: nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir nga rgyal gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir nga rgyal gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the nature of pride, he asks, ‚ÄúWhat is pride?‚Äù

original: nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature and characteristic of pride?‚Äù

original: nga rgyal thams cad kyang 'jig tshogs su lta ba la brten nas 'byung zhing phung po lnga bdag dang bdag gi med pa la bdag dang bdag gir sgro btags nas gzhan gyi phung po bas bdag gi phung po khyad zhugs par 'phags so snyam du lhag par rlom
analyzed: nga rgyal thams cad kyang 'jig tshogs su lta ba la brten nas 'byung zhing phung po lnga bdag dang bdag gi med pa la bdag dang bdag gir sgro btags nas gzhan gyi phung po bas bdag gi phung po khyad zhugs par 'phags so snyam du lhag par rlom
translated: All forms of pride arise in dependence on the afflicted view of the self. When the five aggregates, which are devoid of self and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù are falsely imagined to be ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù one becomes conceited, thinking, ‚ÄúMy aggregates are superior to those of others.‚Äù

original: zhing sems khengs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: zhing sems khengs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of pride is an inflated mind.

original: de'i las kyang gnyis byed do //
analyzed: de'i las kyang gnyis byed do //
translated: Its action is twofold.

original: bsti stang med pa dang sdug bsngal skyed pa'i rten byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsti stang med pa dang sdug bsngal skyed pa'i rten byed pa'o //
translated: It acts as the basis for lack of respect and for the production of suffering.

original: bsti stang med ba ni mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang mkhas shing tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i gang zag yon tan can la lus ma gus pa dang / ngag ma gus pa dang / sems ma gus pa'o //
analyzed: bsti stang med ba ni mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang mkhas shing tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i gang zag yon tan can la lus ma gus pa dang / ngag ma gus pa dang / sems ma gus pa'o //
translated: Lack of respect is the disrespect of body, speech, and mind toward a preceptor, a master, or a person who has good qualities and is virtuous.

original: de la lus ma gus pa ni lus kyis 'dud cing phyag 'tshal bar mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la lus ma gus pa ni lus kyis 'dud cing phyag 'tshal bar mi byed pa'o //
translated: Disrespect of body is not bowing down or prostrating to them.

original: dag ma gus pa ni de dag gi yon tan mi brjod pa'o //
analyzed: dag ma gus pa ni de dag gi yon tan mi brjod pa'o //
translated: Disrespect of speech is not praising their good qualities.

original: sems ma gus pa ni de dag la dga' bar mi sems shing tshod yod par sems pa'o //
analyzed: sems ma gus pa ni de dag la dga' bar mi sems shing tshod yod par sems pa'o //
translated: Disrespect of mind is not thinking of them with affection and not thinking of them with appreciation.

original: sdug bsngal skyed pa'i rten byed pa yang nga rgyal gyi dbang gis tshe rabs phyi ma'i phung po skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal skyed pa'i rten byed pa yang nga rgyal gyi dbang gis tshe rabs phyi ma'i phung po skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It acts as the basis for the production of suffering because, under the influence of pride, one produces the aggregates of the next lifetime.

original: nga rgyal thams cad kyang sems khengs pa'i mtshan nyid du tha mi dad du zin mod kyi nga rgyal gyis dmigs par bya ba'i yul tha dad pa'i sgo nas nga rgyal rnam pa bdun du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nga rgyal thams cad kyang sems khengs pa'i mtshan nyid du tha mi dad du zin mod kyi nga rgyal gyis dmigs par bya ba'i yul tha dad pa'i sgo nas nga rgyal rnam pa bdun du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Although all pride are not different in being characterized by mental inflation, seven types of pride are taught from the perspective of the different objects observed by pride.üîΩSeven types of pride

original: nga rgyal bdun te /
analyzed: nga rgyal bdun te /
translated: Seven types of pride are stated:

original: nga rgyal dang che ba'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / chung ba'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal lo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nga rgyal dang che ba'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / chung ba'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal lo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: pride, great pride, higher pride, extreme pride, wrong pride, lesser pride and pride of thinking I.

original: nga rgyal bdun las nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: nga rgyal bdun las nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir ;
translated: From among the seven types of pride, in order to teach the nature of pride,

analyzed: nga rgyal gang zhe na zhes dris te /

original: nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to /
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to /

original: lan du chung du bas bdag che ba'am mtshungs pa dang mtshungs so snyam du gang sems khengs pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩgang zag 'ga' zhig rigs dang shes nyen dang nor la sogs pa bdag @61b pas chung la /
analyzed: lan du chung du bas bdag che ba'am mtshungs pa dang mtshungs so snyam du gang sems khengs pa'o zhes bya ba smos te / gang zag 'ga' zhig rigs dang shes nyen dang nor la sogs pa bdag @61b pas chung la /
translated: The answer is: Arrogance is the inflation of the mind that thinks 'I am better' or 'I am equal' in terms of such things as family,üîΩhealth, or wealth.üîΩWhen someone has less family, health, wealth, etc. than oneself,

original: bdag ni rigs dang shes nyen dang nor la sogs pa de bas che ba las rigs dang shes nyen dang nor la sogs pa chung du la bltas nas /
analyzed: bdag ni rigs dang shes nyen dang nor la sogs pa de bas che ba las rigs dang shes nyen dang nor la sogs pa chung du la bltas nas /

original: nga ni rigs dang shes nyen dang nor la sogs pas 'di bas 'phags shing che'o zhes gang sems khengs pa ni nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nga ni rigs dang shes nyen dang nor la sogs pas 'di bas 'phags shing che'o zhes gang sems khengs pa ni nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
translated: I am superior and greater in family, health, wealth, etc. This inflation of the mind is called arrogance.üîΩOr, when someone has the same family, health, wealth, etc. as oneself,

original: yang na gang zag 'ga' zhig rigs dang shes nyen dang nor la sogs pas bdag dang mtshungs shing 'dra ba las 'dra ba de la bltas nas /
analyzed: yang na gang zag 'ga' zhig rigs dang shes nyen dang nor la sogs pas bdag dang mtshungs shing 'dra ba las 'dra ba de la bltas nas /
translated: one looks down on those who are equal in family, health, wealth, etc. and thinks,

original: 'di dang bdag rigs dang shes nyen dang nor la sogs pas 'dra ste mi 'dra ba med do snyam nas gang sems khengs par gyur pa ni nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dang bdag rigs dang shes nyen dang nor la sogs pas 'dra ste mi 'dra ba med do snyam nas gang sems khengs par gyur pa ni nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
translated: One inflates the mind thinking, I am equal to him in terms of family, learning, wealth, and so on. There is no difference, and that is called pride.

original: che ba'i nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: che ba'i nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain the nature of excessive pride,

original: che ba'i nga rgyal gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: che ba'i nga rgyal gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: it asks, What is excessive pride?

original: che ba'i nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: che ba'i nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, What is the nature and characteristic of excessive pride?

original: lan du mtshungs pa pas bdag che ba'am che ba dang mtshungs so snyam du gang sems khengs pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lan du mtshungs pa pas bdag che ba'am che ba dang mtshungs so snyam du gang sems khengs pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response, it says, It is the inflation of the mind thinking, 'I am superior' or 'I am equal' to one's equal.

original: gang zag kha cig rigs dang shes nyen dang nor la sogs pa cis kyang mi mtshungs pa med de mtshungs na mtshungs so snyam du mi sems kyi /
analyzed: gang zag kha cig rigs dang shes nyen dang nor la sogs pa cis kyang mi mtshungs pa med de mtshungs na mtshungs so snyam du mi sems kyi /
translated: Some people do not think, There is no difference in terms of family, learning, wealth, and so on. If there is equality, it is equality.

original: 'di dang bdag rigs dang shes nyen dang nor la sogs pas mtshungs kyang /
analyzed: 'di dang bdag rigs dang shes nyen dang nor la sogs pas mtshungs kyang /
translated: But thinking, I am equal to him in terms of family, learning, wealth, and so on,

original: 'di bas bdag gtong ba dang tshul khrims dang nyams rtsal gyis 'phags te bdag che'o snyam nas /
analyzed: 'di bas bdag gtong ba dang tshul khrims dang nyams rtsal gyis 'phags te bdag che'o snyam nas /
translated: One thinks, I am superior to him in generosity, morality, and spiritual practice. I am the best!

original: gang sems khengs pa ni che ba'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang sems khengs pa ni che ba'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
translated: The mental elevation that occurs is called the pride of thinking oneself superior.

original: yang na gang zag kha cig rigs dang shes nyen dang nor la sogs pa bdag pas che ba la che'o snyam du mi sems kyi /
analyzed: yang na gang zag kha cig rigs dang shes nyen dang nor la sogs pa bdag pas che ba la che'o snyam du mi sems kyi /
