original: 'di dang bdag rigs dang shes nyen dang nor la sogs pa mtshungs so snyam nas gang sems khengs par gyur pa de ni che ba'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dang bdag rigs dang shes nyen dang nor la sogs pa mtshungs so snyam nas gang sems khengs par gyur pa de ni che ba'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
translated: But thinking, I am equal to him in caste, learning, wealth, etc., the mental elevation that occurs is called the pride of thinking oneself superior.

original: nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the nature of pride,

original: nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: he asks, What is pride that is pride?

original: nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin dang / mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin dang / mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question, What is the nature and characteristic of pride that is pride?

original: lan du / che ba bas kyang bdag che'o snyam du gang sems khengs pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lan du / che ba bas kyang bdag che'o snyam du gang sems khengs pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúArrogance is the inflation of the mind that thinks, ‚ÄòI am greater than the great.‚Äô‚Äù

original: gang zag kha cig rigs dang / shes nyen dang nor la sogs pa bdag pas khyad zhugs par 'phags te che na /üîΩbdag pas khyad zhugs par 'phags te che bar ni mi sems kyi rigs dang shes nyen dang nor la sogs pas 'phags te che ba de bas kyang bdag rigs dang shes nyen dang nor la sogs pas @62a * //
analyzed: gang zag kha cig rigs dang / shes nyen dang nor la sogs pa bdag pas khyad zhugs par 'phags te che na / bdag pas khyad zhugs par 'phags te che bar ni mi sems kyi rigs dang shes nyen dang nor la sogs pas 'phags te che ba de bas kyang bdag rigs dang shes nyen dang nor la sogs pas @62a * //
translated: When some people are superior to oneself in terms of social class, learning, wealth, and so on,üîΩone does not think, ‚ÄúI am superior to the superior, I am great.‚ÄùüîΩBut when one is superior to the superior in terms of social class, learning, wealth, and so on,

original: 'phags te che'o snyam nas /
analyzed: 'phags te che'o snyam nas /
translated: one thinks, ‚ÄúI am superior to the superior, I am great.‚Äù

original: gang sems khengs par gyur pa ni nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang sems khengs par gyur pa ni nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
translated: This inflation of the mind is called ‚Äúarrogance about arrogance.‚Äù

original: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain the nature of the conceit ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù

original: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: the root text asks, ‚ÄúWhat is the conceit ‚ÄòI am‚Äô?‚Äù

original: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin dang / mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin dang / mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature and characteristics of the conceit ‚ÄòI am‚Äô?‚Äù

original: lan du nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la bdag gam bdag gir yang dag pa'i rjes su lta zhing gang sems khengs pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lan du nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la bdag gam bdag gir yang dag pa'i rjes su lta zhing gang sems khengs pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúIt is the inflation of mind that views the five appropriated aggregates as ‚ÄòI‚Äô and ‚Äòmine.‚Äô‚Äù

original: nye bar len pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang 'dod chags gnyis la bya'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang 'dod chags gnyis la bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAppropriation‚Äù refers to both desire and attachment.

original: de la ma 'ongs pa'i lus kyi dngos po la chags pa ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de la ma 'ongs pa'i lus kyi dngos po la chags pa ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: Among them, desire is attachment to the future state of the body.

original: de ltar gyi lus kyi dngos po la chags pa ni 'dod chags so //üîΩ'dod pa dang 'dod chags gnyis la /
analyzed: de ltar gyi lus kyi dngos po la chags pa ni 'dod chags so // 'dod pa dang 'dod chags gnyis la /
translated: Attachment is attachment to the present state of the body.üîΩDesire and attachment are called ‚Äúappropriation‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya zhe na /
translated: for what reason?

original: 'dod pas ma 'ongs pa'i lus kyi dngos po la chags pa'i rgyus ma 'ongs pa'i phung po len par byed pa dang / 'dod chags kyis da ltar gyi phung po la chags pa'i rgyus da ltar gyi phung po mi gtong zhing 'dzin pa dang len pa dang len par byed pas na /
analyzed: 'dod pas ma 'ongs pa'i lus kyi dngos po la chags pa'i rgyus ma 'ongs pa'i phung po len par byed pa dang / 'dod chags kyis da ltar gyi phung po la chags pa'i rgyus da ltar gyi phung po mi gtong zhing 'dzin pa dang len pa dang len par byed pas na /
translated: Because of desire, one appropriates future aggregates through attachment to the future state of the body. Because of attachment, one does not abandon the present aggregates, but holds on to them and appropriates them.

original: de bas na de gnyis la nye bar len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de gnyis la nye bar len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called appropriators.

original: 'dod pa dang / 'dod chags gnyis dang ldan pa'i phung po rnams la nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / 'dod chags gnyis dang ldan pa'i phung po rnams la nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya ste /
translated: The aggregates that are associated with desire and passion are called appropriating aggregates.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni gzugs kyi phung po nas /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni gzugs kyi phung po nas /
translated: The five appropriating aggregates are the form aggregate,

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i bar du'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i bar du'o //
translated: and so on up to the consciousness aggregate.

original: phung po de dag bdag dang bdag gi med pa la rnam par shes pa'i phung po la ni bdag lhag ma bzhi la ni bdag gis zhes mngon par chags nas /
analyzed: phung po de dag bdag dang bdag gi med pa la rnam par shes pa'i phung po la ni bdag lhag ma bzhi la ni bdag gis zhes mngon par chags nas /
translated: Since the aggregates are devoid of a self and what belongs to a self, the consciousness aggregate is conceived of as a self and the remaining four aggregates are conceived of as what belongs to a self.

original: bdag de bdag gis shes pa lta bur gzhan gyis mi shes so zhes gang sems khengs pa ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag de bdag gis shes pa lta bur gzhan gyis mi shes so zhes gang sems khengs pa ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
translated: The inflated state of mind that thinks, ‚ÄúThis self of mine is not known by others as it is known by me,‚Äù is called pride in self.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the nature of exaggerated pride,

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is exaggerated pride?‚Äù

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: What is the nature and characteristic of manifest pride?

original: lan du gong ma'i bye brag ma thob par bdag gis thob po snyam du gang sems khengs pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lan du gong ma'i bye brag ma thob par bdag gis thob po snyam du gang sems khengs pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúThe mind is inflated when one thinks, ‚ÄòI have attained what has not been attained.‚Äô

original: gong ma'i bye brag ni lha la sogs pa'i chos la bya bas gong ma'i bye brag bstan par bya ba'i phyir mi'i chos je bshad do //
analyzed: gong ma'i bye brag ni lha la sogs pa'i chos la bya bas gong ma'i bye brag bstan par bya ba'i phyir mi'i chos je bshad do //
translated: ‚Äù Since the term ‚Äúhigher distinction‚Äù refers to the qualities of the gods, etc., the qualities of humans are explained in order to demonstrate the higher distinctions.

original: de la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug la sogs pa dang ldan zhing de'i rgyus lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi @62b sgo nas mi dge ba spyod pa ni mi'i chos so //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug la sogs pa dang ldan zhing de'i rgyus lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi @62b sgo nas mi dge ba spyod pa ni mi'i chos so //
translated: The qualities of humans are those that are associated with attachment, aversion, and confusion, and due to their influence, one engages in non-virtuous actions through the three doors of body, speech, and mind.

original: mi'i chos de'i gnyen por gyur pa gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi dang / 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad la sogs pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ni gong ma'i bye brag ces bya'o //
analyzed: mi'i chos de'i gnyen por gyur pa gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi dang / 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad la sogs pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ni gong ma'i bye brag ces bya'o //
translated: The antidotes to those human qualities are the four concentrations of the form realm, the eight branches of the noble path, etc., and the fruits of stream-entry, etc., which are called ‚Äúhigher distinctions.‚Äù

original: ma thob pa ni yon tan de dag ma rnyed mngon sum du ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: ma thob pa ni yon tan de dag ma rnyed mngon sum du ma byas pa ste /
translated: Non-attainment is not obtaining those qualities and not actualizing them.

original: yon tan de dag ma thob par yang mtshan ma cung zad tsam yod pa la brten nas /
analyzed: yon tan de dag ma thob par yang mtshan ma cung zad tsam yod pa la brten nas /
translated: Even though one has not obtained those qualities,üîΩone inflates the mind with pride, thinking, ‚ÄúI have obtained them,‚Äù on the basis of some slight quality.

original: gang thob po snyam du sems shing sems khengs pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang thob po snyam du sems shing sems khengs pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called manifest pride.

original: chung ba'i nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir chung ba'i nga rgyal gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: chung ba'i nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir chung ba'i nga rgyal gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: In order to teach the nature of lesser pride, it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is lesser pride?‚Äù

original: chung ba'i nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: chung ba'i nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature and characteristic of lesser pride?‚Äù

original: lan du bye brag mang pos 'phags pa bas bdag cung zad cig gis chung ngo snyam du gang sems khengs pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lan du bye brag mang pos 'phags pa bas bdag cung zad cig gis chung ngo snyam du gang sems khengs pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The answer is, ‚ÄúIt is the inflation of the mind that thinks, ‚ÄòI am only slightly inferior to those who are superior.‚Äô‚Äù

original: gang zag kha cig rigs dang shes nyen dang / nor la sogs pa bdag pas khyad zhugs par 'phags la /
analyzed: gang zag kha cig rigs dang shes nyen dang / nor la sogs pa bdag pas khyad zhugs par 'phags la /
translated: Some people think, ‚ÄúThose who are superior to me in terms of lineage, learning, wealth, and so on are only slightly superior to me.‚Äù

original: bdag rigs dang shes nyen dang nor la sogs pa khyad zhugs par de bas dma' ba yin na /
analyzed: bdag rigs dang shes nyen dang nor la sogs pa khyad zhugs par de bas dma' ba yin na /

analyzed: de khyad zhugs par 'phags par ni mi sems kyi 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: one does not think that the other is far superior.üîΩOne thinks, I am slightly inferior to him in family, learning, wealth, etc.

original: 'di bas rigs dang shes nyen dang nor la sogs pa cung zad cig gis bdag chung ngo snyam du sems shing gang sems khengs pa ni chung ba'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di bas rigs dang shes nyen dang nor la sogs pa cung zad cig gis bdag chung ngo snyam du sems shing gang sems khengs pa ni chung ba'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
translated: The mental inflation that occurs is called the pride of inferiority.

original: log pa'i nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir log pa'i nga rgyal gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: log pa'i nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir log pa'i nga rgyal gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: To explain the nature of false pride, it is asked, What is false pride?

original: log pa'i nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: log pa'i nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, What is the nature and definition of false pride?

original: lan du yon tan dang mi ldan par bdag yon tan dang ldan no snyam du gang sems khengs pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lan du yon tan dang mi ldan par bdag yon tan dang ldan no snyam du gang sems khengs pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The answer is, It is the mental inflation that thinks, 'I have good qualities,' when one does not have good qualities.

original: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug la yon tan zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug la yon tan zhes bya ste /

analyzed: yon tan de lta bu su la med pa de la yon tan dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //

original: yang na tshul khrims zhig cing sdig pa'i las gang byed pa de la yon tan dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na tshul khrims zhig cing sdig pa'i las gang byed pa de la yon tan dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ste /

original: yon tan ni med kyi skyon dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yon tan ni med kyi skyon dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa'i yon tan med par de dag yod do zhes khas len pa'am /
translated: He does not admit that generosity, morality, etc., do not exist, or that they exist.

original: tshul khrims nyams pa la sogs pa'i skyon yod pa la skyon yod do snyam du mi sems kyi /
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams pa la sogs pa'i skyon yod pa la skyon yod do snyam du mi sems kyi /
translated: He does not think that the faults of violating morality, etc., exist, but thinks that they do not exist.

original: @63a * // bdag yon tan dang ldan no zhes khas len pa ni khas blangs nas bdag yon tan dang ldan no //
analyzed: @63a * // bdag yon tan dang ldan no zhes khas len pa ni khas blangs nas bdag yon tan dang ldan no //
translated: He admits that he has virtues, and thinks that he has virtues.

original: 'phags so snyam nas /
analyzed: 'phags so snyam nas /
translated: He thinks that he is noble.

original: gang sems khengs pa ni log pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang sems khengs pa ni log pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
translated: The inflation of mind is called ‚Äúfalse pride.‚Äù

original: 'dir yang dngos po yon tan gyi dngos po med kyi nyes pa'i dngos po nyid du yon tan du bzung nas ;
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos po yon tan gyi dngos po med kyi nyes pa'i dngos po nyid du yon tan du bzung nas ;
translated: Here, one grasps the entity of a fault as the entity of a good quality, and one's mind becomes arrogant.

original: sems khengs pas na log pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems khengs pas na log pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called 'false pride'.

original: smras pa / mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi skabs su yang gong ma'i bye brag ma thob par thob bo snyam du sems khengs pa yin la /
analyzed: smras pa / mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi skabs su yang gong ma'i bye brag ma thob par thob bo snyam du sems khengs pa yin la /
translated: Objection: In the context of 'manifest pride', one's mind becomes arrogant thinking, 'I have attained what has not been attained'.

original: log pa'i nga rgyal 'di yang yon tan dang mi ldan par bdag ldan no snyam du sems khengs pa yin te /
analyzed: log pa'i nga rgyal 'di yang yon tan dang mi ldan par bdag ldan no snyam du sems khengs pa yin te /
translated: In this context of 'false pride', one's mind becomes arrogant thinking, 'I have good qualities when I do not have good qualities'.

original: gnyi ga yang med pa la yod par nga rgyal byed pa yin pas na khyad par ci yod smras pa /üîΩmngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi skabs su ni gdeng cung zad yod pa la brten nas /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang med pa la yod par nga rgyal byed pa yin pas na khyad par ci yod smras pa / mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi skabs su ni gdeng cung zad yod pa la brten nas /
translated: Since both are types of pride that take what is non-existent as existent, what is the difference between them?

original: bdag gis kun thob po snyam du nga rgyal byed kyi /
analyzed: bdag gis kun thob po snyam du nga rgyal byed kyi /
translated: In the context of 'manifest pride', one's mind becomes arrogant thinking, 'I have attained everything' based on having a slight confidence.

original: log pa'i nga rgyal ni gdeng chung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: log pa'i nga rgyal ni gdeng chung zad kyang med de /
translated: In the context of 'false pride', one's mind becomes arrogant thinking, 'I have good qualities' when one does not have good qualities.

original: skyon dang ldan pa la yon tan dang ldan no snyam du nga rgyal byed pas na bye brag yod do //
analyzed: skyon dang ldan pa la yon tan dang ldan no snyam du nga rgyal byed pas na bye brag yod do //
translated: There is a difference, because the latter is a conceit that takes as its object something that is faulty and conceives of it as having good qualities.

original: ma rig pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir ma rig pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir ma rig pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: In order to teach the nature of ignorance, he asks, ‚ÄúWhat is ignorance?‚Äù

original: ma rig pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature and characteristic of ignorance?‚Äù

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that, he says,

original: las dang 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang / dkon mchog mi shes pa de zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang / dkon mchog mi shes pa de zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is the non-understanding of action, result, truth, and the jewels.‚Äù

original: de la las ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la las ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Here, action is of three kinds:

original: bsod nams kyi las dang / bsod nams ma yin pa'i las dang / mi g-yo ba'i las so //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi las dang / bsod nams ma yin pa'i las dang / mi g-yo ba'i las so //
translated: meritorious action, non-meritorious action, and non-transferring action.

original: 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Result is of two kinds:

original: yid du 'od ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: yid du 'od ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: agreeable and disagreeable.

original: de la lha dang mi'i bde 'gror skyes pa ni yid du 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: de la lha dang mi'i bde 'gror skyes pa ni yid du 'ong ba'o //
translated: Birth in the happy migrations of gods and humans is agreeable.

original: ngan song gsum du skyes pa ni yid du mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: ngan song gsum du skyes pa ni yid du mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: Birth in the three miserable realms is disagreeable.

original: yang na 'bras bu bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang na 'bras bu bzhi ste /
translated: Or, result is of four kinds:

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'od ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'od ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: the fruit of stream-enterer, the fruit of once-returner, the fruit of non-returner, and the fruit of arhat.

original: bden pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: bden pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four truths:

original: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mo ;
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mo ;
translated: the truth of suffering, the truth of origin, the truth of cessation, and the truth of the path.

original: / dkon mchog rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: / dkon mchog rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three jewels:

original: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun no //
translated: the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Sa·πÖgha.

original: ming gis smos pa'i chos de dag yod par ma rtogs shing khong du ma chud pa'am /
analyzed: ming gis smos pa'i chos de dag yod par ma rtogs shing khong du ma chud pa'am /
translated: Not realizing or understanding that those phenomena mentioned by name exist,

original: chos de dag gi mtshan nyid ma rtogs shing khong du ma chud pa de ni ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos de dag gi mtshan nyid ma rtogs shing khong du ma chud pa de ni ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: or not realizing or understanding the characteristics of those phenomena is called ignorance.

original: ma rig pa la phye na du @63b yod ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma rig pa la phye na du @63b yod ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that ignorance is divided into two, it is said:

original: de 'ang lhan cig skyes pa dang / yongs su brtags pa ste zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩde'ang zhes bya ba'i sga ni ma rig pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: de 'ang lhan cig skyes pa dang / yongs su brtags pa ste zhes bya ba smos te / de'ang zhes bya ba'i sga ni ma rig pa dang sbyar te /
translated: It is also innate and imputed.üîΩAlso refers to ignorance.

original: ma rig pa de'ang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma rig pa de'ang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that ignorance is also.

original: de la ma rig pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of ignorance:

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i ma rig pa dang / yongs su brtags pa'i ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i ma rig pa dang / yongs su brtags pa'i ma rig pa'o //
translated: innate ignorance and postulating ignorance.

original: de la nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mi ldan zhing ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i ma rig pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mi ldan zhing ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i ma rig pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Among them, the ignorance that is not associated with other afflictions and is not mixed is called innate ignorance.

original: de 'ang las dang 'bras bu dang bden pa dang dkon mchog rnams yod par khong du ma chud cing mi shes pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de 'ang las dang 'bras bu dang bden pa dang dkon mchog rnams yod par khong du ma chud cing mi shes pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, not understanding and not knowing that actions, results, the truths, and the jewels exist is called innate ignorance.

original: the tshom dang / log pa'i lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs bsnyems pa dang / 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba la sogs pa nyon mongs pa gzhan dang 'dris shing 'grogs pa'i ma rig pa ni yongs su brtags pa'i ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: the tshom dang / log pa'i lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs bsnyems pa dang / 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba la sogs pa nyon mongs pa gzhan dang 'dris shing 'grogs pa'i ma rig pa ni yongs su brtags pa'i ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The ignorance that is familiar with and associated with other afflictions such as doubt, wrong views, pride in discipline and ritual, attachment, anger, and so on is called postulating ignorance.

original: de la de bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba la sogs pa yod dam med snyam du yid gnyis za ba ni the tshom dang 'dres pa'i ma rig pa ste /
analyzed: de la de bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba la sogs pa yod dam med snyam du yid gnyis za ba ni the tshom dang 'dres pa'i ma rig pa ste /
translated: Doubt is ignorance mixed with doubt, thinking, ‚ÄúIs there or is there not merit, demerit, or stable karma?‚Äù

original: de'ang yongs su brtags pa'i ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'ang yongs su brtags pa'i ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is also called imagined ignorance.

original: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i las rnams med do zhes skur pa 'debs pa ni log pa'i lta ba dang 'dres pa'i ma rig pa ste /
analyzed: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i las rnams med do zhes skur pa 'debs pa ni log pa'i lta ba dang 'dres pa'i ma rig pa ste /
translated: Denial is ignorance mixed with wrong views, thinking, ‚ÄúMeritorious, demeritorious, and stable karma do not exist.‚Äù

original: de yang yongs su brtags pa'i ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang yongs su brtags pa'i ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is also called imagined ignorance.

original: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa ni bsod nams kyi las yin na /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa ni bsod nams kyi las yin na /
translated: Generosity, moral discipline, and so on are meritorious karma.

original: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la bsod nams ma yin par 'du shes shing bsod nams ma yin pa phyugs bsad cing sbyin sreg byed pa dang / me'i nang du lus 'dor ba la sogs la bsod nams su 'du shes nas phyugs bsad de sbyin sred byas pa dang lus mer bor nas mtho ris su skye'o zhes rtog pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la bsod nams ma yin par 'du shes shing bsod nams ma yin pa phyugs bsad cing sbyin sreg byed pa dang / me'i nang du lus 'dor ba la sogs la bsod nams su 'du shes nas phyugs bsad de sbyin sred byas pa dang lus mer bor nas mtho ris su skye'o zhes rtog pa dang /
translated: The third is to perceive virtue as nonvirtue, as when one thinks that by killing cattle and performing the fire sacrifice and by throwing oneself into the fire, one will be reborn in the higher realms.

original: tshul khrims la brten nas 'phags pa'i lam bsgoms pas thar par gyur pa yin na /
analyzed: tshul khrims la brten nas 'phags pa'i lam bsgoms pas thar par gyur pa yin na /
translated: The fourth is to perceive virtue as nonvirtue, as when one thinks that by practicing the path of the ƒÅryas on the basis of ethical discipline, one will attain liberation.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs nyi tshe can gyis thar par 'gyur ro zhes lta ba ni /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs nyi tshe can gyis thar par 'gyur ro zhes lta ba ni /
translated: The view that one attains liberation through mere ethical discipline and ritual is

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa dang ldan pa'i ma rig pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa dang ldan pa'i ma rig pa ste /
translated: the ignorance of being proud of one‚Äôs ethical discipline and ritual.

original: de'ang yongs su brtags pa'i ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'ang yongs su brtags pa'i ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is also called the ignorance of imputation.

original: 'gro ba bzang po tshul du shis pa la brtags nas 'dod chags skye ba dang / dgra la brtags nas zhe sdang skye ba yang yongs su @64a * //
analyzed: 'gro ba bzang po tshul du shis pa la brtags nas 'dod chags skye ba dang / dgra la brtags nas zhe sdang skye ba yang yongs su @64a * //
translated: Attachment arises when one examines a good-looking person, and aversion arises when one examines an enemy.

original: brtags pa'i ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brtags pa'i ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the ignorance that consists in thorough investigation.

original: ma rig pa'i las kyang rnam pa gsum byed de /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i las kyang rnam pa gsum byed de /
translated: Ignorance also performs three functions:

original: log par gtan la 'bebs pa dang the tshom skyed pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa skye ba'i gnas sbyin pa'i las can no //
analyzed: log par gtan la 'bebs pa dang the tshom skyed pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa skye ba'i gnas sbyin pa'i las can no //
translated: It functions to misapprehend, to generate doubt, and to provide a basis for the origination of the afflictions.

original: de la log par gtan la 'bebs ba ni ma rig pa'i dbang gis mi rtag pa la rtag par 'dzin pa dang bdag med pa la bdag tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la log par gtan la 'bebs ba ni ma rig pa'i dbang gis mi rtag pa la rtag par 'dzin pa dang bdag med pa la bdag tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Misapprehension is due to the influence of ignorance, because one grasps the impermanent as permanent and that which is without a self as having a self.

original: the tshom skyed pa ni ma rig pa'i dbang gis na las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa yod pa zhig gam med pa zhig ces yid gnyis skye bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: the tshom skyed pa ni ma rig pa'i dbang gis na las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa yod pa zhig gam med pa zhig ces yid gnyis skye bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Doubt is generated due to the influence of ignorance, because one is uncertain whether or not karma and its results exist.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa skye ba'i rten byed pa ni ma rig pa yod pa las 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang nyon mongs pa gzhan byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa skye ba'i rten byed pa ni ma rig pa yod pa las 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang nyon mongs pa gzhan byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the basis for the arising of the afflictions because desire, hatred, and other afflictions arise when there is ignorance.

original: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum ni 'dod pa'i khams nyid na ldan gyi /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum ni 'dod pa'i khams nyid na ldan gyi /
translated: The three roots of nonvirtue are present in the desire realm alone,

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dang mi ldan par bstan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i ma rig pa de dag ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dang mi ldan par bstan pa'i phyir ro // 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i ma rig pa de dag ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum ste /
translated: because it is taught that they are not present in the form and formless realms.üîΩDesire realm attachment, anger, and ignorance are the three roots of nonvirtue.

original: chags pa ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang zhe sdang dang gti mug go zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: chags pa ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang zhe sdang dang gti mug go zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Attachment, aversion, and delusion are the three roots of nonvirtue.

original: 'dod pa na spyod ces bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod ces bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Desire realm means belonging to the desire realm.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa'i 'dod chags dang / 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa'i khong khro ba dang / 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa'i ma rig pa de dag gsum la mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa'i 'dod chags dang / 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa'i khong khro ba dang / 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa'i ma rig pa de dag gsum la mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum zhes bya ste /
translated: The three roots of nonvirtue are the three: attachment belonging to the desire realm, anger belonging to the desire realm and ignorance belonging to the desire realm.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'dod chags la ni chags pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'dod chags la ni chags pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Attachment belonging to the desire realm is called the root of nonvirtue of attachment.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i khong khro ba la ni zhe sdang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i khong khro ba la ni zhe sdang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Anger belonging to the desire realm is called the root of nonvirtue of aversion.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i ma rig pa la ni gti mug mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i ma rig pa la ni gti mug mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Ignorance belonging to the desire realm is called the root of nonvirtue of delusion.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'dod chags ba dang khong khro ba dang ma rig pa de dag rang nyid kyang mi dge ba yin la srog gcod pa la sogs pa ni dge ba gzhan gyi yang rgyu byed pas mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'dod chags ba dang khong khro ba dang ma rig pa de dag rang nyid kyang mi dge ba yin la srog gcod pa la sogs pa ni dge ba gzhan gyi yang rgyu byed pas mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
translated: These three attachment, anger and ignorance belonging to the desire realm are themselves nonvirtuous and they also act as the cause of other nonvirtuous actions such as taking life and so on. Therefore they are called roots of nonvirtue.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang ma rig pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i yon tan la kha phyir bltas pa ma yin gyi kha nang du bltas shing de dag gi nyon mongs pa ni srog gcod ba la sogs pa
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang ma rig pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i yon tan la kha phyir bltas pa ma yin gyi kha nang du bltas shing de dag gi nyon mongs pa ni srog gcod ba la sogs pa
translated: Afflictions such as attachment and ignorance of the form and formless realms are not directed outward to sense objects, but are directed inward.üîΩThey do not act as causes of other nonvirtuous actions such as killing.

original: mi dge ba gzhan gyi rgyu yang mi byed pas na mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes mi bya'i /
analyzed: mi dge ba gzhan gyi rgyu yang mi byed pas na mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes mi bya'i /
translated: Therefore they are not called roots of nonvirtue.

original: gzugs dang gzugs @64b med pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa thams cad la lung du mi ston pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs @64b med pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa thams cad la lung du mi ston pa zhes bya'o //
translated: All afflictions of the form and formless realms are called neutral.

original: lta ba'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lta ba'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain the nature of view,

original: lta ba gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: lta ba gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: it asks, ‚ÄúWhat is view?‚Äù

original: lta ba'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: lta ba'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature and definition of view?‚Äù

original: de la shes rab kyis 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig ces rnam par rtog cing dpyod pa'i bdag mtshan nyid la lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la shes rab kyis 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig ces rnam par rtog cing dpyod pa'i bdag mtshan nyid la lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: View that analyzes and conceives the self to have this or that attribute is called the view of attributes.

original: de'ang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de'ang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It has three types:

original: 'jig rten gyi yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / zag pa med pa'i lta ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / zag pa med pa'i lta ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: The worldly right view, the uncontaminated view, and the view with afflictions.

original: de la yang las kyi 'bras bu yod /
analyzed: de la yang las kyi 'bras bu yod /
translated: The view that karma and its effects exist,

original: tshe 'di yod /
analyzed: tshe 'di yod /
translated: that this life exists,

original: tshe phyi ma yod ces lta ba ni 'jig rten gyi yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: tshe phyi ma yod ces lta ba ni 'jig rten gyi yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o ;
translated: and that the next life exists is called the worldly right view.

original: /'phags pa rnams gang zag dang chos la bdag med par lta ba ni zag pa med pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: /'phags pa rnams gang zag dang chos la bdag med par lta ba ni zag pa med pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //

analyzed: de la sbyin pa med /

original: sbyin sreg med /
analyzed: sbyin sreg med /

analyzed: las de dag gi 'bras bu bde ba dang sdug bsngal myong ba med ces smra ba ni 'bras bu la skur ba zhes bya'o //

original: 'jig rten 'di med /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di med /
translated: Denial of action is the assertion, ‚ÄúThere is no this world,

analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol med /

original: pha med / ma med /
analyzed: pha med / ma med /

analyzed: sems can rdzus te skye ba med ces smra ba ni byed pa la skur pa ste /

original: de la byed pa yang rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de la byed pa yang rnam pa gsum mo //

original: byed pa rnam pa gsum ni 'jig rten gzhan du 'gro bar byed pa dang / sa bon 'jog par byed pa dang / mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa rnam pa gsum ni 'jig rten gzhan du 'gro bar byed pa dang / sa bon 'jog par byed pa dang / mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: The three kinds of action are: action that causes one to go to another world, action that plants the seed, and action that connects.

original: 'jig rten gzhan du 'gro bar byed pa ni tshe 'di nas shi 'phos nas tshes phyi mar skye bar byed pa ste /üîΩ'jig rten 'di med /
analyzed: 'jig rten gzhan du 'gro bar byed pa ni tshe 'di nas shi 'phos nas tshes phyi mar skye bar byed pa ste / 'jig rten 'di med /
translated: Action that causes one to go to another world is that which causes one to be born in the next life after death in this life.

original: 'jig rten phyi ma med ces smra bas 'jig rten gzhan du 'gro bar byed pa la skur pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten phyi ma med ces smra bas 'jig rten gzhan du 'gro bar byed pa la skur pa'o //
translated: Saying, ‚ÄúThere is no this world,‚Äù and ‚ÄúThere is no other world,‚Äù denies action that causes one to go to another world.

original: sa bon 'jog par byed pa ni @66b lus kyi rgyu pha'i khu ba dang ma'i mi gtsang ba 'jog par byed pa ste /
analyzed: sa bon 'jog par byed pa ni @66b lus kyi rgyu pha'i khu ba dang ma'i mi gtsang ba 'jog par byed pa ste /

original: pha med ma med ces smra bas ni sa bon 'jog par byed pa la skur pa'o //
analyzed: pha med ma med ces smra bas ni sa bon 'jog par byed pa la skur pa'o //
translated: Saying, ‚ÄúThere is no father,‚Äù and ‚ÄúThere is no mother,‚Äù denies action that plants the seed.

original: mtshams sbyor bar byed ba ni sems can gang dag padmo la sogs ba'i nang du rdzus te skyes pa'am /
analyzed: mtshams sbyor bar byed ba ni sems can gang dag padmo la sogs ba'i nang du rdzus te skyes pa'am /
translated: Those who are born supernaturally in the womb of a lotus, etc.

original: rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du 'phos pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du 'phos pa ste /
translated: or those whose consciousnesses enter the mother's womb are those who are born supernaturally.

original: sems can rdzus te skyes pa med ces smra bas ni mtshams sbyor bar byed pa la skur pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rdzus te skyes pa med ces smra bas ni mtshams sbyor bar byed pa la skur pa'o //
translated: Those who say that there are no beings born supernaturally deny the existence of those who are born supernaturally.

original: 'jig rten na dgra bcom pa med ces smra ba ni yod pa'i dngos po chud za bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten na dgra bcom pa med ces smra ba ni yod pa'i dngos po chud za bar byed pa ste /
translated: Those who say that there are no arhats in the world destroy the existence of what does exist.

original: de ltar las dang 'bras bu dang byed pa dang dgra bcom pa la sogs pa med par lta ba la log pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar las dang 'bras bu dang byed pa dang dgra bcom pa la sogs pa med par lta ba la log pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the view that there is no karma, no result, no agent, no arhat, etc. is called a wrong view.

original: yang na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la skur pa ste /
analyzed: yang na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la skur pa ste /
translated: Or, it is a denial of the four noble truths.

original: kun 'byung med ces smra ba ni rgyu la skur pa'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung med ces smra ba ni rgyu la skur pa'o //
translated: Those who say that there is no origination deny cause.

original: sdug bsngal med ces smra ba ni 'bras bu la skur pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal med ces smra ba ni 'bras bu la skur pa'o //
translated: Those who say that there is no suffering deny result.

original: lam med ces zer ba ni byed pa la skur pa'o //
analyzed: lam med ces zer ba ni byed pa la skur pa'o //
translated: Those who say that there is no path deny action.

original: 'gog pa med ces zer ba ni yod pa'i dngos po 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa med ces zer ba ni yod pa'i dngos po 'jig pa'o //
translated: Those who say that there is no cessation destroy the existence of what does exist.

original: yang na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis nyon mongs pa dang las dang sdug bsngal gsum du gzhag go //
analyzed: yang na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis nyon mongs pa dang las dang sdug bsngal gsum du gzhag go //

original: de la ma rig pa dang sred pa dang len pa gsum ni nyon mongs pa'i yan lag tu gzhag ste /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa dang sred pa dang len pa gsum ni nyon mongs pa'i yan lag tu gzhag ste /
translated: Among these, the three‚Äîignorance, craving, and appropriation‚Äîare posited as the factors of affliction.

original: de med ces smra ba ni rgyu la skur pa'o //
analyzed: de med ces smra ba ni rgyu la skur pa'o //
translated: To say that they do not exist is to deny the cause.

original: rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang reg pa dang tshor ba dang skye ba dang rga shi dang bdun ni sdug bsngal gyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang reg pa dang tshor ba dang skye ba dang rga shi dang bdun ni sdug bsngal gyi yan lag ste /
translated: The seven‚Äîconsciousness, name and form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, birth, and aging and death‚Äîare posited as the factors of suffering.

original: de med ces smra ba ni 'bras bu la skur pa'o //
analyzed: de med ces smra ba ni 'bras bu la skur pa'o //

original: 'du byed dang srid pa gnyis ni las kyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: 'du byed dang srid pa gnyis ni las kyi yan lag ste /
translated: The two‚Äîformations and becoming‚Äîare posited as the factors of action.

original: de med ces smra ba ni byed pa la skur pa'o //
analyzed: de med ces smra ba ni byed pa la skur pa'o //
translated: To say that they do not exist is to deny activity.

original: ma rig pa 'gags na rig pa skye bar 'gyur ba yin na de dag med ces smra ba ni yod pa'i dngos po 'jig par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gags na rig pa skye bar 'gyur ba yin na de dag med ces smra ba ni yod pa'i dngos po 'jig par byed pa'o //
translated: If ignorance ceases, then consciousness arises, but to say that they do not exist is to destroy that which exists.

original: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag pa nas /
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag pa nas /
translated: When ignorance ceases, formations cease, and so on up to:

original: skye ba 'gags pas rga shi 'gags pa'i bar du ma rig pa 'gags na rig pa skye bar 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: skye ba 'gags pas rga shi 'gags pa'i bar du ma rig pa 'gags na rig pa skye bar 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: If ignorance ceases, then consciousness arises.

original: de dag med ces smra ba ni yod pa'i dngos po 'jig par byed pa'o //üîΩgti mug dang ldan zhing rmongs pa dang bcas pa rnams la ni thams cad med do zhes skur pa 'debs pa 'byung gi //
analyzed: de dag med ces smra ba ni yod pa'i dngos po 'jig par byed pa'o // gti mug dang ldan zhing rmongs pa dang bcas pa rnams la ni thams cad med do zhes skur pa 'debs pa 'byung gi //
translated: To say that they do not exist is to destroy existent things.üîΩFor those who are ignorant and confused, the nihilistic view arises that ‚Äúall does not exist.‚Äù

original: rmongs pa med cing shes rab dang ldan pa rnams la thams cad med do zhes skur pa 'debs pa mi 'byung bas log pa'i lta ba 'di gti mug dang ldan pa dang yod pa'i chos rnams la med do zhes phyin ci @67a * //
analyzed: rmongs pa med cing shes rab dang ldan pa rnams la thams cad med do zhes skur pa 'debs pa mi 'byung bas log pa'i lta ba 'di gti mug dang ldan pa dang yod pa'i chos rnams la med do zhes phyin ci @67a * //
translated: But for those who are not confused and are endowed with wisdom, the nihilistic view that ‚Äúall does not exist‚Äù does not arise.

original: log tu bzung bas phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i phyir shes rab nyon mongs pa can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: log tu bzung bas phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i phyir shes rab nyon mongs pa can zhes bya'o //
translated: This wrong view is called ‚Äúafflicted wisdom‚Äù because it is endowed with confusion and because it is a wrong apprehension of existent things as nonexistent.

original: smras pa / 'jig tshogs su lta ba yang bdag dang bdag gi med pa la bdag dang bdag gir phyin ci log tu lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin pa yang rtag pa dang chad pa med pa la rtag pa dang chad pa phyin ci log tu lta bas na lta ba lnga char yang log pa'i lta ba yin pa las ci'i phyir med par lta ba 'ba' zhig la log pa'i lta ba zhes btags
analyzed: smras pa / 'jig tshogs su lta ba yang bdag dang bdag gi med pa la bdag dang bdag gir phyin ci log tu lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin pa yang rtag pa dang chad pa med pa la rtag pa dang chad pa phyin ci log tu lta bas na lta ba lnga char yang log pa'i lta ba yin pa las ci'i phyir med par lta ba 'ba' zhig la log pa'i lta ba zhes btags
translated: Objection: The view of the transitory collection is the distorted view that the self and entities connected to the self exist, although they do not exist. Also, the view grasping an extreme is the distorted view that things are permanent or annihilated, although they are not permanent or annihilated. Therefore, all five views are distorted views. Why is only the view of nonexistence called a distorted view?

original: pa lta ba gzhan la log pa'i lta ba zhes mi bya /
analyzed: pa lta ba gzhan la log pa'i lta ba zhes mi bya /
translated: Why are the other views not called distorted views?

original: smras pa / shin tu log par lta ba la zhugs pa'i lta ba dang / shin tu sdig pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba 'ga' zhig la lta ba 'ba' zhig la log pa'i lta ba zhes bya ba'i lta ba gzhan la log pa'i lta ba zhes mi bya ste /
analyzed: smras pa / shin tu log par lta ba la zhugs pa'i lta ba dang / shin tu sdig pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba 'ga' zhig la lta ba 'ba' zhig la log pa'i lta ba zhes bya ba'i lta ba gzhan la log pa'i lta ba zhes mi bya ste /
translated: Response: The view that engages in a very distorted way and the view that is the cause of some very negative actions is called a distorted view. The other views are not called distorted views.

original: dper na mar gyi dri mi zhim pa dang gdol bu sdig can zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mar gyi dri mi zhim pa dang gdol bu sdig can zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, the smell of butter is foul and a ca·πá·∏çƒÅla is a sinful person.

original: 'di ltar mar kun kyang dri mi zhim pa yin mod kyi gang lhag par dri mi zhim pa de la mar dri mi zhim pa zhes bya ba dang / gdol bu kun kyang sdig pa'i las can yin mod kyi gang lhag par gzhan pas gsad gcad la dga' ba'i gdol bu la gdol bu sdig can zhes bya ba bzhin du lta ba gzhan yang log par lta ba yin mod kyi de dag phung po lnga la medüîΩpar skur pa mi 'debs shing de las lhag par bdag la sogs pa yod par sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par zhugs pa yin pas shin tu log par zhugs pa yang ma yin la shin tu sdig pa'i rgyu byed pa yang ma yin bas lta ba gzhan la log
analyzed: 'di ltar mar kun kyang dri mi zhim pa yin mod kyi gang lhag par dri mi zhim pa de la mar dri mi zhim pa zhes bya ba dang / gdol bu kun kyang sdig pa'i las can yin mod kyi gang lhag par gzhan pas gsad gcad la dga' ba'i gdol bu la gdol bu sdig can zhes bya ba bzhin du lta ba gzhan yang log par lta ba yin mod kyi de dag phung po lnga la med par skur pa mi 'debs shing de las lhag par bdag la sogs pa yod par sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par zhugs pa yin pas shin tu log par zhugs pa yang ma yin la shin tu sdig pa'i rgyu byed pa yang ma yin bas lta ba gzhan la log
translated: Thus, although all feces are foul smelling, that which is especially foul smelling is called feces.

original: pa'i lta ba zhes ma btags kyi /
analyzed: pa'i lta ba zhes ma btags kyi /
translated: And just as all untouchables have sinful karma, but the untouchable who especially delights in killing and cutting others is called a sinful untouchable, although other views are wrong views, they are not called wrong views because they do not engage in the five aggregates as nonexistent, they engage in the superimposition that the self and so on exist and they are not extremely wrong views and they do not create extremely sinful causes.

original: thams cad med par lta ba 'di ni thams cad med do zhes skur ba'i rnam par zhugs pas shin tu log par zhugs pa dang / shin tu log pa sdig pa'i rgyu byed pa'i phyir log par lta ba zhes btags so //
analyzed: thams cad med par lta ba 'di ni thams cad med do zhes skur ba'i rnam par zhugs pas shin tu log par zhugs pa dang / shin tu log pa sdig pa'i rgyu byed pa'i phyir log par lta ba zhes btags so //
translated: This view of the non-existence of everything is called wrong view because it is extremely erroneous, since it is the denial that everything exists, and because it is the cause of extremely erroneous and sinful action.

original: 'di'i las ni dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod cing mi dge ba'i rtsa bskyed 'phel bar byed ba'i rten byed ba ste /
analyzed: 'di'i las ni dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod cing mi dge ba'i rtsa bskyed 'phel bar byed ba'i rten byed ba ste /
translated: Its action is to serve as the basis for the cutting off of the roots of virtue and for the increase and growth of the roots of nonvirtue.

original: log par lta ba skyes na sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa thams cad kyang med par 'gyur la mi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

translated: When wrong view arises, all the roots of virtue that had been accumulated previously are destroyed, and all the roots of nonvirtue increase and grow.

original: de la lta ba bsnyems pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lta ba bsnyems pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the nature of the haughtiness of views,

analyzed: lta ba bsnyems ba gang zhen zhes dris te /

analyzed: lta ba bsnyems pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature and characteristic of the haughtiness of views?‚Äù

original: lan du / lta ba rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid dang / de'i gnas phung po @67b rnams la mchog dam pa gtso bor yang dag par rjes su lta ba ste /
analyzed: lan du / lta ba rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid dang / de'i gnas phung po @67b rnams la mchog dam pa gtso bor yang dag par rjes su lta ba ste /
translated: It is the view that those three types of views and the aggregates that are their basis are supreme, excellent, and foremost.

original: gang shes rab nyon mongs pa can no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang shes rab nyon mongs pa can no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said to be an afflicted form of wisdom.

original: lta ba rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid ces bya ba ni gong gong du bshad pa'i 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang log par lta ba ste gsum mo //üîΩde'i gnas phung po rnams la zhes bya ba ni lta ba gsum po de dag kyang phung po lnga la dmigs pa las 'byung bas lta ba gsum 'byung ba'i rgyu phung po lnga yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid ces bya ba ni gong gong du bshad pa'i 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang log par lta ba ste gsum mo // de'i gnas phung po rnams la zhes bya ba ni lta ba gsum po de dag kyang phung po lnga la dmigs pa las 'byung bas lta ba gsum 'byung ba'i rgyu phung po lnga yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those three types of views are the three views that were previously explained: the view of the transitory collection, extreme views, and wrong views.üîΩThe aggregates that are their basis are the five aggregates that are the cause from which those three views arise, because the five aggregates are the basis for the arising of those three views.

original: phung po lnga ni de'i gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga ni de'i gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: The five aggregates are called ‚Äútheir basis‚Äù because the five aggregates are the cause from which those three views arise.

original: mchog dang dam pa dang gtso bo'i don gsum don gcig tu 'dra mod kyi gcig gis gcig bshad pa lta bur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mchog dang dam pa dang gtso bo'i don gsum don gcig tu 'dra mod kyi gcig gis gcig bshad pa lta bur rig par bya ste /
translated: Although the three terms‚Äîsupreme, excellent, and foremost‚Äîhave the same meaning, they should be understood to be like synonyms.

original: ji ltar mchog ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar mchog ce na /
translated: How is it supreme?

original: dam pa'i phyir mchog go //
analyzed: dam pa'i phyir mchog go //
translated: It is supreme because it is the best.

original: ci ltar dam pa zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar dam pa zhe na /
translated: How is it the best?

original: gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir dam pa'o zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir dam pa'o zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: It is the best because it is the most excellent.

original: yang dag par rjes su lta ba ni 'di kho na yin no zhes nges par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su lta ba ni 'di kho na yin no zhes nges par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is the grasping of the view that this alone is true.

original: don du na 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba gsum la lta ba 'di dag ni mchog dam pa'i gtso bo yin no zhes sems nges par 'dzin pa dang / lta ba de dag skye ba'i gnas kyi phung po lnga la yang phung po lnga po 'di dag ni mchog dam pa gtso bo yin no zhes nges par 'dzin par byed pa la lta ba bsnyems pa zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: don du na 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba gsum la lta ba 'di dag ni mchog dam pa'i gtso bo yin no zhes sems nges par 'dzin pa dang / lta ba de dag skye ba'i gnas kyi phung po lnga la yang phung po lnga po 'di dag ni mchog dam pa gtso bo yin no zhes nges par 'dzin par byed pa la lta ba bsnyems pa zhes bya'o ;
translated: In fact, it is the grasping of the view that these three views‚Äîthe view of the transitory collection, extreme views, and wrong views‚Äîare supreme, the best, and the most excellent. It is also the grasping of the view that the five aggregates that are the basis for the arising of those views are supreme, the best, and the most excellent.

original: / rmongs pa dang bcas shing gti mug dang ldan pa rnams la ni lta ba ngan pa gsum dang / de'i gnas kyi phung po la mchog dang dam par 'dzin pa 'byung gi //

translated: For those who are confused and ignorant, the three bad views arise and the grasping at the aggregates that are their basis as supreme and pure.

original: rmongs pa med cing shes rab can rnams la lta ba ngan pa dang / de'i gnas kyi phung po la mchog dang dam par 'dzin pa mi 'byung bas lta ba bsnyems pa 'di yang gti mug dang ldan pa dang / mchog ma yin pa'i chos la mchog tu phyin ci log tu 'dzin pas phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i phyir shes rab nyon mongs pa can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa med cing shes rab can rnams la lta ba ngan pa dang / de'i gnas kyi phung po la mchog dang dam par 'dzin pa mi 'byung bas lta ba bsnyems pa 'di yang gti mug dang ldan pa dang / mchog ma yin pa'i chos la mchog tu phyin ci log tu 'dzin pas phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i phyir shes rab nyon mongs pa can zhes bya'o //
translated: But for those who are not confused and are wise, the bad views and the grasping at the aggregates that are their basis as supreme and pure do not arise. original: de'i las kyang lta ba ngan pa la mngon par zhen pa'i rten byed pa ste /
analyzed: de'i las kyang lta ba ngan pa la mngon par zhen pa'i rten byed pa ste /
translated: And its action is to support the attachment to bad views.

original: lta ba ngan pa la mngon par zhen pa ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang log pa'i lta ba la yon tan du gzung bas de mi gtong bar byed pas na lta ba ngan ba la mngon par zhen pa'i rten byed pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba ngan pa la mngon par zhen pa ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang log pa'i lta ba la yon tan du gzung bas de mi gtong bar byed pas na lta ba ngan ba la mngon par zhen pa'i rten byed pa'o //
translated: Clinging to bad views is the support for the view of the perishing aggregates, the view of holding a rule or ritual as paramount, and the false view, because it causes one not to give up those views by holding them to be virtues.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: To explain the nature of pride in morality and religious austerities, he asks:

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa gang @68a * //üîΩzhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa gang @68a * // zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: What is pride in morality and religious austerities?

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is: What is the nature and characteristic of pride in morality and religious austerities?

original: de'i lan du tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang / de'i gnas kyi phung po rnams la dag pa dang grol ba dang / 'byung bar yang dag par rjes su lta ba ste ;
analyzed: de'i lan du tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang / de'i gnas kyi phung po rnams la dag pa dang grol ba dang / 'byung bar yang dag par rjes su lta ba ste ;
translated: The answer is: It is the view that morality, religious austerities, and the aggregates that are their basis are pure, free, and liberating.

original: gang shes rab nyon mongs pa can no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang shes rab nyon mongs pa can no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is an afflicted form of wisdom.

original: de la srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i las byed pa las slar ldog pa ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: de la srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i las byed pa las slar ldog pa ni tshul khrims so //
translated: Morality is the turning away from the performance of evil actions such as killing.

original: mgo bregs pa dang / sgren mor 'phyan pa la sogs pa'i lus kyi cha lugs 'dzin pa dang / kha zas gcod pa dang / ba lang dang khyi la sogs pa'i spyod lam 'dzin pa ni brtul zhugs so //
analyzed: mgo bregs pa dang / sgren mor 'phyan pa la sogs pa'i lus kyi cha lugs 'dzin pa dang / kha zas gcod pa dang / ba lang dang khyi la sogs pa'i spyod lam 'dzin pa ni brtul zhugs so //
translated: Asceticism is the adoption of a physical appearance such as shaving one's head, going naked, and so on, the fasting, and the adoption of the behavior of cows, dogs, and so on.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyang phung po lnga la brten nas 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyang phung po lnga la brten nas 'byung ba ste /
translated: Morality and asceticism also arise in dependence on the five aggregates.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa 'byung ba'i rgyu phung po lnga yin pas na phung po lnga ni de'i gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa 'byung ba'i rgyu phung po lnga yin pas na phung po lnga ni de'i gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: The five aggregates are called its basis because they are the cause of the arising of the pride of morality and asceticism.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang / de'i gnas kyi phung po la brten nas srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i sdig pa byas pa'i las sbyong zhing dag par 'gyur ro zhes 'dzin pa ni yang dag par rjes su lta ba'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang / de'i gnas kyi phung po la brten nas srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i sdig pa byas pa'i las sbyong zhing dag par 'gyur ro zhes 'dzin pa ni yang dag par rjes su lta ba'o //
translated: The correct view is the belief that one's sins such as killing are purified and cleansed by means of morality and asceticism and their basis, the five aggregates.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang phung po 'dis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bcing ba las grol bar byed do zhes 'dzin pa ni grol bar yang dag par rjes su lta ba'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang phung po 'dis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bcing ba las grol bar byed do zhes 'dzin pa ni grol bar yang dag par rjes su lta ba'o //
translated: The view that one is liberated is the view that one is liberated from the bonds of defilements such as attachment by means of this morality, ritual and the aggregates.üîΩThe view that one emerges is the view that one emerges from cyclic existence and obtains the path of nirvana by means of this morality, ritual and the aggregates that are its basis.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang de'i gnas kyi phung po 'dis 'khor ba las 'byung zhing mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam thob par byed do zhes 'dzin pa ni 'byung bar yang dag par rjes su lta ba zhes bya ste /

original: don dun tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang / de'i gnas kyi phung po la brten nas 'khor ba las 'byung zhing mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob po zhes 'dzin pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa zhes bya'o //

original: gti mug dang ldan zhing rmongs pa dang bcas pa rnams la tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs tsam gyis thar bar 'gyur zhes 'dzin pa 'byung gi rmongs pa med cing shes rab rnams la tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs tsam gyis thar par 'gyur zhes 'dzin pa mi 'byung bas
analyzed: gti mug dang ldan zhing rmongs pa dang bcas pa rnams la tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs tsam gyis thar bar 'gyur zhes 'dzin pa 'byung gi rmongs pa med cing shes rab rnams la tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs tsam gyis thar par 'gyur zhes 'dzin pa mi 'byung bas
translated: Those who are ignorant and confused grasp that liberation is through mere discipline and ritual. But for those who are not confused and have wisdom, the view that liberation is through mere discipline and ritual does not arise.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa 'di gti mug dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir shes rab nyon mongs pa can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa 'di gti mug dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir shes rab nyon mongs pa can zhes bya'o //
translated: Since this pride in discipline and ritual is associated with ignorance, it is called afflicted wisdom.

original: smras pa / bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab @68b kyi gzhung las tshul khrims la brten nas ting nge 'dzin bsgoms te shes rab bskyed nas rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: smras pa / bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab @68b kyi gzhung las tshul khrims la brten nas ting nge 'dzin bsgoms te shes rab bskyed nas rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pas /
translated: Objection: The scriptures of the Bhagavat state that one meditates on concentration in dependence on discipline, generates wisdom and becomes liberated.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs ni dag pa'i rgyu yin na ci'i phyir tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa zhes bya /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs ni dag pa'i rgyu yin na ci'i phyir tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa zhes bya /
translated: Since discipline and ritual are the cause of purity, why is it called pride in discipline and ritual?

original: smras pa / yang dag pa'i lta ba dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs ni thar pa'i rgyur 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: smras pa / yang dag pa'i lta ba dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs ni thar pa'i rgyur 'gyur bas na /
translated: He replied: ‚ÄúMorality and ritual are causes of liberation when they are endowed with right view.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa zhes mi bya'i //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa zhes mi bya'i //
translated: Therefore, they are not called ‚Äòconceit about morality and ritual.‚Äô

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba'am /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba'am /
translated: Morality and ritual that are seized by the view of the transitory collection,

original: mthar 'dzin par lta ba'am log par lta bas yongs su zin pa'i tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs ni thar pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur gyi bcings pa'i rgyur 'gyur bas na tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthar 'dzin par lta ba'am log par lta bas yongs su zin pa'i tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs ni thar pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur gyi bcings pa'i rgyur 'gyur bas na tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa zhes bya'o //
translated: or by the view of holding a rule or ritual as paramount, or by wrong views, are not causes of liberation, but are causes of bondage. Therefore, they are called ‚Äòconceit about morality and ritual.‚Äô

original: 'di'i las kyang lus sha thang chad pa'i 'bras bu don med par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'di'i las kyang lus sha thang chad pa'i 'bras bu don med par byed pa ste /
translated: Its effect is that one‚Äôs body becomes emaciated and one‚Äôs efforts are wasted.

original: lta ba log pa dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsrungs kyang thar pa thob par mi 'gyur bas na lus sha thang chad pa'i 'bras bu don med par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lta ba log pa dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsrungs kyang thar pa thob par mi 'gyur bas na lus sha thang chad pa'i 'bras bu don med par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Even if one observes morality and ritual while possessing wrong views, one will not attain liberation. Therefore, it is called ‚Äòone‚Äôs body becomes emaciated and one‚Äôs efforts are wasted.‚Äô

original: lta ba lnga po de dag las lta ba du zhig ni sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: lta ba lnga po de dag las lta ba du zhig ni sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin /
translated: From among these five views, how many have the nature of superimposition?

original: lta ba du zhig ni skur pa 'debs pa'i rang bzhin zhe na /
analyzed: lta ba du zhig ni skur pa 'debs pa'i rang bzhin zhe na /
translated: How many have the nature of denial?

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba las rtag par lta ba dang lta ba bsnyems pa dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa rnams ni sgro 'dogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba las rtag par lta ba dang lta ba bsnyems pa dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa rnams ni sgro 'dogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The views of the transitory collection and extreme views that are the view of permanence, the view of holding a view as paramount, and the view of holding ethics and religious rituals as paramount have the nature of superimposition.

original: log pa'i lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin pa las chad par lta ba ni skur ba 'debs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: log pa'i lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin pa las chad par lta ba ni skur ba 'debs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The view of annihilation that is a wrong view and extreme view has the nature of denial.

original: the tshom gyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: the tshom gyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain the nature of doubt,

original: the tshom gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: the tshom gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is doubt?‚Äù

original: the tshom gyi rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: the tshom gyi rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature and characteristics of doubt?‚Äù

original: lan du / bden pa la sogs pa la gang yid gnyis za ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lan du / bden pa la sogs pa la gang yid gnyis za ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response, it is said, ‚ÄúIt is uncertainty about the truths and so on.‚Äù

original: bden pa ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: bden pa ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa bzhi'o //
translated: The truths are the four truths of suffering and so on.

original: sogs ba'i sgras ni las dang 'bras bu dang / dkon mchog la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs ba'i sgras ni las dang 'bras bu dang / dkon mchog la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include action and result, the Three Jewels, and so on.

original: yid gnyis za ba ni lam kha brag dang rtsva'i mi la blo gnyis su 'jug pa bzhin du gang blo gnyis su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: yid gnyis za ba ni lam kha brag dang rtsva'i mi la blo gnyis su 'jug pa bzhin du gang blo gnyis su 'jug pa'o //
translated: Doubt is like a fork in the road or a scarecrow, in that it causes the mind to split in two.

original: dper na lam kha brag tu 'dug pa las ma du ra'i grong khyer du 'jug pa'i lam 'di yin nam 'on te 'di min zhes blo yid gnyis su 'jug pa yin pa dang / rtsva'i mi la 'di ni rtsva'i mi yin nam /
analyzed: dper na lam kha brag tu 'dug pa las ma du ra'i grong khyer du 'jug pa'i lam 'di yin nam 'on te 'di min zhes blo yid gnyis su 'jug pa yin pa dang / rtsva'i mi la 'di ni rtsva'i mi yin nam /
translated: For example, when you are at a fork in the road, you wonder, ‚ÄúIs this the road to the town of Madhura or not?‚Äù and your mind splits in two.

original: 'on te mi yang dag ba yin zhes @69a * //
analyzed: 'on te mi yang dag ba yin zhes @69a * //
translated: Or when you see a scarecrow, you wonder, ‚ÄúIs that a scarecrow or a real person?‚ÄùüîΩand your mind splits in two.

original: yid gnyis su 'jug pa bzhin du las dang 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang dkon mchog la sogs pa la de dag yod pa yin nam zhes blo gnyis su 'jug pa yin pa dang / 'on te med pa yin zhes blo gnyis su 'jug pa ni the tshom zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yid gnyis su 'jug pa bzhin du las dang 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang dkon mchog la sogs pa la de dag yod pa yin nam zhes blo gnyis su 'jug pa yin pa dang / 'on te med pa yin zhes blo gnyis su 'jug pa ni the tshom zhes bya'o //
translated: Similarly, when you wonder whether there is action and result, the truths, the Three Jewels, and so on, or whether there is not, this is called doubt.

original: de'i las kyang dge ba'i phyogs la mi 'jug pa'i rten byed pa ste /
analyzed: de'i las kyang dge ba'i phyogs la mi 'jug pa'i rten byed pa ste /
translated: Its function is to support not engaging in virtue.

original: the tshom yod na dge ba'i phyogs la rgyun du 'jug par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: the tshom yod na dge ba'i phyogs la rgyun du 'jug par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one has doubt, one does not continuously engage in virtue.

original: nyon mongs pa drug gi rang bzhin dang las bstan nas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa drug gi rang bzhin dang las bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the nature and function of the six afflictions,

original: da 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: da 'di dpyad par bya ste /
translated: now this should be analyzed.

original: nyon mongs pa drug las du zhig ni yongs su brtag ba 'ba' zhig yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa drug las du zhig ni yongs su brtag ba 'ba' zhig yin la /
translated: From among the six afflictions, how many are only imputed and

original: du zhig ni lhan cig skyes pa yang yin la yongs su brtag pa yang yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig ni lhan cig skyes pa yang yin la yongs su brtag pa yang yin zhe na /
translated: how many are also innate and imputed?

original: de dag gzhan la mnyan nas 'phral du bsams te skyes pa rnams ni yongs su brtags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gzhan la mnyan nas 'phral du bsams te skyes pa rnams ni yongs su brtags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those that arise from hearing about them from others and then immediately conceiving them are called imputed.

original: 'khor ba'i thog ma med ba nas rang bzhin gyis skyes yod pa ni lhan cig skyes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i thog ma med ba nas rang bzhin gyis skyes yod pa ni lhan cig skyes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those that have arisen naturally since beginningless cyclic existence are called innate.

original: de'i lan du nyon mongs pa de dag las lta ba 'og ma gsum dang / the tshom ni yongs su brtags pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i lan du nyon mongs pa de dag las lta ba 'og ma gsum dang / the tshom ni yongs su brtags pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In response to that, it says that from among those afflictions, the three lower views and doubt are imputed.

original: nyon mongs pa de dag las zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang / the tshom ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de dag las zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang / the tshom ste /
translated: From those afflictions means from attachment, anger, pride, ignorance, views, and doubt.

original: drug po de dag gi nang nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: drug po de dag gi nang nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: From among those afflictions means from among the six: desire, anger, pride, ignorance, view, and doubt.

original: lta ba 'og ma gsum dang zhes bya ba la lta ba lnga ste /
analyzed: lta ba 'og ma gsum dang zhes bya ba la lta ba lnga ste /
translated: From among those three views means from among the five views:

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba bsnyems pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs bsnyems pa dang lnga las log par lta ba dang / lta ba bsnyems pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba bsnyems pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs bsnyems pa dang lnga las log par lta ba dang / lta ba bsnyems pa dang /
translated: the view of the transitory collection, extreme view, wrong view, esteeming views, and esteeming morality and asceticism.

original: tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs bsnyems pa gsum la ni lta ba 'og ma gsum zhes bya ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs bsnyems pa gsum la ni lta ba 'og ma gsum zhes bya ste /
translated: From among those five, the three views are called the three lower views.

original: lta ba de gsum yang gzhan nas gtsug lag mnyan nas 'phral du bsams pa las 'byung bas na yongs su brtags pa las 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lta ba de gsum yang gzhan nas gtsug lag mnyan nas 'phral du bsams pa las 'byung bas na yongs su brtags pa las 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Those three views are called ‚Äúarisen from imagination‚Äù because they arise from listening to other scriptures and from reflection.

original: the tshom yang gzhan la gtsug lag mnyan nas 'phral du bsams pa las 'byung bas na yongs su brtags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: the tshom yang gzhan la gtsug lag mnyan nas 'phral du bsams pa las 'byung bas na yongs su brtags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Doubt also arises from hearing the scriptures from another and from reflection, so it is called ‚Äúinvestigated.‚Äù

original: lhag ma ni lhan cig skyes pa dang yongs su brtags pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lhag ma ni lhan cig skyes pa dang yongs su brtags pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The rest are innate and investigated.

original: lta ba gsum dang the tshom bshad pa'i lhag ma ni 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / ma rig pa dang / nga rgyal dang / 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par @69b lta ba rnams te /
analyzed: lta ba gsum dang the tshom bshad pa'i lhag ma ni 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / ma rig pa dang / nga rgyal dang / 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par @69b lta ba rnams te /
translated: The rest of the views and doubt explained above are attachment, anger, ignorance, pride, the afflicted view of the self, and the extreme view.

original: de dag la lhan cig skyes pa yod la yongs su brtas pa yang yod do //
analyzed: de dag la lhan cig skyes pa yod la yongs su brtas pa yang yod do //
translated: They are either innate or investigated.

original: de la 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas rang bzhin gyis yod pa'i 'dod chags pa dang khong khro ba dang / ma rigs pa dang / nga rgyal dang / 'jig tshegs su lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba rnams ni /
analyzed: de la 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas rang bzhin gyis yod pa'i 'dod chags pa dang khong khro ba dang / ma rigs pa dang / nga rgyal dang / 'jig tshegs su lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba rnams ni /
translated: Attachment, anger, ignorance, pride, the afflicted view of the self, and the extreme view that exist naturally from beginningless cyclic existence

original: lhan cig skyes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: are called ‚Äúinnate.‚Äù

original: gzhan las gtsug lag thos nas 'phral du bsams nas skyes pa'i 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang / ma rig pa dang / nga rgyal dang / 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba rnams ni yongs su brtags pa'o //
