analyzed: 'di yang 'dod chags kyi shas las byung bas na rdzas su med kyi btags par yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: Since this is born from a predominance of attachment, it should be understood to be a designation, not a substance.

original: 'di'i las kyang nyon mongs pa thams cad skye ba'i rten byed pa'i las can te /
analyzed: 'di'i las kyang nyon mongs pa thams cad skye ba'i rten byed pa'i las can te /
translated: Its action is to serve as the basis for the arising of all the mental afflictions.

original: rgyags pa'i rgyus nyon mongs pa drug dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gzhan yang skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyags pa'i rgyus nyon mongs pa drug dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gzhan yang skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the six afflictions and other secondary afflictions arise due to the cause of pride.

original: rnam par 'tshe ba'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir rnam par 'tshe ba gang zhe na zhes dris te /üîΩrnam par 'tshe ba'i rang @73a * //
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir rnam par 'tshe ba gang zhe na zhes dris te / rnam par 'tshe ba'i rang @73a * //
translated: In order to teach the nature of violence, he asks, ‚ÄúWhat is violence?‚ÄùüîΩWhat is the nature and characteristic of violence?

original: bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the question.

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: In response, he says:

original: sems can rnams la rnam par tho 'tshams pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sems can rnams la rnam par tho 'tshams pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is the harmfulness toward sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams kyi lus la sdug bsngal bskyed pa dang / yid mi bde ba skyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi lus la sdug bsngal bskyed pa dang / yid mi bde ba skyed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it generates suffering in the bodies of sentient beings and generates mental dissatisfaction,

original: sems can rnams la bcing ba dang / brdeg pa dang / bsdigs pa la sogs pa rnams gnod pa sna tshogs kyis tho 'tshams shing mi bde ba skyed par byed pa la rnam par 'tshe ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la bcing ba dang / brdeg pa dang / bsdigs pa la sogs pa rnams gnod pa sna tshogs kyis tho 'tshams shing mi bde ba skyed par byed pa la rnam par 'tshe ba zhes bya'o //
translated: binding, beating, threatening, and so on toward sentient beings, it is called violence, which generates various harms and unhappiness.

original: rnam par 'tshe ba de yang ming du na brtse ba med pa dang / snying rje med pa dang bzod pa med pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba de yang ming du na brtse ba med pa dang / snying rje med pa dang bzod pa med pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This violence is called lack of compassion, lack of mercy, and lack of forgiveness.

original: de gsum ni rnam par 'tshe ba'i ming gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: de gsum ni rnam par 'tshe ba'i ming gi rnam grangs so //
translated: These three are synonyms for violence.

original: yang na bdag nyid sems can rnams la bcing ba la sogs pa'i las byed pa ni brtse ba med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na bdag nyid sems can rnams la bcing ba la sogs pa'i las byed pa ni brtse ba med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, one does the action of binding and so on to sentient beings oneself, and this is called lack of compassion.

original: gzhan dag la sems can dag bcing du bcug pa la sogs pa byed du bcug pa ni snying rje med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la sems can dag bcing du bcug pa la sogs pa byed du bcug pa ni snying rje med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One makes others do the action of binding and so on to sentient beings, and this is called lack of mercy.

original: gzhan dag sems can la bcing ba'i las byed pa mthong na dga' zhing de la legs so zhes rjes su yi rang ba ni bzod pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag sems can la bcing ba'i las byed pa mthong na dga' zhing de la legs so zhes rjes su yi rang ba ni bzod pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One sees others doing the action of binding and so on to sentient beings and approves of it, saying, ‚ÄúExcellent!‚Äù and this is called lack of forgiveness.

original: 'di yang khong khro ba'i shas las byung bas na rdzas su med kyi btags par yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang khong khro ba'i shas las byung bas na rdzas su med kyi btags par yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is also not a substantial entity, but should be understood as a nominal entity, since it arises from the portion of anger.

original: 'di'i las ni sems can la sems rtsub par byed cing bcing ba dang rdeg pa la sogs pas sems can rnams la rnam par 'tshe ba'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di'i las ni sems can la sems rtsub par byed cing bcing ba dang rdeg pa la sogs pas sems can rnams la rnam par 'tshe ba'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to make the mind hard and to injure sentient beings by such actions as binding and beating.

original: ngo cha mi shes pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ngo cha mi shes pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the nature of shamelessness,

original: ngo tsha mi byed pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: ngo tsha mi byed pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: he asks, ‚ÄúWhat is shamelessness?‚Äù

original: ngo tsha mi shes pa'i rang bzhin dang / mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: ngo tsha mi shes pa'i rang bzhin dang / mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature and characteristic of shamelessness?‚Äù

original: de'i lan du kha na ma tho bas bdag la ngo mi tsha'o zhes bya ba smos te ;
analyzed: de'i lan du kha na ma tho bas bdag la ngo mi tsha'o zhes bya ba smos te ;
translated: In response, he says, ‚ÄúIt is not being ashamed of offenses.‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa dam pa rnams kyis smad pa yin pas srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i las ngan pa la kha na ma tho ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa dam pa rnams kyis smad pa yin pas srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i las ngan pa la kha na ma tho ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is despised by holy beings such as the Buddhas, evil actions such as killing are called ‚Äúoffenses.‚Äù

original: ngo tsha shes pa bshad na ngo tsha mi shes pas mjal brnga phrad sla bar 'gyur bas ngo tsha shes pa je bstan to //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa bshad na ngo tsha mi shes pas mjal brnga phrad sla bar 'gyur bas ngo tsha shes pa je bstan to //
translated: Since shamelessness is the opposite of shame, it is easy to understand.

original: de la bdag ni cho rigs 'di lta bu las byung ste /
analyzed: de la bdag ni cho rigs 'di lta bu las byung ste /
translated: ‚ÄúI come from such and such a family,

original: shes rab dang yon tan 'di lta bu dag dang ldan pa yin pas las ngan pa 'di 'dra ba bdag gis bya bar mi rigs so zhes bdag la bltas te /
analyzed: shes rab dang yon tan 'di lta bu dag dang ldan pa yin pas las ngan pa 'di 'dra ba bdag gis bya bar mi rigs so zhes bdag la bltas te /
translated: Since I have such wisdom and good qualities, it is not right for me to do such evil actions.

original: sdig pa'i las la bag byed cing bdag med par mi 'jug pa ni ngo tsha shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdig pa'i las la bag byed cing bdag med par mi 'jug pa ni ngo tsha shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, one is ashamed of oneself and does not engage in evil actions. This is called a sense of shame.

original: bdag cho rigs 'di lta bu las byung ba shes pa dang yon tan 'di lta bu dang @73b ldan bas las ngan pa 'di 'dra ba bdag gis spyad pa'i cha ma yin par shes kyang bdag gis bdag khrel ba med de sdig pa'i las la 'dzem pa med
analyzed: bdag cho rigs 'di lta bu las byung ba shes pa dang yon tan 'di lta bu dang @73b ldan bas las ngan pa 'di 'dra ba bdag gis spyad pa'i cha ma yin par shes kyang bdag gis bdag khrel ba med de sdig pa'i las la 'dzem pa med
translated: Even though one knows, I have come from such a good family and have such good qualities, so it is not right for me to do such evil actions, one has no shame.

original: par spyad pa ni ngo tsha mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: par spyad pa ni ngo tsha mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One does not avoid evil actions. This is called lack of a sense of shame.

original: 'di yang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi shas las byung bas na rdzas su med kyi btags par yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi shas las byung bas na rdzas su med kyi btags par yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: Since this is also derived from the force of attachment, hostility, and confusion, it should be understood as not existing as a substance but as a designation.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gnyis dus gcig tu 'byung mi srid pas yang na ni gti mug dang 'dod chags kyi dbang gis ngo tsha mi shes pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gnyis dus gcig tu 'byung mi srid pas yang na ni gti mug dang 'dod chags kyi dbang gis ngo tsha mi shes pa 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, shamelessness arises either through the power of delusion and attachment,

original: gang ma byin par len pa dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa la 'dzem pa med par spyod pa'i tshe na'o //
analyzed: gang ma byin par len pa dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa la 'dzem pa med par spyod pa'i tshe na'o //
translated: when one engages in taking what is not given and sexual misconduct without restraint.

original: yang na ni gti mug dang zhe sdang gi dbang gis ngo tsha mi shes pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang na ni gti mug dang zhe sdang gi dbang gis ngo tsha mi shes pa 'byung ste /
translated: Or, shamelessness arises through the power of delusion and aversion,

original: nam srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i las la 'dzem pa med par zhugs pa'i tshe na'o //
analyzed: nam srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i las la 'dzem pa med par zhugs pa'i tshe na'o //
translated: when one engages in killing, etc. without restraint.

original: 'di'i las kyang nyon mangs pa drug dang g-yo dang sgyu la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams skye ba'i rgyu'am grogs byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i las kyang nyon mangs pa drug dang g-yo dang sgyu la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams skye ba'i rgyu'am grogs byed pa'o //
translated: Its function is to assist the six root afflictions and the secondary afflictions, such as guile and deceit, in arising.

original: khrel med pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khrel med pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain the nature of shamelessness,

original: khrel med pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: khrel med pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: it asks, ‚ÄúWhat is shamelessness?‚Äù

original: khrel med pa'i rang bzhin dang / mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: khrel med pa'i rang bzhin dang / mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature and characteristic of shamelessness?‚Äù

original: lan du kha na ma tho bas gzhan la mi 'dzem pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lan du kha na ma tho bas gzhan la mi 'dzem pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The answer is: It is not to be ashamed of something bad in the presence of others.

original: khrel yod pa sngar bstan na khrel med pa mjal chung sla bar 'gyur ba'i phyir khrel yod pa je bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: khrel yod pa sngar bstan na khrel med pa mjal chung sla bar 'gyur ba'i phyir khrel yod pa je bstan par bya'o //
translated: If shame is taught first, then shamelessness is easily understood as the opposite of that.üîΩShame is to refrain from and to be ashamed of bad, nonvirtuous, evil actions out of fear of the harm of others, such as being scolded, beaten, bound and so on, thinking, If I do these bad, nonvirtuous, evil actions, worldly people will scold, bind and harm me.

original: de la sdig pa mi dge ba'i las ngan pa 'di dag byas na 'jig rten pa rnams 'phya ba dang brdeg pa dang bcing ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa byed par 'gyur ro zhes 'jig rten pas dpyas pa dang bcing ba dang / gnod pa byas par dogs nas sdig pa'i las la mi 'jug cing 'dzem pa ni khrel yod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la sdig pa mi dge ba'i las ngan pa 'di dag byas na 'jig rten pa rnams 'phya ba dang brdeg pa dang bcing ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa byed par 'gyur ro zhes 'jig rten pas dpyas pa dang bcing ba dang / gnod pa byas par dogs nas sdig pa'i las la mi 'jug cing 'dzem pa ni khrel yod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Shamelessness is to not refrain from and to not be ashamed of bad, nonvirtuous, evil actions out of fear of the harm of others, such as being scolded, beaten, bound and so on, thinking, If I do these bad, nonvirtuous, evil actions, worldly people will scold, bind and harm me.

original: sdig pa'i las 'di dag byas na 'jig rten pas dpyas pa dang bcing ba dang brdeg pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa byed par 'gyur bar shes kyang gzhan gyis dpyas pa dang / gnod pa byas pa la 'dzem pa med par sdig pa'i las la 'jug pa ni khrel med pa zhes bya'o //üîΩ'di yang ngo tsha mi shes pa dang 'dra bar 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi shas las byung bas na rdzas su med kyi btags par yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sdig pa'i las 'di dag byas na 'jig rten pas dpyas pa dang bcing ba dang brdeg pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa byed par 'gyur bar shes kyang gzhan gyis dpyas pa dang / gnod pa byas pa la 'dzem pa med par sdig pa'i las la 'jug pa ni khrel med pa zhes bya'o // 'di yang ngo tsha mi shes pa dang 'dra bar 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi shas las byung bas na rdzas su med kyi btags par yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: Shamelessness is the lack of embarrassment about misbehavior in relation to oneself or in relation to others.

original: 'di'i las kyang nyon mongs pa drug dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams skye ba'i grogs sam rgyu byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i las kyang nyon mongs pa drug dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams skye ba'i grogs sam rgyu byed pa'o //
translated: Shamelessness is the lack of embarrassment about misbehavior in relation to oneself or in relation to others.

analyzed: rmugs pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //üîΩde'i lan du /
translated: It is the opposite of embarrassment.üîΩIt is the opposite of embarrassment

original: sems las su mi rung ba ste blong ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sems las su mi rung ba ste blong ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is a lack of fitness of the mind, a dullness.

original: dge ba'i chos la dmigs pa'i tshe dmigs par bya ba'i yul sems kyis rtogs par mi nus shing dmigs par bya ba sems la gsal bar 'jog mi nus pa ni sems las su mi rung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos la dmigs pa'i tshe dmigs par bya ba'i yul sems kyis rtogs par mi nus shing dmigs par bya ba sems la gsal bar 'jog mi nus pa ni sems las su mi rung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When the mind is focused on a virtuous object, a lack of fitness of the mind is an inability to understand the object that is being focused on and an inability to clearly place the object in the mind.

original: sems las su mi rung ba'i don nyid bstan pa'i phyir blong ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sems las su mi rung ba'i don nyid bstan pa'i phyir blong ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The meaning of a lack of fitness of the mind is indicated by the word ‚Äúdullness.‚Äù

original: pags pa bangs na lngar bar 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar sems blun pa'am sems slu ba'am sems mi gsal bar 'gyur ba ni blong ba ste /
analyzed: pags pa bangs na lngar bar 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar sems blun pa'am sems slu ba'am sems mi gsal bar 'gyur ba ni blong ba ste /
translated: Just as skin that is numbed cannot feel, in the same way, a dull mind is a stupid mind, a mind that is confused or a mind that is unclear.

original: sems mi gsal ba'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa la rmugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems mi gsal ba'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa la rmugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: A dull mind is characterized by a lack of clarity.

original: 'di yang gti mug gi shas las byung bas na rdzas su med kyi btags par yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang gti mug gi shas las byung bas na rdzas su med kyi btags par yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: Since this is also derived from a preponderance of delusion, it should be understood to be a designation, not a substance.

original: 'di'i las kyang nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa skye ba'i grogs byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i las kyang nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa skye ba'i grogs byed pa'o //
translated: Its action is to assist the arising of the mental afflictions and the secondary mental afflictions.

original: rgod pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgod pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the nature of agitation,

original: rgod pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: rgod pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: he asks, ‚ÄúWhat is agitation?‚Äù

original: rgod pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: rgod pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature and characteristic of agitation?‚Äù

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that,

original: sems ma zhi ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sems ma zhi ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIt is a lack of mental tranquility.‚Äù

original: de la sems zhi ba zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dang ting nge 'dzin rtse gcig pa la bya ste /
analyzed: de la sems zhi ba zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dang ting nge 'dzin rtse gcig pa la bya ste /
translated: Here, ‚Äúmental tranquility‚Äù refers to meditative serenity and the one-pointedness of concentration.

original: gang sems g-yengs pa ni ting nge 'dzin rtse gcig pa dang mi mthun pa'i chos la sems ma zhi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang sems g-yengs pa ni ting nge 'dzin rtse gcig pa dang mi mthun pa'i chos la sems ma zhi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: A distracted mind is a lack of mental tranquility with regard to the Dharma that is incompatible with one-pointed concentration.

original: de yang 'dod chags kyis rgyu byas nas sngon bgad pa dang / rtsed mo byas pa la sogs pa rjes su dran te /
analyzed: de yang 'dod chags kyis rgyu byas nas sngon bgad pa dang / rtsed mo byas pa la sogs pa rjes su dran te /
translated: Moreover, having been caused by attachment, one recalls previous laughter, play, and so forth.

original: der sems 'phros nas sems yeng yeng por ma zhi bar byed pa'i rgyu byed pa la rgod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: der sems 'phros nas sems yeng yeng por ma zhi bar byed pa'i rgyu byed pa la rgod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When the mind is distracted by that, it is agitated and does not become tranquil. The cause of that is called ‚Äúagitation.‚Äù

original: 'di yang 'dod chags kyi shas las byung bas na rdzas su med kyi /
analyzed: 'di yang 'dod chags kyi shas las byung bas na rdzas su med kyi /
translated: Since this is also derived from the predominance of attachment, it does not exist as a substance.

original: btags par yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: btags par yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood to exist as a designation.

original: 'di'i las ni zhi gnas dang mi mthun par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'di'i las ni zhi gnas dang mi mthun par byed pa ste /
translated: Its action is to oppose serenity.

original: sems rgod pa ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid byung nas sems rtse gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin med par 'gyur bas na zhi gnas dang mi mthun pa'i rten byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems rgod pa ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid byung nas sems rtse gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin med par 'gyur bas na zhi gnas dang mi mthun pa'i rten byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the basis of opposition to serenity because when it occurs, it agitates the mind and prevents the one-pointed concentration of serenity.

original: ma dad pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma dad pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show the nature of faithlessness,

original: ma dad pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: ma dad pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is faithlessness?‚Äù

original: ma dad pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: ma dad pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature and characteristic of faithlessness?‚Äù

original: lan du las dang / 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang / @74b dkon mchog la yid mi ches shing sems ma dad pa ste /
analyzed: lan du las dang / 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang / @74b dkon mchog la yid mi ches shing sems ma dad pa ste /
translated: The answer is, ‚ÄúIt is lack of conviction and lack of mental clarity with regard to action, result, the truths, and the jewels.

original: dad pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dad pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is the opposite of faith.‚Äù

original: de la las ni bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin ba dang / mi g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid dang gsum mo //
analyzed: de la las ni bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin ba dang / mi g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid dang gsum mo //
translated: Action is threefold: meritorious, nonmeritorious, and unshakable.

original: 'bras bu ni yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba ste gnyis so //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba ste gnyis so //
translated: Result is twofold: pleasant and unpleasant.

original: bden pa ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: bden pa ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa bzhi'o //
translated: The Truths are the four noble truths, such as suffering.

original: dkon mchog ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa gsum mo //üîΩde la las dang 'bras bu dang bden pa la sogs pa yod par yid mi ches ba dang / dkon mchog la yon tan du sems dang ba med pa ni ma dad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa gsum mo // de la las dang 'bras bu dang bden pa la sogs pa yod par yid mi ches ba dang / dkon mchog la yon tan du sems dang ba med pa ni ma dad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The Jewels are the three jewels, Buddha, etc.üîΩLack of faith is the lack of conviction in the existence of action, result, the truths, etc. and the lack of clarity of mind which perceives the qualities of the three jewels.

original: dad pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba ni las dang 'bras bu dang bden pa dkon mchog la sogs pa la yod par yid ches pa dang / dkon mchog gsum la yon tan can du sems dang ba dang ldan pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa ni thob par bya bar nus /
analyzed: dad pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba ni las dang 'bras bu dang bden pa dkon mchog la sogs pa la yod par yid ches pa dang / dkon mchog gsum la yon tan can du sems dang ba dang ldan pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa ni thob par bya bar nus /
translated: Faith is the clarity of mind which perceives the existence of action, result, the truths, the jewels, etc. and the clarity of mind which perceives the qualities of the three jewels.

original: 'phags pa'i lam ni bsgrub par nus pa la gang 'dod pa skye ba ni dad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam ni bsgrub par nus pa la gang 'dod pa skye ba ni dad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the desire to obtain nirvana and to practice the noble path.

original: ma dang pa ni las dang 'bras bu dang / bden pa la yid ches pa med dkon mchog gsum la sogs pa la yon tan can du sems dang ba med /
analyzed: ma dang pa ni las dang 'bras bu dang / bden pa la yid ches pa med dkon mchog gsum la sogs pa la yon tan can du sems dang ba med /
translated: Lack of faith is the lack of conviction in the existence of action, result, the truths, etc. and the lack of clarity of mind which perceives the qualities of the three jewels, etc.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam la 'dod pa med pas na ma dad pa ni dad pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam la 'dod pa med pas na ma dad pa ni dad pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o //
translated: Lack of faith is called the adversary of faith because it is the absence of desire for the Dharma, the noble path, and nirvana.

original: 'di yang gti mug gi shas las byung bas na rdzas su med kyi /
analyzed: 'di yang gti mug gi shas las byung bas na rdzas su med kyi /
translated: Moreover, since it arises from the predominance of delusion, it does not exist as a substance,

original: btags par yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: btags par yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: but should be understood to exist as a designation.

original: de'i las ni le lo'i rten byed pa ste /
analyzed: de'i las ni le lo'i rten byed pa ste /
translated: Its action is to support laziness.

original: ma dad pa yod pa na ma dad pa'i shugs kyis mnyan pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa dge ba byed mi 'dod pas le lo'i rten byed pa'o //
analyzed: ma dad pa yod pa na ma dad pa'i shugs kyis mnyan pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa dge ba byed mi 'dod pas le lo'i rten byed pa'o //
translated: When there is lack of faith, one does not want to listen, reflect, and so on, because of the force of lack of faith, and it supports laziness.

original: le lo'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: le lo'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach the nature of laziness,

original: le lo gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: le lo gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is laziness?‚Äù

original: le lo'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: le lo'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature and characteristic of laziness?‚Äù

original: de'i lan du /üîΩdge ba la sems mi spro ba ste /
analyzed: de'i lan du / dge ba la sems mi spro ba ste /
translated: In response to that,üîΩit is said, ‚ÄúIt is the mind not delighting in virtue.

original: brtson 'grus dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is the adversary of effort.‚Äù

original: nyal ba'i bde ba dang 'phres pa'i bde ba la chags nas lus dang ngag dang yid kyi sgo nas mnyan pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa'i dge ba bya ba la sems mi spro zhing dge ba'i las la sems 'jug par mi 'dod pa ni le lo zhes
analyzed: nyal ba'i bde ba dang 'phres pa'i bde ba la chags nas lus dang ngag dang yid kyi sgo nas mnyan pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa'i dge ba bya ba la sems mi spro zhing dge ba'i las la sems 'jug par mi 'dod pa ni le lo zhes
translated: Laziness is the unwillingness of the mind to engage in virtue, the lack of mental enthusiasm for listening, reflection, etc., and for the performance of virtuous actions by body, speech, and mind, due to attachment to the pleasure of sleep, lying down, and the like.

original: bya'o // brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bya'o // brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the adversary of vigor.

original: dge ba'i las spyad pa la sems spro ba ni brtson 'grus @75a * //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge ba'i las spyad pa la sems spro ba ni brtson 'grus @75a * // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Vigor is the mental enthusiasm for the practice of virtue.üîΩLaziness is the lack of mental enthusiasm for the practice of virtue.

original: le lo ni dge ba'i las bya ba la sems spro ba med pas brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: le lo ni dge ba'i las bya ba la sems spro ba med pas brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: It is the adversary of vigor.

original: 'di yang gti mug gi shas las byung bas na rdzas su btags su med kyi btags par yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang gti mug gi shas las byung bas na rdzas su btags su med kyi btags par yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: Since it arises from the class of delusion, it is not a substance, but should be understood as a designation.

original: 'di'i las kyang dge ba'i phyogs rab tu sbyor ba la bgegs byed pa'o //üîΩbag med pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di'i las kyang dge ba'i phyogs rab tu sbyor ba la bgegs byed pa'o // bag med pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Its action is to obstruct the practice of virtue.

original: bag med pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: bag med pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the nature of heedlessness, he asks, What is heedlessness?

original: bag med pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: bag med pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: What is the nature and characteristic of heedlessness?

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: The answer is:

original: chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / le lo gang yin pa dag gis nyon mongs pa'i sems mi bsrung ba dang / dge ba la mi bsgom pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / le lo gang yin pa dag gis nyon mongs pa'i sems mi bsrung ba dang / dge ba la mi bsgom pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is the non-protection of the mind from the defilements of attachment, hostility, confusion and laziness, and the non-cultivation of virtue.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / le lo ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / le lo ste /
translated: Attachment, hostility, confusion and laziness.

original: chos 'di bzhi'i dbang du byas sam chos de bzhi la gnas shing brten nas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa la sems zhugs pa las ni mi srung mi glon /
analyzed: chos 'di bzhi'i dbang du byas sam chos de bzhi la gnas shing brten nas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa la sems zhugs pa las ni mi srung mi glon /
translated: On the basis of these four dharmas, or in dependence on these four dharmas, the mind is engaged in the defilements of attachment, etc., and does not protect or restrain itself.

original: dad pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams la ni sgom par mi byed pa la bag med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams la ni sgom par mi byed pa la bag med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It does not cultivate the virtues of faith, etc. This is called heedlessness.

original: 'di yang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang le lo ste /
analyzed: 'di yang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang le lo ste /
translated: This is also attachment, hostility, confusion and laziness.

original: chos 'di bzhi'i shas las byung bas na rdzas su med kyi /
analyzed: chos 'di bzhi'i shas las byung bas na rdzas su med kyi /
translated: Since it arises from the preponderance of these four dharmas, it does not exist as a substance.

original: btags par yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: btags par yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it exists as a designation.

original: 'di'i las ni mi dge ba 'phel ba dang dge ba nyams par byed pa'i rten byed pa'i las can te /
analyzed: 'di'i las ni mi dge ba 'phel ba dang dge ba nyams par byed pa'i rten byed pa'i las can te /
translated: Its action is to support the increase of nonvirtue and the decrease of virtue.

original: mi dge ba la sems zhugs pa las ma bsrungs pas ni mi dge ba 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba la sems zhugs pa las ma bsrungs pas ni mi dge ba 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From the mind's engagement in nonvirtue, nonvirtue increases due to lack of restraint.

original: dran pa nyams pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dran pa nyams pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the nature of lost mindfulness,

original: dran pa nyams pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: dran pa nyams pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: he asks, What is lost mindfulness?

original: dran pa nyams ba'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: dran pa nyams ba'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, What is the nature and characteristic of lost mindfulness?

original: de'i lan du /üîΩdran pa nyon mongs pa can te /
analyzed: de'i lan du / dran pa nyon mongs pa can te /
translated: In response,

original: dge ba la sems mi gsal ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩdran pa gang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i dran pa la ni /
analyzed: dge ba la sems mi gsal ba'o zhes bya ba smos te / dran pa gang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i dran pa la ni /
translated: he says, Afflicted mindfulness is the lack of clarity of mind regarding virtue.

original: dran pa nyon mongs pa can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa nyon mongs pa can zhes bya'o //
translated: Mindfulness that is associated with afflictions such as attachment, aversion, and delusion is called afflicted mindfulness.

original: de'i dge ba'i sems mi gsal ba zhes bya ba ni dper na sbrang rtsi dang khar zab las goms pa la sogs pa'i srog chags rnams kyang tig ta la sogs pa'i kha zas rdzas za bar mi nus pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de'i dge ba'i sems mi gsal ba zhes bya ba ni dper na sbrang rtsi dang khar zab las goms pa la sogs pa'i srog chags rnams kyang tig ta la sogs pa'i kha zas rdzas za bar mi nus pa de bzhin du /
translated: The so-called unclear virtuous mind is like the case of insects that are accustomed to eating honey and meat, and are unable to eat food such as myrobalan.

original: dran pa gang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan pas 'dod @75b chags la sogs pa'i yul bud med la sogs pa gang yin pa de nyid sems la dran gyi dge ba sems la mi gsal te /
analyzed: dran pa gang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan pas 'dod @75b chags la sogs pa'i yul bud med la sogs pa gang yin pa de nyid sems la dran gyi dge ba sems la mi gsal te /
translated: Similarly, whatever object of desire such as a woman is associated with afflictions such as attachment, that is what is remembered in the mind, but virtue is not clear in the mind.

original: yang dag ba'i gdams ngag la sogs pa'i dge ba'i sems mi dran te /
analyzed: yang dag ba'i gdams ngag la sogs pa'i dge ba'i sems mi dran te /
translated: The virtuous mind of true instruction and so on is not remembered.

original: brjed par gyur pa la ni dran pa nyams pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brjed par gyur pa la ni dran pa nyams pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which becomes forgotten is called impaired mindfulness.

original: 'di yang gti mug gi shas las byung bas na rdzas su med kyi btags par yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang gti mug gi shas las byung bas na rdzas su med kyi btags par yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: Since this also arises from the part of delusion, it should be understood to exist as a designation, not as a substance.

original: 'di'i las ni rnam par g-yeng ba'i rten byed pa'i las can te /
analyzed: 'di'i las ni rnam par g-yeng ba'i rten byed pa'i las can te /
translated: Its function is to support distraction.

original: dran pa nyams pa rnams nyon mongs pa'i yul bud med la sogs pa 'ba' zhig la sems 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa nyams pa rnams nyon mongs pa'i yul bud med la sogs pa 'ba' zhig la sems 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the minds of those who have lost mindfulness are only engaged in objects of affliction such as women.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the nature of distraction,

original: rnam par g-yeng ba gang zhen zhes dris te /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba gang zhen zhes dris te /
translated: he asks, ‚ÄúWhat is distraction?‚Äù

original: rnam par g-yeng ba'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature and characteristic of distraction?‚Äù

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that,

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi dbang gi shas kyi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dgal gang sems yeng pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi dbang gi shas kyi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dgal gang sems yeng pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIt is the mind being distracted by the five sense objects due to the power of attachment, hostility, and benightedness.‚Äù

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga ni gzugs dang sgra dang / dri dang ro dang reg go //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga ni gzugs dang sgra dang / dri dang ro dang reg go //
translated: The five sense objects are form, sound, smell, taste, and touch.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi shas kyis rgyu byas nas gang sems ting nge 'dzin du rtse gcig tu dmigs pa'i tshe'am thos pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i chos sems la sems pa'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa 'dod pa lnga'i yul la sems 'phros pa'am
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi shas kyis rgyu byas nas gang sems ting nge 'dzin du rtse gcig tu dmigs pa'i tshe'am thos pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i chos sems la sems pa'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa 'dod pa lnga'i yul la sems 'phros pa'am
translated: When the mind is concentrated on a single object, or when the mind is reflecting on virtuous dharmas such as what has been heard, and so on, if the mind is distracted to the five sense objects such as form, or

original: sems yeng bar song ba la rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems yeng bar song ba la rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya'o //
translated: if the mind is scattered, that is called distraction.
